name: Stonehenge Rocks!
description:
Inspired by Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game and Spinal Tap, Stonehenge Rocks! puts the players in charge of helping concert-goers vie for the best seats at a rock (tee hee) concert. Players take turns moving fans or seating a fan, then optionally moving the security guard, who maintains order (gets in the way, man!) in the busy venue. Players try to seat fans in box seats for 3 points each, seat them on a trilithon for 2 points each, and/or collect T-shirts for 1 point each. The game ends once a player ends her turn with 20 or more points, winning the game.

Stonehenge Rocks! is an official game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game.

name: Spelling Bee
description:
This early word card game has players all trying to find words simultaneously, from the same set of cards.

There are two decks of 56 cards each. The green-backed deck's cards have single letters or 2-letter combinations on them, and is suitable for children as well as adults (2-6 players). The red deck is for larger groups (4-10) and older players, and has 2- or 3-letter combinations, as well as individual letters in red ink. Each card also has a point value attached.

Any even number of cards is dealt out, so the total is about 50 cards with one deck, 100 cards for both. (E.g. 25 for 4 players, 20 each for 5, 18 for 6, etc.) The remainder makes a face up pool in the center. Players hands are kept face down, and all start by turning up the top card, starting their pack.

A turn consists of exposing the top card of your hand onto your pack (and presumably waiting a short time for people to think). At any time, if a player can make a word out of 2 or more of the visible cards, they call it out and play stops. If the word is verified, the caller takes the entire packs containing the cards he used, and places them at the bottom of his hand. Red letters may only be used as the first or last letter of their word.

If two players call out at the same time, the longer word wins; if tied, the packs involved go into the pool. If a word is wrong and challenged, the challenger gets the packs; if the challenge was incorrect, the challenger's pack goes into the pool.

The winner is the one who gets all the cards; or, after a set length of time, it is the player with the highest total value in his cards.

name: Fāngqí
description:
Square chess (方棋 fāngqí), also known as 丢方(diūfāng) and 下方(xiàfāng), is an abstract strategy board game played traditionally in the northwestern regions of China, especially Ningxia, Gansu, Shaanxi, Qinghai, Xinjiang, and other areas with a high concentration of Chinese Muslims. The game is also played by Dungans, who have brought the game with them to Central Asian countries such as Kyrgyzstan and Kazakhstan.

The game is played on a 7x8 grid, with pieces played on the points, much as in Go. Players take turns alternately placing stones until the board has been filled up, attempting to form 2x2 squares with their pieces. When the board has been filled up, players each remove one of their opponent's stones. The player then counts up the squares that he/she has formed and removes an equal number of the opponent's pieces, as long as those pieces are not part of a square. After the initial removal of pieces, players take turns moving pieces; pieces can move any distance along the grid up, down, left, or right. Every time a square is formed, the player can remove one of the opponent's pieces(again, as long as this piece is not part of a square). The player who removes all of the opponent's pieces first is the winner. Thus, the game is similar in concept to Nine Men's Morris.

The game can be played on any 7x8 board using black or white go stones, even on the intersections of a chessboard. The game is popular in agricultural communities in northwestern China, and often played on a board traced out on the ground.

name: Quarter Pole
description:
Unique horse racing game where each player guides a stable of horses through a program of eight races, where purse money is won and where the majority of races are "claiming" races where the players can acquire other players' horses. Each horse is assigned a value, so stable owners must be careful not to drop a horse in class so much that the horse is snagged by another owner. There are ten race programs that each dictate a different combination of Claiming, Stakes, Fast and Sloppy races. Each horse has a card with a set of numbers for each quarter of the track. A spinner determines which number in the quarter's set is used for movement. The board has bonus spaces. The cards have bonus moves for horses that are "mudders" when entered into races with a sloppy track. The game winner is based on highest stable value added to cash in hand after the eighth and final race. Advanced rules include betting options.

The game was later released as a computer horse racing simulation with Daily Racing Form like past performances and other additional features under the same name. The computer game is still available along with equestrian related stained glass, an odd combination of products.

name: SMART
description:
A polish quiz game.

Very simple mechanics based on rolling 3 dices and answering the question. If you answer correctly you get money. The object of SMART is to be the wealthiest player at the end of the game.

There are 2 rounds of play and then there is a great finale that includes only one question.

name: Whirlpool
description:
Memory game that you play on the floor rather than on the table! First place the 25 stepping stone tiles in a 5x5 grid on the floor: this represents 'the swamp'. Your objective is to cross the swamp from one side to the other. This sounds easy, but at each step you must reveal what is under your new stepping stone, and it could be quick sand, a crocodile, or the dreaded Whirlpool!
WHIRLPOOL was ESPECIALLY COMMENDED for BEST CHILDREN'S GAME 2009 by BGA.

name: 1775: Invasion of Canada
description:
(from the introduction:)

"1775: Invasion of Canada is a two-player game covering the American invasion of Canada which occurred from September 1775 to February 1776."

The game lasts six turns. Pieces are units, leaders and supply. In a turn Americans move and then have combat, then the British. Both sides then roll for reinforcements and events, the latter represented by supply. ZOCs inhibit enemy movement, must move into an enemy hex for combat. Combat is by differential CRT, modifiers come from leaders and supply. If all enemy units are not destroyed, victory is determined by control of cities on the map.
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: Close and Destroy II
description:
From the introduction:

Close & Destroy introduced the notion of playable, realistic, modern combat miniatures game. Close & Destroy II picks up where C&D left off. We have tried to produce a set of rules which covered tactical air and air defense and which could be added to C&D without changing what works. "If it aint't broke, don't fix it."
These rules are the result of our effort. As with C&D, they do not cover every conceivable situation and every possible detail. They are designed to reflect the actual conditions on the modern battlefied, or at least as close as we can figure it.

To be used together with Close and Destroy.

Expands:

Close and Destroy
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Poll: The Game of Politics
description:
The Art of Election
It's Your Age Game

From Instructions.
"The game is intended for children from 8-80. We have designed it to be both reflective and representative of electionary politics as they operate today. Each facet has a relevance and significance to the "real" game itself, and our only alteration is to have injected a sorely lacking sense of humour. Enjoy and be entertained."

As from the blurb this is a game of politics set in Australia with players attempting to win the election by securing a majority in the House.

The Board is a large circle with a series of concentric circles within representing different city & county constituencies. At the center is a grid representing the House, with a Hereditary Seat space at the center of this.

Players roll die to gain a number of move points used to move vote blocks around the board in an attempt to gain control of seats.

Players can also pick up "Contingency & Complication" cards to add some variety to the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Guns of Liberty
description:
From the Designer's Notes:

"I wanted a rules set that could simulate this incredible conflict, yet still be easy to learn and fun to play. I also attempted to keep casualties realistic. That is why I chose the D20 as the combat die. It is not easy to inflict casualties in Guns of Liberty, but morale plays a decisive role in the game. The quality of forces can make up for lack of numbers, while militia poses a wildcard. With they stand and deliver or will they scatter at the first sound of the guns? The variable Fire, Melee, and Morale values allow to make mild, yet significant, differences between troops."

More information:

Guns of Liberty is designed for 15mm miniatures. One inch on the table equals 25 yards. Each figure represents 20-25 infantrymen, 10-15 cavalrymen, and each artillery crew represents one gun, with the artillery gun itself notating the location of the section.

For 15mm, infantry and cavalry stands are 1" with with two figures. Alternative basing is given for 6mm and 25mm figures.

name: The Godfather Trivia Game
description:
The Godfather trivia game features 900 questions from all 3 award winning movies. Who was Kay talking about when she told Michael: "Look at that skooky looking guy!"? How many Oscars sis all three film won? Who said: "LEave the gun. Take the cannolis!"?
Earn points, and snuff out you opponents as you relive all the drama and excitement of the Godfather: the epic saga of a passionate family and their cold blooded crimes. Rise through the ranks, or sleep with the fishes... in the Godfather Trivia Game from Endless Games.

name: Activity Turbo
description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this edition you have only 60 seconds to describe the 4 expressions on the card.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Pit Stop
description:
Race fans start your engines! The game is about to begin.
Kids play it until they drop. Grown-ups peel out for it. Even grandmothers turn into rabid weasels over a game of Pitstop.

What is Pitstop? A fun family card game based on a simple idea: Players race each other to complete a run of numbered "Lap" cards; then be the first to play the checkered flag card to win the game.
But there’s a catch. Pitstop cards lurk in the deck and they can ruin any dreams of a quick win.
A game of Pitstop can be fast and furious because players can play all the cards in their hand in one turn and Lady Luck, in the form of prized wild cards, can make or break a racing career in a hurry.

One of the best things about Pitstop is that it can take as little as 5 minutes for one game or all day for a Pitstop tournament. Race Season rules are included for a 10-race, 20-race or whatever-race competition.

The game consists of 108 unique, racing-themed plastic-coated playing cards, divided into two decks. English and Spanish rules.

name: APBA Professional Golf: Pebble Beach
description:
The 3rd Expansion for the APBA Professional Golf Game. Sold only by mail. "Peeble Beach" came only with 9 boards, Each board depicting 2 holes of the course.

Peeble Beach has beaches (played as sand traps) and cliffs (played as rough). A 9-Iron or Wedge must be used in both circumstances. Balls landing on a cliff roll downward, Not forward.

name: Influence
description:
Influence is an Icehouse game of push and pull in which players play pyramids onto a hexagonal grid to exert influence on stones of three colors.

It was designed by David Fair and tied for 4th in the Winter 2005 Icehouse Game Design Competition.

name: Dezign Pak 3
description:
Dezign Pak 3 is a scenario pack for ASL. It contains fifteen scenarios from a variety of theaters (including an early Korean War action involving poor Task Force Smith).

Scenario list from publisher:

23) GAK GAK THE ACK ACK - Cotentin Peninsula, France, June 6, 1944
24) MAYHEM - Radziechow, Russia, June 26 1941
25) ROAD OUT OF RANGOON - Taukkyan, Burma, March 8, 1942
26) DIABOLICAL SHRAPNEL - Casa del Priolo, Sicily, July 10, 1943
27) TYPHOON'S VORTEX - Yartsevo, Russia, October 4, 1941
28) DANGEROUS RELIANCE - Tulsin, Russia, July 24, 1941
29) BLOOD IN THE MUD - Wyler, Reichswald, Germany, February 8, 1945
30) MINDANAO MOP UP - Bacolod, Mindanao, Philippines Islands, May 2, 1942
31) HELL FROM HILL 441 - 10km East of Nikel, Finland, October 21, 1944
32) STEEL, STEEL, STEEL - East of Iasnaia Pollana, Russia, July 13, 1943
33) MUTILATION STATION - Grodno, Poland, September 20, 1939
34) RIPPED TO SHREDS - Near Osan, South Korea, July 5, 1950
35) DESTROY ALL MONSTERS - GrosRederching, Alsace Lorraine, January 2, 1945
36) HAVOC IN SHANGHAI - Hueishan Docks, Shanghai, China, August 22, 1937
37) TSUNAMI OF MANIACS - Hueishan Docks, Shanghai, China, August 22, 1937
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: 51 Pegasi
description:
From the rules:

"Every player is in command of one colony on the planet 51 Pegasi. The colony is defending an extraction mine for the Coke7100, a strategical energy source for all the civilization of the galaxy. The goal of the game is collecting the most quantity of energy resources, defending themselves from the enemy attacks, using energy shield and releasing the power of lasers from our fighter fleet, to destroy the resources of the other players."

Every kit (one is needed for each player) contains:
1 board card,
9 combat cards,
19 action cards,
7 phase cards,
1 resource level cube,
1 victory points cube.

name: Tiki Rummy
description:
Tiki Rummy is an easy-to-learn card game with a Tiki theme.

In this game you act as the leader of a Polynesian tribe collecting resources for your people. As the leader you'll play runs and sets of resource cards from your hand to score points. If you are the first player to play all of the cards in your hand, you will also score points for the resource cards the other players were unable to play. The player with the most points over several hands wins the game.

What makes Tiki Rummy so fun to play are the powerful Tiki cards in the deck. You can call upon the Tiki to help you... or the Tiki can be used to cause trouble for your opponents!

This game is travel-friendly and it is easily playable at your favorite bar, backyard BBQ, Tiki lounge, or wherever! The colorful cards have great lounge appeal... there is a good chance that when you start playing Tiki Rummy people will stop by your table and ask, "Whatcha doin'?"

name: Microwars
description:
Microwars is a print-and-play wargame with a medieval theme. It was specifically created for speed and simplicity in order to work as a filler and appeal to non-wargamers. New players can be up and gaming in two minutes flat if they're playing with a good explainer or in around ten minutes if they have to read the rules for themselves.

In addition to the printable components the game requires some dice: one of each of D10, D8 and D6 and some dice to use as units.

The rules are available in the files section:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/49732
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Landing Zone
description:
"An asteroid has impacted the moon. There are four large pieces left, one of which is composed mainly of DIAMONDS! You have two ships to use to claim your riches. Unfortunately, the only way to land is to crash land. Avoid the wreckage of other ships and have just the right touch on the throttle and you can emerge victorious."

Landing Zone is an Icehouse dexterity game in which players attempt to flick Icehouse pieces across a table in hopes of being the closest to each one of four stones.

Landing Zone was designed by Carlton Noles and requires 2 Treehouse stashes and four small stones/gems (3 of one colour, one of another).

Landing Zone placed 2nd in the Icehouse Games Design Competition, Spring 2009.

name: 3-high
description:
3-high is a solitaire or co-operative Icehouse game in which the player(s) attempt to construct five trees of Icehouse pieces on a chessboard.

Pieces are placed randomly on the board at the start of the game. Players are subsequently dealt a hand of playing cards. These cards can be played next to the board to move a selected piece a number of spaces equal to the value of the card minus the value of the piece. The players lose if any of the following three criteria are satisfied: a piece moves off the chessboard, the draw pile of playing cards is exhausted, a player is unable to make a valid move.

3-high was designed by Jason Troutman and placed 3rd in the Icehouse Games Design Competition, Spring 2009.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Trivial Pursuit: Sverige-Upplagan
description: A Swedish expansion - Kompletterande kortset.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Omnibus
description: The players roll dice and move towards the bus stop. On the way, they collect colored chips. Once everyone is on the bus, the bus moves around the board. In each turn, a ticket is flipped open, and the players have to contribute certain chips to the "ticket price". If they don't have the right colors, the bus skips a turn and everyone loses a chip. If the bus reaches "Glückstadt", everyone wins together. If not, everyone loses.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ArchMage
description:
ArchMage is a 2 or 4 Player Strategy & Combat game with a fantasy theme. Each Player selects a Faction based around the 4 Elements of Air, Earth, Water and Fire.

By summoning Mages and ArchMages and unleashing powerful spells by controlling Spirit Towers located around the board, players attempt to gain the most Victory Points by completing Quests and trying to eradicate each other in combat before the end of the game.

ArchMage was developed for the Chessex DiceFest Contest run by Kai Bettzieche .
The rules were simple; create a game where each player needs one whole unmodified set of 36 D6 CHESSEX DICE, no more, no less.

Version 1.5 Rules are available which is the Final Release, named First Edition.
All the game boards won't change, so print away! Cards may change slightly as we update and refine them. Card errata's will be posted as this happens.

Awards

2009/2010: Dicefest contest - a tribute to Chessex Winner!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Speculation
description: This simple game is played with a standard deck of cards. There is a pot won by the player who holds the highest trump at the end of the game. Each player is dealt 3 cards face down, and a trump is chosen. In a turn a player reveals the top card of her stack. If it is the highest trump at that moment, it can be kept or sold. This continues until all the cards are revealed.

name: Mäh & Muh und Schabadu
description: Roll and move for the very young. The players take turns rolling a die, moving their animal piece forward to the nearest space of the color they rolled. When meeting another animals, they have to make the sounds of the corresponding animals. The goal is to reach the farm at the end of the track.

name: Mice in the Middle
description:
Mice in the Middle is a fast paced game of strategy where two teams of students decide to let a few mice loose in the university science lab. Unfortunately, getting the mice to return to their cages has proven more difficult than they expected, so why not have a little fun instead. Players take turns placing students and moving mice through the lab,
with the goal of stopping the other players mice from getting to your cheese. In the meantime the players must guide their own mice towards their opponent's cheese. The first player to land 3 mice on the opponent's cheese is the winner.

The catch is that whenever one of your colored mice hits one of your opponent's students, your mouse becomes your opponent's and is now gunning for your own cheese.

The action is fast and furious. Come get a piece of your own with Mice In The Middle!

name: Ajateenija
description:
The game "Ajateenija" is about serving time in Estonian army! You start as "Reamees" (private) and start moving up in the ranks of the army.
The game goes aroud the board where you can be punished or praised - it depends on how good a soldier are you!
The game have 65 card of "Ergutused" (praisals), "Karistused" (punishments) and "Sõdurieksam" (soldierexam). With these cards you can score points and with points you move on the score track aroun the board. With enough scores you can become "Kapral" or "Seersant", with benefits, like more cards in hand and can choose to re spin the spinner or even punish any lower ranked player in the game for any reason.
You play the card in front of you as you get them from the board or from the spinner and each "Ergutus" card and each "Sõdurieksam" card is points from 1 to three, depending from your rank and "Karistused" is minus ponits.
Game ends when any player reaches rank "Lipnik" then the points are calculated from the cards and the pieces move accordingly. Winner is the one who reaches the further. There are four possibilites where you can reach - nowhere, reserv, overserver (üleajateenija) and professional soldier. When you reach to proffesional soldier you also win the game. So you can win other player without winning the game! So, how good soldier are you?
mechanics: Acting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Plonk
description:
This game uses a standard deck of cards. The goal is to win tricks containing cards of different suits from the one led. In each trick, any card of the suit led is a 'dead' card and scores against you, while any card of a different suit is a 'live' card and scores in your favour. The trick is taken by the highest card of the suit led.
At end of play, each side scores the total face value of all its live cards (numerals count face value, J-Q-K count 10 each, Ace counts 15), minus 1 point for each of its dead cards.

name: Squint
description: This game is played with a standard deck of cards. Each player is dealt 10 cards, the remaining two is called Squint. Players then put a card face down on the table, which shows their bid. They can choose cards representing they are able to win six tricks without trump, six tricks with the suit of that card as trump, no tricks at all without trump, or none of the above. The better bid wins, in case of a tie both players have to try to win the number of tricks they claimed. If everybody chooses none of the above, the suits of the bid cards determine the contract (even partnerships can be formed). Then one or more players, depending on the contract, may exchange cards with the squint, and then tricks are played. The score is given only to the player(s) with the highest bid, and depends on the contract and the number of tricks won.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Stucco
description:
This game is played with 32 cards from a standard deck of cards, with cyclic ranking AKQJ10987. Both players are dealt 16 cards (therefore they know the cards of the other player).

To decide who starts, both players select a card from their hand and reveal them simultaneously. If both cards are the same colour (red or black) then non-dealer starts; if different, dealer starts. The starter's card is left face up on the table as the first card played and the other is returned to its player's hand. The non-starter then plays the second card to the spread, and play thereafter alternates.

A player in his turn can play a card which is either the next higher card of the same suit, or the next lower card of the other suit of the same colour, or a card of the same rank but opposite colour. If the player does not have any of these, has to pass. The play continues until nobody can play any more cards. Whoever plays the last card scores 1 point for each card he played, multiplied by the number of cards he played consecutively on the last turn.

name: Silent Death Annex: Operation – Dry Dock II
description:
(from the back cover)

Operation DryDock II is a compendium of new fighters, gunboats, and war drones, some brand new, some cobbled together from the scraps of fallen imperial might. This exciting new expansion brings more ships, more fun, and more stuff to blow up in the Silent Death universe.

Nearly two dozen new ships
New Datasphere technology: wardrones
Long-forgotten imperial fighter designs

Bulldog
Devestator
Dominator
Yellow Jacket


New fighters and gunboats for:

House Colos
Draconians
ASP Technocracy
Data Sphere
Luches Utopia
House Red Star
House Tokugawa
Unkulunkulu Archipelago
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Monopoly: Pink Boutique Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly - in pink.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Enschede
description: The famous Monopoly game. Try to sell and buy property in the Dutch city Enschede. Collect streets and build houses and hotels.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Vanakriget
description:
This game is played on a 5x5 square board. Players start to game with a initial setup position. Each player has 7 game piece in his/her own color.
On each turn, each player must do one of the following things:
Capture a stone on a (orthogonal or diagonal) forward direction by jumping over it and landing on the immediate empty cell. Captures are multiple and mandatory.
Drop a captured friendly stone on any empty cell.
Move a stone on a (orthogonal or diagonal) forward direction to an empty cell.
The player that moves his all game pieces to the opponent's setup position wins the game.

name: Panzer General: Allied Assault – Rommel
description: Rommel is a free expansion card for Panzer General: Allied Assault. He is an Unique Unit (one per deck) and classified as motorized infantry. His special abilites allow him to move twice or move and fire. He may move diagonally as well.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: Zhi Ji Zhi Bi
description:
It is a card game.
The aim of this game is to identify and eliminate your ennemies.

At the beginning, the four players receive one card. It will determine which team you are part of (Blue Ying Yang or Red Ying Yang). Players should keep theirs secret.

At your turn, you had to play a card :

- hit someone (10 pts, 20 pts, 30 pts)
- heal someone
- protect someone
- identify someone

You can't heal or protect yourself.
When someone has been hit for an amount of more than 101 pts, he must reveal his identity and he is dead.

name: Omega the End Times Board Game
description:
Published by Forerunner Publishing a division of Friends of the Bridegroom, Inc, Omega the End Times Board Game is a game of knowledge (trivia question and answer) based on biblical eschatology. Trivia questions are based on knowledge of certain books of the New King James bible, such as Daniel, Matthew, and the Book of Revelation.

The board contains six colored tracks that extend from left to right along the rectangular game board. Each colored track corresponds to six colored playing pieces. Each player selects a colored playing piece and places it on the track.

On each turn, the player gets an opportunity to answer a trivia card question. If answered correctly, the player moves forward along the track and they get to draw special "oil" or "crown" cards that count for victory points at game end. The tracks have certain phases which represent passage of time. For example, the left most track section is the present, the middle of the track corresponds to the "tribulation period", the end of the track corresponds to the "millennium", etc.. The first player to reach a time-based stage causes all other players to immediately move forward to that stage.

In order to win the game, a player must answer questions correctly allowing them changes to collect oil and crown cards that are worth points. When a player reaches the final stage of the track, all players get one more turn. Then card-points are added up to determine a winner.

It is an educational game focused on the escatolagical teachings of Friends of the Bridegroom, Inc, AKA International House of Prayer, located in Kansas City.

name: Euclid
description:
Euclid is played on a 8x8 square board.
On each turn, each player moves one of his pieces.
A King moves like a chess Queen.
A Soldier moves like a chess Rook.
Captures occur at the corners of the rectangle formed by a just moved soldier and the king.
A player with two or fewer pieces loses the game.

Online play: Super Duper Games

name: Crusade
description:
Crusade can be played on a 8x8 square board. In the initial position, all squares are occupied by a stone: white stones on the white squares and black stones on the black squares.

Each stone must move to any adjacent(orthogonal or diagonal) cell, which is occupied by an enemy stone. This stone is captured by replacement. After that, all adjacent enemy stones (orthogonal or diagonal) are converted to friendly ones. There a less and less stones on the board as the game proceeds, which is a major difference to Othello and Ataxx.

The player which has more stones, after there is no valid move left, wins the game.

name: Allez Saute!
description:
Allez saute is a dexterity game made for kids. Each gamer plays a plane and a skydiver, the aim is to let the skydiver fall the closest of a target. The player moves its skydiver after a dice roll and choose when it has to fall. Or the others players can make you fall far from the target... It's working with a magnetic system.

You can choose to play sport or military skidiving.

name: Cage
description:
Cage is a finite, omnidirectional Checkers variant. The 10x10 board is initially set up as shown in the figure. The checkers jump orthogonally in any direction, and the direction can change during multiple jumps.

Cage is a game of annihilation. The game must end, and when it does, there will remain at most one color of checkers on the board, guaranteed. One unique feature of Cage is that you can jump off the board, removing both the capturing and captured checkers.

name: Wired: Black Ops
description: Wired: Black Ops is a thematic worker placement game set in a dark dystopian future. Players have a limited amount of time to hire crew members and collect resources, which are used to complete black ops missions against powerful corporations and organized crime syndicates located in Neo Tokyo. Militarized corporate security, yakuza and mafia forces will attempt to stop the players from completing these missions, which range from simple assassinations to explosive demolition runs.

name: Subelidai
description:
Subelidai, the slide in Japanese, is a very easy tile laying game where players try to build the slide with the most even number of colors.

Each tile contains 6 parts of slide of different colors possibly crossing each other while following the same direction.

Players first get a secret number, telling them which line is theirs.

On their turn, they have to choose between two tiles, that they can place in either direction in order to try and maximize their points.

The scoring follows the same principle as Tigris & Euphrates, i.e. a player's score is equal to the amount of points of the lowest scoring color.

name: Textile
description:
Textile is a tile placement game for 2-4 players. It's designed for nestorgames' game system Nestortiles.

The game's objective is to "knot" a piece of "textile", which is made of smaller parts, so called "patches".

The players freely choose any colored tile from a supply and create the patches by putting tiles together and always following the main rule of allowed color patterns: the same color may not occur on any two orthogonally or diagonally adjacent tiles. If a player decides to add a patch (or if the patch reaches its maximum size of five) it is "knotted" to the main textile in the middle of the table. The players then score points by the formula "knotting sides x size of the patch". After all tiles are played, the winner is the one with the highest total score.

name: Animocity
description: In Animocity, players represent city planners planning a new city's layout. They'll have to wheel and deal to make sure their proposals for the city are the grandest of them all. Players also take on the role of contractor, supplying the project with the supplies necessary for construction. The competition will be fierce, but no player can go it alone. Opponents will need to use one another's supplies in order to finalize plans and earn points. Temporary cooperation will spurn heated rivals as players make and break promises along the way. Once the blueprint is finalized, the planner who shaped the city the most is the winner!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Pickles' Pig Tales
description:
User Summary:

In Pickles' Pig Tales players in the game will be creating and retelling a story from memory.

On your turn you roll the die and move Pickles the Pig closer to his goal of Castle Feastalot. If you land on a blank space you draw a card from the deck. After drawing you retell the story in order from the beginning and then add a sentence to the end using your cards picture and set the card in front of you. There are also a few special spaces that cause parts of the story to be changed or lost all together. If you make a mistake with the story or tell it out of order you will lose the card you just drew.

Be the person with the most cards in front of them when Pickles reaches the castle to win!

From the publisher's website:

Help Pickles make his way to the castle by remembering - and building upon - a fun story! The new game of storytelling, imagination and creativity.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Language Development, Creativity and Memory
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Chez Goth: Promokarte Necronomicon
description:
Chez Goth - Necronomicon is the Promocard number 04 from Pegaus Spiele. It is a slack 3, cost 3 card - class thing (book)

"Es zu lesen, ist relativ ungefährlich, man darf nur auf keinen Fall daraus zitieren..."

translates as:

"To read it is not dangerous, one should under no circumstance quote it though"

name: Kwintie
description:
Kwintie is a strategical building game for 2 players. The objective of the game is to build a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row of 5 square blocks.

The blocks that the players play with have the dimensions of 1 x 1 x 2. The blocks must be placed on a board consisting of a single row of 9 squares, or on top of one another. Blocks from one colour may not touch with their 1 x 1 sides (in other words, two pieces of one colour may not form a vertical or horizontal row that is four cubes long). The first player to get 5 in a Row is the winner. If a player cannot move anymore, then he loses. For balancing purposes, the first move of the first player may not be touch the center field.

name: Villehardouin
description:
From the Perfect Captain website:

The first in our series of Spare Change games, Villehardouin is a campaign game of the Byzantine Reconquest of the Morea in southern Greece in the year 1263 AD.

Players take the role of either the Achaean Franks under Prince William de Villehardouin, freshly back from captivity in Constantinople, or that of the Byzantine Empire under the Sebastocrator Constantine (the Emperor Michael VIII's step-brother).

As with all of our games, supply and logistics are as important as naked force. Never fear- there is of course no bookkeeping. At the start of each turn players figure out how much "change" they gather to fuel their activities for the turn. Simply marching off into arid and barren territory, even if it is strategically important, will leave you high and dry and out of supply- forcing a humiliating retreat. Players must plan carefully where they are going, how long they will be there, and what can go wrong; losing a battle will deplete your treasury as well as your army.

The opposing armies are different too, adding another element to strategy. The Franks have excellent cavalry and good foot troops, but not many skirmishers. The Greeks have an abundance of archers and ambushers as well as hard fighting regulars, and a corps of Turkish mercenaries (of dubious loyalty..). Both sides have to pick their battlefields and their timing must be near-perfect to pull off a game-winning battle.

The terrain is not the friendliest; each players base is green and lush, but you can't win by sitting still. Feint and counter-feint will be the order of the day, but when the time comes, you must strike. Sieges can be long, but sudden assaults costly. Greeks can set up ambushes while the Franks can attempt impetuous charges- either one can, if handled properly, bring about your opponent's overthrow.

This is the kind of game where there can be no wasted moves; everything is important, and dilly-dallying will hurt you sooner rather than later. This is a game that will lead to taut nerves and a lot of beard stroking!

Does it take long to play?
That's entirely up to you. You could easily fly through it in an hour, but if you want to win you'll need to think things through very carefully. Still, it's one of our quickest-play games.

name: Doggie Bones
description:
The dogs have all buried their bones in the yard but they cannot remember where. The players take turns looking through the dirt mounds trying to be the first doggie to find all of his bones.

In doggie bones the players use memory and deduction to locate their bones. There are simple rules for ages 3-5 and regular rules for ages 6+.

name: Arena Assault: Samurai vs Ninja
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a honorable Samurai or a deadly Ninja. Grab a group or friends, blast, pound and bash them into mud on your way to victory. Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks. Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session. Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards. So, gear up and get ready for battle.

name: Cabin Fever
description:
Game Overview
Cabin Fever is a small, dice-based scoring game with the theme of escaping a cabin during a harsh winter. Players begin the game "snowed in" requiring them to "dig out," or score 100 points before they may begin collecting points. The first player to score 1,000 or more points wins the game! The game has a strategy component where players may trap other players in the cabin, preventing them from scoring.

Special scoring situations have easily recognizable winter themed monikers. Players encounter obstacles along the way in the form of certain types of die rolls ("squalls," "thaws," "broken chairlifts") which may end their turn or put them in the cabin. In addition to obstacles there are special die rolls that immediately reward a player such as "vacations" and "chairlifts".

Setup
Cabin Fever is designed for 2-8 players with an optimal number of 3 or more players. A game can be played with more than 8 players at the consequence of extending the game's duration. All that is needed in addition to the game is a pad of paper and a pencil or pen with which to keep score.

Gameplay
Each player rolls a single die to determine who starts the game. The highest roll goes first (after resolving ties). All players are considered “snowed in” and must "dig out" by rolling 100 points or more on the scoring dice. Once a player digs out he or she ends his or her turn and passes the scoring dice to the next player on the left (clockwise) and may begin scoring on his or her next turn. The first player to accumulate 1,000 points wins the game!

The five same color dice included with the game are called scoring dice. Players start a turn by rolling all five dice (opening roll) in an attempt to create matching die faces. Players may elect to end their turn at any time and collect their points (with a minimum requirement of a matching pair). Players may continue a turn to earn more points but must roll at least one match to an existing match, or create a new matching set on each consecutive re-roll of non-matching dice. Dice that have been assigned to a match may not be re-rolled. If players fail to roll a match on a re-roll they immediately end their turn and do not collect any points.

Components
* 5 Scoring Dice (white)
* 1 Vacation Die (green)
* Cabin game piece (clear)
* Cabin Fever rules sheet
* 3 "I have Cabin Fever!" stickers
* Palm-sized, clear acrylic, travel box
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Brainline
description: A two player abstract game played on a 7 by 9 array of hexes. Each player has four pegs of his colour on the specified starting hexes. On his turn a player may move any one of his pegs any distance in a straight line but may not jump any other peg. The object of the game is to be the first to get all four pegs of your colour in a straight line. They do not have to be adjacent but there must be no opponent pegs between them.

name: Rout Pak II
description:
10 scenarios designed for ASL
(and adaptable to '88' with a little imagination, and any WWII miniatures game system, and ....

Rout Pack II #1: The Noose
Rout Pack II #2: The Debt Repaid
Rout Pack II #3: Distinguished Service
Rout Pack II #4: The Knife Edge of Defeat
Rout Pack II #5: Brandernburger Bridge
Rout Pack II #6: Cushman's Pocket
Rout Pack II #7: In the Samurai Tradition
Rout Pack II #8: Riding Shotgun
Rout Pack II #9: He who Hesitates
Rout Pack II #10: The King's Dash
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Professor Noggin's Extraordinary Women
description:
Professor Noggin helps you learn interesting facts about extraordinary women in science, the arts, politics, and more.

Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions. A special three-numbered die is included which creates interaction and promotes communication between players. Easy and hard levels keep kids interested and challenged - while of course having fun.

name: Streifen
description:
Paper-and-pencil game where players try to score the most points by marking the longest rows of squares. Eight rows "1 2 3 4 1 2 3 4" build a square 8x8 board. In their turn, players throw four dice (or a die four times) and mark each time a field on the board with the thrown number; 5, 6 and numbers already used up on the board are wasted throws. The game ends when any further throw is useless, and then the scoring takes place: four or more consecutive spaces in a row or column belonging to a player bring a score of one point per space.

The game is best played in rounds, each round with a starting player.
mechanics: Enclosure, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Marble Games
description:
A collection of marble games. The box contains 28 marbles in two different sizes, rules and a plastic arch with numbered holes. Newer editions also include one six-sided die, required for the game "Dobblers". The rules start with a short history of marbles and then explain the following games:
- Shooting
- Archboard
- Bounce About
- Bouncy Eye
- Conqueror
- Die Shot
- Dobblers
- Hundreds
- Long Taw
- Pyramid
- Ring Taw
All games have one thing in common: score points by skillfully shoot or maneuver your marbles to a defined target. This may be the arch, marbles of other players, or marbles which act as targets. Depending on the game chosen you will score points for fulfilling certain conditions, like throwing other players' marbles out of the way, putting your marbles close to a target, or hitting the right hole in the arch.

name: Anima Tactics: Janiel
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Few agents of Samael have proven as useful to the organization as the Sylvain Janiel Ul Del Valiem. Young even by the standards of her race, Janiel is both an incomparable spell caster and an unequaled martial artist in the service of the Fallen Angel Dinah. Her mystical abilities allow her to invoke into the world a guardian spirit named Enjeil, who takes the form of an enormous eagle made of energy, through which she manifests her powers. Any obscure power that underestimates her will meet its end in a flurry of feathers.

Warrior / Mystic - Samael - Level 40

Einjeil Eyes (Magic, Seek) - This ability gives +8 inches to Janiel's Control Zone and +1 to the success roll of the Seek Control.

The Mark of Einjeil (Magic, Effect) - Choose an enemy unit within 20 inches. Until the end of the turn, all Ranged Attacks of any friendly unit against that enemy gain +2 Attack. Effect 16.

Feathers Storm (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance (20 Inches), +2 Damage.

Feathers Slash (Ki, Attack) - +2 Attack / +2 Damage.

Healing Breath (Magic, Effect) - A friendly unit inside Janiel's Control Zone gains Lv 2 Healing.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Outrider: Tuner Cards
description:
There's a way to upgrade anything. Want more acceleration? Add a 'charger or install a short-throw shifter. Need better handling? Let's tweak the suspension and/or the brakes. The upgrades aren't just limited to vehicle performace, either. Need to eek out a litle more range out of your primary weapon? How about some armor-piercing rounds? The South Tejas Speed Shop has the toys you need to give you the ultimate performance edge ... including a few that you might not have expected - don't discount the importance of fuzzy dice until you've tried 'em(!)

Tuner Cards allow players to equip their Outrider vehicles with performance enhancing equipment and upgrades, allowing them more options to customize and balance their vehicles. The cards also add a slight RPG element to the game, as many cards add 'character' to the drivers/vehicles

name: Fungus
description:
Fungus is an abstract strategy game played on a hex grid by 2 to 4 players. Players take turns placing markers into hex spaces with the ultimate goal of having the fewest number of connected areas on the board and the most markers on the board when the board is completely full.

At the beginning of the game, players take three turns placing a marker anywhere on the board, except along an edge or adjacent to any other marker. After this initial phase, player take turns placing markers, but now they must be adjacent to an enemy marker. During the game, players may have the opportunity to capture enemy markers and place one of their markers in the space or save the markers to alter scores at the end of the game. When the entire board is full of markers, players count their total number of markers on the board and deduct their total number of separate disconnected groups from that amount. The player with the highest total wins.

name: Witte Gij't Nou Nóg Nie?
description:
An expansion for the game Witte Gij't?.

This expansion has more detailed questions about the Dutch province of Noord-Brabant (NB). There is also a new category about guessing a famous person from the province without saying some prohibited words - replacing the Interview category.

The set consists of 54 cards and can be played with or without the base-game.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Ostrich Circus
description:
The game consists of the following:


60 playing cards, each with one of 6 pictures of ostriches performing various feats or being the victim of various misfortunes
4 declaration cards indicating whether players want to fold or continue
"Chicken" chips that are taken as a penalty when folding
Start player card


The goal of the game is to get either one or two cards of a particular picture, as these earn you points. If you have three or more of a picture, points are deducted.

The players each get 2 playing cards, which are kept hidden from other players. At the beginning of each round, 2 cards from the deck are dealt face up and 3 face down. After players indicate whether they will continue or fold, a face down card is turned over. This continues until all 5 cards are turned over. At that point, remaining players who didn't fold will receive the cards. Players who folded receive a number of chicken chips equal to the number of face down cards plus one.

At the end of the game, having one of a particular picture card is worth 2 points and two of that picture card are worth 6 points. Having three or more is a minus 3/4/5/etc. points. Each chicken chip is minus 2 points. The person with the most points is the winner.

The theme is based on the Japanese comedy trio, Ostrich Club.

name: Cthentacle: At the Mountings of Madness
description:
The second expansion for Call of Cthentacle. It adds two new characters, Bligh the sailor and Hostein, an explorer.

This new game style has a new goal - reaching the lost city of O'Riyeh. To begin play you lay out six markers corresponding to the following locations:

1. Spankham Asylum
2. Friskatonic University
3. Innmouth
4. Dunbitch
5. The Mountings of Madness
6. O'Riyeh

The winner of the game is the first person to reach O'Riyeh. You start at Spankham Asylum where your investigation starts with the wild and crazy stories of one of the inmates. From there you need to gather clues to advance.

Enhances the basic game by allowing characters to go back to Spankham Asylum and start over again instead of being knocked out of the game when they get "spooged".
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Imperium of Man
description:
Imperium of Man is a solitaire card game set in the Warhammer 40K universe. The player represents the Human Empire who must defeat all enemy units from the alien worlds: Chaos, Eldar, Tyranids, Orks, Necrons, and Tau. There is also 1 Internal Foe: Rebel Worlds.

Each turn in the game contains 10 phases. In these phases, new enemies are spawned, random events happen, new tech is built, and battles are fought. Battles are fought by rolling a D10 and applying any modifiers from built technology. A modified roll of 6+ is a hit for both the enemy aliens and the Human Empire. The player has a supply of Empire Points which grow throughout the game. These points can be used to absorb hits when no Empire Units are left on the battlefield. The Empire Points aslo affect the number of new units that the player can recruit each round.

To win, the player must eliminate all enemy unit. The final score is the number of turns it took to eliminate them. The game is lost if the player loses all Empire Points before eliminating the enemies.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Card Farm
description:
In Card Farm – the winner of Protospiel's 10th Anniversary Card Game Design Contest – players are the owners of small family farms who are trying to grow crops which must be planted and harvested during particular seasons. The crops are then used to purchase farm equipment, animals, and buildings to aid them in this pursuit and to score points.

The player who builds up the best farm wins.

name: Tempelschatz
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Off you go on a treasure hunt in the jungle! In Tempelschatz, you'll determine to which one of the discovers the dice oracle will reveal the clues and who will then be the first to recover four coins.

name: The Know It Game
description:
The Know It Game is the trivia game where simply answering correctly isn’t enough. To win you have to successfully bluff your opponents into believing you know the answer.
The questions are original, amusing and informative and the games can be traded, swapped or collected.
Each box consists of two broad themes and there are over 200 questions per theme split into five games.
Answer correctly, you win the card. Claim to ‘Know It’, you could win two.

name: Pocket Quiz: Allgemeinwissen
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "General Knowledge".

name: Goal! Game expansion pack: Spanish Team
description: This expansion is packaged like a CCG booster. It contains 14 player cards of the Spanish football team and one new special tactics card.

name: Bare Your Fangs
description:
For untold centuries a war has been waged in the shadows cast by the moon. Two great powers of the underworld clash in repetitive fury, fighting for ultimate supremacy. The hedonistic Vampires believe it to be their birthright to own the night. The untamed Werewolves believe that none other than themselves should master the Earth. Whose claim is true? When twilight descends, which species will set the ancient records in stone and prove their powers of domination? Time to settle old scores. It’s time to Bare Your Fangs!

Bare Your Fangs is a two-player dice fighting game devoted to resolving once and for all which species will reign supreme: Vampire or Werewolf. Players choose their faction dice and roll to attack! The fully customized die icons determine successful hits, blocks, and of course, one’s ability to hunt for humans and thereby heal wounds incurred in these savage battles. But there is always risk. Some humans won’t go down without a fight! And one particular human seeks only the total annihilation of all creatures of the night. The Werewolf’s physical power is unmatched but the Vampire’s ability to heal is legendary. Only one will rule when dawn breaks, but will the victor crush his opponent into oblivion and take his rightful place as Leader Eternal, or will the fang fray destroy them both!

name: Battles & Bones: A Pirate Game
description:
Thar be Treasure out thar for Take'n! Sail the Seas, to Raid Ships for Gold and Infamy, or plunder the Ports to get Pieces of the Map to Treasure Island. Collect 3 Map cards to find the Location of Treasure Island. That Island be tricky, and it's location changes every game. Only a Pirate with Maximum INFAMY (13 INFAMY Points) may acquire the Treaure Card from Treasure Island. A Pirate must move the Treasure to a new Location to keep it safe from other thieving Pirates to Win. There are 6 Possible Locations on the Treasure Card. Do all this while keeping a safe distance from the Powerful navy ships patrolling the waters. They don't take kindly to your "kill Em all, and Take thar Gold" Attitude.

Game-play lasts between 1-2 hours. A 3-5 Player game of Piratey Goodness! GOTO: dowrickGames for more info.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: ONE2TEN
description:
FROM THE BOX: Correctly guess how other players rate a variety of items on a scale of 1 to 10 and be the first player to reach 10 points.

One2Ten is a fun and often times hilarious social card game that exposes how players feel about certain items (including things about themselves and other players) on a rating scale from 1 to 10. It is a fun way to get to know new people and an even more fun way to get to know those you THOUGHT you already knew... your closest friends and family!

EXAMPLE ITEMS (On a scale of 1-10 how do I rate...)
The taste of green olives
My breath right now
My enjoyment of this game
My interest in going camping
My sense of humor
My ability to dance
The outfit of the person sitting to my left

There are OVER 400 items included in the game and a unique randomizer makes it so that no two games are ever the same! To view the complete instructions visit the game's website (see link below)

ONE2TEN: How well do you know your friends?
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: La Febbre dell'Oro
description:
La Febbre dell'Oro (Gold Rush) is a fun game and is set during the Wild West where the search for gold had become a "fever".

The game board has 72 boxes, game of goose style, and the players move their horse through a wheel numbered from 1 to 12. Some boxes (for example, the railroad, the saloon, the emporium, the river, etc.) can be bought to guarantee an income to the owner when another player will occupy the box.
When a player reaches the box #72 has the chance to enter the gold mine (and win) if he gets 13 points using twice the wheel numbered.

name: ASL Comp: Darkest December
description:
(NOTE: This is an ASL expansion. A game of similar title is published for the ATS system by the same publisher).

From the publisher:
"Darkest December is a detailed ASL comp variant module that tells the story of the Battle of the Bulge from the perspective of the 3rd US armored division, facing down the vaunted 116 Panzer Division. Hitler's Wacht Am Rhein offensive was under way, and the yanks of the 3rd Armored, along with engineers from the 23rd and 51st engineer battalions faced the 'Greyhound' Panzer Division and the 560th Volksgrenadier Division - and were soon cordoned off form friendly lines...."

The module includes three historical maps, two counter sheets and 20 scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Schneemann Spiel
description: The object of the game is to help little Polarbear and his friends to build a snowman. Players move on the game board on the other side and back rolling the dice and each time they arrived, one part of three-part snowman gets ready.

name: Des ours et des saumons
description:
"The bears and the Salmon" in English
The object of this card game is to capture the salmon of his opponents with his bears. But players must be careful to protect their own fish.

Players play cards simultaneously. Who has played bears my capture salmon of any opponent. If there are no bears who has captured player's salmon he may take it himself.

The player who has caught the most salmon at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Kurukshetra
description:
In Kurukshetra, players fight the epic battle of Kurukshetra following the story as it was first told in the hindu epic Mahabharata. Two families, the Pandavas and the Kauravas fight for control of the kingdom.

It's a strategy boardgame played in two phases: In the first phase, players struggle to obtain different advice from Krishna that will help them further on. In the next phase, players battle the heroes of the Kaurava family. Special Pandava family members and Krishnas advice are extra efficient when facing the different Kaurava warriors.

The winner of the game is the one who defeats most Kaurava warriors and scores most victory points.

name: Feudal Lord expansion kit
description:
This is an expansion kit for Feudal Lord. It requires that game and cannot be played alone.
This kit adds 257 new historical leaders, 7 special leaders, markers as well as units for 8 new clans, extended rules, 3 historical campaign scenarios and many FAQs to Feudal Lord.

name: Zentrum
description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players must score the most possible points by filling the 16 central spaces of an 8x8 board.

Each player starts from a corner of the board and marks with their own symbol (dot, circle, square or cross) a square two or three spaces away in a straight vertical or horizontal line from the square previously marked; a square can be marked by all players. The distance from one marked square to the next has got to be two squares on one turn, three in the next one, then two squares again, then three and so on (the player can choose which value goes first). A player can't land on a square already marked with their symbol.

The game ends when the 16 central squares of the board have been ticked. Players score for the central squares they have ticked: each square brings as many points as different symbols have been marked on the square.

name: Pferdekoppel
description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players must move on an 8x8 board as Chess knights - used spaces will be unavailable for the rest of the game. The last player who's able to move wins. It's more or less an adaptation of Alex Randolph's Knight Chase for several players.

Each player has got an own symbol (dot, circle, square, cross) and starts from one corner on the board; before anyone moves each player will fill in a square on the board, which will be unavailable from then on (it's not allowed to block a player before their first move). Players then move in turn following the rules for a Chess knight, ticking the corresponding free space on the board with their symbol and filling in the square they departed from. If a player can't move the turn will be forfeited. The last player who can move wins the game.

name: Mall of the Deads
description:
This is a PNP Zombie survival game for 2-6 players. The setting is in a Mall. Players can choose from 12 familiar characters. Each character has his/her own objectives to get besides surviving. For example, a stunt man must find his daughter & a vaccine while a high school girl needs to find her brother. Each character earns a certain victory points if he/she got the right people/item AND arrived at the security room OR exit to parking lot. However, the security room & the exit door are both locked. You must get the key/keycard before others getting them.

Players will meet new survivors in the mall during exploration. You may ask them to join you by giving items they want. You earn extra VPs by escorting them to safety. However, food, weapons & ammo are limited. Players must compete with each other for food & ammo while sharing with his partner survivors.

Beside the brainless zombies, there are other hostile enemies like terrorists, psychopaths & mystic cultists. So players may also need to co-operate with each other to survive against the hordes of enemies. You have to plan when to co-operate & when to betray the other players. Players with most VPs at game end wins.

name: Spanic
description:
Spanic (SP+Panic) is a Series: Shibumi game for 3 to 6 players. It uses 10 balls on each colour (white, black, red), a 4x4 Shibumi board and one bowl for each player.

RULES

Setup

Empty board. In 4 player games, 2 balls are picked up randomly from the supply and placed randomly on the board.

Each player then picks random balls from the supply (bag):

2 players: 15 balls each
3 players: 10 balls each
4 players: 7 balls each
5 players: 6 balls each
6 players: 5 balls each

... and places them in his bowl so the other players cannot see them during the game (variant: balls are visible).

Aim

To get rid of your balls before your opponents.

Rules

Players in turn either:

- place one of their balls on any empty hole or on top of a platform that has at least 2 balls of the same colour as the ball being placed or...
- pass.

End

The game ends when one of the players places his last ball, thus reaching the victory condition. If all players pass in a single round (rare), the player with less balls in his bowl wins. In case of a tie, play again.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Conquest of the Skies
description:
In an alternate history on the brink of global war, the rare telonite ore has been identified as the key to the revolutionary superweapon that could end hostilities before they begin. Unfortunately this ore only exists in meaningful quantities in a small, blighted archipelago in a remote area. Your superiors cannot spare many men or resources - it would be strategic suicide to move important units from their existing positions - but you've been given the vital task of securing enough telonite to ensure the victory of your nation. Unfortunately, the other world superpowers have sent task forces of their own...

Conquest of the Skies is a light 4X in which 2-3 players compete to gather sufficient quantities of ore before anyone else. Players will explore the abandoned archipelago, research and develop new technologies, manoeuvre airships and giant warships into combat, harvest the meagre supplies of food to keep their people alive and try to be the first to obtain enough telonite ore, by fair means or foul.

Play proceeds via an action point allowance, with each of a player's settlements granting a number of action points which can be used for harvesting resources, researching technologies and acting with units; however, food is almost as scarce as ore, and players must be sure to harvest enough to feed each settlement every turn.
categories: Economic, Exploration, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: L'Odyssée
description:
A little game of chance about the adventures of Odysseus on his return to Greece.

In his turn player roll the dice, moves his counter and if it stands on one of the events, inspired by the adventures of Odysseus during his Odyssey, must act accordingly.

The first arrived at the destination wins.

name: First Past the Post
description:
Greyhound racing game.

There are suits matching the six greyhounds in each race. The deck is shuffled and some cards are dealt out and revealed. The number of cards removed can be chosen by the Bookie for the race.

The cards revealed mean that any greyhound, relating to the cards, has less cards in the deck than others. Each race one player is the Bookie. His job is to offer odds on the dogs, taking into account the number of cards revealed.

Players bet and the race is simple. Turn over a card and that dog moves one space forward. First dog to cross the finish line wins the race. Bookie pays out winning bets. Next player on his left becomes the Bookie for the next race. When the game ends, the one with the most money, wins.

The same mechanism can be used with the alternative set of horse tokens that are supplied to yield a horse racing game.

name: Battle of Itsukushima, 1554-1555
description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #104

Campaign level wargame for the battle of Itsukushima. The battle of Itsukushima is one of three major surprise attack in Japanese history.

Player control either Mouri clan or Sue clan. Each player manage movement, combat and negotiation with minor lords. Each counter represent lord and their soldiers. Some lords may change the loyalty to another side. In this part, Mouri clan has the advantage by their intelligence capability.

Winner determined by control of provinces.

name: Futedado
description:
In Futedado, soccer / football goals scored and conceded are dictated by a die.

This die is rolled more often the better the team is, both in terms of their coach, or their players.

The more we invest in the team more times we can roll the dice and thus have more chances to win!

Gameplay (from the website: http://futedado.blogspot.pt/):
Each player chooses the country or countries they will represent.

The tournament begins with the group stage, varying the number of groups depending on the number of players.

After each country is seeded, we know who plays who, match day to match day within your group, with the help of league tables.

Each player starts with five credits of confidence (CC) times the number of countries that have or selections. The credits can be applied in the team or teams the player chooses.

To increase the confidence level of their teams and play in more times the dice to win games, each player must manage the trust claims as best they can. Thus, the CC can be invested in two types of resources: players and coaches. Both types are rated as "good" and "outstanding".

In all matches, the last dice roll made by a player is the one the counts for the final score of the match. For example, if you can throw the dice three times, but if you are satisfied with the 2nd roll, you don't need not make the final one. The latter roll is the one that counts, whether or not the most favorable.

The "home" team may choose to re-roll the final dice of both players, by using the "home factor" card. Once rerolled the results are final.

Each victory is worth 3 points and 4 CC, each tie is worth 1 point and 2 CC and every defeat is worth 0 points and cost one CC.

This increase or decrease of confidence in players and /pr coaches and the gain or loss of CC are accounted at the end of a match day, and before the next match day.

At the end of the group stage, only the two or four best teams from each group (depending on the number of players) advance to the next stage. The tie breakers are:
1st: point gained;
2nd: greatest goal average;
3rd: most goals scored for.
4th: result of the match between the tied teams.

All other teams are eliminated from play at this point.

For each stage a team advances, the controlling player receives 2 CC

The quarter finals (if applicable), the semi finals and final games are to be elimination games. If they end up tied, they go to penalties, using the "penalty die". A series of five penalties for each team is rolled, and if the score is still tied, each team roll once until the tie breaks.

The winner of the European football championship is the one whose team win the final of the competition!

name: Sudoku Puzzle Game
description:
A 1- or 2(+)-Player sudoku game where players place number tiles to complete up to 100 different puzzles.

From the Rule Book:
For 2 or more players. Game One: Chose a puzzle from the book, place the red number squares on the puzzle board in the same positions as in the puzzle you have selected from the book. Now take turns -- one move each player -- to try to comlete the game as quickly as possible. Socring -- if you complete a line either across or down then that player adds up the numbers in that line and that is that players score for that game. The player with the highest score is the winner after you have completed all nine squares.

For 2 or more players. Game Two: Set up the numbers in the squares as before. Player one now turns over the timer and puts on black squares until the timer runs out. As before add up the numbers in any line that player completes to determine that players score. When the timer runs out pass on the timer to player 2 who then turns over the timer and when it runs out that player scores as above. Then pass the timer to the next player who plays the game in the same way and so on depending on the number of players. When the puzzle is finished then the player with the highest score wins that game.

name: Some'R'Set
description:
Some 'R' Set is a trick-taking game that uses a unique deck of 28 cards. The card suits are fractions (ex. 0/0, 0/1, 1/1, 0/2, 1/2, 2/2, ..., 0/3,..., 0/4, ..., 0/,6, ... 6/6) with the mid-cards also being worth extra points.

Some'R'Set is best played with partners (like in Spades).

The object is to bid on how many points you and your partner will take. There are 21 available points, 14 from the available tricks and 7 from the red cards.

Bidding goes around the table once where the players bid for the two card blind. High bid takes the blind and decides which suit (fraction set) will be trump.

Like in many trick taking games, and if you make your hand, you get the points. If you do not, you are set, hence the name (as they say in the rules) Some "r" set.

See also:
Double Some'R'Set - 50 card version
publishers: Some"R"Set Card Co., The Levi Game Company

name: Shield Breaker
description:
Shield Breaker is a fantasy skirmish wargame for use with 28mm miniatures. Players alternately active their models, moving, shooting and fighting with them. Winning is partly based on beating up the opposing warband, partly on controling the centre of the board.

The Warband Builder can acccommodate almost any fantasy figures on the market.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Ice Weasels
description:
Ice floes filled with frozen weasels float by, and you must carefully chip them apart, pull out the furry popsicles, and defrost them. Be on your toes, though, because you don't want to get stuck with frozen monsters or miss your chance to grab the prized weaseltonium particles!

The game begins with a line of cards face up, representing an ice floe. Most of the cards depict a weasel frozen in the ice. On your turn, you may either chip one end off the ice flow and tow it away (take a card from one end of the line) or split the ice floe (separate the cards into two separate lines). If you have collected a matching trio of frozen weasels, you may thaw them to take an extra turn and score more points.

More cards are laid out as the game progresses. Preference cards make particular weasels worth more or less, so part of the strategy is keeping the other players from getting varieties they like while forcing them to take monsters.
publishers: (Self-Published), Friendly Menace Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Monopoly: Ringhotels
description:
Monopoly promotional set of Ringhotels, a German hotel chain of 19 participants.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Quebec Province (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: The Québec Province map is played with the original Ticket to Ride rules and components. This includes the final 10-point score for the longest route. The map is the first to ever include a route of length 9. What a challenge! Such a long route will be difficult to complete without locomotive wildcards, as there are only 12 cards of one color in a standard TtR game. To compensate, the rewards are high: the lucky player finishing this route scores a heavy 24 points -and that's even more than the 20 points from Vancouver to Montreal in the original game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Ludwigshafen
description:
Monopoly set of Ludwigshafen, a city located at Southwest Germany.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Georgsmarienhütte
description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Georgsmarienhütte, a German city, located in Lower Saxony.
remarks:
very first time in Germany, that a small town got an own edition.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Paperclip Railways: Messe / Grugahalle
description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

It was given in Essen 2011 for the buyers of the basegame

From the card:
"When Built: Agree a number with at least one other player, roughly equal to the number of games being played in the current room (or hall). Gain 1 point for every two games."
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Najemnicy Kammeonu
description:
This is fantasy board game for 2 – 4 players who wander through underground corridors and rooms, fight with monsters and collect some objects.
Mechanic is standard -I go you go
The aim of this game is to find three magic objects: golden crown, diamond dagger and magic ring.
The winner is the one who leaves the underground with at least two of three magic objects.
The game probably inspired by Talisman
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Farmeroo!
description:
The farmer left the gate open again! Would you be so kind as to help the farmer's wife get the absentminded farmer and his frolicking animals back to the farm?

In Farmeroo!, players take turns rolling a die, then moving the appropriate number of steps on the game board. If you end your movement on a square with an animal or the farmer, you may pick the corresponding tile from the center of the game board and place it on your personal board – but only if you first lure it by making the sound of the animal or a tractor! If your turn ends on the farmer's wife, you may pick any missing tile. The first player to collect all six animals and the farmer wins!

name: Transylvania Taxi
description:
It's Halloween night. The one night of the year the monsters of Transylvania can get out of the house and act like normal people. Most use the time for errands, but some grab a bite to eat or take in a show. But the dawn comes too soon and the monsters need to get back to their hiding places before the sun catches them outdoors.
That's where the players come in. They must drive their cabs around town picking up the monsters and driving them home to wait out the rest of the year.
In this tile manipulation game, players represent the intrepid cabbies of Transylvania, working hard to see that all the monsters get home before the dawn.
categories: Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Törööö im Zoo!
description:
A children's memory game with an electronic talking device in the shape of "Benjamin the Elephant"

Components:
- 1 talking Benjamin figure
- 15 shrub tiles
- 15 animal tiles
- box bottom that functions as the "zoo"

Background story:
Benjamin should have kept an eye on the zoo animals but he fell asleep and they managed to escape. The players help Benjamin find the animals in the woods.

Aim of the game:
Being the player who finds the most animals.

Setup:
The shrub tiles are laid out and under each shrub an animal tile is hidden. The Benjamin figure is switched on. It explains the game and if you press a button, he asks the first player to find a particular animal. The active player turns over a shrub tile.
