If the first player elects to play in the corner on their first move they may place a stone anywhere on the board on their second.

If one player occupies three corners of a square, and can win the game on their next move, they must announce it to the other player. The game is won when a player makes a single move that produces multiple winning moves for the following turn.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Тайны Тёмного Владыки (Secrets of the Dark Lord)
description:
Тайны Тёмного Владыки ("Secrets of the Dark Lord") is an dungeon-crawler RPG-game. Players are the adventurers in the castle of the Dark Lord. They looting the treasures, fighting the demons and escapes the prisoners.

Every player started at random location with mission and some start bonus (it can be additional HP, spell or equipment card).

Players roll dice (1d6) for moving, opening doors, using teleports in the castle and fighting. Also, rolling the dice may be used when played some random events (player draw event card every time when opening new door on the map) or use spel cards.
To end the game, players must reach the exit from the castle - Blue of Yellow door and open it width the key of same color. Лeys hidden among the tiles of treasures, what randomly placed in treasure cells of the castle map.

After the end of game players counts scored points. Points can be scored for opened doors, killed demons, looted treasures, completed missions, and bonus for player who ends the game.

The player, who has scored more points, wins the game
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Waterloo Squares
description:
Waterloo Squares is 2-player entry-level wargame of the battle of Waterloo 1815 played on a map which represents the historical battlefield.

One player assumes the role of Napoleon and takes command of the French, the other player represents the Wellington/Blücher combination and will command the Allies (British, Dutch/Belgian, minor German states and Prussian)

The Light Blue and Dark Blue counters represent the French forces, the Grey counters the Prussians and the Red counters all the other Allied forces. All counters contain information denoting their type (infantry or cavalry), combat strength and historical designation - which is only used during setup.

The map is divided into 100 squares, each of a single terrain type - Clear, Woods or Buildings - each of which has a somewhat different effect on movement and combat.

Each square can only contain a single counter. Movement and combat between units is regulated and triggered by playing cards from a personal deck which can be manipulated according to a player's chosen strategy.

Players take turns until one player achieves one of his victory conditions at which point the game ends and he's declared the winner.
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simulation

name: La Ruperta Fantasma
description: La Ruperta Fantasma ("The Ghost Ruperta") follows the rules of Battleship. There is a grid with lines and columns identified by letters and numbers. The contestants have to choose a spot from the grid. It could contain a "slip", a "sneak pumpkin" or the "Ghost Ruperta". Getting in a "slip" give the contestants a question. If they answer correctly they go on playing, if they fail you loose your turn The "sneak pumpkin" opens all the spots around the sneak. The "Ghost Ruperta" makes the contestants the winners. There is only a single Ghost Ruperta on the whole grid
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Spooky Wooky
description:
Ghosts roam around the attic playing wildly and (unfortunately) tearing their sheets in the process. Their parents patch them up, but now it's easier to tell who's who when you spot them passing by, and your job in Spooky Wooky is to find pairs of ghosts quicker than anyone else.

To set up, all the tiles are laid face down. Players take turns revealing one tile, and as soon as someone spots a pair of ghosts with patches of the same shape, that player keeps the matching tile newly revealed. Players contain playing until no more matches can be made, then whoever has the most tiles wins.

Alternatively, players of Spooky Wooky can look for ghosts with patches of the same shape and color, or for ghosts with the same number of identically-shaped patches.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Emergency Power Resource
description:
The Emergency Power Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "The Search for Spock," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, The Classic Movies.

When using this resource, place 5 mission tokens on it to start the game. When performing a green or white maneuver with any ship in your fleet, once per round you may spend one of these tokens and perform an additional maneuver from its dial with a speed of 1 or 2, which you treat as a red maneuver. The resource is removed from the game once all 5 tokens are expended.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: En Route
description:
En Route is a pick-up and deliver strategy game with minimalist influences. Players take turns producing and shipping goods around the globe. Commodities are limited and players will be forced to take advantage of their opponents resources to complete their hidden goals.

Players use action cards depicting ports found on the map to produce goods or move goods from adjacent ports. Players must plan how to best move their commodities and re-calculate their plans when their goods are re-directed by other players.

Each player has three hidden destinations, each destination requires two commodities to be delivered to it. When a player achieves one of his or her goals the required commodities are returned to the pool of resources so they can be produced again.

name: Albion's Legacy: The Old Kings
description: The Old Kings adds new characters and new quests to Albion's Legacy. It also adds disasters and companions.

name: Albion's Legacy: The Errant's Journey
description: The Errant's Journey adds new characters and quests to Albion's Legacy. It also adds Disasters and Advantages to the game as well as new mini game boards which can be used to expand the world outside of Camelot.

name: Heist to Paradise
description:
Heist to Paradise - a Dice Game where Crime does Pay! Play the roll of a Criminal and your goal is to rob banks, steal cars, hack computers, and do other mischievous missions to get $1 Million and flee to Paradise! Compete against other players playing as individual criminals or gang together in up to a 9 player game with 3 teams with 3 players on each!

A perfect game for those who love rolling Dice in a fast paced, roller coaster ride of cops and robbers. It's easy to learn and has advanced play features with a timer element adds only more drama! For those who's want to increase the difficulty or just to avoid your slow friend sucking all the fun out of the game taking too long every turn you're now timed on your missions! Besides... who's going to really give you all day to rob a bank anyways?

name: Squer
description:
IntroductionSquer is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. The suggested board sizes are between 5x5 and 8x8. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.



DefinitionsTo flip a stone means to replace it with a stone of the opposite color.

The flipping direction is horizontal for Black and vertical for White.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, you must perform exactly one of the following actions:

- Maneuver: Place one stone of your color on an empty point and flip all straight lines of contiguous enemy stones that are both parallel to your flipping direction and adjacent to your placement in the same direction.

- Sweep: Flip a straight line of contiguous enemy stones along your flipping direction, provided that said line touches the two opposite board edges of your opponent's color and that you haven't swept that same line on any previous turn of the game. As a reference, a swept line can be marked by placing a stone next to it outside the board.



ObjectiveYou win if, at the start of your turn, there's a chain of orthogonally contiguous stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color. You also win if, at the end of your turn, there's such a chain on the board and your opponent has no moves available.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Genios divertidos
description:
Genios divertidos is a party game, Players have to successfully complete activities in each of four sections to win:


Piensa (to think):Players must answer questions of different topics



Actúa (to act: players must act a word or clue



Escribe (to write): Players must solve an ortographic challenge



Crea (to create): Players must draw a clue


Juego de mesa tipo trivia donde se juega en cuatro categorias: Piensa, actúa, escribe y crea.

name: Snowbird Rummy
description: Variation on 5000 Rummy where you play sets of cards for points and try to be the first to get to 1500 points.

name: Falling Stars: Beginner Game
description:
Falling Stars is a Role-Playing and Tactical Game of political and military conflict unfolding amidst an alien intervention.

What is a Tactical Game System? A tactical game system allows players to skirmish one-on-one with each other using the Falling Stars Opposed d10 game system. Players can take a break from role playing (or completely ignore that aspect of the game) and simply enjoy fighting other players. Players can select teams or elect to play free-for-all or anything else in between. The maps in Falling Stars are scaled perfectly for 28mm miniatures, or players can make their own maps using half-inch grid squares or as a miniature gaming system with ranges measured in half-inch increments.
Maybe that tough talking UPAS marine thinks he can take your brawler. So take a break for the RPG and let the two players settle the argument with the Tactical Game System. Bragging rights goes to the winner, and then the group can get back to playing the role playing game. The possibilities are endless!

This box contains everything you need to learn the basic mechanics of Falling Stars. It includes Quick Start Rules, eight pre-generated characters, the first three chapters of an ongoing sci-fi adventure campaign, “Into the Long Dark Night,” characters and tokens mounted on high-quality cardboard and full-color printed maps for the adventure.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Crazy Karts: Accelerators
description:
A set of 4 cards (one for each faction) which can either provide one steering wheel to power an action or (when played in a specific slot) add an additional effect.

Mummies: If placed on the Lasso action, you may move 1 obstacle in your shooting range, 1 space in any direction.

Dwarves: If placed on the Ram action, you don't stop on the first obstacle you hit this round.

Goblins: If placed on the Turn & Go action, you may Turn at any moment during your movement.

Elves: If placed on the Power Up action, you may activate a second Power Up token this round.
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series I – Scenario 03: Rule the World
description:
Two cosmic adventurers are in a tricky scenario and must work together. By rolling and manipulating dice for special abilities and combos, you can be the one that guides them to victory.

Liberation Forces are decimated, paving the way for control of the galaxy's Inner Ring. “But you promised me a real fight."

Suddenly, the comm crackles to life, "Commander! Liberation reinforcements are dropping out of hyperspace!"

"Ah, your playmates have arrived... Now off with you, I'll bring the weapon online."

In Rule the World, your plan for world domination is quickly falling apart as the liberation forces have banded together to stop you! You must eliminate all starfighters to win. If you run out of health, you lose.


Rule the World is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.

This game was originally offered as a stretch goal for Button Shy's Universal Rule Kickstarter.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Operation Desert Weirdness
description:
Published in Command # 16, Operation Desert Weirdness expands the "Desert Storm: The Mother of All Battles" base game. This expansion adds new counters for Japanese, Soviet and Iranian. And new rules and scenarios for Iranian intervention in the Iraqi side, and Soviet intervention in the Iraqi or Coalition side.

The Desert Storm: The Mother of All Battles base game is a one- or two-player operational simulation of the Gulf War. It focused almost exclusively on the Coalition ground war that liberated Kuwait and shattered the occupying Iraqi army.

The game included a 22" x 34" hex map of the significant terrain in the Kuwaiti Theatre of Operations, 192 counters, and 20 pages of rules, charts, and tables.

Rules are split into both a basic and an advanced game. There are separate rules for solitaire play.

The U.S./Coalition player had to completely liberate Kuwait to have a chance to win. If Kuwait was liberated within 12 game turns, the player who has gained the most 'points' in inflicting losses on their opponent, was the winner. The Coalition player had to be aggressive in order to completely clear Iraqi units from all Kuwaiti cities, towns, oilfields, and airfields, otherwise the Iraqi player would win.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: What the Fruit!?
description:
Party trivia game.
In his turn one player draw a card and read a allegation.
Each other player plays a card "True" if he believes that or "False" if not.
All players who guess correctly get a point.
Who is the only one who guessed wrongly must give a point.
If nobody guesses correctly the one who read the allegation gets a point.
Player who gets 10 points first is the winner.

name: Afterglow Miniatures Game
description:
Afterglow Miniatures Game is a tabletop strategy miniature game set in a grim world ravaged by a tremendous cataclysm. Players use models in 32mm scale to represent their warbands fighting over resources, supplies, and territory.

Unlike other strategy miniature games, Afterglow is a game about survival where a player's tactics, decisions, clever use of units, and completion of scenario missions are more important than annihilating enemy units.

name: Gespenster am Fenster
description:
The midnight hour has arrived, and the ghosts are now pressing their noses against the window — but they're scared of their own shadows, so who can find the right shadow to drive them to flight?

Each turn in Ghost Catchers (a.k.a. Gespenster am Fenster), one of the ghosts arrives at the window, and players compete to find the proper shadow for this ghost to scare it away. Whoever thinks they have the right shape, places the transparent card on the ghost and if they're correct, the ghost flees and the player scores. The shadows are all similar, however, and you can try to scare each ghost only once, so look carefully!

The game can played with children from age 4-1/2 and up, with the number of ghosts in play being adjusted to make the game more difficult for older players.

name: Labyrinth: Overlord
description:
What can you expect from this expansion?

Almighty Lord Vortexeios who comes when the Golem is destroyed!
Heroes have to defeat Lord Vortexeios if they want to escape from the Labyrinth!
Lord Vortexeios has much Life and on top of that he moves quickly around the board!
Lord Vortexeios spreads havoc and mayhem by destroying the Labyrinth or changing its layout!
Keys and magic items help in combat with this powerful creature!


Story:
The Golem has guarded the Labyrinth for ages…
But he was not always as we know him now.

Before his creation, the desert was inhabited by Sand Elementals.
The sole purpose of their existence was turning the whole world into the Great Desert.

It was because the sands gave power that could threaten even the Ancients themselves.
When the Elementals grew in power, their ruler, Lord Vortexeios,
Mustered a huge army and attacked the races created by the Ancients.
Many lives were lost, buried under the sands and thrown into an endless sleep.

It seemed nothing could stop Vortexeios.
But then the Ancients intervened.

They used the most powerful artifacts known to them.
They crushed the army of the Elementals so that only few escaped.
Finally, they defeated Lord Vortexeios and locked him
inside a sentient construct - the Golem.

This creation has been bereaving Lord Vortexeios of power
for centuries so that he can never free himself to plague the world.

However, what will happen if the Golem is destroyed?
Will Vortexeios, Lord of Sand Elementals return?

name: Pocket Pharmacy
description:
A dice game where you brew potions out of 5 different ingredients. The lead player takes cubes out of a bag, forms as many groups as there are players, and then each player picks one of the groups. Players then use these cubes to make potions, empower potions and sell them.

The player who most skillfully brews potions, and gains the most money in the end is the winner!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection

name: Dark Darker Darkest: Kickstarter Special
description:
The Dark Darker Darkest - Kickstarter Special box was shipped to all Kickstarter backers of the Premium level pledge.

It added some extras: two new survivors, two new creatures, two new nemesis, ten new map tiles, zombies with special abilities and new miniatures (these where also released with the Zombie Expansion), radioactive rules with red models (a sub-set of the Radioactive Expansion), a small survivor expansion (where you find other civilians in the house) and the small Helipad expansion (a new map tile that shows the landing pad, where you have to end up if you wanna escape).

CONTENT:

2 Survivor Boards and Survivor Miniatures Grey with Colored Base
2 Nemesis Boards and Nemesis Miniatures Grey
2 Creature Boards and Creature Miniatures Grey
10 Room Tiles (6X Inner Rooms, 4X Outer Rooms)
2 Entrap Tokens
8 Skill Tokens
7 Marker Cubes
10 Equipment Cards
7 Glow In The Dark Creature Dice
10 Glow In The Dark Standard Zombie Miniatures
Dark Darker Darkest: Zombie Expansion (contains 40 Spawn Tokens, 50 Zombie Miniatures Grey: 10 each of Standards, Guts, Disco Dolls, Chunk, and Tuff Guy)
Dark Darker Darkest: Survivor Dice Expansion (contains 20 Survivor dice, 5 sets of 4 in each base survivor color)
RadioactiveRed Survivor/Nemesis expansion (contains 1 Room Tile, 27 Radiation Markers, 10 Equipment Cards, 7 Survivor Miniatures Red with Colored Base, 4 Nemesis Miniatures Red) (This is a subset of Dark Darker Darkest: Radioactive Expansion)
Dark Darker Darkest: Victims Mini Expansion (contains 3 Victim Tokens)
Dark Darker Darkest: Heli Escape Expansion (contains 1 Room Tile)
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Tchag
description:
Eliminate the opponent's pieces by mastering a shrinking and transforming playing area, and tiles that fix the type of movement of the pieces.

In turn, each player moves one of his pawns, then removes from play the tile his pawn was placed on. If the removed tile creates an empty space in the playing area, the player moves either side of the row or column to form an uninterrupted row or column. If this reconstruction creates an empty space again, he can move either side of the row or column again and so on. The capture of an opposing pawn is done by moving to the tile it occupies. The winner is the player who captures all 4 opposing pawns.

Contains:

36 tiles,
8 wooden pawns,
1 rule booklet.

name: Catan Scenario: Durango
description:
CWC Durango 2016 Special is a small expansion for Catan, given to contestants at the 2016 Catan World Championship.

The Durango hex is placed in the middle of the Catan board, replacing a pasture hex.

Up to three players may build roads into the center of this hex and settlements on the end of these roads. When the number of this hex is rolled each settlement owner may take a resource card of their choice.

The distance rule does not apply to settlements built inside this hex, and these settlements cannot be upgraded into cities.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Arc of the Kaiser's Last Raider
description:
Description from the publisher:

Arc of the Kaiser's Last Raider (Last Raider for short) puts you in the position of a writer of pulp fiction during the 1920s in which you are trying to complete an adventure fiction novel set some time during World War I on the high seas. You, the writer, are trying to construct a story arc in which the narrator of your novel, the commander of a German high seas raider in 1917, is trying to find a lost secret somewhere in the South Seas which, if he can return it to a port in Europe, will change the course of the World War raging in Europe. This objective is represented by an Objective card.

Along the way, your commander must face many perils, from shark infested waters to monolith haunted lost islands to Uber-Nemeses who will do anything to stop him from completing his mission. These are represented by various Plot Cards.

But you have many ways to complete your mission (i.e., finish the book on deadline). One of these is the mighty Cliche, cards which you can hold and play at critical moments when all seems lost. However, the more Cliche cards you play, the greater the chance you have of losing the reader's suspension of disbelief, quantified as The Plot Thins Index. When you reach your Objective, you must use your Savvy and trusty crew to overcome the final obstacles, grab the prize, and then return home.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Guild Ball: Butcher Starter set
description:
Description from the publisher:

Butchers’ play style has been designed to be quite straightforward. They are masters of the mid to late game. They excel at damage output and generate a lot of momentum through combat and damage effects. They provide each other with a good assortment of buffs and debuffs in order to allow combo play. Butchers mainly focus on raw damage.

That’s not to say that they don’t have some surprises up their sleeves - characters like Shank and Boiler can pop up and surprise you with their goal threats if you’re not careful …

A Guild Ball match requires two teams and a ball. Play against the Butchers and you will find that the ball was really just decoration. The Butcher's Guild knows that there is more than one way to win a game; their intimate knowledge of anatomy developed over years in the slaughter yard is just as useful as the ball skills practiced by their opponents.

In Ox, the Butcher's have one of the deadliest players ever to step onto a Guild Ball pitch. On his own he is responsible for crippling and killing more players than some teams manage over entire seasons. Always on the look out for young talent, Ox brings the apprentices Boiler and Brisket with him to show them just how the Butcher's play the game. They are the meanest, nastiest, most deadly trio to step onto a Guild Ball pitch in a long, long time.

This set provides you with all you need to start playing the Butcher's Guild.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Gundam Cross War
description:
Gundam Cross War is a Gundam themed competitive trading card game. The player acts as a captain leading a troop of Mobile Suit into battle. Destroy your opponent's mother ship as you fight to defend your own! Inflict damage on your enenmy's mother ship. Once your enemy's hit points are reduced from 30 to 0, victory is yours!

Players with the physical card can also register that card into the game app by registering the QR code or 16digit serial.

Physical cards are in Japanese, making players having to memorize skills or be adept at reading Japanese. However the main site provides English translations.

name: Sushi Dice: The Chef's Special
description:
Description from the publisher:

Sushi Dice: The Chef's Special is a mini-expansion for Sushi Dice. During set-up, randomly replace two cards from the box with the Chef's Special cards. These cards require any ingredients, but these ingredients must appear in specific portions:

6 identical ingredients, with no star allowed
2 sets of 3 identical ingredients, these sets must be made of different ingredients
3 sets of 2 identical ingredients, these sets must be made of different ingredients
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Justice League Trading Card Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to the world of the Justice League Trading Card Game featuring the new Meta X game engine! In the Justice League Trading Card Game, universes collide as you battle it out for crossover supremacy. Throughout the game, you’ll be able to play your favorite heroes and villains, enhance your strategies with Event cards, and engage in combat with Battle Cards. Attacking with your Characters will allow you to gain precious Victory Points, and when a player collects 7, they win!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting

name: Exégèse
description:
Exégèse is a game as well as a game generator based on interpretation mechanics.

It is made of 80 cards that contain images and symbols. They lead the players to create their very own games in a short time while playing against the game or against each other.
On your own or with friends, discover a new approach to playing and designing card games, board games and games in general.
While the cards tell if and how you play together against the game or against each other, use Sketch cards and Inspiration cards to find the game mechanics that suit you best!
Discuss with the other players and find out what the new game will look like this time.

name: Fabrik
description:
Description from the designer:

Fabrik players win by creating a line of (at least) four stones in their color, orthogonally or diagonally. However, two neutral pieces (the "workers") determine the spaces where stones can be placed.

name: FAB: Crusader
description:
Welcome to North Afrika November 1941 and Operation Crusader, which was part of the Western Dessert Campaign fought during World War 2.

After the Allied defeat in Operation Battleaxe in June, a lull settled in North Africa, and the Axis siege of Tobruk continued. The Allies used this time to build up their strength and the 8th Army was formed. Before dawn on 18 November, the 8th Army was ready to strike and the Allies launched a sweeping offensive into the Axis controlled Cyrenaica (Eastern Libya) in order to relieve the besieged fortress of Tobruk. After a series of swirling battles, the Axis had to withdraw and the siege was lifted.

Michael Gustavsson, co-designer of FAB: Golan’73 is back with volume IV in the Fast Action Battle series. In this game, as the Allied player, you control the XXX and XIII corps, Tobruk Garrison and the Strategic Reserve force of the 8th Army. As the Axis player, you control the DAK (Deutsches Afrika Korps), the Italian XXI corps and the Corpo d’ Armata di Manovra (CAM) of the Panzergruppe Afrika commanded by the famous Erwin Rommel. Units in the game represents regiments/brigades and some battalions, while assets are mostly battalion size and turns are 1-2 days in time.

In FAB: Crusader you will see features like Motorized Infantry units, higher stacking limits, Tank Refit, Italian Trieste Reserve Division, Ghost Units, Fortified areas, Realistic Armor treatment, Special Reconnaissance Unit Capabilities, movement points to trace Supply and Divisional Integrity rules, a new Combat Matrix and other rules for transferring the system to desert warfare.

Assets include Machine Gun Battalions, Allied "I" Tanks, Powerful German 88’s (AT) and more. Various events are included such as Air Missions, Allied Rapid Response, The Beta Convoy, British LRDG Commando Raid, Naval Bombardment and German Auftragstaktik, Command Confusion among others. The game also have optional rules to enhance realism such as Allied Armor Doctrine, Probe Attacks, Italian SNAFU Check and German Momentum.

This battle will provide interesting challenges to both sides: Will the Allies try a risky breakout from Tobruk, and will it be relieved, will Rommel go for a dash to the wire, will Allied replacements outlast Axis fuel and supply, will the Italians crumble or hold? Now, it is up to YOU to find out…
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Parang
description: Parang is a card game from Borneo, with a theme of headhunting shown through the artwork. The aim is to collect the most head trophies from victory cards. These are separated into three piles with 1, 2 and 3 skulls (Antu Pala) respectively. Players have identical hands of 9 cards and bid simultaneously on each of the three piles; a complete round thus consists of three mini-rounds. Generally speaking the highest valued card wins, but identical cards cancel each other, and there are some other special cases. Ties are broken through a rock-paper-scissors mechanism based on the cards in the tie.

name: Twilight of the Sun-King: Scenario Book 1 – Louis XIV at War
description:
From the Introduction:

"This booklet contains scenarios for use with the Twilight of the Sun King rules and it focuses on the two major conflicts of the era in Western and Central Europe. The first of this is the war of 1688 to 1697, which has various names, the Nine Years War, the War of the Grand Alliance, or the League of Augsburg. The War of the Spanish Succession, 1701 to 1714, was the second major conflict where France and its allies faced a coalition headed by Holland, Britain, Austria, and their allies."
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Cypress Legacy
description:
Cypress Legacy: The Board Game is for 2 to 6 players taking place in one of the Cypress Mansions. Players will take on the role of trying to work their way through the massive mansion while trying to achieve their objectives, and prove to be Lorna's true friend. Each player knows of the other players that are within the mansion and views them as someone who is trying to steal what is there. The player to achieve the goals, will be considered the winner and thus the true friend of Lorna. You will have at times, skills that you can earn or possibly steal. You can also acquire assets and or weapons that will aid you in your task at hand.

Classified Prototypes are very hard to get but are extremely useful if acquired. One example of a Classified Prototype is being able to gain control over the Knights for one turn, be able to capture as well as then send adversaries to the Storage Room and be locked in.

The mansion has its own elements that are going to be hard to get around but with how it has been designed there are also a few very useful elements it also offers. One such benefit is the Security access key, that if acquired gives you additional passages to expedite your journey. Using these and planning your moves well are very important to locate and acquire the "Inheritances". Once achieved then your next task is going to be getting all required items to get out without losing what you have and is needed to take back to Lorna.

Each time a player has a turn, they will draw and event card prior to their role. This will effect their planning and next move or in some cases change everything with the fact the Mansion, Vonya and the Knights are a ever present factor. There are (158) Event Cards Alone.

Additionally in a players turn they can choose to have PVP prior to drawing or roll of dice, depending on cards you may hold and where the other player may be.

Your movement, planning and deck building, will be key to your acquiring what you need and escaping the mansion! (327) Total Cards In Cypress Legacy: The Board Game

Whether you are two players or six, from the first roll to success, the drama to acquire what you need and escape grows continually. This feature is in the game every time you play and with the design, also gives great replayability.

It has taken some time and a lot of changes especially over the last year and a half, but we do now finally have our first run in and are also taking in dealers now. The game has undergone a lot of revisions and art changes. We wanted to take the extra time to adjust the game play and have a very good balance to the game. Now we are very happy with the results and are beginning to get the game out. (Please note this is not a "Legacy" game, this is part of the title because of the overall story.)

Cypress Legacy: The Board Game is based on the Cypress Inheritance Saga.
OBJECTIVE: Use Weapons, Skills, Assets, and Classified Prototypes to be the first player to escape the Cypress Mansion with all the required inheritance items and be Lorna’s proven friend.

STORY: The story you are playing within begins with Lorna Ritten just learning of Alfred Cypress, the grandfather she has never known. Lorna has always wanted to find out more about her biological family, which has always been a mystery. Her grandfather’s attorney, Phillip Brandt, tells Lorna of an inheritance, which includes one of her grandfather’s many mansions and its contents. Her desire to know more marks the beginning of a very unique and potentially dangerous situation. Lorna has no idea just how important this actually is to her and will be to others. As Lorna is studying some of the inheritance documents before visiting the mansion, she realizes there are objects that hold key information hidden throughout the mansion.

Also note the complete Cypress Legacy: The Board Game Manual in the files below. (Note the player versus player elements in the manual)

The Novel Series has gone through a lot of changes as well and the first novel will be available soon.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Take That

name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Archers Promo Cards
description:
Team Arrow takes aim at your opponents with these 3 Dice Masters cards. Use Green Arrow, Roy Harper, and Focus Power for the win. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


Focus Power: Basic Action Card (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men)
Green Arrow: Archery Advocate
Roy Harper: Adolescent Archer


Focus Power can be used with any Basic Action Dice, Green Arrow and Roy Harper use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Punch Cards
description:
A short, party-sized game of robot combat. Work with teams of 2-3 players to navigate your robot across a map filled with obstacles, find the robots controlled by the other teams, and punch them until they stop moving.

The challenge is that everyone on your team is programming your robot independently, and your team's robot will move and act based on whichever actions get the most team votes. To win the game, you'll need to anticipate what your team members are likely to do in a given turn, and work to enhance/boost their actions.

Robots start with 11 basic action cards, and can add extra cards by picking up upgrades that are scattered around the map. The game is fast, chaotic, and ridiculous.

name: House of Boing
description:
Each player picks a Room and chooses a Ball color. The player places 4 Balls of the chosen color in her or her room. Players should make sure the pivoting Doors on the Base of the House are in the open position.
Agree on an official starter. The starter shouts “Boing!” and everyone starts bouncing his/her Balls into the House of Boing, trying to empty his/her Rooms at the same time.
Players must always pick up and throw Balls with ONLY ONE HAND. Players can bounce Balls into the unit either through the Window in the side facing them, or bounce Balls up and into the Skylight hole at the top of the House of Boing. You cannot bounce Balls through the Windows facing other players.
If a Ball drops on the floor, the player who threw the Ball must immediately go and pick it up and get back to the game as quickly as possible.
Hint: watch other player’s Rooms. If you see someone close to emptying his or her room, then try to bounce more Balls in the direction of his or her Room to stop them from winning.


Winning the Game:
The first player to empty his or her Room of Balls and close the pivoting Door is the winner.

name: Crazy Neighbors
description:
Crazy Neighbors is a humorous game, where the players assume the roles of residents in a suburban neighborhood populated by a cast of crazy stereotypes.

Each player belongs to one of four exaggerated demographic groups, the Hippies, the Rednecks, the Culture Snobs or the Moneybags. The people belonging to the different groups obviously cannot stand each other, and the goal of the game is to make sure that your preferred type of people move in to your neighborhood, and that the properties surrounding your opponents are populated by people they dislike. Meanwhile you can also upgrade your own property and bring all kinds of misfortune to your opponents.

The game plays with all kinds of stereotypes in a tongue-in-cheek manner. For the duration of the game, each player will identify with their own demographic and try to be as outrageously mean as possible to her opponents.

The large cast of neighbors are represented by cards with individual abilities and descriptions, each illustrated by the gifted artist Erik Ødegaard.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Lava Flows
description:
Lava Flows is an abstract game played with some of the components in Pyramid Arcade. The goal is to move all of your pieces to the opposite row of a 3x3 grid using careful movement, deduction, and memory.

This game was distributed as a digital download as part of the annual Looney Labs Holiday Gift for 2017.

name: Meat Sweats: The Game
description:
Friends gather to grill and eat massive quantities of meat at a backyard barbecue, but there’s not enough space on the grill!

This card game features simultaneous action, variable player powers, hand-management, take-that and a towel to avoid the dreaded Meat Sweats.

The first player to eat 7 pieces of meat ends the game, but the player that consumed the highest combination of quantity and quality meat wins (most points).

Each round, grill cards are spread out in the center of the table to represent meat on the grill. These cards also have a hidden value on the back of the card based on the quality of the meat (for end game scoring).

Players simultaneously position their characters next to a grill card that they will attempt to eat. Players then simultaneously play a meat craving card (face down) from their hand and reveal. If players have a matching meat they can score it, unless someone else wants the same meat and is willing to pay more matching cards for it. No one scores ties, unless you or a temporary ally play a Meat Sweats card on your opponent. If you receive the meat sweats card, you're unable to claim meat this round, but you get to keep the meat sweats card, making you more powerful later on!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Pokémon TCG: Gym Challenge Expansion
description:
Gym Challenge is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion "Gym Booster 2: Challenge from the Darkness".

The expansion includes 132 cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monopoly Junior: Kung Fu Panda 3
description:
The Dragon Warrior of ancient China needs your help! You must travel with Po and take on the great responsibility of training a village of clumsy Pandas to help him defeat the evil Kai... are your kung fu skills sharp enough to fight with Po to victory?

Travel around the Valley of Peace, buy Po's journey cards, build Jade Palaces, complete Fortune cookie Mysteries and try to get your hands on as many Chopsticks as possible from Mr Ping's Noodle Box!

Belly Gong into this awesome kung fu adventure and give your opponents a heaping dose of justice in this Kung Fu Panda 3 Monopoly Junior! Time for some Skadooshing!

—description from the publisher

name: Ascension: Ultimate Collector's Edition
description:
The Ultimate Collector's Edition was exclusively available from the Ascension Online kickstarter. Only 150 copies were produced.

This edition contains the contents of the Ascension: Year One and Year Two Collector's Editions (excluding the Year Two gameboard).

It's standout features are the stunning wooden box, with metal clasp and corners, and and the signed certificate of authenticity.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Garden of Zen
description:
A cooperative game of silent harmony.

This is a 9-card nano game in which two players try to construct a zen garden that will match the hidden goal card. Each card has both a component of the garden and a victory condition. By clever placement and logical deduction, players try to discern which victory condition is on the last remaining card. The game is quick, but encourages contemplative interaction and logical thinking.

There are alternate rule sets that allow a competitive game, where you try to prevent your opponent from meeting their goal while trying to make yours, or to play solo.

—description from the designer


Another winner of our Nano Game Contest, this one stood out right from the beginning due to its range with just 9 cards. Jason actually developed it as a system with multiple different ways to play, and we may release additional rules down the line. Co-op was where it shined for us, and Mike Mullins was even tinkering with a solo version, which hopefully will make it your way as well.

—description from the publisher

name: Aquarium Designer
description:
In this tile-laying game, players are aquarium designers trying to create the most delightful aquarium.

Tiles can have up to 4 areas depicted on them:

Brown (area where visitors can see seals)
Pink (dolphins)
Light blue (penguins)
Dark blue (angel fish)


At game plays over eight rounds, in which players pick and place tiles. Points are awarded points at the end of the game for the areas they created. The player with the highest score wins.

Gameplay

At the beginning of the game, every player gets an "Entrance" tile (featuring all four areas). Shuffle the layout cards to make a draw deck (cards face up), and place a number of layout tiles equal to the number of players face up. The player that has most recently visited an aquarium goes first.

Each round, there are two phases: a tile acquisition phase, and a building phase.

During the tile acquisition phase, players take turns picking a tile from the available layout tiles. Play proceeds clockwise, and each player may decide to pick immediately, or postpone their decision ("pass") and pick a tile after others have picked theirs. Players can only pass once: if a player decides to "pass" they will have to pick a tile after the other players have picked their tiles or passed. This continues until all players have picked a tile. The last person to pick a tile will be the starting player next round.

Examples: 4 players, A-B-C-D, A starts
1. A: picks, B: picks, C: picks, D: picks. Every player has a card, acquisition phase ends. D is next round's starting player.
2. A: picks, B: passes, C: picks, D: picks, A: does nothing, B: picks. Every player has a card, acquisition phase ends. B is next round's starting player.

During the building phase, player place their tiles in their own Aquarium. The following restrictions apply:
1. The sides of the tiles have to touch completely. The orientation of the tile does not matter.
2. Tiles cannot go outside a 3 by 3 frame. Entrance does not have to be in the middle.
3. Areas on the tiles do not have to match.
4. Once placed, tiles cannot be moved.

At the end of the round, the layout cards are replenished.

After eight rounds, players will have a 3 by 3 grid.

Scoring points is easy:

You can only count connected areas with 2 or more animals.
For each area, count the number of tiles in that area and add the number of animals.


The player with the highest score wins.

—user summary

name: Bird Feeder Frenzy
description:
A very casual deduction and bluffing game for 2 to 6 bird lovers.

You’re just another bird plotting to get the biggest share of seeds from the neighborhood feeders with the most seeds and fewest other birds.

The "Feeders" are several rows of cards in the middle of the table with some face-up and some face-down cards.

Each turn, players add one card at one of the feeders, with an option to first peek at a face-down card. If the player peeks, they play their card face-up. Once all cards are played, all is revealed, critters steal their seeds, and the birds share what’s left.

This 18-card micro-game gives players a limited amount of information along with a few ways to learn more about and impact what is available at each of the feeders. A little deduction will place your bird in the most advantageous spot, and a little bluffing will coax others’ birds to miss the big haul.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Memory, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Huh, What Is in the Garage?
description: Somewhere in the world there lives a purple-haired monster. You might have already heard tales about his sister who travels from wardrobe to wardrobe. Our purple friend tagged along with his sister for a while, until he realized that clothes are just not his thing. He emerged from the wardrobe and left his sister sighing among the garments. He left the house through the garage, we know that he has been there from the mess he leaves behind. Sometimes, that is why the adults can’t find their tools even when they are absolutely sure that they put them back in their place the day before. Can you remember where everything is in the garage?

name: Čtveráček
description: Čtveráček is a satirical improvisation card party game for four or more players. It is played on individual rounds, so-called "term of office". In each term of office, one player is the president (of Czech Republic), player on his or her left is the president's spokesperson and all others are journalist. The President chooses the subject of speech and, after playing the cards (statements) he/she must use them in a speech. Journalists then ask unnecessary and provocative additional questions to which the spokesperson must react promptly, even if they are far from being worthy. If his responses gets journalists offended, they give him points of shame. When a journalist buzzes, the spokesperson is satisfied. Goal of the game is gain as many points of shame as possible.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Political

name: Serengeti: A Race For Life – Migration
description:
Migration is the second expansion aka thematic pack for Serengeti: A Race For Life. It contains 30 cards and provides an alternative to the starting setup as well as changing the dynamics of the game.

In Migration the emphasis is on grassing animals, a class of animals found in the game that is further expanded in this expansion with the addition of the Zebra.

The Zebra takes center stage in this thematic pack and is required in every game playing with this setup, alongside the Wildebeests (special cards) that drives a new majority that players will need to vie for.

Of course no Great Migration would be complete without Crocodile watching their every move, so expect a game of attrition where our grass-eating friends can roam free, but not as freely as they'd wish!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: El Juego de Botilde
description:
Game based on the traditional Game of the Goose. It was used in a giant size in 1983 in the Spanish most famous TV contest "Un, dos, tres... responda otra vez" (on which the British "Three, two, one" was based) and shortly after comerciallized as a board game for the general public.

For this game two different dices are used: One is the traditional dice from 1 to 6; and in the other there are four images of Botilde, one x2 and one negative sign. If it falls in Botilde the throw of the other dice remaines unchanged; while a x2 doubles that roll; and the - forces to go back instead of advance.

As in the Game of the Goose, falling into a Botilde means going "from boot to boot and shoot because it touches you". There are also question boxes; and trip boxes, which assignes a try-out. The other boxes all have a specific function, sometimes positive and sometimes negative, including those that make leaving the game. In the last section, called "the magic circle", the players would go around until they are eliminated or fall exactly in the Booty playing only with the traditional dice.
—user summary (translated)

Juego basado en la tradicional Oca. Se utilizó en un formato gigante en 1983 en el concurso de TV "Un, dos, tres... responda otra vez", para ser comercializado al poco tiempo como juego de mesa para el público general.

Para este juego se utilizaban dos dados diferentes: Uno era el dado tradicional del uno al seis; y en el otro había cuatro imágenes de Botilde, un x2 y un -, si caía en Botilde la tirada del otro dado quedaba sin cambios, mientras que un x2 doblaba esa tirada, y el - hacía retroceder en lugar de avanzar.
Como en la oca, caer en una Botilde significaba ir "de bota a bota y chuta porque te toca". También había casillas de pregunta, y casillas de tropezón, que asignaban una prueba.

El resto de casillas tenían todas una función específica, unas veces positiva y otras negativas, incluyendo las que hacían abandonar el juego. En el último tramo, llamado "el círculo mágico", los jugadores irían dando vueltas hasta que fueran eliminados o cayeran exactamente en el botín jugando solamente con el dado tradicional.
—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Woo Boo
description:
Woo Boo is an unusually judgmental game for friends, family, and total strangers. How well do you know your friends? And how well do they know you? Find out, as you take turns making opinions on three interesting topics, while other players try to guess what you really think. Will it be WOO or BOO? The answer isn't always black or white!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Turn Order: Claim Action, Turn Order: Progressive, Voting

name: Poor Choices: Black Mamba Expansion
description: The Second Expansion Pack includes 112 brand new cards that work well when combined with the Adult Edition.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Storytelling, Take That, Voting

name: Regenbogenrutsche
description:
Kolya the Cat wants to slide down the rainbow, just like the cloud sheep.

In Meine ersten Spiele: Regenbogenrutsche, the children work together to build a colorful rainbow slide. They will learn the numbers from one to three and the six colors of the rainbow.

name: Chicago
description:
You are the boss of a mob family in old Chicago, trying to control the majority of business, pressing their owners for money and avoiding the FBI agents.

Chicago is a hand management game with an area control component, but in order to assure the control ob an ares (a.k.a. business) you have to fulfil some requests (every business has his own requestes) and suffer a consequence (usually loss of some cards).

Chicago is the first game in the Small Box category from MS Jogos.

—description from the publisher

name: Der interaktive Globus puzzle ball
description:
Contents:
In this game there are 96 puzzle pieces, 1 stand for the 3D puzzle ball, 1 control panel for using the tiptoi pen.
In order to play the game each player needs a tiptoi pen which is not included in the game.

Gameplay:
In this game the players have to find places or animals on earth.

At the start of the game the players need to solve a 3D puzzle of earth.

There are 4 different game versions:

1st version:
In order to win the active player needs to find the most places on earth within 1 minute.

2nd version:
In order to win the active player is the last player in the game. The tiptoi sets one condition and each player needs to find one place on earth which fits the description. If it is wrong the player leaves the game until only the winner is left.

3rd version:
The last player in the game is the winner.
The active player puts the tiptoi on an animal. All players can hear the sound of the animal. The next player has to find the previous animals and add another. Each player who can´t find all the animals in the right order leaves the game.

4th version:
The last player in the game is the winner.
At the start of this version the players decide how long one round is to last (set in tiptoi pen). The active player names a place on earth the next player has to find. The active player at the end of the round (sound signal) leaves the game.

name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Brandy Station
description:
In June of 1863 Alfred Pleasonton and the cavalry of the Army of the Potomac would face J.E.B. Stuart's cavalry of the Army of Northern Virginia near Culpepper Virginia in what would be the largest cavalry battle in North America.

Last Full Measure is a free print-and-play game system of battles of the American Civil War. Brandy Station is the seventh game in the series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to its size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 272 2-sided counters.

The Battle Book includes two Scenarios; Groveton, August 28th: The Full Battle and Longstreet Arrives, August 29th and an initial strength chart.

The map measures 39" x 35" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex.
AND just added (July 25, 2018), a 21" x 35" map extension to the west with a new Order of Arrival card to accommodate the new map.
A new ZunTzu box also incorporates the new map extension.

The full game is available for download at: http://UhlanGames.us
as are Zun Tzu gameboxes for all LFM games
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Wake the Dead
description:
The proud Aeldari of Saim-Hann once sought to assist Humanity in the defence of Vigilus — a world beset on all sides by unceasing, brutal conflict — but an act of xenophobic slaughter by soldiers of the Imperium has turned ally to foe, and the warriors of the Wild Host have sworn a blood oath to exact vengeance. No one can prevent them — no one except, perhaps, the Ultramarines. These superhuman, gene-forged warriors are humanity's greatest champions, peerless masters of strategy who have defended the Imperium for millennia. With bolt and blade, they assert the sovereignty of Vigilus.

Warhammer 40,000: Wake the Dead is a boxed set containing two armies split across the forces of the Ultramarines — the iconic Space Marines Chapter who have defended humanity for thousands of years — and the Wild Host of Saim-Hann, hot-blooded, daredevil warriors whose skill cannot be understated. You can use these miniatures to act out the scenarios described in the Wake the Dead book — four connected missions that recreate the violence on Vigilus — and use them to expand your games of Warhammer 40,000, with rules included for the Primaris Lieutenant and Craftworlds Spiritseer exclusive to this set!

Components in this box include a 40-page paperback book with:

- War Zone Vigilus: a brief history of this embattled world – a vital supplier of materiel for the Imperium – and the events leading to the bitter clashes that dominate the surface;
- Space Marines: an introduction to the greatest warriors of the Imperium of Mankind, and the Ultramarines Chapter which embodies their ideals more than any other;
- Craftworlds: a primer on the Asuryani of the Craftworlds, a race desperately fighting to preserve its culture and punish its foes;
- Blood Vendetta: an overview of the intentions and purpose behind the Asuryani of Saim-Hann’s focus on Vigilus, the lengths to which they will go to carry out their mission and the manner in which the defenders of this world will deal with this incursion;
- Detailed background information on each unit included in the box;
- A miniatures showcase featuring a beautifully painted examples of the miniatures in Wake the Dead.

Rules

- 8 datasheets providing rules for each of the included miniatures;
- 4 Echoes of War missions, which can be linked together to form a small campaign echoing the narrative of Wake the Dead;
- Runes of Battle: 6 psychic powers for use by the Spiritseer;
- Points values for every included miniature, for use in Matched Play.

Miniatures

Ultramarines

- 5 Intercessors: these can be armed with 3 different variant bolt rifles, with options for a Sergeant, 1 Intercessor holding a combat knife and 1 holding a bolt pistol. 18 heads, 6 pistol holsters, 5 ammunition and grenade pouches, 3 combat knife scabbards, 2 single grenade pouches and 2 bolt pistol ammunition pouches are included, meaning a huge variety of customisation and spares;
- 5 Reivers: these include a host of weapon options, with 5 heavy bolt pistols, 6 bolt carbines and 7 combat knives are included, with the loadout options being carbine, pistol and carbine or pistol and combat knife.Each model can also feature grav-chutes – 10 fins are included, 5 for each side of the Reivers’ backpacks. They have plenty of helmet options, too – 10 helmets featuring their unique skull design, 10 with the top removed and the lower half remaining and 4 Sergeant-specific bare heads;
- 3 Inceptors: armed with either 2 plasma exterminators each or 2 assault bolters each, these models include 5 different helmets and 4 purity seals – 1 of these is doubled, to denote a Sergeant;
- A Primaris Lieutenant: armed with a power sword and bolt pistol, he clutches a rosary, has a helm featuring a laurel wreath and iron halo emblems on his chest and forearms.

Aeldari

- A 10-man Guardian Squad: this is made up of 8 Guardians armed with shuriken catapults, and a weapons platform with 2 crew – the platform can be built with either a bright lance, a missile launcher, a scatter laser, a starcannon or shuriken cannon;
- 5 Wraithguard: these are armed with a choice of wraith cannon, D-scythe, swords and axes;
- A Wave Serpent: a troop-carrying vehicle armed with a choice of twin bright lance, twin star cannon, twin missile launcher, twin shuriken cannon and a twin scatter laser turret
- A Spiritseer: wielding a Aeldari blade and witch staff, with a shuriken pistol holstered at his back, the Spiritseer is posed with his foot atop a piece of ruined architecture.

Extras

Also included are 2 transfer sheets – 1 Aeldari and 1 Ultramarines Infantry – and a fold-out Warhammer 40,000 Core Rules sheet.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Escape
description:
A solo game requiring the lone survivor of a space mission to gather up equipment on the space ship to make the journey home by escape pod before the oxygen is depleted within the space ship.

Using up to 3 actions, the player moves throughout the spaceship picking up equipment and solving issues that arise throughout the game. Moving through the spaceship reveals equipment found in the spaceship. The spaceship is represented by cards stacked representing the different rooms of the spaceship.

As the the player completes a turn, they draw a card from the Oxygen Levels deck to represent the depleting oxygen supply within the spaceship. The difficulty level can be adjusted by changing the amount of cards within the Oxygen Levels deck.

The base game includes 4 different scenarios that explain what equipment and other requirements are needed to be meet before safely escaping through the Escape Pod.

"Get out while you can still breathe!"

—description from the publisher

name: Anonymous
description:
In A.D. 2358, due to dramatic development of Artificial Intelligent, it is not hard to find AI in our life. However, mother AI with its own ego was born and the mother AI created the algorithm resembles humankind. Now, the position of humankind and AI is reversed. There are a few rebel forces known as ‘Anonymous’ who tries to destroy the mother AI and reclaim the Earth. They fight with mother AI under a mask and the mother AI deploys AI hackers to eliminate them all. A confrontation between mother AI who tries to have control over the Earth and ‘Anonymous’ who tries to regain the Earth is on.

The objective of Anonymous is to decode the codes of the adversary and reveal the identity before the other team does. If a whole team got caught, they lose and the survivors and their team members get victory points.

‘Anonymous’ is a new edition for Internal Affairs released in 2015. Enjoy the quick and easy plays of the game with the new theme and the system!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: Seascrapers
description:
A new city rises out of the seafloor. Pumice brick, ceramic and live coral form massive spiraling towers, bustling with the energy of thousands of beings. The merfolk have always lived a quiet agrarian life below the waves, but times are changing and the way forward is building up.

Seascrapers is a solitaire roll-and-write city-building game in which players attempt to develop an underwater metropolis. By rolling dice, players can build facilities to house builders(which allow for the rolling of additional dice), priests (which allow re-rolls of dice), and scholars (which allow for the creation of more advanced buildings). Players can also construct more specialized facilities, which can modify the effects of adjacent buildings or award points. The most lucrative points, however, come from buildings that scrape the very surface of the sea and emerge into the alien world above -- but these first require the development of vast infrastructure below.

Each turn, after dice are rolled and buildings are built, a space on the time track is crossed off. The end of this track represents the conclusion of the merfolk's efforts, and the city's score is tallied up for evaluation.

Can you balance the various classes of merfolk society to build towering seascrapers, or will your city end in a heap on the ocean floor?

—description from the publisher


Released in the June 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: House of Possession
description:
House of Possession is a filler board game where you race to be the first to escape a demon infested mansion.

Each player in this fast-paced game has a unique character that moves through the house collecting and playing Exits and sometimes causing Possession Events. Characters also have special abilities called Desperate Acts that help you gain the upper hand. And you will need the upper hand to beat your opponents and escape the demons that are working hard to keep you in the house.

To win the race, be the first to collect ten or more Exit Points by the end of any turn.

—description from the publisher

name: Maiden's Quest: Promo 5 – Drinking Steins
description:
On promo cards 2-5, you collect the signatures of up to 5 people when specific conditions are met. You afterwards integrate the signed card in your deck to get a bonus.

Condition for promo 5: when you and another player both have Steins during a Serendipity, tap them together afterwards.
Reward: place in deck as extra discovered treasure.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Afrikaland
description:
Az Afrikaland egy vidám, fordulatos családi játék, ahol a játék elején a pályát is magunk alakítjuk, teret adva a fantáziának és az alkotás örömének. A szafari során menet közben fedezzük fel, hol mi rejtőzik, biztosítva így a meglepetés nyújtotta változatosságot játékról játékra. Utunkat állatok kísérik, szedhetünk gyümölcsöket, utazhatunk dzsippel és helikopterrel, elkerülvén a mocsarakat és a vulkánokat, élvezhetjük bennszülöttek társaságát, miközben felfedezzük Afrika legszebb látnivalóit. A játékszabályok egyszerűek, emellett összetett gondolkodásra, taktikázásra ösztönöznek, ami elősegíti a stratégiai gondolkodásmód kialakulását. Szabályozható a pálya hossza, így a játékidő is, továbbá praktikus is, ugyanis bármilyen méretű és formájú asztalon játszható.

The objective of the game:

The game takes you on an exciting Safari, encountering wild animals which will help you along the way together with exotic fruits and vehicles.
At the crossroads you will get the chance to visit some of the famous African sights.
The player reaching the finish having collected all four image cards of African attractions wins the game.

Ziel des Spiels

Im AFRIKABENTEUER Brettspiel können wir an einer Safari teilnehmen. Unterwegs tauchen unerwartet Tiere auf, die bei unserer Reise uns helfen oder uns behindern können, doch es gibt auch manche Südfrüchte undVerkehrsmittel, die uns behilflich sein können. An den Abzweigungen sind berühmte Sehenswürdigkeiten zu finden. Der Spieler, der als erster das Ziel erreicht und auch die vier afrikanische Sehenswürdigkeiten bei sich hat, gewinnt das Spiel.

—user summary

name: Bottles:  A Boardgame about Wine
description:
"The players take up the role of high society members who need to have a top supply of rare and fine wines in their wine cellar to show off during their dinner parties. Hence, they are forced to travel the world up and down in order to buy the best bottles directly from local producers."

There are 6 markers in the game, each one representing a character; players choose who they want to be at the start of the game.

The Game table show the world that is divided in cells linked with each other. The greater part of the cells represents the world, the cells with the bottle icons indicate the typical wine production places. Other cells represent the market, the blue ones, the sea.

The players, only at start, will stand about two meters away from the board and will, when prompted by an agreed cue, throw their marker on the board trying to get as near as possible to a convenient cell. If the marker does not fall within the cells area, it will be positioned in the closest permitted cell to start playing. In case of launch failure, players can have as many attempts as it takes at throwing their marker on the game board.

The youngest player (alternatively, if you are having fun playing BOTTLES in a bar, the guy buying the first round) starts to move.
The player throws the die and checks the result on the movement chart, according to this the given marker will move from the start cell to a different one.

During his turn the players move and can buy bottle-cards. Moreover they can auction, sell, exchange or donate their bottle-cards or beg other players for theirs at any time during his turn.

There are approximately 80 different cards representing the wine bottles that the players can buy. Each card shows a variety of information about the type, the name, the country of origin and the value of the wine. This value is given by the amount of wine glass icons on the card. For instance, a card with 3 wine glass icons will cost 3 Monetary Units.

When players run out of money they get out of the game... Unless they convince other players to lend them money.

The first player that collects at least ten bottles from ten different countries wins the game.

name: Mongoose vs. King Cobra:  Indian Ocean Carrier Raid Apr42
description:
Relatively fast, playable naval ship, air squadron, and land brigade scale game using dummies for fog of war. As many as 36 8-hour turns (12 days, but warships may not stay at sea for longer than 9 days). ca. 80 miles per hex. Single sided pieces.

Will the "mongeese" - 3 ... or 4? ... Eastern Fleet carriers - get close enough to launch their night attack torpedo bomber squadrons? Or will the 4-6 King Cobra Kido Butai's fleet carriers catch and slaughter them within their aircraft's long range in daytime like they did carrier Hermes and heavy cruisers Cornwall and (Bismarck veteran) Dorsetshire?

There is a quote of Churchill saying that the threat of losing (unsinkable aircraft carrier) Ceylon - and the Japanese gaining control of the Indian Ocean - was the most dangerous moment of the war, although (with hindsight) we now know the Japanese had decided not to invade.

Against all 4 Kongo class fast battleships, the British muster only minimally sufficiently fast Warspite, but then there are the 4 old wheezing R class battleships which have limited duration at sea and being slow would be easy meat ... and victory points ... unless *they* can somehow get within gunfire range of a (secret 50% possible) Japanese landing force's transports or a slowed, damaged carrier.

The British player is thus always under heavy pressure, and if the Japanese get the Ceylon landing/invasion mission, they feel that too. A good 3-player game can be with one British player and a player each for the (invading or instead just raiding) Japanese Malaya Force and Kido Butai.

Replete with questionable Ceylon Defence Force loyalty. Will the Ceylon Planter's Brigade mutiny into a(n ill-advisedly) pro-Japanese Trotskist(!) brigade? (See what happened on Cocos Island about then.)

And yes, our 10th U.S. Air Force is there ... with our 2 B-17s and 1 LB-30 (B-24). And as for my Dutch East Indies and other such games, level bombers can press their luck and bomb lower, albeit at higher risk of being shot down by antiaircraft gun batteries ... not that the Zeroes won't slaughter them anyway.

Lots of freighter fish milling around the Bay of Bengal for the Japanese to bag too.

Our first game, I was the overwhelmingly strong Japanese ... and got SMEARED.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Nautical, Political, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Exodus: Proxima Centauri – ECID-S14 Mini-Expansion
description:
This is a planet hex promo tile for Exodus: Proxima Centauri, Edge of Extinction, and Event Horizon. Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

PROMO RULES:

ECID-S14 is a Hazardous planet. During setup, no dice are placed on the planet. During production, each player with one or more Population on this planet may choose which resource to collect. After collecting resources, each player must remove one of their Population cubes from ECID-S14.

If playing without the Event Horizon expansion, you may use ECID-S14 in place of a standard CP Planet hex.

When playing with the Centaurian Outposts (M3) module of the Event Horizon expansion, do not place a Centaurian Outpost token on ECID-S14.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: GIF IT UP!
description:
The GIFt that keeps on GIFFING

What's funnier than a well-timed GIF and a snarky one-liner?

GIF IT UP! is a game where players match hilarious captions with GIFs from the net to create endless combinations.

Unlimited Fun! Expect the Unexpected

We love to play table-top card games with friends and family, but after a few rounds conventional card games get repetitive, forcing us to buy expansion packs to keep things fresh. GIF IT UP! is different!

GIF IT UP! incorporates a dynamic, intuitive App (iOS & Android) that pulls hilarious and random GIFs from the net, making an unforgettable and completely unique experience every time!

—description from the designer

name: Faules-ei
description:
A short quick card game in which you quickly pass around a card from you hand, until you have a set of four of the same colour. Don't get stuck with the black egg, the "faules-ei".

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Space Freaks: Liquidator – The 29th Head Promo Card
description:
Promo card from the Man vs. Meeple Season 2 Kickstarter Campaign.

Liquidator

States that Freaks gain Plus 2 to attacks when using sponsor cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Warhammer Armies (Fourth Edition): Wood Elves
description:
Warhammer Armies: Wood Elves is an expansion to the 4th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Wood Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Orcs & Goblins
description:
Warhammer: Orcs & Goblins is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Orcs & Goblins faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Wood Elves
description:
Warhammer: Wood Elves is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Wood Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Hatchimals CollEGGtibles Hatchtastic Jumbo Card Game
description:
In the Hatchimals Hatchtastic Jumbo Card Game, you're trying to collect the most egg tokens. To do this, you roll the die and draw cards until one player's cards match the egg color and number on the die. But you have to be fast at grabbing the Hatchimals figure when you find a match or no player wins any tokens. When all the tokens have been taken, count up how many tokens each player has to find the winner.

This game is great for Hatchimals fans. The gameplay is easy to pick up and because the game is in a small package, you can easily bring the game with you for play on the go.

The game also comes with an exclusive Hatchimals figure in an egg.

name: Krazy Klimber
description:
In Crazy Climber, a giant Gorilla and his monkey minions have taken over a large building in New York City. You are the greatest Zoologist in the land and the city has hired you to tame the Gorilla and get the building back. Since the building has been taken over you must climb up the face of the building to reach the Giant Gorilla and take back the building. All the while the Gorilla and his monkey minions will be tossing thing down at you to try and knock you off the building.

The game consists of cards that are building sections, a top of the building and the main base level. You can create different building types randomly. Play is in turns and phases. There are 8 phases to a turn. Each turn a die will drop from the top of the building, a die will drop from out of a window on the building face. These dice are what you have to avoid as you climb up the face of the building. You can move up to two spaces on the building. Each die has a falling speed represented by a number from 2 to 6 with 6 falling the fastest. Each turn a vulture will fly across the building sections trying to knock you off. If you can climb up to the top of the building and avoid being knocked off by the dice you win. If you get knocked off you lose the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Falling Koalas: The Nocturnal Deck
description:
Falling Koalas is a card game all about koalas. Drop Bears, as they are affectionately called, are known to eat eucalyptus leaves and sleep all day. Although seemingly cute and cuddly, they attack!

The game involves intense strategy and a bit of luck where players battle to see who will be the last koala hanging. It's easy to learn and takes 10-20 minutes to play.

This deck is the seedy adult version of Falling Koalas for terrible people like you. It includes hysterical mature-themed content.

The game is simple. Be the last koala alive and win the game
Play cards from your hand and end your turn by drawing a card. If you draw a falling koala card, you fall and are out of the game unless you can save yourself. Strategically play your cards to put yourself in the best position to win or force other players to fall.

Game play:


View your hand, keeping your cards hidden from all other players.
Play a card by placing it face up on the table.
End your turn by drawing a card from the draw pile.
If you draw a falling koala card, you're out unless you have a catch or sleep card.
If you have a catch or sleep card, you're safe. Place it on top of the falling koala card in the discard pile. This ends your turn.
Use your cards to attack your friends and put yourself in the best position to win.


—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Cytosis: Microscope Promo Card
description:
This promo available for backers of The Dice Tower Kickstarter 2019.

During another player’s turn, mimic the current action taken by that player if able. Then exhaust this card by flipping it face down.
When any player takes the first player marker from the previous owner, pass this card to the player in last position and refresh this card.
