categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Medical

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Kogekunst
description:
A small 60 card quiz game about cooking.
Also has a category tile to make this an expansion for the big Bezzerwizzer games.
publishers: Bezzerwizzer ApS (Bezzerwizzer Studio), Nordic Games ehf

name: Hipp Hopp
description:
Hipp Hopp is played in 2 phases.
At the beginning every player has a plug on the board. A new plug may be plugged into a neighboring field - but only if the existing plug can skip the new one in a straight line. Which player brings more of his plugs to the board?
The difference brings points.
In the second part it's time to take away again. Here chain jumps are a tried and tested means of removing several of your own plugs in one go.
Who has all the plugs in the trough first?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Hipp Hopp wird in 2 Phasen gespielt.
Anfangs hat jeder Spieler einen Stecker auf dem Brett. Jeweils ein neuer Stecker darf in ein Nachbarfeld gesteckt werden – aber nur dann, wenn der vorhandene Stecker den neuen in gerader Linie überspringen kann. Welcher Spieler bringt mehr seiner Stecker auf das Brett?
Die Differenz bringt Punkte.
Im 2. Teil geht’s wieder ans Wegnehmen. Hier sind Kettensprünge ein probates Mittel, gleich mehrere eigenen Stecker in einem Zug zu entfernen.
Wer hat zuerst alle Stecker in der Mulde?

—description from the publisher

name: Dice Phalanx!
description:
Summer has come, the season of WAR!

Two greek city-states face off, their battle lines of dice-based units eager to do battle with their rival and force them to a route.

As the generals of these armies, players can reshape and tend to their unit formations in this gridless/boardless dice game before attacking their enemy's army with their disciplined troops. The resolution of attacks is determined by a simple cancelled-value system between both the attacker's and defender's dice pools.

Once a single player has defeated a total of 12 points worth of enemy units, the rival army's morale is shattered and flees in terror, leaving the scoring player as the victor.

name: Dangerous
description:
The world is about to end, but nobody is quite sure exactly how it's going to happen. In Dangerous, your goal is to save as many innocent lives from certain doom as possible. To do so, you must outsmart your rival investigators and correctly deduce which apocalyptic predictions are true and which are false. The player who saves the most lives wins.

In each round, shuffle the twelve prophecy tiles, then lay out three rows of four tiles: the top row (face down) are true prophecies, which players must deduce; the middle row (face up) are false prophecies; and the bottom row (face down) are hoax prophecies. Below each hoax prophecy, lay out a column of four cards face up. The cards come in five prophecy suits, with values 1-3. Among the tiles are two of each prophecy and two 2x.

The lead investigator for that round places one of their two personal tokens by a hoax prophecy tile, looks at that tile, then chooses a card from that column and places it face up in front of themselves. Each other player then chooses a card from this column. If a hoax prophecy tile has two player tokens next to it, don't refill it; otherwise, do refill it. The next player becomes the lead investigator, and this process continues until each player has chosen eight cards, which they now take in hand.

Now you evaluate how well you predicted which disasters will take place. The lead investigator reveals one of the true prophecy tiles, then all players simultaneously reveal two cards from their hand. For each card that matches that revealed prophecy, you score positive points equal to the value of the card; otherwise, you lose points. If the prophecy tile instead shows 2x, you score positive points if you lay out two cards of matching value, but different suits; any other combination loses you points.

Record your scores for the round, and after a total of four rounds (with four players), whoever has scored the most points wins. (With two and three players, you make adjustments to the number of cards and prophecy tiles used and rounds played.
publishers: Raw Potions Publishing, オトコマエゲームズ (OTOKOMAE GAMES)

name: Naniwa no Bob Jiten (なにわのボブジテン)
description:
なにわのボブジテン (Naniwa no Bob Jiten) is a standalone expansion of ボブジテン (Bob Jiten).
Game play is the same as Bob Jiten, except that new character Natasha is introduced. While Natasha is active, question master must explain in one breath.

なにわのボブジテン (Naniwa no Bob Jiten) is a Japanese word game, very dependent on knowing the Japanese language very well. 'Naniwa' means 'Osaka'.

—user summary
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: One Night Werewolf x Yurucamp
description: A collaboration of the Japanese TV anime show "Yurucamp" and "One Night Wolf"
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: SUPÉRO
description:
In SUPÉRO, you must capture you opponent's Super-Weak while protecting your own. You'll choose a starting team of 4 Super-Heros (out of 7 different characters, each with unique abilities ; the remaining three stay at your disposal as backup) to assist your Super-Weak (whom must stay in play all game long and has no special ability).

The two players take turns and can either:

move a character (1 square orthogonally) and/or activate a special ability. A character can't land on an ally, but capture an enemy if it end up on its square. The characters always face their owner, only he/sh knows their identity, meaning you can bluff when using a special ability.
swap or pretend to swap two characters (on the grid or from you backup team)


The non-active player can doubt the identity of a character and the use of its power. The character is revealed, if the action was legitimate the power is triggered and the doubting player loose a backup Super-Hero. If the action was a bluff, the active-player's turn ends immediately, cancelling the activation of the special ability.

The game ends:

when your Super-Weak is captured, you've lost immediately.
when your only character in play is your Super-Weak, you've lost.
when your Super-Weak reach the enemy starting line, you've won!


—user summary
categories: Bluffing, Comic Book / Strip, Print & Play

name: Occult
description:
Occult is a fast-paced, chaotic card game for 2 to 5 players. Players are tasked with keeping their mythological monsters in play for three turns, or by slaying three of their opponent's monsters, to win the game.

Players can slay monsters using rare Banish cards, or by combining other basic cards to have even greater effects. In the base game, the Slayer, the Dancer, the Thief and the Merchant are all used as basic cards to have various effects: one when a single card of that type is discarded, and one when three cards of that type are discarded.

Each monster has their own effect as well when they enter play, causing chaos that may or may not benefit their controller.

With no additional tokens or dice, everything is tracked on the cards themselves by rotating them and therefore, Occult is the perfect pick-up-and-play card game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Racing Stars
description:
The Racing Stars are a superpowered team of magical girl go-kart racers. Queen Destructa has challenged them to a race, and summoned an army of monsters to help her team win.

Roll five different polyhedral dice, assign one to each racer, plotting a line that avoids collisions and sets up the others to get a speed boost by drafting. If they're going fast enough, they can run into monsters to defeat them. Each racer also has a special power you can use to gain an edge.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Say What Again!
description:
Say What Again! is a party game for 2-20 players that can be played while doing other things - at a party, playing another game, watching TV and so on. Each player starts with 3 cards. When someone says the word or does the action on the card, they get the card. You are simply trying to get rid of your cards. Look at your phone - get the card. Curse - get the card. Cards are translated in French, German and Spanish - great for learning other languages!

—description from the publisher

name: Shelfit!
description:
You all went to boardgame auction, and bought a lot of games. Now it is time to split them, and put them on shelves.

Shelfit! is a roll and shelve game - roll and write where one player rolls the dice, and splits them into as many groups as there are players, then each player chooses one group, and what is left the player who rolled the dice gets. Then players draw the games to the shelves, trying to reach one of the scorings for each shelf they have filled.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, I Cut, You Choose, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil

name: A Fistful of Sardaukar
description:
A Fistful of Sardaukar is a fast-play miniatures battle for tactical-scale combat in the universe of Frank Herbert's Dune novels.

The rules are quite simple and very deadly; the gist of the melee rules is that each side rolls 1d10, adds their combat skill, and the lower scorer is killed.

name: The Game Charades
description:
The game Charades, created in the 16th century France, has become one of the famous 'parlor games' known today because it involved large or small groups of people in a hilarious theatrical expression similar to pantomime.

John Hansen Co. has now elaborated on the original game to include 2000 updated names and titles for adults (ages 18-80)! The Game Charades will entertain you because laughter, like the common cold, is catching. Have Fun!

—description from the publisher

name: Revolution Against the Revolution
description:
"Revolution Against The Revolution" is a group of scenarios covering modern tactical conflicts in the Nicaraguan Contra War using FIREPOWER. It starts with an in-depth review of the history of the conflict and related forces, including tactics, unit composition and equipment lists and then provides the following scenarios:

Border Raiders 1980
A Trap for the Militia 1982
Coffee Harvest 1985
Cazadores Y Cazadoros 1986
Blazing Tooth 1983
Miskito Coast 1984
Flight to the Coco 1983
San Juan Del North 1984

This expansion was first published as an article in The General, Vol. 23, No. 6 (1987).
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Battle Bots: The Sling Sliders Game
description: Battle Bots: The Sling sliders Game is a crokinole-style game that has players using an elastic band to shoot wooden discs into the centre of the game board, or into an opponent's area of the game board, to earn points. Get rid of all of your discs by slinging them straight or ricocheting them on your opponent's side of the board.

name: The Mount of the Duke (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
In the area next to the walled city of Carcassonne there is an amazing forest. Recently there are plenty of thieves, bandits and all sorts of people in this forest. It is believed that Robin Hood is around, and his friends are now in control of the forest.
Will you win more points in this new adventure or will you lose all hope when you reach the burned inn?

—Jose Barros Alonso
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Potted Plant Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for the Munchkin Collectible Card Game

Card #305
Rarity: F - FOMO
Type: Neutral - Location

This comes into play zapped.

All Monsters with a gold cost of 1 gain 1 life.

Monstrous 1 (When this is committed to a fight, it is a 1 gold, 1 power, 1 life Monster card. Its card type changes to "Monster" and it has no other ability.)
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: City of Gears: Music Shop Promo Tile
description:
Available in the Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter campaign.

A new city tile to use in the game. Tile text: "Bring up to 2 Workers from adjacent tiles into this one. They may belong to any player and cross over any player's Gear Link."
categories: City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Board Game Cafe Frenzy: Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
This is a set of items for Board Game Cafe Frenzy that were available during the Kickstarter campaign.

The set contains items below:


10 Store board cards
1 Essen'19 store board card
5 Level 4 customers
7 Essen Spiel'19 objective mini-expansion cards
1 set of store manager mini-expansion


Store manager mini-expansion contains 6 store manager tokens and 4 coins (value:3).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trick-taking, Worker Placement

name: Plunder!: The Great Bermuda Treasure Hunt
description:
Players race across the Islands to be the first to reach a wreck site located at each of the four corners of the game board. The first player to reach a wreck selects a 'buddy' from among the other plays and they then dive to the Treasure Site of their choice and attempt to recover the doubloons buried there.

BUT... The divers' time underwater is limited and meanwhile the other players have suspended their activity on the Islands and have become SHARKS. The sharks close in on the divers, intent on defending sites where they have hidden their own doubloons. They are also determined to steal any doubloons the divers may have recovered.

The winner is the first player to reach the airport with 12 doubloons in his possession.

—user summary

name: Bonelli Kids: Il Gioco di Carte – Zagor vs Martin Mystere
description:
The Bonelli Kids are the deformed version of the most famous characters from the Sergio Bonelli Editore.

In this card game two of the most famous characters of Bonelli, Martin Mystere and Zagor, will clash using bananas skins, toys and pedal machines.

Bonelli Kids is a 2 player game that will finally put in game the passion of the fans of comics and share it with friends and even younger generations.

In this first box Martin Mystere and Zagor will collide with their custom decks for the conquest of the most important books of their collections, illustrated by the famous cartoonist Luca bertelè and colored by Manuela Nerolini.

In Bonelli Kids players will fight to win the famous comics of the two characters. Each round they will have to manage a hand of cards and try to get a strength value higher than the opponent's to win the comic they are fighting for.

The two characters' decks are unique and this allows many combinations during each single game. Also, every comic you fight could change the normal rules of the game.

Are you ready to win more comics than your opponents?
publishers: Pendragon Game Studio, Sergio Bonelli Editore

name: Haiku Ninja!
description:
This is a friendly and stealthy game of deception and word attack. played between friends, in groups via any form of written message. The idea is to start a round with a haiku message (via written message, text, email, or some form of communication note) to a friend or group of friends. They must be vigilant and observant, for if they don't reply in haiku format they have been ninja'd and receive their honorable haiku death. It is a simple and fun way to pass some time and have fun, sneaky fun, with friends.

Variations can include: Tanka Ninja, Renku Ninja, Sonnet Ninja.

When all is said and done, the group and put together their Haiku Ninja! poetry string and enjoy the story as it unfolds in verse.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: A Dance of Spiders
description:
A Dance of Spiders is a smart filler game with simple rules but deep strategical gameplay.

Two spiders must move each turn on a web-like board, leaving a block on each space they pass. The first spider to get trapped loses the dance of spiders...

name: Pickpockets: Business Cards
description:
A 3-card set of bonus abilities for Pickpockets.

Description from the publisher:

The bonus cards are 3 special ability cards featuring business cards of The Cleaner, Kingpin and The Pigeon.


To play with these new bills you will swap out the bill behind the business card. The card count will be exactly as before, but with the alternate bill in place. We suggest that you shuffle the alternate bill and the one being swapped out so you don't 100% know if the alternate bills are in place.

The Cleaner counts as a regular $10 bill, but also has the bonus ability of canceling a marked bill.

The Kingpin stops a Snitch from saying they are a cop. You take an unmarked bill of your choice from their end THEN the game ends. The player with the most money wins.

The Pigeon is an ally to the Snitch / Cop in 4 player games. The player who holds the Pigeon card cannot snitch, but only wins if the cop wins. On the downside, it’s a little harder for the cop to win since the Pigeon’s marked bills don’t count.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: T'aimes-tu ça?
description: T'aimes-tu ça? is a game that tests the bond that reigns within player duos. To score points, players must prove that they know each other well by having the same answers. The perfect game to spark laughs, discussions and surprising revelations! Standalone version which can also be added to the Connexion base game.

name: Ultima Ratio Regum: Grand Tactical Wargame Rules 1689 – 1763
description:
Ultima Ratio Regum - 2nd edition are a set of grand tactical wargame rules for late 17th to mid-18th century wargames (1689 – 1763) with the emphasis being on maneuvering and campaign aspects. What does this mean? Well the rules allow for spying, assassination, stirring speeches and the rules of war as well as the usual mechanisms for playing a wargame!

The sequence of play begins with any artillery shooting by either side, then one side moves and issues orders, then combat is resolved, and the next side then has a go (in other words, You-go;I-go).

Armies begin in march columns, so scouting plays a part in the tabletop wargame to discover where enemy forces are. Each column is represented by an officer figure until it is spotted so you really don’t know what the enemy’s doing until your patrols see them!

Orders are used, and the possibility of marching to the sound of guns included. Allowance is made for brigadiers disobeying orders as well!

All in all a very different set of rules for grand tactical battles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Red Sonja: Deluxe Expansion Set
description:
The first expansion to the core game Red Sonja: Hyrkania's Legacy, adds additional quests, cards, tokens, playable heroes and a new type of realm (terrain) tile. New playable heroes include characters from the world of Red Sonja as well as famous literary characters like Robin Hood, Peter Pan, and King Arthur!

-description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: Nickel
description:
Nickel is a perfect-information strategy game for two players designed to be played with Looney Pyramids. A 5×5 grid is randomly filled at the beginning of the game with 25 pyramids, each of which consists of a unique combination of color and orientation (N, E, W, S, standing-up). Players then alternate turns removing one of the pyramids on the board and replacing it with one of their tokens. Moves are restricted based on the pyramid that your opponent has just removed: you must play in a square that matches this just-removed pyramid in either orientation or color. The goal is to form an L shape or a straight line of your tokens. An alternate win condition is to leave your opponent without a legal play at the beginning of his turn.

—description from the designer

name: Top Cake
description:
You are an aspiring hotelier getting ready to exhibit at the industry’s leading luxury trade show. Whispered rumours have reached you that Des Erttrolley, the notorious cake critic, will be attending and judging the confectionary on offer at each stand. You realise that your bowl of mints isn’t going to cut it. You want a slice of the real action. At the last minute, you dash to the cake auction to bag a few bargains. To save time, stack layers as you win them and stop your multi-tiered, gravity-defying showstoppers from collapsing prior to judging.

Fox and out-bid your competitors to win layers of cake in each round of bidding. Stack your cakes as you win them. At the end of the game, the more impressive each cake stack, the more points you’ll get during judging. Win extra points for stacking matching layers and for crowning your creations with a fabulous topper.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Constrained Bidding

name: Twilight of the Soldier Kings: European Battles in the Age of Frederic the Great 1730-1780 – Scenario Book 1
description: Includes detailed information on 12 battles, 5 from The War of the Austrian Succession (1740-1748) and 7 from The Seven years War (1756-1763).

name: Smoosh and Seek Treehouse
description:
The Mash It and Match It Memory Game!

“Ready, Set, Seek! The woodland friends are playing and and seek and don’t want the fun to end. Can you find them all before Mr. Prickles climbs the ladder to send them on their way? Take turns drawing tokens and working together to remember which animal is under which game shoosher. Then press the smooshed into the smoosh dough to see if you found the right one! Find all the animals and everyone wins!”
—description from the back of the box

name: Vietnam: The Men of Company B – Wargame Rules for Vietnam 1955-1975
description:
The Men of Company B (MCB) covers search and destroy actions in Vietnam at platoon level.

The figure scale is 1:1.
Each player controls about 50 figures.

There is also the ability to include vehicles.

The US or allied player searches and the communist player attempts to stop him.

MCB uses a terrain map made from grid squares so no measuring is needed making the game faster.

name: Mushrooms by Mail
description:
In Mushrooms by Mail, two players attempt to coordinate their pixie workers to deliver various fungal treats to a band of incredulously fussy trolls.

Players draft dice determining which spaces they can send their pixies to, and attempt to control both the crops of 'shrooms and the access to trolls — as well as the greedy troll that will eat anything!

Collect helper tokens along the way to help augment your dice rolls. Feed the trolls!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: Reggae Revolution
description:
In the year 2266, the world is controlled by a facist police state. Peace, love, unity, and respect have all been made illegal. Finding the relics of reggae in the ruins of the old world, a circle of youths rediscovers the power of music. They plan to coordinate an enormous underground dance party to return the message of nonviolent resistance back to the people.

Reggae Revolution is a cooperative card game for 1 to 6 players.

Players work together to bring the message of peace and love back to the world. In the game are four suits: peace, love, unity, and respect. Players try to use these cards to collect sets in the score area to win the game. But, at the beginning of each player's turn, a villain card pops out and makes the player discards all cards of a suit that the villain supresses. Instead of fighting the villains, the players must sway them by giving them cards from their deck. If the player does not have enough, the villain stays in play. As the villains stack up, the players must discard more and more cards from their hand. If the villains ever supress all four suits, peace, love, unity, and respect, then no one has any cards and the villains win the game!

Fight the power! Join the resistance! And bring peace and love back to the people!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Matching, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Carpet Bocce
description: For those of you who enjoy playing bocce ball, outdoors in the summertime, here is a way to play all year round in the comfort of your living room. This miniature version of bocce ball is a fun way to get the whole family involved in the excitement of seeing who can get closest to the pallino. On those cold winter days, or during the rain-soaked springtime, never worry about getting in a friendly game of bocce again. A fun family game of dexterity for 2-4 players.

name: Speed Soma
description:
Speed Soma is a combination game in which three-dimensional figures must be made. These figures must be made with wooden, tetris like blocks.

In addition to concentration and powers of deduction skills, this is also about speed. The aim of the game is to be the first to make the figure shown on the task card with their own Soma set.

—description from the publisher

name: War Of 1812: The Early Battles
description:
War of 1812 - the Early Battles is the first of three low complexity wargames covering the major battles of the war between Imperial Great Britain and the still young democracy of the United States of America.

This game is intended to provide an introduction to the fascinating history of America’s first major war after independence through an easy to learn wargame. Experienced wargamers will find a wide variety of situations that can be quickly played during downtime.

The 14 battles start of fighting in 1812 until mid 1813 include: Beaver Dams, Brownstown, Chateauguay*, Craney Island, Gaganoque, Ogdensburg, Queenston Heights*, First River Raisin, Second River Raisin, Sacketts Harbour*, Stoney Creek, Thames River*, Tippecanoe*, York.


The battles have been revised and expanded from the originals in War of 1812 Battle Collection


Box includes die cut 5/8" counters, battle specific maps, terrain chart, rules and scenarios booklet.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Multiple Maps

name: Tudor: King & Queens
description:
A fun-filled strategy game full of intrigue and betrayal set in Henry VIII´s court. Use your cunning to undermine and weaken your rival queens by spreading ridiculous rumours to ruin their reputation - anything to be the King´s favourite and win the crown!

—description from the box

In the game, you are one of Henry VIII's queens who intrigues to become the one Henry VIII will marry. In turn, you roll the dice and go into one of the castle rooms to try to win a trophy poll based on different traits. For each traits you have the most in gives you a trophy token. You win these by either taking from other players who are in the same room as you or playing gossip cards that lower other players' values.
You win either by having at least three trophy tokens and reaching the same place as Henry VIII. You can also win if you are the last remaining queen in the game (other queens can be eliminated if any of their traits end up at too low a level).

—user summary
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Player Elimination, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Mystiska magiker
description:
The game is about finding out which magicians the other players have chosen. If you expose an opponent, you win his magician. The player who last has a magician on hand, when all opponents have lost theirs, has won.

Each player has a deck of eight cards that show exactly the same magician. Each player chooses one of them and put it facedown on the board. The player roll a dice and goes along a path and performs an action depending on the color you land on. On yellow or green, you can ask one or two questions to any other player. You get the questions by drawing a question card. What you ask is whether the chosen magician has or does not have a specific attribute, such as a blue hat. Depending on the answer, you mark on your display which possible magicians that player may have chosen. If you end up on pink, you can either try to guess another player's magician or if you are not yet prepared to take a pink token that can be used to guess at a later time. If you end up on blue, you have to replace your magician with a new one (but it can be the same) so that the other players have to reset their displays.

—user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Targeted Clues

name: Lost Worlds: "Arcanthus" the Sage
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: Azlana Darque – Sorceress with Broadsword
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From the back of the book:
Azlana is the daughter of a dark elf priestess and her human captive. Although raised by her mothe rin the Underdark, he mixed blood was discovered by another house of drow, and Azlana was made a slave ... . After two years ... Azlana was finally able to escape ... . Azlana had become a highly skilled warrior. She put those skills to use one night fighting a roving thief. The incident was witnessed by a red dragon who saw her value and quickly befriended her... the dragon convinced her to stay with him in order to help guard his treasure... The dragon ... taught her spells for producing fireballs and poisonous smoke ... ."
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From inside front page with User Summary:

This book represents "Amara Wintersword : Female Barbarian with Axe" in the LOST WORLDS combat book games and is playable, with all other LOST WORLDS books. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

Her weapons are a dagger, red magic, blades that pop out of the toes of her sandals AND because of her long red hair - a hair whip - that can wrap around an enemies neck or ankles.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Können Taxis fliegen?
description:
Can taxis fly? NO!!!

Every child knows that, but it is not always that easy to correctly assess vehicles: Does a jumbo jet have an engine? How many wheels does a truck have? Do you need a driver's license to drive a motorized lawn mower?

Round after round you take a close look at one of 38 great planes, cars and ships. But it's not just a matter of knowledge, a quick reaction is also important.
But beware! If you attribute a wrong feature to a vehicle valuable points might go to another player.

Whoever has the most points after 5 rounds wins.

Based on the game principle of "Can pigs fly?" by Sonja Häßler.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Matching, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bankrupt: Bad Habits
description:
Bankrupt – is a fast-paced competitive game for 2 or more players. Can you avoid picking up Bad Habits that will send you Bankrupt?
Living a lifestyle beyond your means?
Gambling eating into your income?
The Debt pile is stacking up?
Spending out of control?

This game will have you laughing in stitches as you strike and counterstrike your opponents. Be the last one standing!

This is a fast paced card game where people are trying to avoid financial bad habits and not go bankrupt.

The game play is fairly simple. There are as many Bankrupt cards in the deck as there are players. Each player is trying to avoid having to pick up Bad Habit cards from the deck. The more financial Bad Habits you get the more cards you have to draw - with any one of them possibly being a Bankrupt card! If you get a Bankrupt card and don’t have any Insurance that’s it you are out of the game. Last person standing wins!

Just to make it a bit more interesting the player who picks up a Bankrupt card gets to put it back in the deck - wherever they want. Watchout! Players also have the chance to pick up Attack or Defense cards that enable them to strike and counterstrike against the other players, change the order of play, skip a turn or even block another player’s action, take a peek at cards coming up in the deck, steal another player’s card, transfer some Bad Habits to another player... Remember though any Bad Habits that you pick up could send you Bankrupt. If you start to accumulate Bad Habits in your hand the more Bad Habit cards you will have to pick up!

It is a bit different from other card games that you might be used to. The goal is really to not be picking up cards and making your opponents pick up as many cards as possible. Whether you have a lot of cards in your hand doesn't matter BUT the more financial Bad Habits you have the greater the chance you will need to pick up more cards. The more cards you pick up the greater the chance you will go Bankrupt!

The deck is full of twists and turns in the game. Just when you think you have the game won another player can turn the tables on you and send you Bankrupt!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Zombies!!!: Master Zombie Promo Card
description: When this card is played, all players must discard all Event cards from their hands. Cards in play are not affected.

name: A kuflik és az esőtánc
description:
Cooperative board game for active children.
It is raining on the meadow and it is already starting to flow into the heap of the Kufli creatures.
Help them!
Do the rain dance together to let the sun finally shine and dry out the puddles. You do not need anything more than your good memory, and of course solid dancing skills.

Each player has some colored tokens. Two players select one-one tile, and if both tiles have that color that the players have, throw away the color tokens and put the tiles under the board. These tiles will be the next part of the rain dance. Do the known part of the rain dance (tiles shows some moment instructions). If none of the players have any color tokens, the players win together after they do the whole rain dance.

name: Monopoly: Juventus
description:
The most famous board game in the world is enriched with this edition dedicated to the famous Juve team of Turin.
Build your empire and amass fortunes, but beware of taxes, jail and bankruptcy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Ireland Edition
description:
"Cead Mille Failte" to the Republic of Ireland edition of the great property board game Monopoly.
Ireland is famous for its writers and poets such as James Joyce, Sean OiCasey, W.B. Yeats, and Seamus Heaney and its musicians, which include U2, Thin Lizzy and Boyzone.
Sports such as horse racing, Grey hound racing and golf thrive, while Hurling, recognised as one of the fastest games in the world, and Gaelic Football are the national sports.
Home of the shamrock, the Aran jumper, the "craic agus ceol" (fun and music) Ireland maintains its reputation of the "Land of the Welcomes".

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fort Boyard: Escape Box
description:
Can you escape the Fort?

You have just finished the challenges, you have positioned yourself on the code word, but the Boyards do not fall.
Rouge has taken control of the Fort: you have 45 minutes to find a way to bring down the Boyards, take whatever you can and escape.
If you do not succeed, you will remain prisoners.
It's your turn !
You have 45 minutes and not one more!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Réussirez-vous à vous échapper du Fort ?

Vous venez de terminer les épreuves, vous vous êtes positionnés sur le mot-code, mais les Boyards ne tombent pas.
Rouge a pris le contrôle du Fort : vous avez 45 minutes pour trouver le moyen de faire tomber les Boyards, prendre tout ce que vous pouvez et vous enfuir.
Si vous n'y arrivez pas, vous resterez prisonniers.
À vous de jouer !
Vous avez 45 minutes et pas une de plus !

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Real-time

name: 1-100 Mathespiel
description:
(You should know how to calculate)

Rules:

Each player should have a pencil in his own color. Define a starting player. The active player rolls the dice and has to combine all 5 dice using the basic arithmetic methods (addition / subtraction / multiplication / division) to reach a number that has not been calculated by any other player before. He then can mark this number (e.g. circle, cross out, box ). The player can, but does not have to, use all types of calculations methods. He can e.g. use only addition or e.g. once addition, once subtraction and twice multiplication. He can use brackets to work with the dot-before-dash calculation. Only whole numbers are allowed in the calculation process.

End of game:

The players play alternately. The game ends as soon as the numbers in 3 rows or columns (or a combination thereof) are circled.

Valuation:

The rows and the columns then are evaluated one after the other:


Whoever has the majority in a row receives 5 points
Whoever has the majority in a row where the numbers are completely circled/marked receives 10 points



If several players have circled the same amount of numbers, nobody gets points


The backside shows the game Knüller, which also can be played.

—description from the designer

name: Das Filmquiz: 666 Fragen zu Kino, Kult & Kassenschlagern
description:
This is a simple box of trivia questions about films and everything regarding the film cosmos.
On each of the 111 cards are six categories for you to answer:

Stars
Quotes
Popcorn
Classics
Direction
Awards & Festivals


The category Popcorn consists of questions regarding goofs, adaptations, film music, voice actors, tech, technical terms and more.
Since there aren't any rules in the box, the game can be played as you like. The first one who reaches ten points wins? Why not. The first one to answer a question from each category correctly wins? Valid as well. As long as you have fun.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Fiefdoms
description:
A brutal rivalry among the Kingdom’s strongest Fiefs has the King’s Lords on the verge of conflict. The King, corrupt with power and a lust for blood, has demanded a battle to gain his favor. The Lords, unwilling to fester their mighty King, assemble their Knights, Squires and Seige in preparation of pending brutal combat.

Fiefdoms is a frantic, real-time, medieval dice battler that requires quick thinking, dexterity and stamina. As a ruling Lord during a rather volatile medieval time, defend your Fief while gathering stone, mining gold, and destroying your enemy! With only a few but crucial components, Fiefdoms sets up in seconds, plays in minutes and satisfies your quest for domination.

VICTORY
Slay your rival’s Lord or collect 5 Gold Nuggets.

SETUP:
Start the game with 1 Lord and 3 fiefs. Gold Nuggets and Stones are set in the center of the table within reach.

HOW-TO-PLAY:
Roll 2 dice simultaneously and continuously (in real-time) with your rival until you attain victory.


Roll 7’s

MINE GOLD (add 1 Gold Nugget to your side of the table)

or PILLAGE GOLD (remove 1 Gold Nugget from your rival’s side of the table and send it to the center of the table)

or REBUILD FIEF (send 2 Gold Nuggets to the center of the table to add back 1 Fief to your side of the table).

Roll Doubles
MINE STONE (add 1 Stone to your side of the table)

REBUILD FIEF (send 1 Stone to the center of the table to add back 1 Fief from the center of the table to your side of the table) 

or FIRE TREBUCHET (send 1 Stone to the center of the table to remove 1 Fief from your rival’s side of the table and send it to the center of the table)

Or SLAY LORD (if none of your rival’s Fiefs remain, send 1 Stone to the center of the table to remove the Lord from your rival’s side of the table).

FAQ
The table is a neutral zone where unused Fiefs, Stone and Gold Nuggets reside.

You can only add Fiefs of the same color to your side of the table.

-description from publisher

name: Labyrint 3.0
description:
The popular Labyrinth (Swedish TV series) game in a new edition, with four new, exciting challenges:


Take orbs through the labyrinth,
Look for tiles in the slime catapult,
Find clues in the keys and boxes
Decipher the secret code.


The game is standalone but works excellently along with the challenges in previous editions of the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Banned Books: Alice
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Go Ask Alice by Beatrice Sparks, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club April 2018 package.

Alice:
(2) Express: Reorder the action cards as you would like.
(3) Escape: Eliminate a Power card from the game. (once per game)
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Land Surveyors 2 (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
This free PnP mini-expansion is available under files.
Carcassonne: The Land Surveyors 2 is a mini-expansion to be played with the basegame Carcassonne and the mini-expansion The Land Surveyors. Just like in The Land Surveyors, surveyors roam the countryside, changing the value of roads, cities, and monasteries when they're scored.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Vampiros en el Puerto: el juego de tablero
description:
Adaptación del comic del mismo nombre, mezcla elementos de RPG con turn based movement.
Maneja una de cuatro facciones, con hasta cuatro personajes cada una.

Based in the comic book of the same name, this game is heavy influenced by RPG and tactical games. Each player has to control one of four factions fighting for the control of a city, using between one and four characters.
Each turn the player has to roll a die and move his characters accordingly and try to accomplish one of two things to win: rescue a character from the Prision in the center of the board, or be the last faction alive, eliminating all others by combat.

name: Battle of Qingshuping
description: The first issue of Mini Wargame Magazine. Attached is a wargame that simulates the Battle of Qingshuping（青树坪战役） during the Second Chinese Civil War.

name: Whac-a-Mole Stack-a-mole
description:
Inspired by the kid favorite Whac-A-Mole game, Stack-A-Mole is the fun way to teach little ones about colors, matching and sequencing. Your mission is to use your mallet to stack up the mole cups in a certain sequence. But hurry- your opponent is trying to stack them first. Be the first to stack all the cups in the correct order and you win! It's mallet-smacking, mole-stackin' and learning fun!

—description from the publisher

name: Dante Alighieri: Comedia – Inferno
description:
The Divine Comedy by Dante Alighieri begins among the punishments of sins and ends with the beatitudes of virtues. Join Dante and Virgil in their journey through the Circles of Hell until... we again behold the stars.

Through a "spiral" draft, players must collect Encounter cards with different numbers (possibly just a single copy) in order to convert their value into Victory points at the end of the game. Character cards, on the other hand, are helpful support cards which give control certain mechanics but, at the end of the game, having the supremacy of the Characters penalizes in any tie-break for victory.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Medieval, Novel-based, Religious
mechanics: Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Sir Chester Cobblepot, Top Hat Games

name: Piek-de-boom
description:
A game the size of a Christmas Card, in which two players race to be the first to put the tree topper on the Christmas tree.

In this game there is no standard turn-order. Instead, the player who is behind will get to roll the die. Ever turn a player is allowed to re-roll the die once, but only the last roll will count.

The trick of this game is not to try and get too much ahead, but instead watch your opponent closely.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Race

name: Daiku9
description: Daiku9 is a two player abstract game. The board has nine areas of 3x3 fields each. Players take turn adding pieces to these fields, first their own, than their opponent's, then their own again. Afterwards, they move by jumping over other pieces, trying to get their 27 pieces to fill three areas completely. The first player to achieve this wins.

name: Tu préfères !?.
description:
Tu préfères !?. is a party game in which we must secretly classify 4 incongruous situations, from the "least bad" to the worst. You have to try to be as close as possible to the rankings of other players.

—description from the designer (translated)

name: Geographica Schweiz: Suisse
description:
In Geographica, anyone can win, regardless of their knowledge.
You answer the questions using your cards representing the Swiss cantons.
To find the answers to the 220 questions of the game, you will have to observe the geographical map of Switzerland and be the fastest.
Whoever completes their Switzerland puzzle first wins the game.
A visual quiz in which your speed will make the difference.

To win, be the first to assemble your puzzle from Switzerland.
Earn coins by answering questions as fast as possible and using your answer cards. You can find all the answers on the central card or on your answer cards. What matters is not knowing the answer, but being the first to find it!

name: Grossdeutschland 1944
description:
This Panzer Grenadier: Broken Axis expansion booklet contains 20 tactical-level scenarios (linkable into four “battle games”) set during the Soviet invasion of Romania in 1944. Mustered against two Soviet armies are a miscellany of German and Romanian units. Four scenarios center on the SS “Death’s Head” Division and are designed to shatter illusions about that formation’s “elite” status.

In addition to boards and counters from Broken Axis, most scenarios require components from one or more of Kursk: South Flank, Fire in the Steppe and Armata Romana.

The booklet takes its name from its feature article on the famous Grossdeutschland Division and the included set of 64 die-cut counters portraying its lower level units in the division’s color scheme. The counters aren’t actually used in any of the booklet’s scenarios. They are provided for the numerous Broken Axis scenarios in which the Grossdeutschland fought. Other articles in the booklet discuss the Romanian Royal Army and Soviet armored fighting vehicles employed in the Romanian campaign.

Note: This booklet should not be confused with Panzer Lion: Grossdeutschland 1944, a long out-of-print Panzer Grenadier supplement that portrayed the division’s actions in Romania and was superseded by Broken Axis.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: The Old and Hidden Secret
description: The Ambrosia Hotel is a Valley Falls historical landmark and the scene of an unsolved murder from the 1930’s. Local millionaire Harlan McAllister has purchased the hotel and spent the past 6 months restoring it. A week before the Grand Reopening he has invited a series of well-known Valley Falls personalities who all have historical ties to the hotel including famed mystery author Rosemary Clark (last seen in The Dark and Stormy Night). The night’s events are proceeding as planned until one of the guests, Sinclair LeCompt, doesn’t show up for dinner. After checking his room, they find that LeCompt’s door is chained from the inside. Once the chain is cut and access to the room is gained, LeCompt’s body is found. He has been stabbed through the heart. But how is such a thing possible? The only one of the guests with an airtight alibi is Rosemary Clark. After the Will Street Detective Agency is brought in to help with the case, they enlist her assistance with this locked-room mystery. Can you help Rosemary Clark and The Will Street Detective Agency solve the mystery of The Old and Hidden Secret?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Minor Leaguers
description:
Draft, develop and manage a minor league baseball team via write and roll mechanics in this print and play game.

You draft eight baseball players and spend a season developing their skills via dice rolls. Your team plays through a season, pitting the team's skills against dice checks at pivotal moments of each game. If all goes well, you contest the league championship at season's end.

Along the way, earn revenue by developing a player to your big league affiliate's needs, qualifying players for the All-Star game, winning the regular-season MVP and fending off injuries.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Star Wars:  Snack Time Game
description:
It's snack time!

Launch squishy frogs through The Child's mouth-to the player on the other side. You both race to clear your side of all frogs and the first one to do so wins!

Don't take turns. You both launch squishy frogs at the same time!

Any frogs that arrive on your side must be sent back before you can win. So keep launching as fast as you can!

This is the way!

-description from the back of the box

name: Sketchy Ski Lifts
description:
In Sketchy Ski Lifts, players are responsible for constructing a network of ski lifts to transport guests between mountain lodges.

The game takes place over 12 rounds, each representing a month of a year-long construction project. Each round, dice dictate where players may build stations and poles for their ski lifts that month. Players may also trim forests or invest in upgrades for future rounds.

Every 6 months, an Opening Day occurs where players can connect their network with cables and receive points depending on how long it takes to travel between each pair of lodges. After the second Opening Day, the winner is the player with the lowest total score.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bingo, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bad Boss 2
description:
Bad Boss 2: It is the Arses that get ahead! A humorous card game that requires you to be an Arse to win! Collect more office characters than your opponents and avoid being stuck with the dreaded Bad Boss.

The deck has 3 types of cards - Character cards which players try to pair and accumulate as many as they can, Arse cards which players use to sabotage others or to get ahead; and the Bad Boss card which everyone tries to avoid.

The goal is to collect as many pairs as possible while avoiding the Bad Boss card by using Arse cards to your advantage. There are 9 different types of Arse cards like Arse kisser, Lazy Arse and Smelly Arse which makes getting ahead of others hilariously funny.

The player that is stuck with the Bad Boss card when all the cards are players will be the loser and the player with the most pairs is declared the winner.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Matching, Memory, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Black Stories Junior: Detective Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Detective Stories are exciting and tricky riddles for clever detectives. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

name: Времена и эпохи: Смута
description:
The beginning of the 17th century.
The Russian kingdom is going through a turning point - the Time of Troubles.
In the absence of a sovereign on the throne, fierce battles for the land unfolded in the country.
Choose one of the opposing sides in the board game Times and Epochs: Troubles and create your own history of the Russian kingdom.

In the battle for the land, you play for one of four sides: the Russian kingdom, the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth, Sweden or the Crimean Khanate.
At the beginning of the game, you will have only three commanders, several types of troops and a small territory at your disposal. But with each turn you will expand your territories, create buildings and strengthen your political position.
The entire game is broken down into six long turns of four phases: winter, spring, summer and autumn.

Each season, participants take turns performing a series of activities. In winter, they plan to seize territories and erect buildings, in the spring they receive policy tokens and participate in trading in neutral lands, in the summer they receive income and buy troops, and in the fall they harvest crops and use tokens of neutral military leaders. In addition, one of five military maneuvers is performed in each phase.

The main goal is to complete certain missions and get victory points for them.
At the end of six moves, the participants count the points and determine the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Events, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Die Geschichte vom kleinen Siebenschläfer, der nicht einschlafen konnte
description:
Sleep, little dormouse, sleep! Everyone is getting ready for hibernation, only the little dormouse isn't tired at all yet. Who can help the little one? It's up to the players! They join in the search for valuable tips on how to fall asleep. In this board game, they move their game piece along the path and uncover memo cards that can help them. The matching motif was not found? Then the next player tries his luck.

On their way, the toddlers meet fox, nightingale, snail and co. who give everything to bring the dormouse to dreamland. Whoever reaches the last path map and discovers the card with the yawning dormouse is the winner! A wonderful party game with a story about sleeping and cuddling for toddlers, parents and grandparents.

name: What's Your Sign?
description:
In What's Your Sign?, players compete to create the most unique and humorous horoscopes for each other. In each round, a "Horoscope" card is drawn, and each player choses an "Ending" card to complete the Horoscope. The winner of each round is decided by a rotating judge. Pro tip: pick your caption card to match the judge’s sense of humor, desires, or sign.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Help the Princess
description:
Help the Princess is a board game where players play a classic role of an RPG world character. The King is desperate and relies on a company of heroes to get his daughters in danger safely back to the castle. it is a competitive game but during the battles the hero can ask for help from the companions.

Help the Princess is a competitive game, but during the battles heroes can ask for help from the companions. Every face of the board is a new mission which can be played in a single game or in campaign mode. The game is for 1-4 player. Players will have to decide if and when to fight the monsters that plague the various villages along the route, when to buy cards from the village market and when use potions or evocations. Fighting,(with combat dice) summoning and buying cards at the best price will increase your experience points, while not fighting will make you advance on the path but without gaining any experience. In the game even the daughters of the king, the princesses are eager to help you in battle ... they love to use their long sword!

The player who brings the princess to safety and who has the most experience points wins.

Remember: you help the Princess, but without the Princess help you can't win!

Can you imagine a princess with a broadsword?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Butterfly Garden (Second Edition): Endangered Species
description:
Save endangered species to score more VPs! This 10-card pack includes 2 variants.

—description from the publisher

name: Silbury
description:
Summer solstice is coming. ln order to celebrate the event, the county druids gather at the bottom of Silbury Hill to challenge each other in a big potion making tournament. Each of them is eager to show his knowledge, wisdom, and power to the great druid, who is the only judge of this competition. As tradition requires, only the winner will be entitled as the great druid disciple. Anything is fair for such an honour!

For thousands of years, a spirit has been watching over each clearing. Every spirit is represented by an animal that is engraved on the giant stones surrounding Silbury Hill. Although they protect the forest, they tolerate the presence of druids on solstice days. They are even used to help druids by giving them their power and favour, sometimes in exchange for an offering ...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Sockenmonster
description:
This version of Sock Monsters does not have the legacy component, just a mini-expansion with three additional pieces.

While the house is empty, brave and industrious elves set out to tidy up. But the sock monsters are always lurking in the dark! Search chests and lockers, find socks and be the first to collect three pairs. Monsters are eager to steal lone socks. Watch out or, better yet, unleash them on your opponents.

Your game character is a brave and industrious elf trying to rescue socks from sock monsters. You start at the center of the game board, while monsters move from the corners in. Players make moves as monsters first. The monsters lurk around the house, always eager to steal a lone sock from a careless elf and carry it into a dark corner.

The next player to make a move takes a color die and puts it underneath his or her monster figure. When making a move, the players lift the figures slightly above the board, so the die underneath moves with the figure but is not visible from the outside. After making the move, the monster figure can be lifted to see the die. If the top face is showing a closed eye picture, this means the monster has fallen asleep and the player’s turn is over. If the die is showing an open eye picture, the player can perform an action.

After finishing the monster turn, the players then take a turn as elves, trying to find colored socks in chests and cabinets on the game board. If a matching pair of socks is collected, elves put them on their hands, feet and ears – and that’s really hard work!

The game ends when any one player has collected three pairs of socks.

—description from the publisher

name: Munchkin Starfinder: The Swarm
description:
Add 15 more cards to Munchkin Starfinder to make the terrifying Swarm even more vicious . . . and silly! Make sure to carry your Swarm Repellent to avoid the Head Louse!

This is an expansion for Munchkin Starfinder. It is not a stand-alone game.

Based on the Starfinder Roleplaying Game from Paizo Inc.

—description from the publisher

name: Last Aurora: Waypoint Promo Tokens
description:
This promo was published in the Italian magazine ioGioco 7/10/2020:

"As a gift to our readers, Pendragon has decided to offer a series of special waypoints to make their Last Aurora experience even more varied. You can find them at the end of the review, ready to cut out and use in your games. The new waypoints are compatible with every map (even that of the Project Athena expansion) and hide many dangers: you will risk suffering a lot of damage and running into many radioactive areas, but you may also have the opportunity to find a refuge that shelters you from enemy fire."

It adds an alternative, print-and-play set of waypoint tokens compatible with the base game and Project Athena maps. These waypoints are more dangerous than regular ones.
The list of the tokens includes:
2x regular radiation
1x radiation + bullets
1x radiation + gas
1x radiation + object
1x radiation + hit
1x hit + food
1x double hit
1x hit + object
1x hideout

The only special waypoint is the hideout: enemies and players outside cannot attack those inside. Players in the hideout can attack each other (if using the pvp module).

name: Motif
description:
Two players, three sides. Six pawns, no dice. Are you ready to turn fate into your favor?

Motif is a game with one objective: occupy more squares than your opponent. It is a head-to-head board game comprised of simple rules and brilliant tactics.

Players attempt to control the largest area on a 5 x 5 grid board using zone of control tactics. Each piece added to the board affects all the other pieces of the same color so careful placement is the key to winning the most squares and the game.

Motif always begins with an empty board — no pawns, all white squares.

On each turn:


Add a new pawn to any square that is reachable by your existing pawns if any.
Move your other pawns on the board. Relocate all of them if possible. Pawns can freely maneuver around other pawns in complicated trails. Diagonals and jumps are prohibited.
Turn squares into the same color as the pawn that lands on it. Pawns always leave a mark.
Play until all the squares are occupied.


The player with the most squares in their color wins.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Zone of Control

name: UNO Triple Play
description:
UNO Triple Play features the familiar UNO gameplay, with players trying to rid themselves of cards first, but this game comes with a special electronic unit that holds three discard piles and features lights and sounds. On your turn, you can play onto a discard pile only if it's lit up — and if any pile gets too many cards in it, it may overload, with the LED display indicating how many cards must be drawn!

Lights and arcade sounds on the machine create maximum anticipation and excitement, and the "timer mode" makes the game move even faster. As always, when players have only one card left, they must yell "UNO!"

name: Pirate Party: Women of the High Seas
description:
A competitive card game for 1-4 players ages 14+. Easy to learn and 20 minutes to play. 

Players race to collect sets of cards featuring vibrant, diverse, historical women pirate captains with special powers. Plunder, pillage, and raid from other players to take the largest pirate booty. Includes period ships, mermaid wild cards and a Kraken Attack.

How to Play:

Players start with eight cards each and the remaining deck forms the draw pile.

A turn consists of playing sets face up on the table. A set can be suited with at least three cards that must include a captain, crew, and a ship or another card in the suit. Then use the special power of the captain to plunder cards from other players. A set can be 3-of-a-kind such as 3 birds or 3 maps or 3 treasure chests. Match cards to sets of other players by suit or kind. Adventure cards keep the competition for pirate points lively. Mermaid is a wild card. Draw a card when you are done playing any sets, matches, or adventure cards then the turn is over.

Game play moves to the next player. All cards played score pirate points at the end of the game. The player with the most points wins.

Bonus 1-player Seaport Solitaire games included!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Rubbish Race
description:
Did you know that the environment is Yellow, Blue, Brown, Green and Grey? These five colours are the ones that keep the planet clean and, taking advantage of our local festivities, we are going to celebrate the already traditional colour test that our participants have been preparing for quite some time in which they must be the fastest in recycling objects. Will you win the test this year? Show it by remembering the five colours of the environment and what we deposit in each one of them...
you should extract one of the cards with rubbish, then the first player to take the correct container win the card.
The player who gets 10 cards it's the winner, but pay attention, due if you take the wrong container, then you lose one of your cards.
It's made with FSC wood and recycled paper.

—description from the publisher

name: One Night Werewolf x Hoshi no Kirby
description:
A collaboration with popular character Kirby for this installment in the One Night Werewolf series.

The skilled Chef Kawasaki has concocted a new menu and has invited Kirby and friends for a tasting. But just when everyone has gathered and its time to reveal the tasty dishes...it seems as if they have already been eaten by someone sneaky!

Work together to try and figure out who is the guilty glutton.

Like other versions of One Night Werewolf, this game features special role cards such as Kirby who can inhale another character resulting in two players exchanging role cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Crazy Golf
description:
Cards are lined up to create mini-golf holes, players will roll dice to try and achieve the lowest score. There are different routes to each hole - which route to take is up to the player. The player will call out which route they intend on taking, then roll dice to determine whether or not the conditions are met for them to continue along that path.

Holes consist of 4-6 cards lined up, with difficulty differences depending on which side of the card is used.

The game is a mix between dice rolling, risk vs reward, and mini-golf.

name: Paperwall
description:
The empress gathered the greatest Shoji craftsmen to submit them to a competition for the creation of washi paperwalls. The winner will have the honor of creating the walls for her summer residence.

In summary, "Paperwall" is a game that is played simultaneously.
Each player must play a card to the left or to the right of his row of cards (covering or not the previous card partially).
Each card has 3 strips of wallpaper, at the end of the game, each strip is worth 1 point except for the player with the most (there are 4 different types of strips).
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Hand Management, Layering, Push Your Luck

name: Magnificent BarStars
description:
Magnificent BarStars is a party game of persuasion where you create a bar, mix outlandish cocktails, and sabotage the competition to become the finest watering hole in town.

Each round, one player takes on the role of the Customer and randomly draws a card from a wide range of characters. They introduce themselves to the remaining players and share details about what type of cocktail they're looking for.

One by one, each Bar player mixes and serves a cocktail for the Customer using the cards in their hand. They have to convince the Customer that their bar is the best on offer! Why should the Customer want to drink this cocktail? What’s so unique about their Bar?

The Bars try to gain the Customer’s favour by improving their cocktail or establishment. On the other hand, they could be ruthless and just sabotage the competition!

The Customer makes a decision and buys the cocktail from the most persuasive Bar, earning them Bar Bucks. The Bar that earns the most Bar Bucks by the end of the game wins!"

Similar to: Snake Oil
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: Monos en la Selva
description:
Monos en la Selva is a game for 2 to 5 players where each one will represent a Carayá monkey, a native of South America with the ecosystem of the Misionera jungle.

Players must play cards to move through the jungle and steal resources from the trees and be the player who steals the most fruits from their daily diet. The player who scores the most points at the end of the day will be the winner.

Each turn, a player:

play a card and executes its action
movement
fauna help (special action in the same tile)
monkey fight or branches shaking (all players get involved)

collects the corresponding resource from the tile
takes a new resource from the bag and put it in the empty space
takes a new card to end their turn with 3 cards in hand


The game end is triggered when the deck is empty or the resource bag is empty and 60% of the tiles are empty. Players do their last two actions and the game finishes.

Resources give points according to the scoring card of each player. The player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: Frost
description:
“Please help. I’ve kind of lost my memories and my… body!”

On your way to the 100 Year Winter Faire, you and your friends are interrupted by a mysterious little blue Wisp.

“All this flying about isn’t so bad, but I don’t want to be stuck like this forever!” she says. “My only memory is of the Winter Faire, but that can’t be right… the last Faire was 100 years ago!

Could you help solve this mystery and piece together who I am?

Frost is a printable escape room game that transforms any space into a DIY escape room adventure. This ready-to-play game pack is crafted to for 9-12-year-old kids, with puzzles that ignite their creativity, and a whimsical story they will cherish unraveling.

Players will work together to complete the trials of the Winter Faire, and uncover mysteriously forgotten memories before time runs out. Gameplay is centered on a series of puzzle sheets that you set up around the room. Each puzzle solved puts you one step closer to uncovering the Wisp’s long-lost past.

Game setup is quick and spoiler-free, and hints are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then pitting them against each other to see who finishes the game first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Fantasy, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Literówka
description:
Literówka is a real-time game for 2-6 people in which players need to simultaneously write 6 words starting with letters shown on 6 rolled dices (consonants and/or vowels) according to drawn category. The first player to write down those words flips a 17-second timer. That player is now the fastest player, and every other player now has 17 seconds to write down their words.

When the timer runs out, players compare their lists of words and remove any words found by multiple players. Points are then awarded for remaining words: 1 point for each original word which moves a player's pawn on a score track. The track has 38 places and the first player who reaches the end of a scoring track is the winner.
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time, Spelling

name: Redcoats & Rebels
description:
Redcoats and Rebels-Élan for the American War of Independence is a collaborative work based on the recently released Élan Deluxe rules for 10-25 mm miniatures by Phillip Jones with special contributions from Messrs Mark Hume (AWI specific rules and army lists), Chris Johnson (more army lists) and Greg MacPherson (campaign rules).

Presented in a style similar to Élan Deluxe, (which was recently downloaded for the 10,000th time!), Redcoats and Rebels is well indexed and written in a straightforward clause style.

At nearly 100 pages including play charts, the zipped PDF file also has internal bookmarks for ease of navigation and includes campaign and optional rules, numerous specific unit and general ratings, battle scenarios and orders of battles for several actions in the AWI.

The game is scaled for 1:25, but can be used at the 1:10 to 1:50 ratio and uses any basing system.

The rules sequence features both simultaneous and alternate actions, resulting in an intuitive and balanced game that captures the feel of the period. Individual units represented are the battalion and regiment and players can do sub-unit actions such as company and squadron actions.

The complexity of the game is moderate, and would appeal to a player who enjoys small unit tactics and a wide latitude of unit options (within historical parameters) on the table.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Turn Order: Progressive

name: BattleTech: MechWarrior Card Pack II
description:
Pack contains 9 double-sided MechWarrior pilot Cards, for a total of 18 named MechWarriors.

• Maconaquea Akerlund/Okubo Henderson
• Dieter Shackle/David Kendal
• Zaïre Danielson/Zhong Shui
• Maxim Vasiliev/Arthur Rutherford
• Vyna/Garo
• Hela/Magnus
• Stephania/Elvin
• Ivan/Bestla
• Polina Vickers/Eluris

A Clan Invasion Kickstarter exclusive, Card Pack II was known as MechWarrior Pilots III during the crowdfunding campaign.

name: Hack!
description:
In this game Hack!, 4 players try to hack each other's computers to steal private data and secrets, using some routers and USB cables. Each time one of them succeeds, he or she gets smarter and thus stronger. But be aware! When you get too smart, you'll surely meet more hurdles! The first player that manages to hack all computers wins the game.

Players layout a 6x6 grid of tiles face down and start the game with 5 tiles in their hand. Players use or discard tiles from their hand to explore the boards and to turn, manipulate or block the route of networks as the board is developed.
mechanics: Square Grid, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Alexandros
description:
Simple wargame following Alexander the Great's conquest of the Persian Empire and India.

Each player has two armies, led by Alexander and Antipater on one side, Darius and Memnon on the other side. Each army has a strenght track and is represented by a single counter on the map. Combat is resolved rolling a die per player, with various modifiers.

Alexander must conquer most of the Persian Empire and India before turn 14 to gain a decisive victory. A minor victory can be achieved by conquering Egypt instead.

--user summary

Published on "Guerre e Guerrieri" magazine, issue #37.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Ring it On
description:
Ring It On is a new wedding themed card game.

Be the first player to have laid down in front of you the required items and number of guests.

Players start with seven cards and pick up two cards at the start of their turn. Each box contains 140 cards with different wedding guests and items on... some of which are special shiny cards! Some guests have special abilities and some items have unique powers. Box also includes play money and rule sheet.

—description from the designer

name: El Bucanero
description:
Letters are placed in the center of the table. All the silver coins are distributed in equal parts.

The gold coins are in the power of a single player (who will be called the payer) who will then distribute 5 cards to each player.

These should be face down.

After a signal each one turns over their first card.

The player who first made all the words that indicate his 5 cards gives the signal to stop.

Each player must pay the participant who completed all the words first, a silver coin for each card that he did not complete.

If the player who stops the game does not have all 5 words complete or there are spelling errors, he pays a fine of 2 silver coins to each of the players. When the collection is settled, the cards are redistributed, leaving aside those used in the previous round.

It is played over 5 rounds and the winner is the one who accumulates the most points at the end.


Originally release in 1940's by Casa Estanciero.

It is one of the best board games created in Argentina, and for 6 decades it has been entertaining young and old alike. It is quick to play, since with the large number of letters there are, you will have to put together the words that correspond to the definitions of the cards. In this way, you can win the treasure of gold and silver coins.
publishers: Casa Estanciero S.R.L., Gato Garabato, Top Toys, ToyCo

name: Pékin Express
description:
Pékin Express the board game is a race in which the players will move across Europe or Asia and collect points. The game ends when a player reaches the finish line (Lisbon or Beijing) and the player with the most Amulet points wins.
