Once the board chosen (Asia for 2 to 4 players ; Europe for 4 to 6 players) and the setup complete, the first round begins. A round is structured as follows:

The players draft their 5 Travel cards.
The player with the Red Flag card in hand must play it and take the Red Flag token. Then they take their turn by playing a Travel card or by passing. When a player reaches first a city with no Stage Token, they gain a face down Amulet card and place a Stage Token on that city.
The players continue to take their turn in order in a similar fashion until every player has passed consecutively.


Such rounds keep going until the end of the game is triggered immediately as soon as a player reaches the finishing line (and by doing so, they gain 3 Amulet cards).

Each player counts their Amulet values, the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Advantage Token, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: Titan: Starbot
description:
Starbot is a Solo/AI mode for TITAN. Whether you’re searching for a challenging solo experience or just want to add another player to your game, Starbot’s rules and behaviour remain the same.

This top of the line automaton specialises in mining operations and has just touched down in Titan’s mining crater alongside you. It has been programmed to extract as much Deuterium as possible and to avoid polluting its ship’s Hold with Tholins. It will not be involved in extracting standard resources or in
meeting corporate Objectives. All Starbot cares about is Credits, and it will do anything it can to obtain as many as possible! It controls ultra-mobile Drones, expands its network efficiently and takes control of Rigs in the blink of an eye.
Starbot is a new kind of opponent and your results won’t only affect the STARDRILL™ bottom line, but also the future of all human TITAN workers in future mining operations.

Starbot includes 6 different AIs, represented by their own individual Command Boards. Each version provides a challenging experience in their own way!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Escape: Murders in the Speakeasy
description:
Two murder mysteries await in this massive adventure! The year is 1928 and Prohibition is the law of the land. Behind the hidden door to the Blind Hog Saloon, however, drinks are pouring, gambling is rampant, and men and women dance the night away to the Charleston. The owner of the speakeasy, Arthur “Goldie” Nickels, rules the shadows and has made thousands by smuggling and selling alcohol…until he was found murdered. There were only a few suspects around him at the time of his death and it is up to you to find the entrance to the speakeasy, interview the suspects, and to solve the crime. Unfortunately for you, however, there are multiple weapons, motives, and killers to choose from. Even more than that… Goldie is not the only person who will be murdered in the speakeasy tonight. Another murder sets the scene for the second mystery in the box… one where you appear to be the leading suspect. Solve both murders before you find yourself framed for the crime of the century!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wasteland Racing
description:
The race take place on a 6´x4´ flat surface where you place terrain and 5 point markers. You have to race thru the markers in order two times to win (two laps). At dispenser points you can get weapon, traps, shields a.s.o to use during the race.

Each turn you can do one of three things:


Move: Move +D6”, pivot once by up to 90°, can use one item
Drift: Move +D6”, pivot twice by up to 90°, can’t use any items
Boost: Move +2D6”, pivot once by up to 45°, can’t use any items


First to finish two laps win.

name: Prince August Fantasy Adventure Game
description:
The rules was included in a Prince August catalogue from the 1980-ish. It´s a simple set of rules for fantasy wargaming. The battle take place on a 3´x3´ battlefield table with terrain of your choice.

Sequence of play

Both players write new orders, rally troops.
Both players move each unit according to orders.
Combat: (A. Missile fire, B. Hand-to-hand (melee), C. Mind combat and magic).
Morale: Check morale and move units accordingly.
Movement 2: Move any or all units again 2" or 3"


For each unit of the player on the board both players must write orders, corresponding to what he/she wants each unit to do in the course of the battle. A unit without orders cannot move. A unit cannot receive new orders unless it has a leader with it. All units must follow orders.

Mind combat is resolved before spells are cast. Only wizards may attempt to take over another creature´s mind.

The winner of the game is the one winning the battle.

The rules includes a battle scenario between the "Army of Neldoreth" (humans) and the "Gurthang´s Army" (undead).

Army of Neldoreth
1 King
1 Superhero
2 Heros
3 Wizards
24 Spearman
12 Bowmen

Gurthang´s Army
1 Gurthang
1 Sub-general on horse
10 Skeleton cavalry
15 Wraiths
24 Skeletons
35 Undead warriors

name: Etat d'urgence: Pass Sanitaire
description:
The mask is no longer mandatory, the places of life have reopened, the curfew is over and the summer holidays are fast approaching?

Let's go for the crazy adventure of the health pass! In this extension of the "état d'urgence" game, you will not only have to manage your game and avoid the twisted moves of your opponents, but also integrate the non-mandatory obligation to make your health pass before the 4th wave, which can arise at any time !
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medical
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Sly'ne
description:
In this puzzle game, players must align their four marbles in a straight to win.

Each turn, the participants must perform two actions among the following five:


Place a tile
Move a tile
Place a marble
Move a marble
Place a barricade


The game ends as soon as a player manages to align their four marbles in a straight uninterrupted line (without a barricade blocking the path).

The board is not fixed, the hexagons can be moved just like the marbles.
But be careful, the tides can quickly change and a simple mistake can lead you in a world of pain.
mechanics: Action Points, Connections, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Pieces as Map

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave – Gift Pack
description:
Enhance any deck with a vast host of universal cards with 10 gambits, 10 upgrades and 12 objectives, you'll be spoiled for choice when constructing your decks.

A printed card dashboard, meanwhile, makes tracking your games simple – just place each of your decks and discard piles in the slots to check your cards at a glance. Use the dashboard to track activations and rounds, and spend less time trying to remember whose turn it is and more time working out deadly strategies! The set includes 3 round tokens for use with the above.

You'll need a copy of the Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave Core Set to use the contents of this pack.

name: Gone Hunting
description:
A family friendly, light, board game for 1 - 4 Hunters. Create a custom hunting ground while you stalk, hunt, and harvest trophy animals to gain the most trophy points by the end of a 14 day Hunting season.

During each turn, Hunters will start by placing out a map tile and then gaining the bonuses from it. From there, each Hunter will take their turn spending 2 actions to Move, Scout, Hunt, or Buy.

Moving allows the Player to move to the different Tiles to get in Range of animals to Hunt. While you can shoot father than your Range, there is a penalty for taking the long shot.

Scouting allows the Hunter to look at the facedown animals on a tile within their Range or place a new Animal on a Tile.

Hunting is where you take the dice from your weapon, equipment, and any that you have gained/saved and roll them hoping to score enough Shots to take the animal down.

Buying allows you to purchase equipment or even a canine companion from the Store, grab some important Ammo dice, or turn in a completed Trophy card for more Trophy points and other bonuses!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Dice, Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fortress of Terror: Lake of the Dragon
description:
Journey far and wide through the distant mountains to the hidden Vale of Harmony to answer their enigmatic summons…and discover an ancient and terrible Evil living beneath the Lake.

Lake of the Dragon is the fourth Fantasy Adventure Module in the Roll-With-It system, a modular, solitaire roll-and-write adventure game system with endless possibilities for adventure through an accomplish-the-task-and-escape-the-maze-style gameplay.

Gameplay is centered around a maze or map, through which the player must navigate, accomplish some objective(s), and escape the map under pressure from the enemy's attacks via the Doom die. The simple, puzzley, maze-style gameplay is approached differently in each adventure, building on the basic rules with new rules, concepts, and components that make each adventure feel fresh and unique.

-description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Castles in the Sky
description:
A Wargame of Flying Battleships

It is the dawn of the 20th Century, and the Great Powers turn to war. Since the development of the airscrew and the creation of the first flying warships, the navies of the world have grown to be dominated by these aerial ironclads. So fire up the turbines, ready the aether drives and take to the air in Castles in the Sky: A Wargame of Flying Battleships.

Castles in the Sky is a steampunk miniature wargame using your own models or tokens, set in the early 20th century. Each model represents an individual warship in one of three classes, either escort, cruiser or battleship. Engagement are typically made up of small skirmishes between a handful of ships per side. Rules are provided for using aeroplanes, aerial torpedoes, sky mines as well as bombing of ground targets. There is also a simplified campaign system presented.

name: Ultimate Showdown
description:
The game that pits famous people and characters in a battle to decide once and for all -- Who can triumph under the description at hand? Will it be the Easter Bunny vs. Ben Franklin for Best Babysitter? Or will Genghis Khan beat out Frank Sinatra for Best Roadtrip Companion? Anything goes! You pick the challenges and YOU try to get your picks to WIN!

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Predictive Bid, Voting

name: Cellulose: A Plant Cell Biology Game – Scenario Pack I
description:
Pack of 3 new Scenarios for Cellulose: A Plant Cell Biology Game.

The Community Garden Scenario adds private objective cards. Players begin with an easy "A" objective that earn a small reward and a choice of more difficult "B" objective cards that provide large benefits or additional asymmetric abilities.

The Venus Flytrap Scenario makes it harder but more rewarding to to gain protein.

The Coffee Plant Scenario jump starts the game with starting cards and resources that give more early strategic direction to experienced players.

name: Star Force 300
description:
Star Force 300 is a 1/300 scale Science-Fiction miniatures wargame.
Mid to large size battles of miniatures from the British company "QT Models". Combined Air/Land combat in the Grand Tactical scale. In Star Force 300 the forces of the Federation (Human) fight against the mighty legions of an Alien race known as the Ramorians.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2020 Planeswalker Deck: Vivien, Nature's Avenger
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Vivien is a friend to the wild beasts of every world she visits. Call larger and larger creatures to your side as the game goes on, and power them up with spells to make sure they dominate the battlefield.

Contents: 1 ready-to-play 60-card deck featuring a foil Planeswalker card, 1 Core Set 2020 booster pack, 1 strategy insert, 1 Magic reference guide, 1 MTG Arena code card, 1 tuck box

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Good Puppers: Fun Friends!
description: A mini-expansion to Good Puppers providing automated opponent for a solo experience or to add an extra player to the table. The expansion A set of four friends that each have it's own set of rules to play against.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Selection Order Bid, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Teléfono Descompuesto
description:
Can you imagine combining great games like Pictionary and Say it with Mime in an original dynamic? Well, here we are for you to try this super fun game for groups and meetings. Guaranteed laughs (we laugh every time we try the prototype).

A team game where 1 player must draw a word, another act what he sees in the drawing (without seeing the word) and the rest guess what the word is (without seeing the drawing or the word).

ALL IN 90 SECONDS.

Ideal game to play with the family. Guaranteed laughs.


HOW TO PLAY?

Juan takes out a word card. He chooses and he has to draw the word he chose.

Juan shows the drawing to Pedro (ONLY HIM), who can only act out what he sees in the drawing (without seeing the word card).

Laura watches Pedro acting and has to guess what word he is.

Can they do it in 45 seconds?

You earn more points if you choose the most difficult word… there are three categories.

name: BOO Party Game
description:
A game of cards and speed. Those fast games, that everyone enjoys. They explain and play quickly. They don't fail. =)

HOW TO PLAY?

All cards are dealt. Each player places the pile of cards received in front of him, without seeing them.

In turn, they turn over the first card of their personal pile and put it in the middle saying a color.

If they hit the color, different actions happen.

There are two jokers where everyone must participate... that's why they must be attentive to what always happens.

Whoever runs out of cards wins!

Whoever doesn't want to play loses!

POWERFUL THE LITTLE ONE!

With Boo! We inaugurate our pocket Party Games, to take it anywhere and laugh a lot.

name: Scrabble: Genderstein
description:
The „Genderstein“ (gender tile) is a promotional tile or the German version of Scrabble with the letter combination *IN and a value of 10 points. It has been released on World Scrabble Day (April 13th) 2022 and distributed at various events like Internationale Spieletage SPIEL in Essen, Germany and can also be ordered at Mattel Germany’s customer support for free.

In the German language, nouns describing people (especially job titles) default to the male form ending with -e(r), while the female form ends with -(er)in (e. g. Bäcker – Bäckerin = baker – female baker). Activist groups are demanding a neutral form using the asterisk (*) as the so-called „Gendersternchen“ (“gender starlet”). In that example, you would write „Bäcker*in“ to emphasize that you mean both genders.

name: Dixit: Blue Mishmash Puzzle Promo Card
description:
Promo card from the Dixit Puzzle called "Blue Mishmash"

The Dixit Puzzle Collection contains 14 different Puzzles with Dixit artworks, 6 with 500 Parts and 8 with 1000 part.

Each puzzle contains a unique promo card different from the artwork on the puzzle.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: Dreamworld: An Unconscious Mind Card Game
description:
Dreamworld is a lightweight card game for 2–4 players that plays in 20–30 minutes. It is designed by Jonny Pac, co-designer of Unconscious Mind and the lead developer for Fantasia Games.

As a follower of Freud’s theories of the unconscious mind, your goal is to help suffering people recover from their psychological traumas. You can foster each client’s healing potential by interpreting the symbolism of their dreams.

At the start of a round, each player chooses a dream card and simultaneously reveals it. Next, you’ll arrange the cards numerically beside the current client. The difference between your card’s number and the next limits how many treatment tokens you may score: the bigger the gap, the better. If you’re the first to complete all your tokens, it proves your treatments were the most effective—making you Freud’s most formidable contemporary.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Quiz Cube: Name 'em All
description:
Can you name... The Seven Dwarfs? Two countries beginning with Z? Santa Claus's eight reindeer? The Famous Five? The four Hogwart's Houses? Six actors who've played Dr. Who?
How many would you know?!

In this general knowledge quiz game, the more examples you can name, the more points you’ll score!

name: Instant Saga
description:
Instant Saga is a drafting game where players select a team of Vikings to then attempt to land at four locations.

The Viking cards show certain colors, which indicate which islands they can land on. Viking cards which do not help capture a land card are sent to Valhalla, and may score points in a secondary manner.

If a player does not contribute at least 1 card to a landing attempt, they are eliminated from the game.

The player with the most points wins.
publishers: ハレルヤロックボーイ (Hallelujah Rockboy)

name: Fallout Factions: Nuka-World
description:
Get ready to dive back into the world of Fallout 4 in Fallout Factions: Nuka World, a new skirmish wargame in which two players have enemy factions vying for power as they battle over territory to strengthen their Raiders and take control of Nuka World. Using standard ten-sided dice and featuring a streamlined resolution system, this wargame is great for beginners and those that want to set up the game on the fly.

Fallout Factions: Nuka World features 32mm scale miniatures that are compatible with Modiphius's adventure game Fallout: Wasteland Warfare. The miniatures have multiple build options available for each figure (ten per box), and they fall into one of three Raider gangs: the Operators, the Pack, and the Disciples.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: El Melómano: Expansión Vol.2 – Grandes Éxitos: Inglés
description:
Stand-alone expansion with songs in English for El Melómano.

Contains 128 cards to sing and answer, with greatest hits.

It can be played with the original game, or individually.

name: Beep! Beep!
description:
Big disaster in town today! Trains and buses are not running. The only saving grace for the locals are taxis. Which of the taxi drivers will turn out to be the best and deliver their passengers first?

Roll the dice and move your taxi to the randomly drawn space. If this location is one of your three objectives, place an objective token there. If you place all of them, you win!

name: Yu-Gi-Oh Pegasus' Castle Sprint
description:
From the back of the box:
Battle it out around the duelist kingdom.

Race around the Duelist Kingdom to reach Pegasus' Castle with 10 star chips in your possession FIRST!

Battle it out against other players and opponents using monster cards. Power up your attacks with field power bonus' ... And win battles to gain star chips. Duel, steal and fight your way to win 10 star chips, which grants you access to Pegasus' castle.

Play as either Yami Yugi, Seto Kaiba, Joey Wheeler or Mai Valentine as you battle it out around the Duelist Kingdom to get to the castle first.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Memory, Race

name: Magic: The Gathering – Amonkhet Planeswalker Deck: Liliana, Death Wielder
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Get started playing Magic right away! Harness the power of death itself to debilitate and destroy all who stand in your way, then raise a horde of undead minions to overwhelm your enemies. Call on the dark magic of the Planeswalker Liliana Vess--with a card unique to this deck--to claim ultimate victory.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Curio Black 1962
description:
Curio Black 1962 is a high stakes undercover auction game, lasting around 15 minutes per player for 2-6 players. Outbid, outplay, and outlast the world’s nations to collect the most valuable artifacts, inventions, and deals for your country. The player who escapes the island with the most merit points wins the game.

Players bid on and win auctions to gain points. They then take their turns with playable action cards to try to get an upper hand in the night's dealings. The game is on a set event board, where each turn brings the black market closer to its eventual destruction.

Curio Black 1962 is a fictitious game rooted in dark history—the thick of American / Soviet tensions, the Cuban Missile Crisis, an escalating nuclear arms race—and pits players against the clock of atomic annihilation!

—description from designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Kill Steal, Memory

name: Dreams of Yesterday
description:
In Dreams of Yesterday, you compete with rival museums to build the best collection of fine art, ancient artifacts, and fossils. As the curator of your museum, you'll use your resources of money, prestige, and knowledge to obtain the best artifacts and create enticing exhibits.

But it's not just about collecting the most valuable items. The unique layout of your museum allows you to activate powerful abilities that can rearrange your exhibits, flip cards, and transform resources. Plus, with the addition of the mysterious Urn cards, you never know what ancient secrets you might uncover...

—description from the publisher

name: P'tit Market
description: Buying game: To be the fastest to finish your shopping, you'll need a little luck and a smart approach to managing money. A fun introduction to buying games, working with numbers and learning to give change.

name: Путь к успеху (Your way to success)
description:
The strategy of the game is based on the fact that success in life can be achieved through education and effective work. Players perform the same actions as in real life: go to school and work, earn money, buy food, acquire personal property, pay utility bills. Players all the time have to plan their income and expenses, as well as their actions during the working day, week, month. The game helps to acquire financial decision-making skills and choose your development strategy on the path to success.

A player on his turn can visit from one of the three city buildings on the game board. Moving between buildings is possible both on foot and by taxi.

There are several types of buildings: buildings in which the player works; buildings in which the player spends earned money (shops); buildings in which the player receives improvements in personal skills (educational institutions).

An example of a building where the player earns money is a factory. Arriving at the factory, the player rolls a die and, depending on the result of the roll, the player receives a certain amount of money earned.

Gradually, the player buys more items for himself in the house. As soon as any of the players has 10 items at home, 5000 units of currency after paying off all loans and utility bills, then that player wins.

name: Woblet
description:
The Woblet games are played with two-sided letter tiles.
Make the longest word or crosswords. Find a secret word or pass on the hot potato. Always try to play faster than your opponents.

Exciting or relaxing. Competitive or chill. Creative and above all: fun.

You play all at once and don’t have to wait until it’s your turn. The rules of the games are explained within a minute and you play Woblet at any desired level. From short words with young children to extremely difficult tasks for the real word artists.

The average duration of each game is a couple of minutes.
Each game box contains enough game material for about 6 players.
With the contents of a box you can play Woblet in any language. (Latin alphabet).
The rules in different languages and extra game possibilities can be found on the website.

name: Sons of Faeriell: 5th Player Tribe Set
description: Components for the 5th player.

name: Gondos Gazdik
description:
Many small animals are looking for a new owner: a kitten, a puppy, a guinea pig, even a chameleon! They need care and love, but unfortunately, there is not enough space in the shelter yet. Luckily, Lili and her friends - the players - are there to help! They're taking a few into their own home, and will look after them for a while until they find the best, loving owners!

Each player can collect care tokens (such as bathing, feeding, and playing) on their own game board, creating the perfect temporary home for one or two of the animals. But the game doesn't end there - you'll also have to find the best real owners for your pets! Once you've done that, a space on the board will open up for you to temporarily adopt another pet. Players earn points for the animals they cared for and delivered to their future owners. The player with the most points win.

As well as being endlessly cute and teaching responsibility in a subtle way, this game is also highly recommended because after two rounds your child won't be demanding that you take all the animals home from the shelter. This game shows that different animals have different needs and not all pets fit the same owner.

Plus, Gondos Gazdik has great scalability! You can play cooperatively with younger children, helping each other and "brainstorming" together, and after a bit of practice, you can play competitively! Who will help the most pets find a home?


* *


Sok kis állat keres gazdit: a cica, a kutyus, a tengerimalac, sőt, még egy kaméleon is! Gondoskodásra és szeretetre van szükségük, de sajnos a menhelyen már kevés a hely. Szerencsére Lili és barátai - vagyis a játékosok - segítenek rajtuk! Párat befogadnak a saját házukba, és egy ideig ők vigyáznak rájuk, míg meg nem találják számukra a legjobb gazdit!

Minden játékos a saját játéktáblájára gyűjthet gondoskodás-korongokat (például fürdetést, etetést, játszást), így teremtve meg a tökéletes átmeneti otthont egyik-másik állatkának. A játék azonban itt még nem ér véget, ugyanis a legmegfelelőbb igazi gazdit is meg kell találni a kiskedvencek számára! Ha ez sikerült, felszabadul egy hely a táblátokon, hogy újabb állatot fogadhasatok be átmenetileg. Minden ellátott állatka után pontokat kaptok, a legtöbb pontot gyűjtő játékos nyer!

Amellett, hogy ez a játék végtelenül aranyos és észrevétlenül tanít meg a felelősségvállalásra, azért is ajánljuk jó szívvel, mert nem fogja azt követelni két kör után a gyerkőc, hogy minden állatot vigyetek haza a menhelyről. A társas rámutat, hogy különböző állatoknak különböző igényeik vannak, és hogy nem minden kisállatnak ugyanaz a gazdi a legmegfelelőbb.

Ráadásul a Gondos Gazdik remekül skálázható! Kisebbekkel játszhatjátok kooperatív játékmódban egymást segítve és közösen ötletelve, egy kis gyakorlás után pedig mehet a versengő játékmód! Vajon ki segít a legtöbb kiskedvencnek otthonra találni?

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Easter Egg Hunt
description: Hunger for the eggs
mechanics: Command Cards, End Game Bonuses, Push Your Luck, Resource Queue

name: Skullbites
description:
Bernadette Octavia the Witch has been cursed by the twelve Zodiac demons. She now aim to defeat the red dragon Jamil Hendock to acquire his book of curse removal. Hiring adventurer to help her achieve her goal, so did the dragon. A battle of epic proportion ensue.

Skullbites is a tricktaking game where the loser (lowest card) of the trick get damaged by all the other player's cards. Each player is given two Adventurer cards with an health value on them and a passive skill, one is played face up and the other is hidden face down. The two camp bosses are hidden among those adventurers. Once an adventurer is defeated, a player reveal their hidden adventurer and continue the game with the newly revealed character.

When losing a trick, you can block incoming damage by exhausting one of the three elemental shields chip each player has (wind, water and fire) but each shield has a one time use so be careful when to use it!

Some storytellers will help bring balance, but ultimately the war won't end until one of the two camp leader is defeated.

name: Taco Kitten Pizza
description:
Taco, Kitten, Pizza! These 3 pals are super cute and pop up when you least expect them. They love it when you remember their names and call for them at the right time!

Juts like the adult's version Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza, be the first to get rid of all your cards to win the game

How to play :

Announce a word, then flip your card.
If the word corresponds to the card, play again.
Quickly grab the piece of candy when it appears.
publishers: Albi, Blue Orange (EU), Dolphin Hat Games, MIPL

name: Chocolate Mousetier
description:
In this light strategy game, aspiring pastry chefs compete to become the world's Master Chocolatier by crafting delicious Chocolate Landscapes and enlisting the help of talented mice.

Build your Chocolate Landscapes by collecting sets of Task cards and assigning Mice to them. Use your Power cards to stop your opponent's progress and to boost your chances of success.

You need 3 different Task Cards from the same landmark and 5 mice assigned to them in order to gain a Quest Token. Collect Quest Tokens for completed landscapes to win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: The Fabulous Adventure: Who'll save the Princess?
description:
Hurry! Dragons and witches have kidnapped the princess. The whole kingdom is invaded by these monstrous creatures.

Now it's your turn! Seize the 12 dices bag, take 3 of them and throw them. The more Princesses you get, the closer you'll get to save the kingdom. But be careful, you'll need to be smart and stop in time so you don't get too many dragons or other traps. You could lose your points or worse...skip you turn !

You will save the Princess in this fabulous adventure?

—description from the publisher

name: Hope of the Stranded
description:
Sci-fi scavenge on a derelict spacecraft while an alien presence stalks you.

A mint tin solo game; find three fuel rods before the ship falls apart, the O2 runs out or the alien catches you.

Reveal cards for the rooms in the craft, oriented by dice rolls, manager resources, hunt for what you need.

name: Sfynx
description:
Every 25 moons, the mysterious Sfynx open a gateway to their sunken city...but only the adventurers able to solve nine riddles before the clepsydra empties will be granted access to its vanished splendors and forgotten knowledge.

Are you up to the task?

name: Heroes of Barcadia: Coin of Magic Pourtals
description:
Hey, did you drop this coin? It seems to have a slightly risky magical aura… maybe you should try using it the next time you go through a Magic Pourtal? Who knows what may happen… We know what’ll happen — when a player uses a pourtal, they’ll have the option to flip this coin for either a reward… or a punishment. Get either +1 Loot Card or -5 HP. Is it worth the risk?

This Heroes of Barcadia Coin of Magic Pourtals adds a fun new mechanic to the game that's 100% optional and 100% awesome! Clinging on to life is something you'll need to get used to while brawling in the Barcadian dungeons, so why not take this coin with you?! It may just be the extra oomph you need, or that final blow that sends you back to the starting point...

Product Specifications:


Heroes of Barcadia Coin of Magic Pourtals
Game Add-on
Available exclusively from Rollacrit
Size: 1" diameter
Material: Iron
100% waterproof
Heroes of Barcadia game not included.
Made by Shire Post Mint


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Ruination: Blood Sworn
description:
Glory be to the Immortal Khan, who soon will ascend from the Wasteland to the Next World. With no heir to inherit the Blood Throne, He appoints four chieftains from the ruling hordes--each more thirsty than the next for a chance to rule the ruins.

Blood Sworn, is the second expansion for Ruination, bringing even more to the post-post-apocalypse. Each horde now has two new additions: a chieftain and a horde deck. Each chieftain provides unique tactics during battles, as well as the possibility to be upgraded. Horde cards are asymmetrical one-use abilities with extremely powerful effects.

This expansion also includes:

- Updated rules for nomads, including all new nomad tokens and event cards that change every game
- New rules for the glory track, including a glory die
- Defense: a new stat to mitigate casualties
- Alternate exile cards
- New action decks with completely unique cards, including the aforementioned chieftain upgrades
- And even more powerful advancements
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Drafting, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Guyenne
description:
Guyenne is a card game of bluff, hand management and castle conquest, with a historical flavour.

The name "Guyenne" refers both to the hereditary duchy of the English crown resulting from the Treaty of Brétigny signed in 1360 and to the battle cry of the Anglo-Guyenne armies during the Hundred Years War.

Players compete in successive rounds. They play the cards in their hand to take control of as many of the castle defences as possible that face them. But their forces are limited, and they must be used at the right moment to get the final victory.

Each game turn consists of two phases (laying cards and resolving battles) during which both players are alternately attacker and defender.

—description from the designer

name: Bier Pioniere: Funny Leicht Promo Card
description:
A new Person, with this Power:

Draw 2 cards from the deck and 1 card from every other player. Keep 2 cards and give every other player 1 card

name: Zombies!!!: 20th Anniversary Edition – Promo Pack
description:
A set of 5 promo cards packaged together that backers received for backing Zombies!!!: 20th Anniversary Set.

High Roller
Card says: Play this card and roll the Die. On a 1-3, lose a heart token, 4-5 gain a gain a bullet token and on a 6 gain gain a heart and bullet token.

Elder God
Card Says: Place this card in front of you at the beginning of your turn. Add +2 to all rolls. Discard at the end of your turn.

Sibling Rivalry
Card says: Discard a heart token. Target a player who must win two combat rolls of 5 or better.

Dead Man's Hand
This card says: Item: Discard this card. Draw up to 5 cards instead of 3.If you do not finish your turn on the helipad, move pawn to the starting line.

What'd Ya Find Boy?
Card states: Collect all tokens on your current tile.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Hand Management, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sabobatage: Tastea Expansion Pack
description:
Our first ever Boba Shop Collaboration - with none other than Tastea - the popular California Franchise that's won many hearts with their delectable drinks, punny names, and cute mascot!

Tastea friends join the Sabobatage universe in this brand new expansion pack introducing new mechanics that enhance gameplay. A new draw pile called the Employee Roster - allows the hiring of employees across the board allowing their special abilities to help you in your goal of building 5 boba drinks!

name: UNO: Disney Pixar – Lightyear
description:
An UNO variation featuring Buzz Lightyear, promoting the 2022 Disney movie Lightyear.

Players still race to get rid of all their cards by matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the discard pile, and the special Hyperspeed rule can result in multiple players being skipped one after another.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kniffel 7
description:
Kniffel 7 uses the familiar Kniffel gameplay of having players roll dice on their turn up to three times, then scoring for a dice combination on their individual player sheet.

What's new in this game is that players now roll seven dice on their turn — and with seven dice, you have more possible combinations than before, such as the double-triple or the Super-Kniffle, which requires a six-of-a-kind.

Why not a seven-of-a-kind? Because on each of the seven dice, one of the numbers from one to seven is missing, which gives you something extra to think about when deciding which dice to keep and which to re-roll.

name: Red Labyrinth
description: Red Labyrinth is a horror-themed trick-taking game. Each player must move towards the exit while following their memories. However, if you stay in this labyrinth for a long time, your emotional ups and downs will be intense, your memories will gradually fade, and your path will become complicated. Additionally, a presence lurking in the darkness will slowly approach you. Once you are caught by that presence, you will never be able to escape from here. Will you be able to avoid it and escape from here?

name: Master Sinseh
description:
Learn about commonly used traditional Chinese herbs as you outbid your fellow sinsehs (Chinese physicians) for patients. Designed in partnership with Eu Yan Sang, a traditional Chinese medicine giant, Master Sinseh is a meticulously researched unique bidding card game.

The game is played over 5 days. Each day, players will prescribe exactly 2 herb cards to each patient. Each herb card has values in the 4 categories that each patient is suffering from. Players will need to juggle and combine herbs in the cleverest way possible to become the Master Sinseh!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection

name: Алиби: Смертельное блюдо (Alibi: A Dish to Die For)
description:
Alibi is a murder mystery game series inspired by dinner parties with a crime theme, designed for players aged 14 and above.

In the game Alibi: A Dish to Die For there is a scenario of the last "poisonous" episode of a cooking program.

All five players are suspects, and through clues and discussions, they must reconstruct the events while concealing or revealing the secrets of the story.

In Alibi, it is important to carefully follow the order of card decks. If there are six (or more) players, the Detective (or investigation team) comes into play. With only four players, one innocent suspect deck will be removed from the game.

No one knows who the killer is — not even the guilty party — until the final phase of the game, which begins with the Revelation when each player learns their guilt or innocence from their own deck of cards. At this point, all players provide their reconstruction of the events before the voting. Will the killer manage to direct the suspicions of other players towards an innocent person to win the game?

A mystery to experience firsthand in an innovative blend of board game and role-playing game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Traveling Fair
description:
Welcome to the grand fair in a small Japanese town! You’re arriving along with many extraordinary merchants, gardeners, and fortune tellers, who quickly flood the cozy streets. But you’re not here to sell—Joban Takemura, the dragon who organizes the fair, needs as much help as he can get. And he’s even ready to name one of you his best assistant!
In Traveling Fair, players will help Joban arrange the stalls at the fair so that all the merchants are satisfied. Everyone has a shared goal, but each player also has a personal objective to complete. By using cards and placing the stalls in the right spots, you can get the most Influence Points and become the winner and Joban's best helper.
Traveling Fair is a cozy and atmospheric board game, perfect for a family game night!

name: The Adventure in Ancient Greece
description:
Ancient Greece and its myths await you for an adventure of Mediterranean taste. Defeat the mythological creatures and the enemies hiding among the temples. Then face the terrible Minotaur and become the hero of Greece.

Shuffle the 12-card deck of monsters and other encounters. Place the cards at the numbers around the labyrinth board. Move around the labyrinth from point to (numbered) point to complete each encounter (by rolling several dice). Monsters need to be defeated, while the other encounters give you extra abilities to use.
Final monster to defeat is the Minotaur. Succeed at this before you lose your last life to win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement

name: Apophis: The Curse
description:
Apophis: The Curse is a competitive game of moving pieces on a board, where the opponents will fight to reach with one of their pieces to the Anubis square of another player before the rest.

The main feature of Apophis is that players cannot use their pieces to remove other pieces from the board, for this there is a single central piece, which gives name to the game, which is used by all players to make their way through the board.
Each piece has a special move that players must respect. And zones that players cannot cross. The Apophis piece also has a special move.

On the other hand, when a player has the Apophis piece in his zone of the board, he will obtain the Curse. This prevents him from moving any of his pieces until he gets rid of Apophis. If he manages to eliminate with Apophis any enemy piece, he will get extra moves.

It is a game with strategy and medium term planning.
It is possible to play one against one, and also two against two.
Never three players.

—description from the publisher

name: Lynx
description:
In Lynx, an economic game with a historical and ecological theme, each player takes on the role of a late 18th century fur trapper in the Hudson's Bay region of northern Ontario who is exploiting the lynx-hare cycle and trying to outwit other trappers.

Traps are supplied by the Hudson's Bay Company with the agreement that all pelts be sold exclusively to them. By trapping when the lynx are plentiful and selling pelts at high prices, the trapper who earns the most money pays off their debt and becomes a free trapper.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Market, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Solace
description:
Solace is a co-operative science-fiction game set in a world of immortals in which players are agents of a futuristic SWAT called FTO. Players have to accomplish increasingly dangerous missions, which are playable independently or as part of a campaign. In each mission, as a team you raid a building or a palace, with the goal of saving hostages, killing a target, retrieving data, or pursuing other objectives as stated on the mission cards.

Each turn, you have to plan your actions in a co-operative mode to move between palace floors, move inside rooms of the same floor, hack electric elements, fight enemies, and so on. Once you've planned the actions, you execute them and see the feedback of the palace: enemy movement, enemy attacks, new room cards being triggered, etc.
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Race Around Europe
description: From the creators of Ticket to Ride, a fun game where kids can learn about Countries, Capitals and Landmarks as they travel across Europe! Players use Country and Transportation Tiles to chart a course across Europe. The first player to complete a 10 trip journey, where each trip connects to the next, is the winner!
mechanics: Connections, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Race

name: La Spada di Ghiaccio: Il Gioco da Tavolo
description:
A cooperative game, in which participants can play the roles of various heroes of their choice, with the aim of finding the ice sword before the Antagonist. Pawns, action cards, thematic decks and the inevitable randomness of rolling the dice will accompany players on a gaming adventure waiting to be discovered.

—description from the publisher (translated)

A un anno di distanza da quando Marco Nucci e Cristian Canfailla ci hanno riportato a visitare il mondo dell'Argaar, e per la prima volta in un assoluto esperimento inedito, sarà possibile immergersi in prima persona nella leggenda con l'imperdibile gioco da tavolo della Spada di Ghiaccio. Un gioco cooperativo, in cui i partecipanti possono interpretare i ruoli di vari eroi a scelta, con l'obiettivo di trovare la spada di ghiaccio prima dell'Antagonista. Pedine, carte azione, mazzi tematici e l'immancabile aleatorietà del lancio dei dadi accompagneranno i giocatori in un'avventura di gioco tutta da scoprire.

—description from the publisher

name: Pocket Tennis
description:
Pocket Tennis is a fast dice game that simulates a match of tennis. It's a very light dice game that contains custom made dice for serving, baseline shots, net shots, attacking shots and a unique Bird Eye Challenge die.

The game rules also include an achievement progress Wall of Fame. Leave your name in history as you win games and proceed to the next spot to write your name!

Easy to play for any tennis fan. Fast, furious grand slamming Pocket Tennis action!

name: Amino
description:
In Amino, players compete to create Amino acids out of the primordial ooze and early atmospheres of their planets. Collecting useful molecules like water, ammonia, and methane, avoid unhelpful molecules like diatomic nitrogen and hydrogen, and add other effects to your atmosphere like additional UV radiation or lightning.

The game is played with all placed cards face down, so you never know how well your atmosphere compares to your neighbors until the round is over. Use your allotted action points each turn to draw cards, place new cards, or even swap cards between players! The player with the most total points after a set number of rounds is the winner!

name: Фарт
description:
Greed is a concise and fascinating eurogame from substantial developer of board games - Reiner Knizia. In addition to a good mechanic this game can show off a peculiar look styled as picture post cards of the Russian 19th century lifestyle designed by Oleg Ershov.
The game is of the sort when rules understanding takes 15 minutes but mastering of playing skills requires indefinite time.

You will play a role of a pre-revolutionary businessman beating up among the winds of city life and trying to make money in these fickle conditions – you are not surprised, are you? Bargaining with proper people, using contacts and getting biggest profit by turning the circumstances to your own advantage.
The most skilled merchant wins the game. And what is the better evidence of business success then undertaking profit? That’s why the winning point counters look like cash notes and for the mostly successful ones – like gold bar cards.

Gameplay

Each player acquires two “Фарт” cards, one “Big Фарт” card and 10 more cards with random characters (8 cards if there are five players). Characters have positive and negative values. The first ones add the winning points, the others withdraw. “Student” is a special character which has a neutral, zero value. These two card types differ at the back so as to know how many “Фарт” cards each player has at the hand. Players shouldn’t hide this information.

Define by any suitable way who will start the game. Further the turn will dispose clockwise. In your game-business action several card piles will be formed – one for each player and one in the center. Only upper cards make sense during the game.

Player should put a card from his hand during his turn. Cards with positive or negative values can be placed to the own pile or at the center. “Student” card can be placed to any pile except the one with upper “Фарт” or “Big фарт” card on it. These cards can be played only to the own card piles.

When you’ve got all needed contacts and character positions at the table brings you delight and rejoicing, it’s time to catch up a moment of gain and hit the jackpot playing “Фарт” or “Big фарт” card. It’s placed near player’s pile and incites the instant count of all cards values at the table. Sum up the positive values, subtract negative and acquire or lose the sum of cash notes equal to the outcome. It’s simple! Though not as simple as it seems because all other “Фарт” cards at the table also work at this moment. In this case their owners are swept over the commercial tide and they get or lose the congruous sum of banknotes. If “Big фарт” has been played or provoked the sum of points, positive and negative as well, doubles.

When everyone plays all the cards the round ends. Then there can be more rounds at will. The amount of rounds can be equal to the number of players to let everyone to make the first turn for the most unbiased result.

Firstly, the game is logical so the word «фарт» obtains a bit different meaning then luck or risk. It can be associated with business acumen, enterprise and skill to use the chance. Remember: maybe business path loves the lucky ones but respects only gentlemen who are sober-minded and prudent.

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel – Sonderkarte 2009 – Franz vohm Winkel
description:
This is a special card for the Siedler von Catan card game distributed in special fairs usually by mr. Klaus Teuber itself.
The card name is "Franz vohm Winkel" and is a special thanks to them (who is the illustrator of the entire series in Germany).
The card text says: "pay the costs for Franz vohm Winkel and place them over a Church. The both cards counts, together, as 2 victory points. If the Church must be removed from the game, Franz vohm Winkel is also removed."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Canine Kleptomaniacs
description:
Canine Kleptomaniacs is a simple, silly, addictive, doggy card game that celebrates the bizarre thieving habits of our canine friends.

Like the average, faithful family hound, Canine Kleptomaniacs is unashamedly simple. It doesn't employ sophisticated gameplay or in-depth strategy. But don't think because of this that it isn't great fun and endlessly re-playable.

It's all about Pooch Points.

You score Pooch Points by doing what comes naturally to all Canine Kleptomaniacs – thieving and hiding underwear, socks, slippers and anything else that takes your fancy.

Choosing what to collect, when to hide and whether and what to trade with other players (as well as having luck along the way) will ultimately determine your fortunes in this silly, fun, fast-paced, simple-to-learn, family-and-dog-friendly card game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pacific Battles: Shanghai 1937
description:
Pacific Battles: Shanghai is a wargame part of a series of several campaigns in the Pacific Theater of Operations in World War II. The system emphasizes the operational level of these campaigns, and deals with land and air operations.
This is a two-player game. One player controls the Japanese, the other the Allies. Shanghai is the third game in the series. It covers the entire land-air campaign for that strategic Chinese city of Shanghai, August to November, 1937.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters


World at War Magazine #42 (Jun-Jul 2015)

name: Tighee
description: A trick-taking game released at Tokyo Game Market 2023. 5 suits. For the black suit, at the start of the game you flip over a card from the undealt cards (which the players have seeded) and all black cards are this suit instead (possibly black. For the trick play, must follow, with high card winning if all follow and low card winning if there are any offsuit. Winner takes the cards from the trick and the card which was determining black’s color (reveal a new card for black’s color). Earn positive points for winning 4/8/12 tricks, but negative points for any other number.

name: Dien Bien Phu: Strategic Game of Indochina 1950-55
description:
Published in Conflict Magazine #6 - the French Vietnam war period

"Dien Bien Phu" is a strategic level wargame about the "First Indochina War" (1950 - 1955). A small area map of North Vietnam and bordering areas is used to plot simultaneous movement via written orders. When opposing units move to the same place there is combat which is worked out via a diceless system. The Viet Minh win the game if they capture and hold Hanoi or eliminate 3 French regular units in 1 turn.

Components:
Small map
1 Countersheet
Rules Booklet
Movement Plotting Sheets
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Programmed Movement, Simulation
publishers: Flying Buffalo, Inc. (FBI), SDC (Simulations Design Corporation)

name: ATS Warfighting Guide #1
description:
From the publisher's site:

The first in a series of detailed handbooks for ATS players filled with illustrated examples of play and instruction articles. Each issue is about 40 pages.

The first issue of ATS WARFIGHTING GUIDE #1 also includes a bonus multi-turreted tank play aid for owners of ADVANCED TOBRUK + a free bonus GOODY..

Articles cover analysis of machine-gun and mortars in ATS, a look at Panther Tanks in the system, compared to US Army data, and a couple of new variants...plus we hear more from the Hal Hock correspondence collection...and more!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Welcome to the Dungeon: Toad Promo
description:
This is a promotional Tile for Welcome to the Dungeon. The Toad is a 1HP creature that can be played with any set of hero equipment.

This tile is included with the IELLO Aramini Circus editions (FR or EN) of Yardmaster.
publishers: Bureau de Juegos, IELLO, Lex Games

name: Ridiculous Expositions
description:
Ridiculous Expositions is the word game that seems innocent, sounds indecent and sure is good for tons of naughty laughs.

Two teams compete to discover the saucy expressions that lie beneath the surface phrases. Watch friends sound out dirty phrases without even realizing it! But that's not all - each round, there's a Swinger. This smooth lady or gent gets the chance to take one (or a few) for their team by stealing any unsolved cards from their opponents. There's five rounds of enjoyment. Whoever has the most points at the end wins the game. Ridiculous Expositions is perfect for lovers of crude humor with quick and dirty minds!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Santiago 1898: Final del Imperio
description:
Santiago 1898: Final del Imperio is a simulation of the campaign of Santiago de Cuba during the Spanish - American War.

One A3 sized map, 200 cut and paste counters.

name: Quick Checkers
description: Award winning introductory form of checkers with a smaller 6x6 board covered with instructions to help children remember the set-up and legal plays. Included in the packaging is a foldout pictorial list of easy lessons and alternate rules to make the game intriguing and interesting for the growing player. The board is double-sided and has a regular (though still labeled) 8x8 board on the reverse.

name: Who Knew?  The Who-What-Why Phrase Game
description:
From the game box:
"Move around the Who Knew? board, landing on colors that determine what kind of question you get. Can you guess who first said the familiar phrases, what they mean or why we say them? Some of the questions may LOOK easy, but the answers just might surprise you.

Up to four players or teams.
Ages 12 and up
Playing time: 45 minutes."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Sewing Circle
description:
Sewing Circle is an 18 card microgame and part of The Stocking Stuffer Collection.

Unspool your ribbon and keep it from getting tangled. If someone's ribbon gets tangled, they'll be out of the running!

Sewing Circle is a game for 2 or 3 players. Your goal is to be the player who avoids tangling their ribbon. 12 cards are placed onto the table in a circle, with the 6 remaining cards being divided evenly among the players. Each player decides which color ribbon will represent them, and the first player to choose will go first.

The rules are simple- keep your line unbroken. If your turn ends and your line is broken, you lose. Every turn you must flip a card in the circle face-up, then you may swap a face up-card with its neighbor, and then you may exchange any face-up card with a card in your hand.

To win the game, you'll have to plan your moves so that while untangling your ribbon you tangle your opponents' ribbon as well. Causing multiple tangles means they'll have to spend their turn dealing with them and can limit their options in tangling things up for you. Choosing the best cards to flip on your turn and making sure the cards in your hands have different lines on them can be important as well. If you can plan multiple steps ahead you can improve your chances even more.

Sewing circle also includes a solo/cooperative mode, where players must keep all three ribbons from getting tangled. If any ribbon is tangled at the end of any player's turn they all lose.

—description from the publisher

name: Chill Pill
description:
Nanodaption of Fever Chill.

Way back at the end of 2015, we released a little wallet game called Fever Chill. It's nearly sold out at this point, but revived by Nat Levan in his line of Nanodaptions that capture the essence of the game in a smaller package. In Chill Pill, you will simultaneously choose actions to try to raise the infection level above 7 without raising the temperature too high.

—description from the publisher


Based on Fever Chill by Kenneth Thompson.

Now you play the viruses competing to infect a body. Players simultaneously infect a part of the body to increase their infection level, but too many viruses in one place also raises the temperature. The doctors always target the virus with the highest temperature, so you can only win by infecting faster than the doctors can treat or outlasting your fellow viruses.

This game is back to basics, with two board variations on one two-sided card and a rule card. Just add 2 tokens per player (and an optional die) to play anywhere from 2-4, 5, 6, or more.


Released in the July 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Dictionwary
description: A player reads aloud the first and last words on the pages of an opened dictionary. The other players think of words which fall between those keywords to spell and give their meaning. Points are awarded for the number of letters, the meaning of the word, and bonus letters. Dictionwary is a game for word lovers.

name: Tolstoi: Wieviel Erde braucht der Mensch?
description:
The first (?) game based on a Tolstoi short story ("How Much Ground Does a Man Need?"), this game's premise is simple: Two to four people have paid 1000 Rubles to the Bashkirs for a "day" of land. How much is a "day"? Well, you start on a mountaintop and begin walking. If you come back to the mountain by sundown, you get all the land you encircle.

The board is a 24x32 grid. Each player drops a small cylinder to indicate their starting location, and then draw cards (generally) to move. Each card indicates how far and in what direction you move (your "boundary" is indicated by plastic cones in your color) and how much time it took--around the board, a Sun token moves from Dawn to Dusk. When the Sun token hits Dusk, the game is over. If you end up back on your mountain, you get points equal to the area you have enclosed (plus how many spaces are in your boundary--for the Go-enabled, it's "Chinese scoring"). If you're not on your mountain, you get nothing. If nobody is on their mountain, the Bashkirs win--just like in the story...

name: Les Vins de France: The Game of French Wine & Food
description:
In Les Vins de France, players tour the famous wine regions of France, acquiring some of the myriad types of wine, and scoring points by the judicious use of these wines with gourmet meals representative of the regional cuisines of France.

Players roll an eight-sided die and move clockwise around the outskirts of France. Vinyard spaces allow the player the choice of acquiring a wine from the region, or dining on a meal from that region. City spaces allow dining with a meal from any region. When Dining, a player rolls the die and references a chart to determine the meal. He then selects a wine from his holdings, and cross-references another chart to determine the points scored for the meal. Dessert and Picnic spaces allow discarding wines for a set number of points. Fortune spaces require the drawing of cards which grant special abilities, change the players location on the board, or cause the loss of a turn.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Copyright
description:
In Copyright, players need to reproduce a pattern as quickly as possible using the transparent image sheets that they have in hand. Each sheet is a 3x3 grid that has a circle, a square, and a plus in three of its nine squares.

At the start of a round, one player takes four image sheets at random, then stacks them together to form a model for that round. Players receive ten sheets at random, then try to reproduce the model by flipping the sheets and stacking them any way they like; the sheets do not have to overlap perfectly, but a player will lose points for any non-perfect overlaps. How does a player indicate which squares in his stack are to be considered the solution? Through the use of a 3x3 grid that has a thick black outline; each player has one of these in addition to the ten sheets.

As soon as a player recreates the model, the round ends. Each player scores one point for each square in the model that she reproduced in her image; whoever ended the round receives one bonus point, scoring 10 points (instead of nine). All players then lose one point for each row and column that "sticks out" from her 3x3 black-bordered grid. Players then shuffle the sheets and start a new round.

When a player's score totals 20 or more points, the game ends and this player wins.

name: Space Puppies
description:
Space Puppies is a deck-building game for 2-5 players. Each player begins with 5 cards and can take 2 actions per turn: play a dog in front of you, play an action card, save a planet, or discard a card.

Once a player completes a set of dog cards, they choose one of the planets on the dog cards to save, thus earning points. Play continues in turn order, with each player taking 2 actions per turn.

The endgame trigger is chosen at the beginning of the game; the game can end when someone scores 40 points or when someone has saved 3 planets.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Pacific Battles: Guadalcanal
description:
Pacific Battles: Guadalcanal is a two-player (Japanese versus U.S.) operational level game, designed by Joseph Miranda. The game includes 228 medium-sized die-cut counters, with the battalion as the primary maneuver unit, and also includes air units, supply markers, campaign chits, suppression chits, and deception markers. The colorful map features the island of Guadalcanal, with each hex representing approximately two miles across, and includes such prominent locations as Henderson Field and Bloody Ridge, as well as various charts and tables for easy reference during play.

The rules entail a variety of standard and unique rules, such as Reinforcements, Suppression, Logistics, Reorganization, Headquarters, Air Operations, Naval Bombardment, Fog of War, Engineer Units, Fortifications, Amphibious Movement, Evacuation, as well as optional rules detailing aspects such as High Ground, Artillery, Air Superiority, Close Air Support, Capturing Supply, and Airborne mechanics.

The game sequence is as follows:

PLANNING PHASE
FIRST PLAYER INITIAL IMPULSE
SECOND PLAYER INITIAL IMPULSE
FIRST PLAYER FOLLOW-ON IMPULSE
SECOND PLAYER FOLLOW-ON IMPULSE
Victory Points phase


Victory in the game is determined by the accumulation of VPs for control of important hexes, eliminating enemy units, as well as evacuating friendly units.

name: Les Batailles de St Albans
description:
Les batailles de St Albans (Battles of St Albans) is an introductory level tactical medieval wargame about War of the Roses.

The game includes one A4 map, 34 units and leaders counters and 10 markers.

The game covers the two battles of St Albans, fought on the same battlefield:
- First Battle of St Albans (May 22, 1455), Richard, Duke of York v. Edmund Beaufort, Duke of Somerset
- Second Battle of St Albans (February 17, 1461), Richard Neville, Earl of Warwick vs. Henry Beaufort, Duke of Somerset

name: MTV Remote Control
description:
MTV's Remote Control! It's the Worthless Game of Useless TV Knowledge.

Impress your friends and family with your wealth of meaningless TV Trivia. Prove how too many hours of watching television has warped your brain. Avoid chores and responsibilities just like everyone at MTV!
Study up on your Brady Physics, Partridge Family and Celebrity CAT Scans. And if you can Beat the Bishop and Mortify Your Mom, this is the game for you.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Bus Boss
description:
Bus Boss is a follow up to Railway Rivals/Dampfross that is simpler and plays faster.

Similarly to RR, the players draw routes they control on a map in the first part of the game and race to/from randomly determined cities. There are some important differences.

In the building phase: Instead of building a short section of track each turn, players buy an entire route between 2 cities. The price of the route is determined by its length + $2. This continues until one player has less than $50 left. This speeds up the building phase considerably.

In the racing phase: All players who compete in the race receive a share of a pot of $30. Ties on the same number of dice rolled, split their shares of the pot.

Many maps for different countries have been published.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building, Race

name: Krimi total: Das Geheimnis der Burg Wolfsklamm
description:
Translation - "The secret of Castle Wolf's Glen"

The 10th case of the Krimi total series takes place in dark ages. Kunigunde von Kauzenstein was murdered at Castle Wolf's Glen.
8 or 9 players slip into the roles of aristocrats and attendants, one of them is the murder.
His goal is not to be convicted, while all other try to find out the truth.

name: Sentinel Tactics: Mobile Defense Platform
description: This is a poster map and scenario for Sentinel Tactics based on the Mobile Defense Platform environment from Sentinels of the Multiverse.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Greater Than Games, LLC, Living Worlds Games

name: Scratch House
description:
The tile-laying game Scratch House takes its inspiration from the Winchester Mystery House, a bizarre mansion in San Jose, California owned by Sarah Winchester that was added on to continuously.

User summary:
Scratch House is a multi-player solitaire tile placement game. After your home is destroyed, fairies help you build a new house. But since they will live there too, they walk around the new rooms having a good look.

Players take turns collecting room tiles and spells from the board and then follow a solitaire process of building and scoring. The tiles show four portals, but 0-4 exit arrows which allow the fairies to walk only one way. Players can only build off arrows, so building is always with a mind to the next walk to score points as well as keeping it legal.

Fairies will not walk through unfinished rooms, and rooms don't become available until the build time is spent. All the tiles have a build cost, and players add to this cost how many steps to the nearest bedroom, and how many rooms built this turn to get the final cost. This is marked on the room with tokens.

Then build time is taken off each room according to which season you chose on the board. If you picked Spring, you get only 1 new tile but take 3 off each build time; Summer and Autumn get you 2 tiles and 2 off build times; Winter gives you 3 tiles but only 1 off build times. This means a balance forms between your house expanding quickly, or the rooms opening quickly, but not both together. Get it wrong and you restrict the walk and the chance to score points.

Add to this special effects in rooms to trigger bonus VPs, teleports, repainting and so on, Feng Shui to affect the fairies, spell cards to help you gain, extra steps for reaching bedrooms, and bonuses for seasons and colours, and there's a lot going on.

Production quality is high, the artwork is very good and the theme and the mechanics all work together nicely. Apart from the tile selection each round though, there is zero inter-action and players are really just trying to optimise their own builds and walks each time. The first edition of the game does not include English rules (downloadable though), despite full English on the cards and game box.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pieces as Map, Tile Placement

name: Alluvium
description:
There is an unexplored land appearing at the end of the ice age. Players are the heads of five fantastical races setting out to cultivate this mysterious land. Though pioneering this land is a collaborative effort, the other races are mischievous and may be disturbing your progress while pretending to cooperate.

Alluvium is a flip-and-write game with a twist: after each round, the sheets are passed clockwise to the next player and the sheets will come back to the original player with multicolored shapes from each of the opponents' work.

Each turn, a card is flipped. Players then draw that shape in their color in an empty area on the sheet in front of them. By helping to make a larger contiguous area, they will earn cooperation points toward a bonus, but they will also be helping the owner of the sheet get a higher score. After drawing the shape, players pass their sheets to the player on their left and repeat.

name: BANANINE
description:
In Bananine, you will compete to collect banana cards with quantities ranging from 1 to 9.

On your turn, take one stack of banana cards from the banana market and add them to your storeroom. Then choose banana cards from your hand with a total quantity equal to that of the cards you took and place them in the banana market.

Before ending your turn, stack the cards in the banana market by quantity. If a stack’s total quantity is 10 or more, discard that stack.

At the end of the game, score each quantity of banana card separately. The player who has the most banana cards of a given quantity in their storeroom will score points for it.

-description from designer

name: Ra: Strategy Among Hexagons
description:
This is a strategic game over hexagons, with easy rules, but is challenging to play with coordination. Victory will belong to whoever has the capacity to win but also to lose with intelligence.

Contents:

Playing board in rigid thick cardboard and printed in metallic colours.
18 cylindrical pieces in rigid, coloured plastic.
Rule booklet in 4 languages with examples.


Not to be confused with Reiner Knizia's Ra (1999).

name: Chez Cthulhu: Cthulhu Mask Promo Card
description:
This promo card is available in multiple ways including, during Steve Jackson Games demo sessions, product orders, and some store locations.

Text:
You may either gain 2 Madness, or give 1 point of your own Madness to someone else, when you acquire the Cthulhu Mask.

"Guess who!"

name: Warage: Starter Set
description:
You are a solitary hero fighting to survive in a world once afflicted by ancient wars between Orcs, Elves, Humans and Angels and other Races (included in the expansions Cripta, Covo, Alchimista).

It does not matter if you are a Mage, a Paladin or a Warrior (or another Class contained in Cripta, Covo, Alchimista expansions); all you have to do is to get the most powerful equipment you can find, such as handcrafted swords and shields, spells or what remains of the fire guns and hi-tech weapons produced by a now-gone civilisation.

Defend yourself and defeat your opponents. Are you ready to fight?

Warage is the ultimate turn-based strategic card game: role play, strategy and deck building merged all together for endless adventures.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: The Game of Fuzzy Logic
description:
The Game of Fuzzy Logic. The game where the best clues are the ones that aren't too good. Are you clever enough to give clarity to your teammates while simultaneously confusing your rivals?

In Fuzzy Logic, two teams take on pairs of mystery words, going head-to-head to see which team can correctly guess its word first. Here’s the twist: Each pair of words is in some way related, so really good clues are ones that help your team while at the same time hindering your opponents!

The first team to win 9 points wins the game.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Push Your Luck, Targeted Clues, Team-Based Game

name: Co-op Train Game
description:
A cooperative print-and-play children's game where one to four players work together to try to complete as many deliveries as possible before nightfall.

The board depicts 16 stations connected by rail lines. On the delivery stations (beige), one of each of the eight destination tiles are placed randomly, face up. On each of the pick-up stations (green), two passenger/freight tiles are placed randomly, face down. Players roll a die to move (and sometimes advance the sun along its path in the sky). As trains arrive at a pick-up station, players reveal the goods/passengers. Sometimes, the player will load them onto their cars (limited number of cars on each train). Sometimes, they will leave them for other players to pick up. A player can even take a passenger part-way and leave them for another train to complete the job later.

The idea is to work together to see how many jobs will be completed before the game ends.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rays of Light
description:
In Rays of Light, each player sets up colored chips and chips representing mirrors on their grid, which is hidden from their opponent, much like in Battleship. The object is to guess what your opponent's grid looks like, by shooting imaginary light rays into the grid. Your opponent will tell you where on the grid the light exited, and what color it was. Using this information, you try to recreate your opponent's grid before he does the same.

Rays of Light could be described as a combination of Battleship and Black Box.

name: Guderian's Last Gamble
description:
Last Gamble covers the last German offensive of the war, Operation Solstice, Feb. 1945 by the 11thSS Pz army with 300 AFVs. The attack lasted 4 days and succeeded in penetrating the Russian lines near Arnswalde. Stalin was so shocked by this attack, he diverted huge resources to counter it. The objective was to advance towards Landsberg on the Warthe, by way of Arnswalde and Berlinchen, forcing the Russians to withdraw from the Oder. Each hex represents 1.5 miles, each turn is 12 hours. German units are either battalion or regimental size, while Russian units are all regiments.

Many what if options are included, including the arrival of the 2SS Pz Corps!

The first edition of the game comes with one 10"x16" map and 127 counters. The second edition comes with one 11"x17" map and 250 counters.

name: Havok Skirmish Battle Set
description:
The Havok Skirmish Battle Set was a starter set for the short-run miniature war game Havok produced by Bluebird Toys in 1997. As well as this base set additional units & even vehicles were also available in non-random booster packs.

The Havok Miniatures Game was intended to fill a gap in the market by posing as a cheap alternative to Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition). Unfortunately bad marketing and Bluebird Toys' financial shut-down cost the game dearly, and the line (along with the Bluebird Toys company) folded by Christmas 1997.

Initially sold exclusively through Argos stores, all the unit boosters had a single item code meaning customers could not purchase the specific unit boosters they desired (Argos would pick from the boosters 'at random'). At the end of the line remaining Havok boosters were sold in bulk to toy suppliers where they proved surprisingly popular, but it was already too late for the game and many new fans didn't initially realise that the game was already discontinued.

The game itself can be compared to a lighter, more simplistic version of Warhammer 40,000. Two or more players pick forces from three possible factions of the Havok sci-fi universe using a point system, and then battle it out across the tabletop.

In the game's favour the models were made of from durable plastic, pre-painted and simply slotted into their bases which were decorated with simple stickers, meaning there was no modelling or painting required.

The Havok Skirmish Battle Set included everything you needed to play, including a small fixed selection of miniatures, custom dice, range rulers and instructions, as well as four pieces of slot together scenery.

name: Venga-Venga!
description: "Oh no, the vet is due a visit! We'd better run away." The cow, horse, dog, and other animals need their check-up to make sure they get through winter safely.
