The only way to stay on the shore is to throw off the rest of the cliff. During the game, players try to mislead each other - because everyone knows only his character. Because of this, a real bacchanalia begins on the shore.

name: Attack on Monster
description:
People are one team and try try to escape from the monsters.
The players gain victory points in two ways:
1.Kill the monster together and get the point.
2.Every one have 3 life. The first player to die gets one point, the second player gets two points, and so on.

For example:
A monster with 6 strength. And the team have 7 players.
If more than 5 people stay and fight, they will win the battle and gain points. Someone who leaves the fight will not gain points.

However, if more than one person sneaks out, others will die in the battle and the cowards will gain higher score.

So, in this game. If you think the team can kill the monster, try to ask everyone to stay and fight together. If you think you can't win, just cheat your partner to stay and escape from the battle.
publishers: Good Game Studio, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Discovery: The Evolution Game – Prehistory
description:
Discovery is a brand new educational and collaborative game, for adults and children from 6 years old, based on the evolution of mankind during prehistory and antiquity. Each card represents a major discovery, innovation or breakthrough in our history. Most discoveries are based on earlier discoveries, called prerequisites, and open the way to new discoveries.

The goal of the game is to earn the most points, by making discoveries and starting new eras. All the discoveries cards are placed in the common discovery tree, which is constructed together by all the players and organized by eras. A discovery card can be placed in the discovery tree only if all its prerequisites are already there, or if it has no prerequisite.

Discovery is a flexible and evolving game universe which allows you, with a single deck of cards to play different types of games. Discovery can be played as a solitary game or with up to 9 players, between humans only or with automatons (virtual players), in teams or individually, with simple fast 5-mins games or complex longer ones (>1hr). Adults and children, beginners and experts, all can play together by adjusting the game difficulty and relative player strength.

In Discovery Simple, each player receives 5 cards and plays in turn. During your turn you can place one or more cards from your hand. If you don't, you must discard one card. You can also liberate cards from other players’ discards (but not from your own). The game ends when a player places his last cards. The winner is the player who has earn most points. Points are earn by placing or liberating cards, inaugurating new eras.

In Discovery Flash, all players select the cards they want to play at the same time, and then place them in turn. This creates a strong element of risk and suspense, as your outcome will depend on the selection made by the other players.

Discovery Battle is a more complex game in which each card has specific attributes which allow you to attack your opponents, capture loot, make alliances, etc.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Civilization, Educational, Memory, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Treasure Hunt
description:
An interesting word game where alphabet tiles are placed in a pile in the center of the table. "Pieces of Eight" (cardboard coins) are distributed equally among all players. Five cards are dealt to each player, on the cards are a 'something' When the dealer says "Dig!" all players turn up their top card and begin digging through the letters in the pile to spell a word descriptive of their card. The winner is the person who spells a word for all five cards.

Scoring is simply paying the winner a "piece of eight" for each uncompleted card in your hand. Each person must also pay one "piece of eight" per letter that his longest word is shorter than the winner's longest word. If the winner misspells a word, or has not actually completed all 5 cards he must pay all other players 2 "pieces of eight."

Variants include setting a minimum number of letters for words or only allowing a word to be used once for any card during the game.

First published in January 1940, it must have been a hit. The second edition followed in March, 1940. By February 1942 they were on the 30th edition!
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Winning: The Bicycle Race Game
description: Winning: The Bicycle Racing Game challenges up to six players to compete against one another to finish a three-stage race in the least total time. At the start, all cyclist have the same chances of winning the race. Victory will be decided by how well a player plans and performs his or her own race strategy, using energy and stamina carefully to overcome both the other cyclist and the rigors of the race course itself - just as though you were competing in an actual bicycle race.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Vanity Chase
description:
Players are on a road trip through California. To advance up the board, players must decipher vanity license plates. The plates are in three different difficulty levels. First level is to figure out what the plate is supposed to say; HELOAGN = Hello Again. Second level adds a second element by asking for more information that the plate could be indicating; Sports plate GONFSHN = "Gone Fishin'" and is a fisherman, Hobby / Occupation plate ICLICK = "I Click" and is a photographer. Third level is used for the final challenge to win, and is the same as the second level but doesn't give the category. The player must decipher the plate, figure out the category and how the plate applies to that category. For more excitement the board has hazard squares to slow you down on your trip.
This is a great game, and with 575 different plates, it provides hours of fun for any group.
categories: Deduction, Humor, Puzzle, Racing, Word Game
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Invasion of Togoland 1914
description:
"Togoland 1914" is a wargame covering the Anglo-French campaign to capture the radio station in German-controlled Togoland at the outbreak of World War I.

The pressure on the Germans is to set up a defense that will prevent the Allies from taking the radio station in the alloted time - they also need to defend their supply dump, as once they lose it they cannot raise new units or attack anymore. The Allies need to take ground, but they must be careful not to spook the Germans into blowing the radio station before they can capture it.

Units stacked with a leader are deployed on a hidden unit display and a traditional odds ratio CRT is used. As the units present in this campaign are inexperienced, casualties are quite heavy in combat, with one side generally being wiped out. An attack can be modified for the presence of entrenchments, machine guns or artillery, all of which played a role in the battle, and a successful attacker can see his units advance and attack again in the same period.

Each hex is 15 miles, each game turn is two to three days (there are nine turns in total) and each unit is a platoon, company, combat group, artillery section or machine gun section.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: La Campagne de Russie
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #21

A strategic game on Napoleon's 1812 Russian campaign.

name: Horus
description:
Horus, by publisher Theta, is a game for up to four people who take the roles of Egyptian priests from different temples. After the Pharaoh's death they compete against each other in equipping the Pharaoh's death barque with both necessary and valuable offerings to prepare him for his life in the realm of the dead.
In order to do this, the players need to trade, buy, sell, negotiate and sometimes even fight to obtain the best and most valuable offerings to put in their part of the barque. Horus thus combines elements of strategy, chance and luck.

The game is composed of a the three-dimensional board, an obelisk, 40 playing pieces and gemstones. Except for the gemstones and a thin metal ring, the game components are made completely from THETA-Stone, a new substance developed by Theta. It is composed of organic and mineral materials which simulate stone, but can be lighter than stone, and it can be produced in any form.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Trading

name: Flip to Win Hangman
description: Classic word game with a twist! Think of a word and try to stump your opponent. Includes one game board with erasable whiteboard, self-storing dry-erase marker and eraser. No loose pieces.

name: Second Story
description:
Any housebreaker can fill a sack with monogrammed silverware, but a spoon only shows a robber's skill when it's next to something else - maybe a gold broach, a china cup, or a set of false teeth. The real professional pilfers with variety.

Players are house thieves in Jacynth, trying to prove their skill as mighty yeggs. Each turn of the game is one night of burgling. As a player fill up their bags with loot, they always have the option of going to one more house. If detected, though, a player must drop their bag and flee - which means losing anything they had collected that night.

This game uses the basic Decktet, two ten-sided dice, and a set of Decktet suit chips.

name: Starvation Island
description:
Starvation Island is a re-implementation of The Decisive Battle Guadalcanal which appeared in Japanese Hobby Magazine Game Journal back in 2001. This time around it's a magazine game. One of the major changes from the Japanese edition is that instead of a hex based map, you now have an area based map, and the rules are in English as opposed to Japanese.

A game on the Guadalcanal battles in Operations Special Magazine #3 by Multi-Man Publishing.

(as per information in MMP company folder on Consimworld)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Irondale: The City Complete
description:
Irondale: The City Complete is the second, and final, expansion for Small Box Games' Irondale.

The City Complete offers 36 new cards, including 11 new buildings, with new building types: Rubble, Gardens, and dual building types.

The highlight of the expansion is a classic rigid Small Box Games' small box with enough room to house the base game and the two expansion, sleeved.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: Cadaver City
description:
An Offal Game for 1 or 2 players

Pity the poor people of Cadaver City. Long ago they filled up all their cemeteries with their loved (and not so loved) ones. Now they’ve run out of room so they have taken to dumping the bodies down the sewer (out of sight out of mind). You, enterprising 3rd Class Sewer Engineers (Plungers), see a chance to make some fast money and solve the corpse clog threatening to overwhelm the existing system. At a quiet back door behind the Treatment Plant a line of customers queue up for the bits and pieces you have on offer. Deliver them the right parts, aged to the right amount of time and you’ll receive your reward.

Needed to play: The deck of 27 cards
10 eurocubes in each of 4 colors for the body parts (white for Bones, brown for Organs, gray for Brains and red for Hearts) and 9 black eurocubes for the rats
1 eurocube marker in each of 2 other colors to keep track of player scores on the Gore Track
1 large bag [or an old sock] (the Bag O’ Parts) to hold all the body parts, 10 small ziplock bags to act as body bags in the game and 1 four-sided die

Setup: Place the 4 Sewer Pipe cards, Gore Track, and the score markers between the Plungers (players).
Shuffle the customer deck and deal 2 customers to each Plunger, placing the rest in a face down draw pile known as “The Queue”, next to the Sewer Pipe. Each plunger should place their customers face up in front of them.
Shuffle the tool deck and deal 3 tools to each Plunger that they will use as their initial hand of cards. The remaining tool cards will be placed in a tool card draw deck next to The Queue.
Place the body bags within reach of both Plungers. Each Plunger should take 1 body bag for each customer they have during the game. Lastly place all the body parts and rats in the Bag O’ Parts.

Phase 1: Adding new body parts
Roll 1d4 and add that value to the number of waiting customers in front of them. The Plunger will then blind draw that number of body parts from the Bag O’ Parts. Shift all existing body parts towards The Clog to make room for the incoming body parts. Rats will never move. Set aside any body parts that are shifted off of the Day 3 card into a reserve pile. Place the new body parts in the order they are drawn on the Sewer Pipe cards beginning from the rightmost space on the Day 1 card. If any rats are drawn they will be placed on the Rat spaces beginning from the far left of the Day 3 card. Any body part occupying a Rat space where a Rat will be placed, during this phase, will be removed and tossed back into the Bag O’ Parts.

Roll 1d4 and place that many reserved Day 3 parts on The Clog card spaces, tossing the rest back in the Bag O’ Parts.

Phase 2: Filling orders
Each customer card lists the number of parts required to fill the order.

To fill an order a Plunger must choose all of any of 1 type of body parts on any one Sewer card (meeting the desired aging requirement) placing those parts in the customer’s body bag. Any extra body parts not needed for the orders go back in the Bag O’ Parts. Plungers may use the body parts to attempt to fill 1, 2 or more customer orders as long as the body parts are of the desired type and aging. If a customer’s complete order is filled the Plunger scores the money value, indicated in the lower right corner of the customer card, on the Gore Track. All body parts from this order are then tossed back in the Bag O’ Parts. A new customer is then drawn from The Queue.

Tool Cards: Each Plunger may use one of their tool cards at any point during their turn. Once played, the card will be placed on a discard pile next to the tool card draw pile and a new card is drawn.

Game End: The game ends in one of two ways:
a. The Clog card has become full of body parts. In this case, the current Plunger finishes their turn and any final scoring is marked.
b. All 10 customers have had their orders filled.

The Plunger who has earned the most money is declared the winner and receives a promotion to 2nd Class Sewer Engineer.

This game can be played solo as well. See the rules for modifications to the game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Castello
description:
There are 30 game-pieces for each player and 11 castles. The gameboard is divided into three sections: homes and center section.

Object of the game is to capture four castles (among those of the central section and the other side) or 28 pawns of Your opponent.

In his turn player moves one of his pieces, horizontally, vertically or diagonally. In his first move, a pawn can move two squares after that only one square. Additionally a pawn can jump over another pawn as long as the square behind that pawn is free.
Multiple jumps are allowed and all enemy pawns are captured this way and removed from the deck. A pawn can capture a maximum of five enemy pieces, and his movement ends after the fifth piece is captured.

A castle is conquered when it is surrounded by three of Your pawns. This castle is then removed from the grid and is held near the box.

name: Objectif Varsovie 1944
description:
Objectif Varsovie 1944 (Target Warsaw 1944) covers the second part of the soviet offensive against the Heeresgruppe Mitte. The victorious red army runs towards oriental Prussia and the polish capital city.
It expands the first game, Bagration 1944, which covered the 2 first weeks of battle and the capture of Minsk. The 2 games can either be played separately or linked as a campaign game.

Objectif Varsovie 1944 is a 2-player game, one representing the commander of German forces and the other the commander of Soviet forces. It is played on a map covering the operation theater. It is divided into hexagons representing 20 km. It uses die-cut counters representing military units that participated in this campaign: German divisions and Russian army corps. A full game lasts 15 turns, each representing two days of real time.

Ziplock game with:
- one A2-size map
- 192 die-cut counters
- 16 pages full color rules (both French and English)
- A quick reference aid
- A german display for operation points
- A soviet display for operation points

name: Scripts and Scribes: The Dice Game – Mini Expansion
description:
This mini expansion adds two main elements to the base game:

It adds a new "Power Die" that's rolled along with the standard dice. The "Power Die" can be chosen instead of one the other dice and it grants its own unique benefits.

It also adds an auction card and some cubes that are used to track an altered form of the "Auctions for Gold" from the base game.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Die verrückte Vogelscheuche
description: Together with the Magic Raven Schnabelgrün, the children collect leftover grain seeds from the bales of straw for the sparrows. Who remembers best, in which bales the most seeds are? And who lets Scarecrow Otto chase herself/himself to the right bale in the tactically higher version - and uses her/his Magic Stars in the best way?

name: Phantom Detectives
description:
The Tokyo of the Taisho era.
Player is one of the four private detectives,
Among the suspects repeatedly investigating each other, gathered in a creepy mansion Is the reason unidentified members of a bizarre killer skull King and each detective game.

Unplug one suspect cards from the skull King card. Player dealt evenly the remaining 12 pieces, you can check each player only.

Using action card with special abilities as a working method, the Suspect location, gender, initials, and members will ask players.
Shadow man to disguise other suspects during the suspect card one, the confused investigators. Use private detective sheet, locating the suspect card each while organizing information!

However, the investigation and will continue over time little by little in the game.
Slowly ticking clock towers were placed on the game board, Saw a cruel was approaching towards's daughter is kidnapped!

Within the time limit, the player can be declared "uncovering the truth"?

In that the identity of each given point.
Add jewel points have on strategy, and bonus points.
Players totaling the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Villages: Power Dice
description:
Power Dice are an optional component of Villages that adds a bit more luck and drama to each battle. Each time two units face off on the battlefield, each participating player rolls one of these dice and adds the value to their unit's power.

Each set of dice also comes with a bonus Gambler card whose ability is based on a roll of the dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Diet & Friends
description:
The city is full of fine foods. You love to go out with your friends, wandering around and eating tasty things. But you might have overdone it a bit. You're all feeling a bit plump lately. One of you speaks up: "Let's all dieting contest! Whoever loses the most weight wins!"

And so it begins. A pleasant game of watching what you eat while you stroll the streets and dine together. If you feel an item has too many calories, pass it off on a friend. Try to be the first to reach your goal.

The players collect food cards, trying to keep the cards lowest in fat while passing off the unhealthy cards to their friends. Whoever empties their hands first scores zero, while the other players count the amount of weight gained in their remaining cards. After everyone has been start player once, whoever has gained the least weight wins.
publishers: Adventure Planning Service (冒険企画局 / Bouken)

name: Poland (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city:others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some famous names intervene to add interest.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though the famous names can help with these.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Paper Sumo
description:
From the publisher:

Ready, set, sumo! Japan's centuries-old national sport is the main attraction in this paper-based smackdown where creativity and competition collide. The result? Laughs guaranteed! There is an impressive assortment of 39 characters—from traditional sumo wrestlers to animals to monsters and other eye-catching creatures from Japanese lore. Additional characters can be created by drawing on customizable shapes. Then battle it out against an opponent's character on the sumo doyho ring. With each player tapping on his or her side of the doyho, the stakes are high until one of the characters falls and the other wins!

name: Black Stories: Mörderische Bescherung
description: Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult

name: Going Around the City
description:
You are traveling around the city by using transportation cards to visiting a variety of attractions. The earlier you can get to an attraction, the more victory points you can get. But be carful not going too far in case you don't have the correct transportation card to get you back on the route!

Going Around the City is a play-card-and-move game that challenges young gamers to carefully plan their movement based on their hand cards and the route they want to travel. The game ends when someone has placed all six of their player tokens on the board and the player with the most points wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Yes! Broccoli!
description:
In the Yes! Broccoli! card game, players bid to collect the healthiest foods while avoiding unhealthy ones. The more nutritious the food on the card, the more points the card is worth. However, junk food cards cause players stuck with them to lose points. At the end of eight rounds, the player with the most points wins.

With quick gameplay and fun art, Yes! Broccoli! encourages kids to make healthier food choices. Strawberry pirates and broccoli tennis players are the way to go. Kids may love candy, but the candy T-Rex won't help them much...

name: Cult Following: Not Safe For Worship
description:
Cult Following: Not Safe For Worship is an expansion for Cult Following: The One True Game. This expansion includes 58 question cards and 17 sign cards that work well with adult themed cults. Mix these cards in with the base game, or keep them separate to allow players the choice of regular or NSFW cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Dragons Arena
description:
Dragons Arena is a two-player strategy and confrontation game using dice. However, it is accessible from 8 years old thanks to its clever implementation and the simplicity of its rules... But do not be fooled by this apparent simplicity, because the most experienced players are still likely to rack their brains and will take a lot of fun!

An abstract game with dice, for two players ! Strategic, smart, original and accessible from 8 years in the world of dragons...
—description from the publisher

The two opponents play in turn.
In turn, the attacking species must eliminate an enemy dragon with one of its adjacent dragons. It is also necessary that the dragon powers allow it. In most cases, a dragon can eliminate an enemy dragon if the latter has a strictly lower value.
Special case: a dragon with a power of ￼1 is the only one who can eliminate dragons with a power of 6 !
The dragon used then takes the PLACE AND POWER of the dragon it has just eliminated.

If a species cannot eliminate any enemy dragon but has at least one dragon adjacent to an enemy dragon, it must, instead of eliminating a dragon, modify the power of the dragon of its choice (of its species or of its opponent).
Once the dragon’s power has been modified, it places a force field (symbolized by the «square frame») around the dragon concerned, on the square. It is impossible to change the power of a dragon surrounded by a force field. This force field disappears if the dragon changes boxes to eliminate an enemy
dragon or if it is eliminated itself.

The turn is completed at the end of one of these two actions (Eliminate an enemy dragon or Modify the power of a dragon of your choice).

The duel ends if there is no dragon left adjacent to an enemy dragon after a game turn OR if all remaining dragons are surrounded by a force field and the attacking species cannot eliminate an enemy dragon. The duel then ends immediately.
We then add up the power of the dragons left for each species. The most powerful one wins the duel!

—user summary

name: Naruto: Ninja Arena – Genin Pack Expansion
description:
The Chûnin exams are in full swing! With the expansion of Naruto Ninja Arena, you can now have a greater choice of characters and play with up to 6 players! This is a great opportunity for Rock Lee, Tenten, Hinata, Kiba, Temari and Gaara to join Naruto, Sasuke, Sakura and Shikamaru to spar in frenzied bouts and practice mastery of their TECHNIQUES and special POWERS.

The young Ninjas will use their skills to the best of their ability and try to bring down their rivals by inflicting DAMAGE that will add up to WOUNDS, KNOCKOUTS or even worse, final elimination. The last Ninja standing wins!

Naruto Ninja Arena is the first game using the Roll & Clash system. During the game, you throw your dice as quickly as you can and use the results to activate Techniques without stopping the game. Everyone plays at the same time in a frantic battle to be the last Ninja Standing!

The game ends when all players are K.O. or eliminated except one. The last player standing wins the game!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Chaining, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Chamuyo: A full!
description: Chamuyo is a storytelling game in which you have to convince the judge by looking for your best arguments defending an association of letters. You are going to have to use your best chamuyo (chatter), so that the judge gives the points to you. If you don't win for best chamuyo, maybe you will earn points for rowing it!
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: Grab Your Breakfast
description:
Grab your Breakfast is a family light drafting game about grabbing the heartiest breakfast possible.

There will be a sumptuous spread on the table ... pancakes, cereal, bagels and cups of coffee. Start collecting what you would like for your breakfast.

But you'll need more than luck to win. Some food are worth more points than others so you have to plan what to collect. Reveal hidden food items as you play the game and get bonus points for special combinations of cards you collect. Be careful about penalty points if you don't let others collect the items you want!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Matching, Set Collection

name: Kotobaateru (コトバーテル)
description:
"Kotobaateru" is exactly what it sounds like. "Guess the word" with the cards! Use the "moji" to tell your friend. Tell your friends what to say!

But!

The cards are dealt randomly with 50 syllables! Draw and replace the cards. Tell your teammates quickly! If one team gets the answer right before the other team, they win!

You can communicate "words" using only 50 syllables.
It's surprisingly easy to read.
The dilemma of not getting the "moji" you want!
But the Japanese language's " ambiguity " makes this game so much fun.

—description from the designer

「コトバーテル」はその名の通り
「コトバを当てる」カードゲーム！
「モジ」を使って
お題の「コトバ」を味方に伝えよう！

！しかし！

「モジ」は50音がランダムに配られるぞ！
カードを引いたり入れ替えたりして
いち早く味方に伝えろ！！
他のチームより先に、双方が正解すれば勝利！
ーーーーー

50音だけで「コトバ」を伝える。
意外とすんなり読めたり、
欲しい「モジ」がこないジレンマ！
だけども、日本語の「あいまい」という部分が
このゲームを物凄く楽しいものとしています。

—description from the designer (Japanese)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: 7 Wonders: Companion App
description:
7 Wonders Companion is the official game aid for 7 Wonders.

It includes an exclusive wonder: Cupertino.

—user summary

This application will offer you unparalleled ease of play, with multiple options:


A new exclusive wonder: Play with Cupertino, created specially for the occasion!
Random drawing of wonders: For a quick game setup. You can also choose not to play with some wonders
Efficient Scoring Calculation: Total your points in an easy way with a system that's designed and optimized specifically for 7 Wonders
Keep track of your statistics: Record your games and look at the evolution of your scores over time
Quick access to the science scoring total and the building chain: Don't lose any more time, and be more precise in your forecasts during the game
Expansion Support: Also helps when playing with Leaders or Cities! You can even enable Teamplay!


—description from the publisher

name: Asteroid Dice
description:
The first of its kind - a squishy dice throwing and rolling strategy party game!


Asteroid Dice came about from a love of dice and dodgeball! A dicey combination? We don’t think so. Simply throw and collide your squishy foam dice to roll the highest score each round and win all the cards in the asteroid field. You must choose a dice from the middle of the table, but if you pick the same as someone else, then battle it out to see who gets that dice and who loses their card!


How to play: Place all the giant squishy dice in the center of the table and take your deck of cards. Secretly choose which dice card you want to play, and on the count of 3 reveal it to the other players. Grab the dice you chose and prepare to roll them! If anyone matches their cards, you brawl with the chosen dice.The last player hit will gain their opponent’s cards and the losers have to choose from the leftover dice. Now everyone rolls their dice in turn - starting with the D20 and down to the D6 with the highest number winning. But watch out for the special cards! Losteroid cards are blackholes that will suck all the cards away in the round and reduce your score if you end up with one in your score pile. Play your "I Can’t Diecide" card if you’re not sure which dice to choose or as part of your dice game strategy.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Sandokan
description:
Based on E.Salgari (Italian writer born in 1862) novels and TV series. Players as pirates move their ships to collect treasures by visiting isles or challenging other players. The player who reaches 20 points first is the winner.

Game components:
1 board
24 Oracle cards
52 Sandokan cards
6 Ships
A collection of treasures (ruby, emeralds, diamonds, pearls, gold and rum barrels)
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Circle the Wagons: Wildest West
description:
A Wildest West scoring condition card for Circle the Wagons, which was a twitter joke that made its way to a digital promo card, and later released physically.


Released in the April 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: American West, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Megachess
description:
Chess for three players. Also includes Megacheckers on the flip side of the board.

When the other two players have resigned or their king has been checkmated, the third player wins.

name: Small Market
description:
A stock-holding micro game.

At start, all players will get the same amount of "price" card and "Merchandise" card, all cards present 5 merchandises in a combination of 2 kinds.

Players trade their hand cards until someone runs out his hand cards. Players multiplies the merchandises on their hand cards and traded cards by the merchandises on "ALL" price cards, who got most points wins!

name: At Neuve Chapelle
description:
At Neuve Chapelle provides a tactical re-play of the World War I battle. The British attempted to reduce a poorly-defended German salient centered on the town of Neuve Chapelle. Plans were to expand a breakthrough and with cavalry and infantry reserves take the Aubers ridge line. However, poor communication and coordination and the weather conspired to slow the initial British successes and allowed the German army to rush reinforcements into the area. Among other game features, designer Michael W. Kennedy uses offensive artillery and defensive artillery fire, British command checks, and a unique assault combat mechanic to simulate the bloody struggle. (Sourced from the White Dog Games website.)

The game is played over a series of 14 turns which represent the three days of The Battle of Neuve Chapelle. Each day is divided into four turns with a separate night turn in between. During the day turns, both sides will fire artillery (weather permitting), move, and attack. During the night turns, both sides will dig in new trenches on the new front lines.

The game simulates early trench warfare and makes prominent use of artillery and the defensive advantages of trenches. Weather conditions and British communications among the four divisions are determined randomly each turn. Each assault phase contains a defensive artillery and defensive combat phase, making defense a major component of the game.

There are several hexes that have victory point values. The British win by controlling as many of these hexes as possible. The Germans win by preventing the British from achieving this objectives.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Triovision Master
description:
Triovision Master challenges players to move quickly and create certain combinations of shapes.

To start, the nine tokens – three cubes, three cylinders and three pawns, with red, blue and yellow versions of each – are placed randomly on the playing area: a field of 17 squares in a rough cross. Ten cards are revealed from the deck, with each card showing a pattern of colors and shapes in a particular arrangement. The backside of the card on top of the deck shows one of the nine tokens.

Everyone plays simultaneously. Players attempt to form one of the patterns shown on the cards by moving the specific piece indicated on the card back to any empty space on the game board. If the player does this correctly, she claims the card; if not, she's out for the round. Once someone claims a card, the top card of the deck is flipped, revealing a new pattern and the piece that now must be moved.

The first player to collect twelve cards wins.

Reimplements


Triovision

name: Windmill: Cute Secrets
description:
Windmill: Cute Secrets is a standalone expansion for Windmill: Cozy Stories and is fully compatible with Windmill: Cozy Stories. You can freely combine cards from both games to make your sessions easier or more difficult, or just more fun to play!

Windmill: Cute Secrets is a standalone expansion for the storytelling game Windmill: Cozy Stories. In Windmill: Cute Secrets, players are weaving short stories based on the hidden picture cards they draw.

While one player tells a story, the other players attempt to guess the visible card that matches the story. The more opponents guess the card incorrectly, the more points the storyteller receives when a player finally guesses the right card. However, if all players fail to guess the picture, the storyteller loses a point instead, so the tale mustn't be too mysterious.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Minions: Darkness & Myth
description:
(from publisher's website:)
How does a Minor Deity get more glory than the Minor Deity living next door? By sending Minions into battle of course!

The funny folks at Cloud Kingdom games bring you a fantasy card game where each player becomes a Minor Deity. The object of the game is to get the most Glory. The trouble is that, ever since that “Atlantis Incident,” deities are no longer allowed to directly affect the material world. The only way to get the glory is to send your adoring Minions out to do battle in your stead.

Each player controls eight amusing minions who are sent out to strive against the minions of your opponents. The battleground is defined and, based on your minions’ attributes, you choose the best “ahem” man for the job. You can then grant your minion a Boon to help him succeed. At this point a combination of daring and luck may bring you the glory. Dice are rolled. Points are tallied. Only one Minion will emerge to shower glory on their master. Will it be you?

This game contains all the cards and components for a two player game and takes about 20 minutes to play, ages 10 and up.

name: Pew Pew!
description:
Pew! Pew! is a solitaire (i.e. 1 player) game designed to emulate the feel of old school space shooters.

You are the last and best hope for survival against a horde of Advanced Alien starships on their way to lay waste to your homeworld! But are you enough?

The game is played in turns. Each turn is broken up as follows:
Sequence of Play
1) Spawn New Ships
2) Player Actions
1 AP - Fire a Pew!
2 AP - Move Orthogonally
3 AP - Move Diagonally
+1 AP - Drop a Mine while moving
ALL AP - Spawn a Heart
3) Alien Ships Move
4) Spawn Missiles
5) Move Pews!
6) Move Missiles
7) Move Player Ship Forward
publishers: (Web published), Nathan Hansen Games, Victory Point Games

name: Floß geht's!
description: Players race their rafts along a variable game board. First one to reach the river mouth wins. Players advance their rafts by matching the symbol on their die to the next one on the river tiles. On a player's turn, he may roll his own die or someone else's. He then advances his own raft down the river. Anchors (don't move) and suns (wild) add more chaos to the mix. For players age 4 and above.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tamamooool: Defend the Eggs
description:
[STORY]
"Please defend the eggs!!"
Here is in another planet and somewhere in the continent.
A pair of dinosaur breed their eggs.
But evil birds named "fukouno-tori (unlucky-bird)" look down their eggs. These bird steel eggs and hide them.
And good birds named "kouno-tori (lucky-bird)" that are gentle bring back their hidden eggs.
It seems there is also another tribe that is a turf war around here.
Will they be able to defend successfully eggs?



[GAME CONTENT]
Tamamooool: Defend the Eggs is a 2 vs 2 partnership game.
Players have 4 cards in their hand and each turn a player plays a card from their hand.
Cards have two colors, one color for "fukouno-tori" (black) and another color for "kouno-tori" (white).
When a card is played, birds of the corresponding color move.
At the beginning of the player's turn, if any bird is in front of them, then their life (egg)( will increase or decrease.
The "fukouno-tori" (black birds) decrease their life, and "kouno-tori" (white birds) increase their life.There are 19 different birds, and players choose which birds to play while setting up the game.
There are many different combinations to choose from, and this drastically changes how the game is played!
You can choose easy set of birds for "beginners" players and more difficult (challenging) sets for "advanced" players.

name: Horde
description:
“All the clans are gathered. But confusion reigns in the ranks. Can you organize the horde so that it obeys you, and only you?“
Each clan is identified by the color of its favorite gem. Players lay out cards representing goblins to form battle lines, consisting of rows of twelve cards. Their objective is to align cards of their own color and have a majority of them in as many battle lines as possible, in order to obtain victory points. Each player depends on the hand he Is felt. Fortunately, even it's not their glow, each card in their hands has a unique power that can counter-balance fate and alter the game.
—description from the publisher

name: Vampires Vs. Unicorns
description:
It’s time to CHOOSE YOUR SIDE!

Will you lead the fierce blood snob VAMPIRES or perhaps throw down with a herd of obnoxious UNICORNS?

VAMPIRES vs. UNICORNS: Floor War is a hillariously fun THROWING CARD game with unexpected results, featuring fantastic hand painted tile art by TRAVIS LAMPE and TRAVIS LOUIE suitable for frameing!

Draw from your deck of cards to RAISE THE DEAD, cause a UNICORN STAMPEDE, and more! It’s up to you to find the best throwing technique to destroy your opponent’s FLOOR TILES, but, like, BEWARE! As not all tiles are the same!

It’s HORN vs. TOOTH, HOOF vs. CLAW!

Game designed by JIM DUBOIS and ATTABOY, based on an original concept by JIM DUBOIS.

It's a game that is durable, playable, then frameable.

—description from the publisher

name: Xenophon – March of the Ten Thousand 401 - 400 BC
description:
A variant for Alexandros, the featured game from Command magazine Issue 10 on Alexander the Great's conquest.

This variant appeared in Command magazine Issue 14 and is based on Xenophon's Anabasis, which is the story of 10,000 Greek mercenaries who joined a revolt against the King of Persia in 401 B.C.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Knatsch: Die kleinen Sonderkarten
description:
This is an expansion for Knights/Knatsch. 10 extra cards. These cards are smaller than the others. Limited print run of 1500 copies.

The normal rules of the game apply, with the following additions. Each of the small cards in this expansion has a special advantage, which the owner can use once when it is his turn. A player may win only one small special card on his turn. If successful, he may continue to roll, but may not win another of the small special cards.

The 'Guard for special cards' can protect all the small special cards. The special catalog expansion cards can also be combined with this expansion.

name: The Gauntlet
description:
The Gauntlet covers the battle of Chongchon, Korea 1950, where the Chinese Communists nearly overran the UN Eighth Army. The game includes armor, infiltration tactics, and an air system. Options for reinforcing the UN and marching on the Yalu.

4 km/hex; 1 day/turn; units are Brigades, Regiments and Battalions.

name: Pig Wars: When Men Were Men and Pigs Were Money
description:
Pig Wars is a skirmish-level miniatures wargame set in the Dark Ages: after the Fall of Rome, before the Norman conquest of England. Each figure represents one person.

Each player controls one "unit" of 20 figures and is given one 52-card deck of ordinary playing cards, which are used instead of dice in this game. Each unit has one chit (or 3x5 card) used to determine activation randomly in a given turn.

Units are distinguished by a bar of color on the base: since ten players can be playing at once, and there are no uniforms in that era, this is important. A number of stripes (from 0 to 3) on the color bar shows the morale level of the figure, from militia to average to proven veteran to elite veteran (leader). This is important both in melee combat and morale checks.

Pigs are a frequent goal of a given scenario, hence the name of the game. In fact, different units are given different objectives in a raid scenario, though things don't always work out the way one intends ... it can get a bit chaotic.

Cards are used to determine all random events: missile fire, combat, rallying, morale checks, etc. The system is very easy to understand and there is very little in terms of a player aid needed. The only downside to the card method is that a player goes through his entire deck before reshuffling, and if he notices all the good cards have been used early, it may change his tactics half way through the game as he becomes more conservative ...

Overall, a good light system, more for "fun" gaming than serious gaming.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Measurement Movement
publishers: (Self-Published), Black Falcon Games, Tod Kershner's Games

name: とりてこ (Torite Co)
description:
Torite Co (Trick Taking by Coffee Ritokon Blend) is a must-follow team-based trick taking game where the goal is to brew as much coffee as possible because your wage depends on it!

The setting is a popular cafe, and the players divide into two teams to brew coffee. Brewing more coffee than the opposing team is the winning condition of this game.

In Torite Co, players will always be divided into two teams. If you play with 4 or more people, you may not know know who your teammate is (due to identity concealment).

Therefore, you can unintentionally help the opposing team, or there may also be situations where teammates drag each other down.

In addition to the identity concealment element, in the case of 4 and 5 players, it can be an irregular team structure (1 to 3 or 2 to 3). If it becomes one-on-three, it may be difficult to win on one side, but the sense of accomplishment when you win will be higher than when you win 2 vs 2…

—description from the publisher (translated)

The 3 main wrinkles of this game:

The secret teammate component is similar to Doppelkopf where the “part-time leader” calls out a specific card to indicate that the player with that card is now on their team (this player does not have to reveal who they are). The leader also chooses the Trump suit for the round.

Tricks can be worthless or count for multiple points, as only Coffee Cards (8-A) count for points.

2 is considered the highest number (still lower than A and T) when the trick is entirely comprised of the same suit.

name: Happy Turkey Day!
description:
The turkeys on the farm are feasting away, but they must be careful! When Thanksgiving comes around, those turkeys that have made the deepest impression on the farm owner make perfect candidates to appear on the Thanksgiving dinner table. Would you, as a turkey in this game, be able to pig out with all that yummy food, but without becoming a dish yourself?

Happy Turkey Day! is a simultaneous-move game with each player taking the role of a voracious turkey. In the beginning of each round, each player takes one of the Action tokens in his/her hands, and places it, face down, on the playing surface in front of him/her. Then, all players turn over their tokens simultaneously and take an action: either grabbing some Food from a Hen House (i.e. Eat), or exercising to trim down a bit
(i.e. Lose Weight).

Each player has two goals in this game: first, getting a balanced diet by obtaining a variety of different Food cards – the wider the variety and the more the Food cards a player gets, the better the score; at the same time, each player should try to avoid getting marked Chubby whenever the Farm Owner makes an inspection to identify candidates for his Thanksgiving turkey dinner. At each inspection, the chubbiest turkey (as indicated by the highest number of Food cards held) will be given Chubby Markers. When Thanksgiving comes around, the turkey with the most Chubby Markers will be sent to the dinner table!

At the end of Thanksgiving, the survival turkey with the highest score wins! How to collect as many Food cards as possible, while avoiding getting Chubby Markers, is the key to winning this game.

name: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies – Superheroes & Comics Expansion
description:
Contains over 70 new genre themed cards to add your favorite movies, actors, and directors to your Cinelinx game.

Includes blank Cinelinx cards to customize your deck even further!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sweet Holic
description:
The sweets of the world-renowned dessert contest are sweeter than sweet. The theme of this contest is the sweet French dessert — macaron! You have to compete with macaron pâtissiers from all over the world and make the macarons more deliciously than anyone else. If you careless, the cookie (the outer parts of the macaron) can burn. To make the perfect macaron cookies and filling, you must have a perfect blend! Will you be able to defeat your competitors and win competitions to become the best pastry chef in the world?

Sweet Holic is a macaron-making board game for 2 to 4 players. At the start of the game, each player receives five hand cards, then discards a card of their choice in front of them. During a round, players have to choose to change their cards with the topmost card of one of the open discard piles or play macaron ingredients in their hand to finish a macaron. In order to finish a macaron, a player needs to collect a pair of the same kind of cookies and one filling card. Same-colored macarons score extra points.

If a burned cookie is included in the finished macaron, it gives -1 point.

After finishing a macaron, players draw back up to four cards. Add all the macaron scores to find the winner! Each player can receive extra points depending on the character card they received at the start of the game.

name: Hot Pot Hustle!
description:
Tonight, the Immortals get together to feast on their favorite dish, hot pot. But, despite their shared love for hot pot, they don’t care for each other one bit!

In Hot Pot Hustle! Each player takes the role of a mythical creature from the traditional Chinese mythology, an Immortal, whose goal is to have the best and most delicious hot pot dinner whilst sabotaging the other Immortals their meal! Each Immortal character has a favorite type of food, as well as one they despise. Each player tries to eat as much as possible of their Immortal’s favorite food, while tricking the other players into eating food they despise and ruining their meal. A variety of tricks, traps and deceits are available to make the dinner go according to your wishes. Steal food from other players, switch up ingredients or outright threaten the other Immortals: everything is fair game in Hot Pot Hustle!

In Hot Pot Hustle! Players take turns flipping cards from a deck of cards called “The Pot.” Each card has a chili spiciness level assigned to it with a value between 0 and 6. Players must take care not to go over a chili level of 6, or they have to dispose of all the flipped cards. After this, the Immortal proceeds to eat the food cards and you place them in sets of different types of food. There are a total of 6 types of food (meat, fish, vegetables, tofu, mushrooms and noodles) and each food set has to be up of different food types up to a total of 4 cards per set.

Each player’s Immortal character has a favorite food type indicated on the character card: for this food type, you can place as many as you want in one food set, up to the 4 card set maximum. However, the character card also shows what food your Immortal hates: these food cards are thrashed and scored as minus points at the end of the game.

In addition to the food cards there are Trick & Trap cards that allow the player to alter the game in their favor and sabotage other players.

At the end of the game, players score points for each food set they have created, and they get minus points for food they disliked and put in the trash.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Pentagonia
description:
This is an update on Nine Men's Morris. The original game is played on a square board on which players take turns placing pieces. When a player places three pieces in a row, he may remove an opponent's piece of his choice. Once all pieces have been placed, players try to align three pieces by sliding them on the board. A player wins when his opponent is down to two pieces.

This version is played on a five-sided board. Once a player is down to five pieces, he can jump them from anywhere on the board to any open space. in order to align pieces or to block his opponent.

Pentagonia is a two-player, board game with a very chess-like attribute. Victory is completely dependent on your reasoning and pattern recognition skills, and completely independent of luck.

name: Good Ol' Charlie Brown Game
description: Be the first player to collect the most picture cards of their character while moving around the board.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Editrice Giochi, MB Jeux, Milton Bradley

name: PigzUp!
description:
How quick and precise are your fingers? Find out as you build piggy piles in this thrilling stacking game.
When two cards match, players race to construct a tower of piggies that is tops of the sty! Be careful! There are rules to how you can stack them. And your pile must stand up with the right number and color. Run out of cards and you are king of the pen.

Players will be on the edge of their seats and will take like pigs to mud as they shout "Pigzup!"
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Atlantis
description:
The sinking of Atlantis is said to have been over 11,000 years ago. Thousands of books published around the world rely on only one source: the account by the Greek philosopher Plato, who wrote of it around 350 BC.

On the island of Atlantis, there was the capital city of the same name in the center along with nine other cities. The island was divided among the ten sons of Poseidon and Clito.

Although the island thrived for hundreds of years, it eventually declined into tyranny and immorality. Eventually Zeus sank the island with earthquakes and floods in a single day.

To win the game, the players struggle for the crown of Atlantis. The winner is the player who succeeds in entering the temple of Poseidon in the very heart of Atlantis with his crown. He becomes the new king of all Atlantis. This attack must happen as quickly as possible before the island sinks.

name: Pharsalus: The Clash of Legions, August 9, 48 B.C
description:
Simulates the land battle between Caesar and Pompey during the Roman Civil War, 48 B.C. This is a tactical-level battle game. {Description and information from The Complete Book of Wargames, by the Editors of Consumer Guide, 1980}

480 counters
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Giseh!
description:
Intersting Connect Four 3D-variant with great looking material. Score as many rows with 4 marbles of your color as possible before the pyramid is completed. Simple rules, fast gameplay.

Obwohl es nur darum geht, während des gemächlichen Aufbaus der Pyramide möglichst viele Viererreihen mit der eigenen Farbe zu legen, ist es doch um so schwieriger, den Überblick über die Kugeln des Spielgegners zu behalten. Durch die vielfältigen Spielmöglichkeiten in der dritten Dimension wird man schneller ausgetrickst als man glauben will. Vorausschauendes Handeln und Konzentration sind gefragt. 204 Kugeln lang Spannung pur, bis die letzte Kugel gelegt ist - denn erst zum Schluss entscheidet sich, wer der wahre Giseh!-Meister ist.

Individuelles Design
Hier bleiben keine Wünsche offen! Wir bieten Ihnen nicht einfach nur ein Spiel an, sondern auch ein Designobjekt, das nicht nach jeder Spielrunde wieder in dem Karton verschwinden muss. Denn diese Spiele können sich sehen lassen! Durch ein erstklassiges Produktangebot stellen Sie Giseh! ganz individuell nach Ihren Wünschen zusammen.

Für drei oder vier Mitspieler können Sie ein Erweiterungsset bestellen.

name: Daruma Otoshi
description:
Daruma Otoshi is a Japanese cultural toy. The first part of the name "Daruma" is the name of the doll (usually the face of a angry-looking Japanese samurai-like guy, but also can be friendly looking, depends on the artist who draws the face),"Otoshi" means "to drop".

This traditional Japanese game requires a good eye and fast reflexes. The purpose of the game is to knock the center pieces out with the hammer without causing the doll on top to fall over. The doll on top is called daruma; he represents the Buddhist priest Bodhidharma who is said to have lost the use of his arms and legs after meditating for nine years. Today daruma are used as a charm for the fulfillment of a special wish, for example, passing the entrance exam to high school or winning an election. The character written on this darumas belly reads gfuku,h or good fortune. Japanese children can play with daruma otoshi when they are alone by seeing how many blocks they can knock out before daruma topples over. They may also play it with friends and take turns until someone causes daruma to fall over.

Usually made of solid wood.

name: Dash-in Dungeons
description:
Dash-in Dungeons uses custom-designed cards to provide a fast-play, rules-light, portable, fantasy adventure game which can be played in around an hour.

The players cooperate as a small team of wizards and warriors exploring a dungeon map comprised of cards representing 'rooms/areas' where they encounter monsters, traps and treasures.

As the team explores the dungeon, the 'Dealer' reveals the map by flipping-over each new dungeon room card and reading the description from the 'Adventure key'. The players then decide what they want their characters do according to the rules (printed on quick reference cards).

Actions attempted, and combat with monsters is resolved using a set of 'Task rules' and the 'Fate deck' - a weighted set of numbered cards used to generate random numbers determining success or failure.

As the characters defeat a dungeon's challenges, they gather treasure cards representing 'gold' (to spend at the market between adventures) or 'magical devices' which enhance their abilities.

A team of players who plays more than one adventure together select character cards of increasing power level equipping their characters for the challenges offered by subsequent 'higher-level' adventures.

Home Page: http://www.dashindungeons.com
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ringo
description:
Ringo is a two-player abstract strategy game said to be from Germany. It was likely invented sometime in the late 1800's or early 1900's. Pieces are captured similarly as in checkers, but no multiple jumps are allowed. Thought to be descended from the Tafl group (Fox & Geese, Tablut, Hnefatafl).

The game simulates a castle siege. Attackers are attempting to enter a castle (the center circle on the board) while defenders are trying to protect it and reduce the number of attackers. Since the attackers out number the defenders, the defenders have an advantage in movement.
publishers: (Public Domain), ABRA, Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), Gaudé Création, Geoludie, L. P. Septímio, LuduScience, MacGregor Historic Games, Sala, Spieleverlag Friedrich Kleißl, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Polar Base
description:
Polar Base is a storytelling game in which the players must find a way to explain how all the members of a polar base met their grisly death, based on the cards they are dealt. Each player is a screenwriter in charge of a different character. Together they narrate the screenplay for a film which unfurls the story in reverse chronological order (à la Memento), scene by scene. After all the players have told a scene each, voting occurs. Then a new round starts. The game ends with each player providing his own version for the final scene. The last round of voting will provide extra points for the best ending.

In the advanced variant, players can interfere with the narrating player by imposing some elements to him.

name: Loony Quest: Christmas Promo
description: This level is a bonus level released in 2015 during the holiday season on the Libellud web site. It is labeled as Promo Level 1.

name: The Bottled Imp Game
description:
The Bottled Imp Game is a card game for 2-6 players. The object of the game is to be the player holding the Bottled Imp Card at the end of the game's allotted 8 rounds.

Each player begins the game with 5 cards in their hand. One of the players (nobody else knows who) has the Bottled Imp card. The number of cards they are permitted to hold is denoted by their 'Life Dice', it begins at 5, but can go up or down from 2 to 7.

In each round players get a turn to lay any number of one type of card, then draw back up to their allotted hand size. The card types and their affects are:

Dagger = Reduce and opponents Life Dice
Pie and Ale = Increase your own life dice
Spyglass = Look at an opponent's hand
Lockpick = Blindly take one card from an opponent's hand
Wild/Coins = Wild card
Bottled Imp = Win the game

After each player has taken a turn the round is over. This happens 8 times, recorded on a D8, then the game is over. The player holding the Bottled Imp Card at this point is the winner.

Sounds simple, but in reality keeping track of where you think the Imp is and timing when to make a play for it provides some very interesting decisions and a tense atmosphere.

A good game for a party or warm up.

—description from the publisher

name: Tower of Mages
description:
As long as there has been magic, there have been Mages' Towers. Tall, dilapidated structures built in wild curves to tap into elemental energy. As the Solstice approaches, three Wizards break ground on what they're sure will be... Well, it will be a tower anyway.

Tower of Mages is a dice game for one player. Each of your three dice represents a scatterbrained wizard with a short attention span. Over the course of the game they will be working together to build a tower to gather elemental energies, convert them into valuable spells, and to predict and manipulate the spell market.

The game uses a sort-of-rondel mechanic. You roll your dice and choose which order to play them in. Each time you use a die, you count down the list of tower segments, starting at the last segment built.

There is also a market speculation aspect, all Elements begin at a value of -2. As the game progresses, you will roll dice to see how values grow and fall. To make the best of this, you can build high value rooms, destroy negatively valued rooms, cap towers to score them early, and gain rerolls to adjust the outcomes of the market.

All you need to play is the PDF, three standard dice and a pencil.


Released in the January 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
publishers: Button Shy, Metal Snail Idea Workshop

name: Runes & Regulations: Kickstarter Exclusive Card Pack
description:
1 Kickstarter Exclusive: Stunning Kitsune
1 Kickstarter Exclusive: Mischievous Kelpie
1 Kickstarter Exclusive: Phoenixi
2 customizable Regulation cards
2 customizable Spell cards
2 customizable Creature cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Diamantový les
description:
Diamond Forest is a children's play by a Czech author with elements of remembering and strategy. Players in the role of dwarves in the dark forest, trying to find four colored diamonds. The game board always shows only a few squares at the same time, and players gradually explore it. In the Diamond Forest, there are treasures, adits, rocks, swamps, and devious imps waiting for dwarves.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Exploration, Maze, Memory, Puzzle
mechanics: Advantage Token, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Movement Template, Pieces as Map, Voting

name: Lineup
description:
The Lineup is set and it’s time for you to identify your friends!

In Lineup, you’ll be asking the group questions that have a numeric answer. Then, you’ll create a lineup of your friends based on how you think they’ve answered! The most accurate predictor wins!

Lineup is based off the smash-hit CUT show with over 1.2 billion views to date!

—description from the publisher

name: Ah Ouinnn? Édition 25+
description:
The idea of this game is to guess the order of preference of other players among 5 subjects. The more you guess accurately, the more points you earn. Cards are different, with topics for adults aged 25 or more.

Bringing laughter, discussions and small malaise, this game is excellent at parties, dinner or date. Learn more about who you play with.

—description from the publisher (translated)

L’idée de ce jeu consiste à deviner l’ordre de préférence des autres joueurs parmi 5 sujets.

Plus vous devinez avec précision, plus vous gagnez de points.

Portant à rire, aux discussions et aux petits malaises, ce jeu est excellent lors de party, de soupers ou de date. Apprenez en davantage sur la personne avec qui vous jouez.

—description from the publisher

name: Boo-ty Call
description:
"Boo-ty Call" is a party game of deduction and seduction where lonely mediums interpret cryptic answers from a sexy ghost in a race to score! Imagine if Guess Who and Red Flags had a spooky baby. That would be this game!

One player will be acting as a Ghost, looking to get a little lively with the living. They will draw a Ghost Profile card and learn their secret identity before shuffling it with 7 other profile cards and placing them face up on the table in view of all players in a 2 x 4 grid. All the other players will be acting as Mediums looking to be the first to correctly guess the ghost player’s identity from among the 8 face up Ghost Profile cards on the table. They will do this by asking the Ghost player questions using Séance cards.

However, the Ghost has a hard time communicating across the veil and will be restricted in how they share their information based on the séance performed. The types of séances may require the ghost to knock their answers, use charades, make faces, or use non-verbal sounds to clue the mortal morsels in to their identity. There are limited chances to perform these rituals and if you take too long, the Ghost thinks you're playing games and the round will end.

When a Medium thinks they know who the Ghost is they can tap the card on the board. If they tap correctly, they successfully hooked up and both they and the Ghost score a point. If they tap the wrong Ghost, they have made an awkward misjudgment and won't be able to guess again this round.

Then the Medium to the left of the Ghost becomes the next Ghost and play continues in this manner until someone has 5 points and is declared the winner!

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Deduction, Race, Targeted Clues

name: Elfik
description:
Each player is an Elfic hero of one of four Elfic houses. To win you have to fight dragons living in the mountains. To beat a dragon you must collect certain items and spells in different places (forest, city, ...)
Each time you kill a dragon you earn experience points, the first player to reach a certain amount of experience points wins.

name: Search Party: Chaos at the Park
description:
Your search for the perfect family game is over. Meet Search Party: Chaos at the Park, the 3D interactive game that's here to shake up your game night. This game contains 15 unique missions and 300 search-and-find objects. To solve missions, you'll answer questions and find clues by following characters around the board and onto the pop-up locations. Or you can dive into the search-and-find guide and look for hilarious and hidden objects scattered around the board. Whichever path you choose for game night, you're bound to have a blast.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Spotcha!
description:
The Wild, Which-Way-Did-They-Land Game

Spotcha! takes fast eyes and faster hands. Start by tossing the 18 oddball objects and watch how they land. Flip a card and the race is on. Is the lawn mower rightside-up? Is the ghost face down? Look, the wizard hat is on its side! Quick, grab the correct scoring flags before anyone else. Everybody plays on every turn, so it's all-out, mad-cap fun for everyone!

name: Cat & Chocolate: Nichijou Arc
description:
A version of Cat and Chocolate with everyday scenarios. Each turn, the active player draws an event card depicting a certain crisis they must handle - being chased by bees! Bad breath! Or a long line for the bathroom! The player then chooses one to three item cards from their hand and explains how they use these items to get out of the situation.

Other players then vote on whether or not the active player succeeds; if a majority of players agree, the player keeps the event card. At the beginning of the game, players are secretly divided between Team Cat and Team Chocolate. The game is over when a special "End!" event card is drawn, at which point players reveal their team allegiance and count up the number of event cards they've won for their side. The team with the most event cards is the winner!

name: Superfight: The '80's Deck
description:
Gnarly cards, Brah! This Deck's got a totally righteous set of '80s cards to remind you of how rad things were back in the day. Go ahead and mix this deck with any of your other decks or play it on its own!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Ninja Dice: Team Locations
description:
Are you ready to join forces with your ninja friends in this epic team-based Location Card expansion for Ninja Dice? Inside this box are 24 team locations that can only be beaten with the sheer force of cooperation. Introducing new art, new stories, and exciting new ways to play the push-your-luck dice game where the direction of the dice matters!

Team Location Rules
Setup: You will need two sets of Ninja Dice to play. Get into teams of 2.
Sort the cards: Team Locations come in sets of 6, such as the Omi Mint. You will play with one set per team, plus one extra. Choose which sets you will play with, and put any others aside.
Sort the cards into 3 decks for Round 1, 2, and 3, as shown on the back of the card. Place all the cards for the current Round face up on the table.
Coin reward = Number on bronze coin + Number in black box. (No bonus.)
Teamwork: If an Active Ninja targets his teammate’s locked Hourglasses with a Fortune, he can use the Fortune to remove one Hourglass (the Fortune can’t be used for anything else that roll). You can revive a ninja who has run out of time.
Once on your turn, you may give a Skill Die to your partner. They can’t give it back and they can’t lend you one afterwards. They roll that die in addition to their other dice for the rest of the turn.
Scores are kept as a team.
Kage Dice (expansion content): Can target any dice. Awesome! (Hourglasses still lock to chosen ninja.)
Your Team’s Turn: Choose a pair of Locations from the same set. (You do not need to choose the same set each Round.) You will try to defeat one Location Card while your partner tries to defeat the other. Roll the number of House Dice in the black box and add the icons and rules on the card to create your House.You each roll Skill Dice simultaneously, but keep them separate. Skill Dice you roll only count towards your House.
Your partner can choose not to roll while you roll.You can keep rolling if your partner is out of time.

Not Your Turn: Choose an Active Ninja to roll against; your Hourglasses don’t affect the other Active Ninja this turn. Roll Threat Dice each time your chosen Active Ninjas rolls Skill Dice.
If there is more than one Inactive team, ninjas on the same team have to be on the same location. If you’re the only one rolling against an Active Ninja, roll an additional Threat Die (not a Kage Die).
Ending Your Turn: Both ninjas must run away or collect coin rewards at the same time. A Ninja with 4 Hourglasses must stop rolling and collects no reward, even if she beat the House.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: NOCCA x NOCCA
description:
An easy-to-learn, quick-to-play abstract game containing 5 black and 5 white dice. The board is simply a 5×8 grid. All five white and black dice begin the game on their respective sides. You can win the game one of two ways:


Move one die of your color to the opponents goal (This area is behind the starting line)
Have all five of your dice on top of the other opponents.


On your turn you must move one of your dice to any orthagonal or diagonal space adjacent to this die. You may move your die on top of one or two (stacked dice). This means you will then create a stack of two or three, unless the space was empty. You may not create a stack of four. You can also move your cube on top of any stack to an adjacent space.

It takes 5-10 minutes per game, but the moves demand much attention and cleverness.

name: Gess
description:
Gess is a chess-like two-player abstract that is played with a Go-Ban (that is, a go set), although it uses the squares formed by the grid rather than the intersections of the grid, and the squares around the outside edge of the board are not used. Thus, you play the game on an 18×18 grid.

The 'pieces' are 3×3 patterns of go stones, with each possible pattern of stones representing a different type of piece, each of which moves in a different way. Rather than the pieces remaining the same throughout the game, however, a player can use any 3×3 portion of the board that contains at least one of his stones and none of his opponent's stones. This means that two pattern-pieces can move near each other, and then portions of each of the original pieces can be moved away together as a different piece, leaving behind the remainder of the original formations, which can, in turn, be used as other pieces.

If a piece moves in such a way that it overlaps one or more stones (of either player), all stones that the piece moves onto are captured.

Each player must maintain one piece that is a ring of eight stones around an empty square at all times. If one player is in a position where he no longer has such a ring anywhere on the board for any reason, he loses.

name: Häuptling Bumm-ba-Bumm
description:
A Native-American-themed rhythmic reaction game.

Recognize the rhythms another player is producing on the tambourine, be first to hit the corresponding motif card with the swatting hand, and win the game by collecting the most motif cards.

The game also includes some variants for more challenging games, introducing memory elements and cards that reverse the meaning of the symbols on the motif cards.

name: Arktika
description:
Eat or be eaten on the North pole.
In this asymmetric game, you are either an Eskimo hunter, an orca, a polar bear or a seal. Each hunter has his own move options: swimming in sea, moving on ice floes or a combination of both. The ice floes drift each turn, changing the game board and your tactical options.
The player with the most food points wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Map Deformation

name: Dr. Seuss: Stack with the Cat Game
description:
It’s a cold, cold, wet day and the Cat in the Hat has come to play! Stack the playthings one by one. But watch out—the Cat is up on a wobbly ball, so don’t let all the playthings fall!

Draw a card. Choose a plaything to stack on the Cat in the Hat. Be careful—don’t make the Cat drop it all!

Players pick from 2 available cards that have items on them to stack on the cat. Players are out when they make the stack topple. The last player in the game wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Blindside
description:
A Nomination Whist variant that is played with an odd deck of cards. The deck contains the four regular suits, but each has 2 Kings, 2 Queens and 3 Jacks, 3 '10's and 3 '9's. There are also four jokers, which
count as the highest trump. At the end of each hand, the players score a point for each trick made, with a
bonus of ten if you make exactly as many tricks as you bid. If you bid zero and made no tricks, you score
20 points - which makes zero very valuable. The game ends when any player reaches 77 points at the end
of a hand: the player with the most points wins. Each hand starts with dealing out the entire deck. Each
player uses one face down card as a bid for the trump suit. If one suit has more cards than any other,
this suit becomes trumps for the hand. If not, the hand is played as No Trumps. There is a clear trade-off
here between getting the suit you want as trumps and retaining as many cards as possible in the suit.
However, it can also be a useful way of reducing your holding in a particular suit. Or even throwing away
a high card that would otherwise win a trick, if you are going to bid zero tricks. Once the trump suit has
been determined, each player, starting to the left of dealer, states how many tricks they expect to take.
This gives an interesting advantage to the dealer.

name: Lunar Laser Frogs
description:
The laser-fast dice game for up to 8 players!

Lunar Laser Frogs’ dice feature icons in three colors as well as blank faces. When it is your turn, you roll three times to cast all six dice. At the same time, and even before you are finished, each other player tosses one face down card onto a shared pile.

The fastest opponent to play a particular color card will get one point per matching die. However, if you do not roll a particular color at all, it will be “lasered” onto every die and suddenly be worth six points.

—description from the publisher

name: Succession!
description:
