Alexander Cornelius V, the king of Dayrm is dead and has left no heir. The nobles houses are each sending envoys to Alexandria to vie for the crown and be the new ruler of the land. Each of the other houses are also hiring brigands to try and capture the noble lineage and stop them from making their journey to the capital city. Can you and your trusted knights and envoys navigate to the capital so you will have the political clout to become the new ruling house of the realm?

Each player has the same 9 cards consisting of capturing pieces and pieces that give extra points if not captured. Each turn players will play their cards representing envoys, guards, and kidnappers in 3 different paths to Alexandria. Play continues until all cards are played and points are calculated. Whoever has the most points wins the round and gains a token. First one to 3 tokens is now the new ruling kingdom of Darym.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Renaissance

name: Kiss My Ass 2nd edition
description:
It is 1944, eastern front was falling into its ,ost dangerous phase. With overwhelming military power soviet forces have penetrated german front lines in various places succeeded in surroundING a German Corp . The Germans have assembled a handful of armored units to rescue the besieged german troops.

Kiss my ass is a card game on tactical combat in the eastern front 1944. One player plays the Germans and the other the ussr.

The game has 110 cards, 6 dice an English and japanese language rules manuals..The game is based on Motofumi Kobayashi's classic manga Black Knight
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motofumi_Kobayashi

1st edition was published by Tenkafubu.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Lost Ship
description:
Your civilization’s great migration was just beginning when something went wrong. From your place on the bridge, you watched the lead colony ship explode, starting a chain reaction of fire and death that wiped out half the fleet in an instant...

Now, half a galaxy away, you fly under unfamiliar skies. You have no way back to the fleet, no way of knowing if there is even a fleet to return to. You press on alone, lost, in search of a planet to call your own. You will find it or die.

A game of Lost Ship consists of encounters between your ship and alien threats as you leap from system to system in search of a habitable planet. Between battles, you will search for materials, make repairs, care for your pilots, and search for a planet your people can inhabit.

If you find home, you win. If your ship runs out of fuel or is destroyed, you lose, and your civilization dies with you.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Unfold Kids: Kid's Quest – Mission Cookies
description:
You are not an ordinary child because you have superpowers, and your parents are secret agents. You have longed for them to take you on a real assignment. To prove that you are old enough for an undercover mission, you are going to find the most secret room in your superhero house. And Elp — your Electronic home assistant — is always ready to help you out with a hint or put you on the right track.

Kid’s Quest. Mission ‘Cookies’ is an exciting tabletop quest designed specifically for children. Open new locations, solve unique puzzles and complete your mission, relying not only on your smarts but on your senses as well. Learn more about the character's family and watch the story unfold as you play.

This is a tabletop quest in the form of two fold-out envelopes. The players are not allowed to unfold them immediately. Read the story page by page until you come across a puzzle. Use logic, good reasoning and sometimes your senses to solve each puzzle. If you are stuck, you can always look up a hint or solution with a short explanation of the puzzle. Do not open new pages unless you are instructed to do so. Usually, you'll need to solve a puzzle in order to turn over a page. As soon as you reach the page stating "To be continued..." or "The End", you have successfully finished the game!

—description from the publisher
publishers: DV Games, Hobby Japan, Korea Boardgames, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Mercurio, MINDOK, Red Cat Games

name: 10-Minute Games: Expansions
description:
Up the fun on the three small games by adding the expansion pack which increases player counts and adds special variables.

The Mountain Goat expansion pack adds more components for a fifth player and "The Big Mountain" expansion.

The Sequoia expansion pack adds more components for a sixth player and the "Negative Point Values" expansion.

The GPS expansion pack adds three specialty satellites for each player and components for a sixth and seventh player.

name: Descent
description:
Materials
3 black pawns
3 white pawns
48 square tiles

Setup

Arrange stacks of three tiles into a 4x4 grid, then place two like color pawns on opposite corner stacks. The remaining two pawns are placed at B1 and C4.

Definitions

Adjacent - Means orthogonally or diagonally adjacent.

Play

One player is black the other white.

Decide who goes first in any appropriate manner, turns then alternate.

On a turn you,

Move a friendly pawn to an empty adjacent stack of tiles that is 1 higher, 1 lower or the same height as the one it was on, then remove one empty tile from an adjacent stack.

Objective

There are two ways to win,

1) The player who makes a straight line out of his three pawns either orthogonally or diagonally (the line of pawns must be on adjacent stacks of the same height) or
2) The player last to move.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Tile Placement

name: Turbo-Team
description:
The marathon-camels are warming up, the hurdle-kangaroos are jumping up and down, the lively frogs are stretching their legs, and off they go!

Team turbo is a dice-powered animal race game with pigs, camels, frogs and kangaroos. Every player has his/her own individual racetrack. Goal is to be the first player finish the whole team while avoiding obstacles which slow you down.

name: Emergence Event: The Awakening
description:
The Awakening is the first expansion for the competitive space exploration game, Emergence Event. This expansion contains two new captains, eight new galaxy tiles, two new discovery story arcs, and expands the story arcs from the base game to four acts from their previous three. Each of these elements further enriches the story within the Emergence Event universe.

Players seek to explore and control locations in the galaxy, but now the Markarians have arrived. The Markarians' arrival places the players in danger. This danger is represented by a new encounter deck that adds variety and difficult choices to the game. These encounters with the Markarians must be overcome for players to have a chance at victory when the Markarian Dreadnought arrives.

The Awakening expansion offers a variety of new galaxy tiles with special rules. These new galaxy tiles require players to adjust their strategy if they wish to unlock the secrets held within them.

Made up of modular tiles, the galaxy itself, and many of the elements within, is very different each and every time you play Emergence Event. The Awakening expansion allows for even greater replayability as players develop the story of their own species as they prepare themselves for the upcoming invasion.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dyade
description:
"Dyade: the captivating game for strategists

One 'dyad' (Greek: a pair of units) consists of 2 figures connected by a chain."

Dyade is a draughts/checkers variant with a twist - pieces are made up two metal posts joined by a chain link, and opposing pieces stand on squares of opposite colors. A move consists of moving one post of any piece, only as far as the link allows. Captures are made by crossing enemy links with your own. Pieces (dyads) that reach the far end of the board are promoted to gold pieces that have the extra power of moving both posts in one turn.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: Ramses
description:
Each of the two players is trying to maneuver his four pieces onto specially marked squares or to box his adversary in (if he cannot move any piece, he's lost). On your turn you move first one of your own pieces, then one of your adversary's.

The pieces move orthogonally (as long as they don't go twice through the same square during a move) by as many squares as there are pieces in its starting column and row (using the larger number, counting itself).
The game has Chess-like qualities since there is no randomness at all, and each player has perfect information.

name: Chir 1942
description:
Chir 1942 is a simple introductory wargames published in Vae Victis "Hors Serie" nr 10 in August 2008. 33 DTP counters and a 11" x 17 " map at battalion level with some companies.

It simulates the battle of December 1942 along the Chir river (so just after the Stalingrad encirclement) where the 11th Panzerdivision of the 48th Panzerkorps managed to destroy the 1st Soviet Tank Corps during the battles near Sovkhoze 79. The book of von Mellenthin "Panzer Battles" describes the story very well. The 11th Panzerdivision destroyed 800 Soviet tanks and mauled several other tank and mechanized corps during all these battles despite a tank strength of only 56 tanks.

name: Chutes à gogo
description: A tree, built from two interlocking cardboard pieces, grows by putting lots of cardboard leaves onto it. The players alternate adding a leaf to the tree; the first player getting rid of all his leaves first without toppling the tree wins.

name: Captain Tsubasa Trading Card Game
description:
This Trading Card Game is based on the famous Captain Tsubasa comic/animation. The theme is about the World Cup 2002, in which Tsubasa leads the Japan team to challenge soccer players from other countries.

Konami Japan also uses the similar rules to release another TCG, the Perfect Eleven.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Sports

name: Thundercats
description:
After their planet Thundera exploded, the ThunderCats came to Third Earth to start new lives. But they were followed by the Mutants of Plundarr, and are also plagued by Mumm-Ra, the ever-living, a creature from Third Earth. They seek Lion-O's mystic Sword of Omens. When Lion-O needs help he raises the sword and shouts, "ThunderCats! HO!" to summon the other ThunderCats: Pantro, Tygra, Cheetara, Wilykit, Wilykat and Snarf to aid in his battles and protect Third Earth.

Game Includes 1 Gameboard, 8 Cardboard Pawns w bases, Deck of 54 cards, Sword of Omens, and 2 plastic Diamond Jewels. Instructions on box top.

There is a cardboard insert box cover with great graphics and descriptions of each character: Lion-O - the brash and courageous young lord who leads the cats on their journey. Weapon: the mighty Sword of Omens containing the eye of Thundera, the source of the cats Power. CHEETARA: Friendly and compassionate, Cheetara is the fastest of the Thundercats because of her ability to move at super speed. Weapon: A magic staff she uses as a throwing stick, a pole vault or spear. WILYKAT & WILYKIT: These two pranksters are mischievous and disrespectful of the older Tcats. Weapons: a whole arsenal of powders.. sneezing, itching, smoke screens and more -- designed to confuse the enemy and make a quick escape! PANTHRO: a skillful engineer responsible for making weapons and vehicles for the Tcats. Special powers: superb martial arts skills and exceptional acrobatic abilitiy. Weapon: a set of nunchakus he uses to stun his attackers. TYGRA - The architect in charge of designing & building the Tcats new home. The Cats Lair. Special power: perfect camouflage ability with any background. Weapon: a bolo whip used to entangle the legs of his enemies!
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Atlas in a Box
description:
Atlas in a Box is a spin-off from "Take Off" and consists of the full deck of cards from "Take Off," a small, color paper map of the world, and new instructions of games to play with the cards. The games include flag- and map-matching, ranking countries and taking tricks, as well as a straight quiz game.

From the box:

"Can you name this country? If not, don't worry because Atlas-in-a-Box is a delightful card game that can teach you world geography with fascinating facts and lots of fun. Here's what you get:
Detailed country cards -- nearly 200 in all! -- from the award -winning board game Take Off! The cards profiles the nations of the world with flags, maps, and much more.
A full-color political map. The map shows the whole world at a glance, and include a complete country index.
Four easy-to-play games. The games turn the cards and world map into adventures in fun while unlocking a wealth of knowledge.
Whether for the home, the classroom, or on the go, this portable Atlas-in-a-Box is the ideal year-round gift for families and students -- or even yourself.

name: Laboratório do Dr. Lógica
description: In this game you have to discover the aspects of the 8 little monsters of the lab from Dr. Lógica (Dr. Logic), asking in rounds questions about the features of the monsters that the other players already know.

name: Pièges galactiques
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie # 7

A spaceship is invaded by various aliens... the crew tries to organize itself to destroy the invaders.

name: Graf Spee
description:
Graf Spee is a World War II tactical naval game, pitting the German pocket battleship Graf Spee versus three Royal Navy cruisers off the coast of South America, December, 1939. Designed by Gary Graber. The game was initially released as a "Mini-Sim" game in Panzerschrek #13. The required the components to be photocopied and mounted prior to playing. It was subsequently released as a "Zip Edition" with color counters and a player aid printed on cardstock. The counters still need to be cut out prior to playing. The Zip Edition also provided additional informational markers, ships, scenarios/variants and a modified optional odds table.

It has subsequently (2011) been re-released in a fully revised edition under the title Battle of the River Plate.

name: Lovers & Liars
description: Lovers & Liars invites you and your friends to talk about love. It's played like scruples. Can you enjoy yourself when your lover is mad at you? Would you mind if your lover occasionally wanted you just for your body? There are no right answers and you don't have to tell the truth. The game is provocative and hilarious.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Magnus Magnusson the Quizmaster
description:
Based on the BBC quiz programme "Mastermind", Magnus Magnusson presents the ultimate quiz with 10,000 questions.

There is no board or dice. The box with the questions in is simply passed from one player to the next each acting in turn as quizmaster.

The 10,000 questions are arranged into ten colour coded categories:

Famous People
Common Sense
History
The World
Stage and Screen
The Sciences
Sports and Games
The Arts
The Animal World
General Knowledge

The questions themselves have been designed to intrigue and arouse curiosity and so are interesting to ask. The answers are often unexpected, sometimes incredible, sometimes obvious.

The ultimate quiz game may be played by an unlimited number of people.

name: Merit: The Catholic Game
description:
In "Merit", two to four players work to build the six key properties (Church , Convent, Seminary, Catholic Charities, School and Foreign Missions) while maintaining their level of merits (700 points) and obtaining six of the seven sacraments. The first player to return home with the required six sacraments and at least 700 merit points after the six properties are built wins the game.

The question deck is filled with excellent questions related to Catholic belief and practice, and also has cards that offer the player a chance to advance via deeds rather than answers (e.g., a card that allows the player to go to any square if they promise to say the rosary, or pray a Hail Mary, and so on).
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ceuta
description:
This wargame is about hypothetical first confrontations between Spanish and Moroccan forces fighting for the control of Ceuta city. This conflict would be in the 90's.
Map size is A3, with Ceuta city and the surrounding area (small Moroccan villages). Counters are battalion. There is one counter sheet with 96 counters.

Originally published in Alea Magazine nº1 (Spanish rules), then in "Journal Du Stratège" French magazine (French rules).

name: Fallout Warfare
description:
Fallout Warfare is a small scale skirmish wargame with role play elements and character/unit customization.

Initially released with the "Fallout Tactics Brotherhood of Steel" video game bonus CD, it features units and creatures from the award winning "Fallout" line of post-apocalyptic video games.

Players can build war bands with units from different factions and customize them with equipment, skills and experience points.

Also included are rules for vehicles, savage animals, scenarios and paper counters for miniatures and weapon fire.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Graveyard Shift
description:
"It usually happens on Halloween, during full moons, on the occasional Friday the Thirteenth or pretty much anytime one of the walking dead comes by with a keg of beer. The Graveyard comes alive, the lost spirits start wandering around and it's time to play Graveyard Shift."

Published in the October/November 2000 issue of Games Unplugged Magazine. The board is printed in the magazine; you provide cards, pawns and chips.

You try to capture spirits of different values (represented by playing cards) by singing to them (placing chips on them). You move, sing to a spirit (optional), capture a spirit (if you are on it and: you have at least as many chips on it as anyone else and there are at least as many chips on it as its rank OR you have more than half of the card's rank in your own chips) and slide a spirit or line of spirits (optional). New spirits sometimes emerge from from Open Graves.

name: Line of Battle: Tactical Capital Ship Combat, 1914-1924
description:
LINE OF BATTLE: Tactical Capital Ship Combat, 1912 through 1924. A Tactical Study

Lord Fisher started it all when, in December of 1905, he approved the laying of the keel of Dreadnought, the first of a type of line of battle ship that would make everything built before it obsolete and whose concept would dominate the big gun ships of major navies for the next 40 years. By the eve of the Great War full fleets of these vessels faced each other across the narrow European seas, ready to fight for domination of the open ocean.

In an integrated combat system the game covers shell strengths, immune zones, armor placement, gun ranges, and angle of incoming shot without resort to complicated calculations. Detailed rules on movement, command, and other vital factors complete the game. 400 unit counters are included to cover every European, American, & Japanese dreadnought of the period."

Scenarios include Dogger Bank, Jutland, and hypothetical battles.

Re-implemented by:

Line of Battle (Second Edition)

name: Summa Summarum!
description: Each player gets 18 discs of a color and places them face up in front of him. Alternating the players place now the discs on the board. The first disc could be placed entirely free, all further must be placed in the row or the column where the last chip has been placed. If one has a higher sum than the fellow player thereby in a row, then you turns all face up chips of your opponent face down and if your (if there are any) face down chips face up. The game ends if no player could place a new chip according to the rules. The player with the highest face up total wins.

name: Following Suit
description:
Following Suit is a simple trick-taking game. The object is to collect as many points as possible in a single suit. The game is played in several rounds and the first player to reach 400 points wins.

Following Suit was one of the simultaneous-play games which began with Lamarckian Poker (published by GAMES Magazine in 1997 and previously free on the Cheapass website) and continued with Last Man Standing and Starbase Jeff. Following Suit was first published in Game Trade Monthly in 1999.

name: H. R. Pufnstuf Game
description:
Game is based on the trippy children's television series H. R. Pufnstuf from the late sixties.

Players must attempt to collect a single set of 4 cards which form a picture of one of the shows characters (Jimmy, Pufnstuf, Freddie, Cling/Clang) when assembled, depending on the character selected by the player at the start of the game. Each card is duplicated once.

The 32 cards are dealt in 4 piles face down on the board in designated areas. Gameplay is directed by a spinner. Cards are taken up or returned to the board, or taken from opponents, depending on the spin.

The first player to collect the four correct cards that complete their character picture wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Seebär, ahoi
description:
Four sailing ships are docked in the port. The little sea dogs have to skillfully use their colored sails in order to be the first to reach the mysterious rainbow island. One by one, in a clockwise direction, the players each pull a sail out of the sailor's kit bag: the boat onto which a colored sail is stuck moves ahead to the next free square of the same color as the sail. As there can only be one sail of each color on the masts of the boats, the sails sometimes have to be stuck on the boats of others players. Watch out: If a black sail is stuck on a boat, it has to move backwards. The sea dog who brings their boat into the bay of the rainbow island first wins the game.

Ages 4 and up.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Nautical, Racing

name: Greif zu!: Würfeln, schauen, schnappen
description: Act quickly in Greif zu!: Würfeln, schauen, schnappen as this lively game is about snapping up the pictures that have just been rolled on the dice. The player who reacts the fastest wins the game.

name: Gift of Enlightenment
description:
From the advertisement:

Gift of Enlightenment is a unique and totally original board game that brings a flow of positive energy to all who discover it. Friends and family will be delighted by its healing messages and fun game play. This is one adventure that is guaranteed to stay in the mind long after the final dice has been thrown.

Game Features: - Seek your very own ‘Gift of Enlightenment’. Make life-changing decisions as you travel the ‘Circle of Life’. Win and lose positive and negative human traits along the way. Harness the energy around you. It can help you to reach the ultimate goal. How powerful are your Sixth Sense, Insight, and Intuition? Here’s your chance to find out as you seek to master the ‘Seven Chakra Challenges’. Collect the Seven Chakra Crystals that can help you to open the wonderful ‘Book of Enlightenment’.

Delve into the mysterious Karma Pool. Try to avoid falling for False Idols. Gain a personal gift from the ‘Book of Enlightenment’.

Each beautifully boxed game contains: -

Game board

7 special Chakra stones with velvet holding bag.

6 Aura cards

3 packs of game cards

42 Chakra crystals (acrylic)

7 Chakra color cards

7 Chakra Challenges.

Wooden Dice

Full Instructions

Plus the 82 page ‘Book of Enlightenment’

name: Blockade
description:
Blockade is a game that is played with Icehouse Pieces.

Blockade is a roll-and-move race game played in two dimensions. Each player is assigned 2 colors in a 5x5 board, and are trying to arrange their pieces in formation first. However, as pieces arrive at their destinations, future piece movement by friend or foe is restricted. Players will need to cleverly jockey for position while leaving themselves more options and blocking the opponent's movement paths.

Published online at the Looney Labs website since 2001.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

name: IceFloe
description:
IceFloe is a piecepack game designed by Tim Schutz. It was a runner-up for the Changing Landscapes design competition sponsored by Mesomorph Games.

IceFloe uses a piecepack set, piecepack pyramids, and a candle (or another easily accessible incendiary device) for its components. The game board consists of piecepack tiles that are placed suit-side up; each representing an ice floe. One player is selected to be the torch bearer and is given the candle. Game play is broken up into phases. During the movement phase, starting with the torch bearer, players take turns either moving a game board tile, or moving one of their own pyramids. After movement, a voting phase takes place, accompanied by a comment period that allows some limited negotiation. Players vote on which floe is to be blown up by the torch bearer, with the torch bearer being the tie-breaker. Any pieces on the selected floe are removed from the game. Often, multiple players will have pieces on a single ice floe, so short term alliances may form during voting.

Complete rules are free to download from http://piecepack.org

Not to be confused with: Ice Flow

name: Jobber
description:
The object of Jobber is to eliminate all of your own pieces. This can be accomplished by getting your pieces to their elimination corner or having your opponent jump your pieces Checkers style.
The Jobber piece makes the game unique. The Jobber piece must stay in the Jobber row outlined by red squares and shaped like a plus sign in the middle of the board. You can use your Jobber piece to block your opponent's pieces or to advance your own pieces by having them jump over your jobber piece.

name: Bay of Pigs
description:
Bay of Pigs is an Operational level wargame simulation of the 1961 invasion of Cuba by Jim Bumpas, the designer of Schutztruppe.
Amphibious landings, unit disruptions, supply limitations, air and naval bombardment.
Fairly easy to play and fast-moving. 176 counters

name: Total Football
description:
From the Back of the Box

Play the opposition home and away in the Total Football League.

Experience the pressures of football management as you make decisions on tactics and team selection for each fixture.

Match by Match, your team will battle against injuries and the consequences of red and yellow cards. You will have to speculate on the transfer market to strengthen your squad with foreign flair or home grown talent in an effort to stay in contention for the whole of the season.

Contents - 6 sets of Team Cards, 24 Overseas Star Cards, 8 Referee Cards, fully detailed League Table Scorepad, set of money chips and 3 dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: More Who's in the Bag
description: This is an expansion to the game "Who's in the Bag" which is a bit like charades with some Taboo mixed in (and probably some other party games as well). This expansion adds cards with another 400 celebrities' names.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, TDC Games, Inc.

name: How To Host A Romantic Evening: Tropical Paradise
description:
From the company that brought you the "How To Host A Murder" series comes a series of games that are geared towards 2 players. There are 3 themes to choose from in the "How To Host A Romantic Evening" series: Tropical Paradise, Roman Holiday, and Parisian Night.

From the back of the box: "In her best-selling book, Light His Fire, author Ellen Kreidman shares the secrets of how to keep romance and excitement alive in a relationship. Those principles were the inspiration for this unique evening of entertainment for two. How To Host A Romantic Evening-TM is more than a game --- it is an event in which two people rediscover the excitement and attraction that may be forgotten in day-to-day routines."

From the "Host's Guide": "Object: players move around the board by correctly answering the 'Knowledge' or 'Imagination' questions. When a player lands on a space and answers a question correctly, they keep the card. Five cards can be redeemed for a Light His/Her Fire Certificate of the player's choice. The first player to collect 3 certificates wins."

Of course, in a game like this, both players are ultimately winners!

Game components:
-1 game box
-1 game board containing 2 "Start" spaces, 12 "Imagination" spaces, 12 "Knowledge" spaces, and 4 "If possible, take one card from your partner" spaces
-1 "Host's Guide" containing a note from Ellen Kreidman, an introduction, a list of game contents, guides for planning the evening, setting a romantic mood, and costuming, food, drink and dessert recipes, instructions for playing the game, and 18 tips from Ellen Kreidman "on adding romance to your life every day".
-1 advertisement/mail order product sheet
-1 booklet containing 12 "Light His/Her Fire Certificates" which can be redeemed by the winners at a later date
-1 invitation made up to look like a passport
-1 envelope to go with the passport invitation
-24 "Knowledge" cards
-24 "Imagination" cards
-1 white, six-sided die
-1 purple glass playing stone
-1 yellow glass playing stone
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Mature / Adult, Trivia
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Call to Arms
description:
Call to Arms is the second supplement for Lightning Strike, completing the space-based rules set with provisions for advanced ECM, minefields, unit variants and space stations. In addition to twenty-four new CEGA and Jovian units, vehicles used by the neutral Mercurian Merchant Guild are also presented. Within these covers you will find:


Full rules and data cards for fielding the exo-armors, fighters and warships of Jupiter, Earth and Mercury;



Advanced rules for new weapons, cargo and low orbit battles;



Two full-color counter sheets


DP9-318, 32 pages +counters

SRP $15.95US/$17.50Can

NOTE: Call to Arms is not a stand-alone game. You will need to own Lightning Strike in order to play it.

Expands:

Lightning Strike
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warriors of Mars
description:
The warfare of Barsoom in miniature. Rules for individual and large-scale land and aerial conflict. Published by Tactical Studies Rules, 1974, 57 pages, $5.00.

Staple-bound book produced simultaneously with original three-booklet edition of Dungeons & Dragons. Fans of the original D&D set have noted contains a few Barsoomian elements.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Vertigo: The Balancing Puzzle
description:
A game whereby the players attempt to balance components to make a mobile structure which is rather Alexander Calder in feel.

Components include:
1. Tube which both holds the game pieces when not in use and which also provides the base and initial pivot point,
2.central support pieces which balance on top of each other
3. stiff wires that are projected from the central support pieces.
4."c" shaped weights to hang off of the wires or each other.
The central supports will only balance if the wires and weights are properly balanced.

The goal is to get all the pieces on to the structure without it collapsing.

On the tube it says, "A dizzying experience awaits he who challenges Vertigo . . . but the reward is a gently floating mobile sculpture.

Steady hands and a keen sense of balance help you to hit upon the right combination of weights and counterweights which complete all levels of the puzzle. Vertigo - the puzzle that thinks it's art."

name: Totika
description:
From the Publisher's website:
"Totika, a Maori word meaning “well balanced”, is a wood block stacking game unlike any other. As players pull blocks from the stack, being careful not to let it topple, they ask each other questions that focus on building self-esteem, social skills and coping strategies. As they concentrate on removing the blocks, players tend to relax, allowing them to open up and talk more freely with one another. Playing Totika will encourage people of all ages to set and achieve goals, motivate themselves, identify strong role models and form healthy relationships. Totika includes the Self-Esteem deck of questions but may be played with any card deck made by Open Spaces, LLC."

48 colored, wood blocks and 48 question cards, each with 4 questions for 2 or more players ages 8 & up.

name: The Blue and the Grey:  Grand Tactical Rules for the American Civil War
description:
As the game title would indicate, these are miniatures rules for fighting large scale American Civil War battles. One infantry stand is made up of four figures and each figure is 100 men. The basic element is a brigade, which is typically four-five stands. The ground scale is 100 yards for 15mm or smaller; for 25-30 mm figures, all distances should be doubled. The time scale is 1 turn = 20 minutes, which is fairly short for a grand tactical set of rules.

Game turn sequence is as follows:

1. Activation (each division or cavalry brigade rolls a die to determine if they can move effectively that turn)
2. First Move Determination
3. Combat Phase One (first mover moves and fires)
4. Morale Phase One (first mover)
5. Combat Phase One (2nd mover moves and fires)
6. Morale Phase Two (2nd mover)
7. March Phase (both sides make march moves)
8. Rally Phase (routing/retreating units may attempt rallies)

The game includes orders of battles (but not maps or scenario rules) for: First Bull Run, Shiloh, Gettysburg, and Chickamauga.

name: The Nutcracker
description:
A "miniatures" game in which an brave band of Nutcrackers must vanquish the Rat King and his minions. The game is played with small wooden nutcrackers and rubber mice. Movement is made in inches, and the figures can attack each other with ranged ice balls or melee attacks.

Inspired by the E.T.A. Hoffman story "The Nutcracker and the Mouse King".

name: Life on Mars
description:
To be published in May 2009 probably at Game-Market in Tokyo.

This is self-published game from Kossetsu-brand.

The game is a management game which covers the business on Mars.
The game is composed of 3 rounds. In each round, players build map and allocate labors and then do 3 actions.

[updated May 24, 2009]
Publishing is postponed.
There's no updated publishing date so far.
categories: City Building, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation

name: Magic of Stonehenge
description:
Magic of Stonehenge is a bluffing game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game. Players attempt to take tricks by playing their highest-value card (trump is either day or night for any given hand), or concede that they aren't going to take it by playing a retrievable trilithon card. Winning the trick means placing an apprentice (disc) on (or just below, if occupied) the space on the outer ring matching its card. Failing to win (without conceding) means taking the card you played as a penalty, which drags one of your apprentices back down toward 1, and ultimately off the board.

Once you have all of your apprentices on the board, you raise a trilithon and remove all your apprentices. Get them all on there once you already have a trilithon raised to win!

Magic of Stonehenge is an official game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game.

name: Stymie
description:
Stymie is a 2-player abstract game. It's a connection game (similar to Twixt or Hex), where each player attempts to build a solid path connecting their goals, while blocking their opponent from doing likewise.

Stymie is played on a 4-8-8 tiling, ie, a board of octagons and squares. Most player moves are double moves: an adjacent octagon and square. When a player is forced to make a single move, their opponent gets a very powerful triple move.

name: Tycoon: Business Game
description:
An exciting business game in which each player holds the position of a compancy chairman. Each chairman has to buy materials for his factories and manufacture products which he must sell competitively under changing market conditions. Shrewd management is needed to maintain suffcient income to pay the monthly expenses of the business and provide for expansion. Failure to take advantage of favorable market conditions may result in bankruptcy or being taken over by a more successful company. The winner is the most successful chairman at the end of 12 months trading.

Reimplemented by: Business Strategy

name: The Game of Great Detectives
description:
In The Game of Great Detectives, you play Sherlock Holmes against others in an adventure of skill and detection. Use your powers of detection to thwart your rival and disprove his theory of the crime before he has a chance to do the same to you. Win by completing your investigation and being the first to implicate the suspect and his motive in a crime.

WARNING
Spoiler Alert: The content of these cards contains information about the secret solutions to many Sherlock Holmes adventures.

name: Diggity
description:
Diggity is a fast-paced card game with a mining theme. Players use mine cards to build a mine while at the same time trying to construct (or steal) the mining tools needed to grab the gold before others. The Diggity mine cards have two functions - they construct the mine the players use to collect gold, and they also hold parts that players can use to create a miner or to build tools. The miners produce gold, and then it's a battle as players vie to use the best tool to collect it.

Easy to learn, quick to play, but with deep gameplay and unique mechanics, Diggity is suitable for a party, a family game night, or a break from school or work.

The game includes:
Mine Cards Deck (64 cards)
Tool Cards Deck (16 cards)
Gold Cards Deck (16 cards)
Diggity Rules Document
publishers: Plankton Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Cult
description:
Cult is a card-based strategy game about fanciful religious cults. You start with a single god with no worshippers, and during the game, you develop a cult of followers for your god and build a temple to your god. You’ll be in competition with other cults, and you may eventually add other gods and cults to your pantheon. Your goal in the game is to attract more followers (and stronger followers) to your cult and to build complete temples to your gods.

You'll also be able to take your pesky competitor cults down a notch or two with special cards such as Heresy, Purge, Iconoclasm, and many others.

Sometime during the game, there will be a prophecy. When the prophecy is fulfilled, it's the End of Days, and whoever is ahead wins!

The game is family friendly and easy to learn. It takes about 45-60 minutes to play depending on how fast you are.
publishers: Plankton Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Chapter Approved – 2001 Edition
description:
A series of three expansion books for Warhammer 40,000 third edition. Like the Book of the Astronomican for Rogue Trader, this short-lived annual collected articles from White Dwarf featuring various new rules, updates to the game, and army lists - some official, others merely experimental. There is substantial overlap between the volumes as each subsequent one was in part meant to update and/or collect much of the material of the previous.

The original in the series, Chapter Approved, was published in 2001, with Chapter Approved 2003 following in 2002 and Chapter Approved 2004 in 2003 (the year in the title indicating the coming year rather than when it was published). They were also known as the Second, Third, and Fourth Book of the Astronomican, respectively, in homage to the original from Rogue Trader.


Army Lists
- Sisters of Battle
- Revised Necrons
- Blood Angels Death Company for use with Codex: Blood Angels (3rd Edition)
- Imperial Guard Armoured Company for use with Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 1st Codex)

Scenarios
- Advanced Mission Selection
- Army of Death
- Assassins
- Battle at the Camp
- Capture the Hulk
- Carnage
- Dawn Assault

Additional Rules
- Dark Lords of Chaos
- Grey Knights
- Cult Terminators
- Night Fighting Extended Rules
- Ultramarines Special Characters

Codex Updates
- Reprint updates for Space Marines, Armageddon, Orks, Blood Angels, Catachans, Eldar & Craftworld Eldar
- Revisions for Dark Eldar and Dark Angels

Vehicles
- Transport Vehicles
- Vehicle Design Rules
- Tyranid Monstrosities
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Whirled Peas
description:
In Whirled Peas, players compete in two teams in five types of interactive challenges, with the winner of each challenge earning a pea to fill its team pod. The first team to fill its pod wins. The challenges are:

• Putty Pal: Manipulate someone's body to act out the hidden word.
• Back Tracks: Draw an object on a teammate's back.
• Zip Your Lip: Get teammates to guess a word/phrase through charades and talking – but only talking through a closed mouth.
• Sketch Coach: Give drawing instructions to players on both teams and hope your team can guess the answer first.
• Clap Trap: One player from each team face off, giving answers to a category back and forth until one player falters. The other players clap. No, really.

name: ASL British AFV Vehicle Cards
description:
This expansion for Advanced Squad Leader provides the British forces of West of Alamein: ASL Module 5 a set of 24 "AFV cards". Each card represents an AFV (armored fighting vehicle) type and has counter marker tracks for up to a platoon of such vehicles. Markers for armor leaders, malfunctions and special equipment could thus be off board, allowing for less clutter on the mapboard units.

Common in miniature game systems, vehicle tracking cards in ASL first appeared for German and Soviet forces in Streets of Fire: ASL Deluxe Module 1 and then for American forces in Hedgerow Hell: ASL Deluxe Module 2, both encouraging the use of 1/285th scale armor miniatures as mapboard units.

Use of the cards does not impact the AFV rule set, it is simply a record keeping enhancement. In particular, these cards are not meant to provide a means of hidden information, as the rules specifically require the AFV status to be displayed at all times to the opponent. Thus, for example, hidden armor leaders are still be noted somewhere off of the cards.

Page F18 of Chapter F provided in West of Alamein: ASL Module 5 stated: "British AFV Cards will become available for purchase as of January 1989. Their cost will be $5.00 US, plus 10% for shipping within the USA (or for APO/FPO); or 20% for Canada or Mexico; or 30% for shipment overseas."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Embolada
description:
The challenge is to accomplish the poses and connections with other players, as described in the cards without dropping your ball. The moves vary from touching your friend's shoulder with your hand, hugging somebody's leg or even doing one of those with your eyes closed!

When you're eliminated, you choose someone to take care of your ball now, making it harder for him.

The last player standing with the ball wins!


Neste jogo você tem um desafio: manter a bolinha no lugar e fazer movimentos engraçados e complicados.
Estique-se para encontrar a sola do pé do seu adversário, contorça-se e alcance o ombro do jogador amarelo, ou até faça alguma dessas tarefas de olhos fechados!!
Mova-se com cuidado e cumpra as tarefas sem deixar sua bolinha cair para não ser eliminado.

Quando você é eliminado, passa sua bolinha para outro jogador, que agora terá 2 bolinhas para cuidar e muito mais desafio!

name: Honey Comb
description:
Save the Bee

This game plays like "Don't Break the Ice", but it's vertically oriented. Players take turns spinning a spinner determine which color 'block' they are going to knock out of the honeycomb, which destabilizes the whole setup. The first person to drop the bee sitting on top of the honeycomb loses.
publishers: Di Hong, Happy Kid Toy Group LTD., Lucrum Games

name: Tournament Express
description:
A solitaire dice game of knightly tournaments. You will be competing against the Black Knight in a series of 5 colored tournaments. Roll against his attack strength with 12 custom dice adding in various bonus skills you possess, as well as the help of your loyal squires, to defeat him and win the colored pennants. This game was inspired by Reiner Knizia's Ivanhoe card game from GMT Games.

You can also use 12 Battlelore(tm) dice or 12 regular d6.

Requirements
Dice for the game
1d10
1d12
and the score sheets provided
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Moskwa 1941
description:
The German strategic offensive named Operation Typhoon was planned to conduct two pincer offensives, one to the north of Moscow against the Kalinin Front by the 3rd and 4th Panzer Groups, simultaneously severing the Moscow - Leningrad railway, and another to the south of Moscow Oblast against the Western Front, south of Tula by the 2nd Panzer Army, while the 4th Army advanced directly towards Moscow from the west. A separate operational German plan, codenamed Operation Wotan, was included in the final phase of the German offensive.

This game allows to play the German assault and Soviet counter offensive that started on December 5th and was turning point for WWII.

name: Monopoly: Alton Towers Resort Edition
description:
A version of Monopoly with the traditional properties replaced by rides and attractions from the Alton Towers Resort.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: SeXoPoLiTan
description:
Card game with an STD prevention, sexual wellness and sexual pleasures theme. The goal is to collect 69 pleasure points. This can be reached by getting involved into different kinds of sexual activities.
Each player represents a male or a female character. During the game, a player can get a relationship with an opposite sex card (no same sex possibilities in the rules, although it might be adapted). In each turn, a player plays three cards and draws three new cards. Cards can be played on oneself or on opponents or their partners. Card effects can be positive, as in having sex or making up etc., or negative, blocking others. When a sexual act card is played, one or two dice are rolled and the result is added to the pleasure point total of the player, until one of them has reached a total of 69 points.

name: Walls of Light
description:
After decades of neglect, the Cathedral is in grave disrepair. The Cardinal has commissioned three master craftsman to restore it to its former greatness. Each must strive to rework and beautify the stained glass windows to emulate the light of heaven's glory.

Walls of Light is a light strategy game for 2-3 players. Each player places their colored winks to complete the cathedrals windows. Colored winks can be combined to make new colors. When a craftsman completes a window, he earns points for the number of different colors within that window. All craftsman then earn points for their colored panes in the completed window. The colored dice are used to determine which of the six windows the master craftsman may work on this turn, and in what way they may place their colored pane. Strategy is enhanced with the stained glass cards which allow dice to be rerolled, the switching of colors, the adding of extra colors on your turn, etc.

Walls of Light is a fast-playing strategy game that players of all skill levels will enjoy.

Available on The Gamecrafter or as a Print and Play!
PnP Game Files include:
Rules: 2 pages
Cards: 2 pages (16 cards)
Windows: 4 pages

PnP Players will need to supply:
1 Red d6, 1 Yellow d6, 1 Blue d6
8 Red Winks, 8 Yellow Winks, 8 Blue Winks (all translucent)
3 small tokens (1 red, 1 blue, 1 yellow) for keeping score
6 White cubes (or other token)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building

name: Wire to Wire  The Horse Racing Game
description:
A dice based horse racing game, where you can play multiple roles of a jockey, a handicapper, or an owner.

Horses and Jockeys are rated with a rep value (the higher the value the better the horse or jockey) a common feature of all Two Hour Wargame rules. Horses are also rated by style of running and effectiveness of within their style. The styles are Frontrunner (breaking hard from the gate), Stalkers (sits off the lead, then tries to close on the home stretch) and Closers (who run hard and the end). Finally it has a Class Rating, that is a race variable, that effects the horse on the day of the race. (making predicting the performance of a horse on any race, more troublesome).

It is fulled with horse racing terms and explanations, and comprehensive system for rating a horse to determine the odds of any race, and a full on campaign system, with buying, training and racing your horses and choosing your jockeys.

Product Description from the website:

THE SPORT OF KINGS, THE SPORT OF EVERYMAN

Once a year in early May, the sports world stops and takes note. It's the running of the Kentucky Derby, the first leg of the Triple Crown of thoroughbred horse racing. It's a time where the casual fan and the hardcore handicapper share the rail as they watch to see if there will be another Triple Crown winner.

But horse racing is much more than the Derby. It's the come from behind winner, the wire to wire runner, the long shot that defies all odds as it bolts across the finish line in dramatic fashion.

Wire to Wire brings the excitement of thoroughbred horseracing to you in three different ways.
As a jockey you make all the decisions as to setting the pace, moving up, and finally when to make a run for the finish line.
As a handicapper you bet on the horses, not only to win but also in the Daily Double and Exactas.
And as an owner you take your horse from auction to winner’s circle by deciding which races to enter and which jockeys to hire.

In Wire to Wire we provide over two hundred horses in thirty races for you to use. And if that’s not enough we’ll show you how to build your own horse! Wire to Wire can be played solo or competitively, head to head. We've included a track, horses, and everything else you need to run your races. In fact, we've provided a Power Point version that you can play right on your computer!

So lay out the track, grab some dice and get ready for some fun.

Wire to Wire, THE horse racing game!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Trivial Pursuit: Bayern Edition
description:
A German subsidiary card set for use with any Trivial Pursuit master game with specific questions about Bavaria. The game contains 500 cards with 6 questions each from the following 6 categories:

Blue: Geographie (Geography)
Pink: Unterhaltung (Entertainment)
Yellow: Historie (History)
Brown: Kultur (Culture)
Green: Weiß-Blau (White-Blue)
Orange: Sport & Freizeit (Sport & Leisure)

The questions in the green category (white-blue) center around slang terms and very specific bavarian topics, making it very hard for non-bavarians to answer.

name: TRIFUSION
description:
Add a colored tile each turn, trying to join the largest connected areas to maximize your score. Connect with all three colors for the most points. This game teaches pattern recognition and problem solving. With hundreds of combinations, there are infinite strategies to win!

Each turn, you connect one of your Game Tiles side to side to 1 or more Game Tiles in the middle of the table. The colors of the just-placed tile must match all adjacent tiles. Also, the corners of the Game Tiles must line up completely; that is to say that tiles may not overhang and the corners must match too.

Receive points for each game tile in the color chain that your tile connects to, but not including the tile you are adding.

name: Honest Andy's Used Card Dealership
description:
A short two player card game designed for 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest

Using 20 cards from a standard poker deck, players take turns trying to sell cards to each other and make a profit. The player selling can put lower value cards up for sale, but they run the risk of getting caught and losing their honest reputation.

Each player faces a small "Prisoner's Dilemma" choice each round. The player selling tries to guess what cards the other player is likely to buy. The player buying cards must decide if the other player is being honest or not.

name: Munchkin Triple Play: Set 2
description:
Munchkin Triple Play: Set 2 consists of three Munchkin booster packs previously sold separately:


Munchkin Easter Eggs: Bunnies and chocolate and monsters and treasure!
Munchkin Penny Arcade: The hit webcomic comes to Munchkin!
Star Munchkin: Space Ships: Just what every Star Munchkin needs — more ships!


As with the individual boosters, Munchkin Triple Play: Set 2 is an expansion for a Munchkin standalone game, not something playable on its own. The cards included are neither collectible nor randomized.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Pirates
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: Γράμματα – Τέχνες (Quiz Hunt: Arts and Letters)
description:
A competitive game with 600 questions about Greece and the whole wold focusing on Culture.

The game play is simple: Each player rolls the dice and according to the outcome of the dice he is being asked the corresponding question. If he answers right, he collects the card.

The player or the team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

It belongs to a series of trivia games Κυνήγι Ερωτήσεων
1.History
2.Animals - Plants
3.Science
4.Culture
5.Sports
6.Geography
7.20th century
8.Greece

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: Γεωγραφία (Quiz Hunt: Geography)
description:
A competitive game with 600 questions about Greece and the whole wold focusing on Geography.

The game play is simple: Each player rolls the dice and according to the outcome of the dice he is being asked the corresponding question. If he answers right, he collects the card.

The player or the team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

It belongs to a series of trivia games Κυνήγι Ερωτήσεων
1.History
2.Animals - Plants
3.Science
4.Culture
5.Sports
6.Geography
7.20th century
8.Greece

name: Plants
description:
Plants is a board game that attempts to model the life of plants from their point of view in a specific, easily playable format. Plants is also a modular, organic game system that can grow and adapt beyond a single game board or a set of rules. The game is not meant to be an educational simulation, but more like an open creative project that deliberately intertwines certain biological concepts with suitable board game mechanisms.

During the game, the players continuously move through several different types of phases and perform actions at their own pace. They must try to adapt to the whims of the competing players and manipulate the upcoming situations to help them pollinate their flowers and gather enough nutrients and energy to produce seeds. At same time the players may sprout from the seeds, use the nutrients to grow in the habitat area and be forced to use up their energy to get rid of pesky larvae. Having enough water available is always a concern, and sometimes the players must accept losing their precious biomass. And if the players are not careful, they might even be eliminated from the game completely.

Plants features no randomness after a simple setup and there are no auctions, negotiations or trading. It has an open spatial element with shared resources and some three-dimensional play. The actions are short and the turns go by quickly and the possible butterfly effects keep situations tense. Clever planning and timing is required for success, and in the end only the number of seeds matter.

name: Boss Monster: Bastas Promo Card
description:
This limited edition promo card features Bastas from Patrick Rothfuss's The Kingkiller Chronicles.

Bastas is an Epic Hero, class Thief.

This card was released for a limited time only, along with its Ordinary Hero counterpart Bast.

From the website description:

Introducing the brand new, limited edition "Bast" and "Bastas" hero cards for Boss Monster, a dungeon-building game inspired by classic video games.

Designed and donated by Brotherwise Games, these cards are available exclusively through our store, and they are in limited supply! Claim yours while you can!

The game itself is not included in this item. If you don't have the game yet, you can get the game and the cards together over here: Boss Monster Game.

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Havok & Hijinks: Dragon*Con Promo Card
description:
This promo card was created for Dragon*Con 2013 and was distributed to players who demoed Havok & Hijinks.

Ready Side:

Play: Your dragon gains an affinity of your choice
Crash: If an event with an affinity is flipped, your dragon gains that affinity and you may resolve the event for your dragon (the original dragon resolves it after)

Tired Side:

Crash: If an event with an affinity is flipped, your dragon gains that affinity and you may resolve the event for your dragon (the original dragon resolves it after)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Eminent Domain: Cygnus Planet Promo
description:
Cygnus is a new Prestige planet. This planet is worth zero Influence and takes 6 Colonies to Settle or 8 Ships to Attack. Instead of Influence or resources, the new planet provides one of each role symbol. Place Cygnus into the middle of the planet deck after shuffling.

Promo planet card available as a reward to backers of the Drive-Thru Reviews Season 5 Kickstarter.

name: Activity Champion
description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this edition, players do not play in teams anymore, but try to get as many points for only themselves. The cards show 4 different words, as well as the way you need to explain them (verbally, pantomimic, by drawing). The rules are slightly changed so that it works without teams. Points are given to the player who guesses right and the player who acted, described or drew the words.

name: Geoengineering 101
description:
From the publisher:

Action to stop climate change came too little and too late. Geoengineering, although dangerous and unproven, is now on the table. A world like this has no winners, but can you minimize the hardship your regions face?

In Geoengineering 101, you're one of two to four world leaders, and you have two parallel but sometimes competing goals: One is to minimize the hardship your regions endure from heat, drought, or flood. The other is to fully decarbonize the world economy. Only by eliminating all fossil fuel use can climate change be slowed and the game won. However, in the meantime, the air conditioners and pumps running on fossil fuels can shield you from the some of the impacts.

A world where climate change has gotten so bad that geoengineering is on the table is one without winners, only those that lose less. There's only one way to "win" in Geoengineering 101: have the least amount of Hardship when all Carbon Tokens are finally removed. There's plenty of ways to lose: having all regions destroyed by the climate going off the charts, or when all the players suffer a total of 100 Hardship - which in a typical game, is only 10-15 turns away.

In Geoengineering 101, you'll take turns with other players to carry out geoengineering programs or acts of deep green resistance. There's a time delay to your actions, though: the program you initiate now doesn't come up until your next turn. In between, other players' programs happen and if uncoordinated, can trigger side effects that cause hardship, randomize the sequence of future actions, or shift global rainfall patterns.

The game takes inspiration from real climate science and geoengineering ideas, as well as the political implications of different nations unilaterally or cooperatively meddling with the weather. Enjoy the game, but let's hope that carbon emissions can be stopped before we ever have to play it for real.

name: Ice Cream
description: Each player is dealt a cone card. The reverse side of it tells you what you should be adding to your ice cream cone: chocolate, strawberry or vanilla ice cream, almonds, cherries or wafer sticks. On your turn you draw a card and place it on your cone or replace the topmost card on your cone with the new card or you can place the card on someone else's cone. The game continues until everyone has five scoops on their cones. Then you score every card. If the card shows components that were required by your cone card you score positive points for the card and vice versa.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Encounter at Farpoint Q Cards
description:
This was given out as a participation prize for the first month of the official Q Continuum tournaments.

It consists of 4 cards which randomly effect the game state each round.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: De Mol: Extra Vragensets
description: Addition to base game, with five new packs of cards and notes sheets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: West of Africa: Wineries
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2016 for Day 2

Includes 5 wineries

Setup:
Place the 5 wineries next to the game board

Game Play:
The player whose turn it is may purchase up to 3 of the 5 wineries in the game in addition to his normal actions. Each winery cost 8 gold and is then placed next to any island by the owner. However, there may only be a maximum of 1 winery per island. In addition, the player takes any one of his workers and places him on the winery marker. The worker does not have to already be on the same island; he may be transferred from anywhere.
The winery has the nice side effect that the owner is able to activate a passive worker in this way.

Each of his winery markers that is sold from the warehouse on the winery island earns the owner 3 additional gold.
Other players may use the winery, too. In this case only 2 additional gold is earned - 1 by the seller and 1 by the owner of the the winery

The worker on the winery is counted normally when the island's Alcalde is determined.
The worker on the winery is removed when he normally helps with cultivating goods or when he is moved by the owner to a different place. When this happens, the winery is removed from the game board and may be purchased later
categories: Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: ADC Blackfire Entertainment GmbH, Frosted Games

name: Thief's Market: Mimetic Stew
description: Promotional card offered by "Man vs Meeple Season One Kickstarter".

name: Jandwich
description:
In Jandwich (ジャンドイッチ), players each manage a sandwich shop and need to create sandwiches to satisfy guests. The card deck consists of different types of breads and fillings, and to create sandwiches, a player needs to pair a filling with matches types of bread. Players acquire cards by drawing from the deck and buying cards from the discard pile.

Publisher's summary
The players, as sandwich shop managers, make sandwiches to get and steal customers from other players. Using 12 different types of breads and fillings, form 2 melds of 3 cards from your hand of 6 cards.

There are 3 ways to meld each 3 cards, namely a "trio" (set of the same cards), "combo" (sequence with the same suit), or "sand" (2 same bread cards and 1 filling card). The game starts with each player holding 25 pt of Customer chips, and the player with the most Customer chips at the end of the game wins.

プレイヤーはそれぞれサンドイッチショップの店長となり、サンドイッチを作ってお客さんを取りあうゲームです。
パンと具材のサンドイッチカード12種類を使って、
6枚の手札を3枚組2セットの形にすると完成となります。
3枚組は同じカードを3枚である「トリオ」、同系統の3連番である「コンボ」、全て同数字のパン2枚と具材1枚の「サンド」の3種類の作り方があります。
25Pずつお客さんチップを持ってスタートし、最後に一番多くのお客さんチップを持っている人の勝ちです。

name: Bhaloidam
description:
Description from the publisher:

Bhaloidam is a time, a person, a feeling. Bhaloidam is a language, an idea, a place, and a memory. Bhaloidam is a modern expression of three timeless cultural forces: bha to tell, loid to play, and dam the tribe. In other words, Bhaloidam is where Story, Play, and Community come together.

Bhaloidam is an indie tabletop game from Zakelro! that is an open and accessible storytelling platform. With it you'll spin character-driven stories and weave them together with the stories of your friends. You'll exert your influence upon the storyworlds you create together, shaping its future and controlling your characters' destinies as you perform their successes and their failures.

Story

Bhaloidam can be used to build any type of storyworld you and your friends want to explore. Sail the high seas as vicious pirates, uncover inter-dimensional conspiracies as government agents, solve murder mysteries as retired librarians, or scheme for power as members of the Elizabethan court.

Bhaloidam’s rules free you from context-specific actions, so your stories don’t need to revolve around combat, or even conflict. You can find yourself rolling the dice and using the rules to determine the outcome of a conversation, the impact of a musical performance, the success of a cunning plan, or any other action you wish to perform. This works because Bhaloidam provides you with thematic ways of Influencing the world and characters around you, and these Influences can be interpreted differently depending on the needs of the story and of your character.

This empowers a Skein (group of storytellers) to explore deeply personal stories together. And because each Spinner (storyteller) is in complete control of their character, they are encouraged to interpret their failures in ways that advance the story and provide opportunities for character growth.

Play

The rules of Bhaloidam are powerful and flexible, but they are also intuitive enough that new players--young or old--can learn them and start spinning stories within 45 minutes. Through the use of iconic visuals we are even able to represent every game rule you need to remember on the Lifewheel itself. Each storyteller uses one of these colorful gameboards to keep track of their characters’ influence upon the storyworld, and the storyworld’s influence upon their character.

Community

Bhaloidam can serve as a Spinner-only platform, meaning everyone has equal influence upon the story. But it can also serve a more traditional approach, wherein one person takes on the responsibility of creating the storyworld, writing the plot, and acting as final authority on the interpretation of the rules. We call this role the Weaver and encourage you to see this role as a support position rather than an authoritative one, helping the Skein spin the best possible story threads they can and weaving them into a compelling tapestry.

Bhaloidam is also a flexible and scalable platform you can build on. The clear and consistent rules serve as a solid base that you can add to as needed for your storyworld.

name: Wild Dash
description:
Wild Dash is the card game where animals race to the finish line! Players compete to get the best score by racing with fun animal cards. Reveal your animal card, then add booster cards to propel your animals to the checkered flag at the finish line.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Magic: The Gathering – New Phyrexia
description:
It came not in a fair contest of warriors, but as a wave of unstoppable slaughter. Though the Mirrans bravely resisted the onslaught from inside their own world, their efforts were for naught. Mirrodin is now New Phyrexia.

The third in the Scars of Mirrodin block, this set features 175 black-bordered cards, randomly inserted premium versions of all cards in the set, new mechanics (Phyrexian Mana), and a new Planeswalker card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Building A Better Monster
description:
Building a Better Monster pits players against each other as Mad Scientists competing to be the first to build a unique creature and bring it to life. When not acting as the Mad Scientist, you take on the role of Angry Villagers trying to work together to stop the current Mad Scientist's work.

The game plays using one standard 6-sided die to determine what twisted blueprints they’ve jotted down from fever-dreams and insane visions, as well as 6 custom Mad Scientist dice to determine what building blocks they’ve managed to collect from local cemeteries, mortuaries, hospitals, or prisons. Each scientist uses these materials to make their twisted schematics a reality. With the help of their faithful lab assistants and the occasional pack of ghouls at their summons, the madness is contagious. The Angry Villagers have their own set of 6 custom dice to determine their actions for the night. Will they storm the lab with a Pitchfork or Fire? Will they decide to cut off the Electricity instead? Maybe some will sleep through the night or decide to go Grave Robbing instead to use for their own creations.

—description from the publisher

name: There Grew A Kingdom
description:
There Grew A Kingdom is a medieval theme, middleweight strategy board game for 2 to 5 players, and one game takes about 20 minutes per player.

It is a competitive 4xGame that uses mechanics such as area control, worker placement and resource management.

It has soft end game trigger, player powers, and card combat system.

The goal of the game is to get the most Glory Points.
Those you get for several actions that reflect the glory of your Kingdom.

The game area is made up of hexagons, which are placed randomly.

By activating resource areas, you get resources which you are using to build and upgrade the cities, as well as your army.

The army is an important aspect of the game.
It is used to protect your kingdom and expose other players.
Army battles are carried out using army cards.

This game does not use any dice!
Consequently, the game has a very low luck factor!
Your game is determined by your decisions and the players' reaction to them.
The only luck element is an Army Card Battle that you can try to avoid.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Worker Placement

name: Kampf um den Olymp: Der Zyklop
description:
A promo card released at Spiel 2017. A new hero that damages your own units as well the opponents.

Text:
Füge jeder eigenen Einheit 1 Schaden zu. Füge der gegenüber liegenden Einheit 3 Schaden zu.

Translation:
Inflict 1 damage on all of your units. Inflict 3 damage to the unit directly opposite of this card.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Goblins, Guns and Grog!
description:
Five Goblin Pirates, marooned on a deserted island by treacherous crewmates, cobble together a raft and set off towards home through the Goblund Gauntlet, a dangerous pass full of sharp rocks, shipwrecks and merciless fellow pirates. Surviving the trip would be great. Collecting a big pile of loot would be better.

Goblins, Guns and Grog is a solitaire roll-and-write adventure game in which players attempt to navigate a treacherous sea route to make it to the mainland. Each turn, the player rolls dice to "Scavenge" (add items to the inventory), "Attack" (if in possession of cannons), "Loot" (in case of a successful attack), "Move" (along the map track, always straight forward towards the destination), "Adventure" (if the turn has ended on one of the X's scattered along the track). Every turn ends with eating, depleting the meager store of food that, if exhausted, causes the player to lose the game.

Arriving at the end of the track is somewhat easy and is nominally considered a "win." But points are only scored for looting the many ships along the way. To engage with these potential prizes, however, the player needs both cannons (to attack) and chests (to store loot). The catch? At the start of the game, the player's "ship" is large enough only to hold a pair of cannons. The ship can be expanded through adding Tetris-like pieces to the hull, slowly expanding the size until the raft has become a formidable warship. But focusing on acquiring lumber, cannons, and chests means passing up opportunities to acquire food. Players must therefore decide when to push their luck and when to play it safe.

Will you be satisfied to return to the mainland, safely and with a fully belly? Or will you risk it all to answer the siren call of gold?


Released in the March 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Badass Riders: Four Horsemen
description:
Four Horsemen expands the Badass Riders experience with two new game modes:

Cooperative Mode: Battle against the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse and their fearsome war machines in three deadly challenges.
League Mode: Place bets and collude with other drivers, upgrade and repair your vehicles, and manage your gas to win the Fuel Wasteland League.
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly: 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
The FIFA World Cup is the ultimate prize in the world's most popular sport, won only by those with belief, skill and good fortune on their side.
You'll need all of those qualities as well as the roll of the dice, to win MONOPOLY: 2018 FIFA Worfld Cup edition!/p>
You'll find the world's heavyweights and many others in the game, as the cream of world football find their home together in one place, and for the first time, this prestigious event will be hosted in Russia.
Join Zabivalia to see who will be crowned champion of MONOPOLY, the 2018 FIFA World Cup edition.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Suwałki Gap: The Baltic 2023
description:
Suwałki Gap is a two-player wargame based on hypothetical Russian attack on the Baltic States and Poland taking place sometime between 2023 and 2025.

The sides and capabilities in this game are based on current procurement, recruitment, and basing plans to the extent of publicly available information. This game in particular examines the concept of the “Suwałki Gap,” a 65km section of the Polish-Lithuanian border between Belarus and Kaliningrad, and the potential of a Russian encirclement of the Baltic States by attacking over this route.

Scale: Each hex is roughly 28Km (17.3miles) across. Each game turn represents one day. Each combat unit represents a battlegroup or task force and can be considered to include a mix of infantry, armour, artillery, and other support units.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters.

—description from the publisher

name: Junior Sagaland
description:
Junior version of Sagaland / Enchanted Forest.

All together, or everyone for themselves: Junior Sagaland offers the right adventure for everyone! An exciting memory and collecting game for children ages 3 and up.

Let's go to the magical forest of Sagaland to search for the magical items of the king. Will the players be able to bring three items to the castle before the wizard arrives there? Then the Kingdom of Sagaland is saved and the game is won.

Immerse yourself in the magical world and experience its magic up close.

—user summary

name: What the Woof
description:
What the Woof is a Dog game for card people. It's a quick fun and easy to play take-that game based on dogs marking their territory. The objective of the game is to be the Top Dog in the pack the marks the most territory (collects the most cards). Along the way you will challenge dogs, get belly rubs, chasing squirrels, dodge angry cards, bark, get treats, pee on poles and do whatever it takes it get more territory cards between your paws.

Gameplay.
The game is all about hand management. You get dealt 5 cards, and for the rest of the game, you are trying to get more territory cards by playing actions. It is a fun take-that game where you get to use a bit of strategy and have to submit to a bit of chance as well. Everyone gets two moves per turn, and you can pick up or play cards on each turn. There are also drop cards which act as curve balls that you have to deal with. You can't keep drop cards in your hand, they have to be played as soon as they are drawn from the deck. The game goes on until the draw pile is empty, and then everyone gets one last move before you count up the territory card points to see who has won.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Memory, Take That

name: Langland Yatzy
description:
Yatzy is one of the best-known and most popular dice games there is. Langland Yatzy allows kids to join the fun even if they cannot count yet, because here players use picture dice and try to roll long animals in order to score: Three of the nine dice each show heads, three dice show waists, and three dice show tails. As usual in Yatzy, players roll up to three times and can set aside or re-roll dice as they see fit in order to score the required combinations. And while players usually compete with each other, Langland Yatzy also offers a team variant.

Langland Yatzy is an easier accessible variant on the popular dice game that gets rid of the dice pips and replaces them with the cute, long animals from Langland. Players neither need to know numbers nor are they on their own, if they prefer to play the team variant.

—description from the publisher
