description:
Ritter Rost: Eisenhart & Voll Verbeult is based on the "musical book"-series and upcoming animated movie about Ritter Rost, a knight built of rusty pieces of scrap. In the game, each player has his own "Ritter Rost" tableau to equip with arms, horse, and so on. These are auctioned from three card piles: one face-down and two face-up. The players then decide when their "Ritter Rost" is ready for dice-rolling adventures. There are three adventures he has to go through successfully in the following order:


Joust
Fight a dragon
Attack the castle


On their turn, players decide whether to start an auction of one of the topmost open cards (paid with "sheet metal cards") or to send his "Ritter Rost" out to an adventure.

Auctions are held by bidding with face-down cards with values 1-8; these values are "circular", so a "1" beats an "8". Each card can be used only once and is discarded after the auction. When all cards are played, the discarded piles of each player is handed to the next player, since there are tie-breaking symbols on them.

To adventure, players equip their "Ritter Rost" with the items they gained via the auctions. Icons on these items tell how many dice the player uses trying to fulfill the adventure. To fulfill an adventure, the player reveals a matching adventure tile that tells him a number he has to reach by rolling the dice. The dice have only "positive" and "negative" sides. The player rolls all the dice he gets. All negative ones are laid aside, all positive ones are added and rolled again. Each consecutive roll is added (positive sides) or subtracted (negative sides) from the total until the number is reached, one die roll is entirely negative, or the player gives up.

Supplemental helper cards as well as cards that make adventures even harder add variety and more tactical elements to the game.

The first player who fulfills all three adventures wins the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Backyard Bugs
description:
Collect the ladybugs and katydids while avoiding stink bugs and other destructive bugs

The game play mechanics are simple. It's a collecting game that involves 52 cards of mostly insects and other creatures of the yard. What makes this game unique and different from your average trick taking game is that you don't just add your points up when all cards have been played. There's a damage phase that takes place when scoring and certain cards (or bugs) will eat other bugs. There are many different combinations of scoring that can happen depending on what you collect.

name: Stratego: Duel Masters
description:
Duel Masters Stratego is an advanced version of Stratego set in the famous Anime setting. Unlike most classic game re-themes, Duel Masters Stratego introduces rules changes that allow the game to stand on its own.

From the game's box:

When the forces face off- who will survive?

It's a face off between all of the five forces! When Light, Nature and Water take on the fearless armies of Darkness and Fire- which team will capture the enemy's flag.

Like the Kaijudo Masters themselves, STRATEGO puts you in command of armored vehicles and ruthless creatures. Mark your territory and advance your forces on the gameboard.

name: Medieval Manor
description:
"Players are the inhabitants of a small European fiefdom in the middle ages. Players use their Peasants to gather goods and score Victory Tokens."

The game is played on a modular map of terrain cards formed into a 3x4 or 4x4 grid. Victory Tokens are earned by playing Upgrade cards onto terrain cards that are compatible with the particular Upgrade. The Upgrade cards represent various types of structures, installations, and activities such as a Cattle Enclosure, Quarry, Vineyard, Smithy, University, or Guild Hall.

"The game ends the end of the turn in which any player accumulates 15 or more Victory Tokens. The winner is the player with the most Victory Tokens at the end of the game."
categories: City Building, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Medieval, Print & Play
publishers: Print & Play Productions, Warp Spawn Games

name: Maelstrom: The Coming of Chaos
description: Free game that came complete with Inquest Magazine issue number 31 (November 1997) In it up to 5 players choose one of five powers that are battling over the world.. Each player sets up on the pre-made map and then all players secretly write down a action either a attack or move. Then the results are resolved and combat or movement commences. The object of the game is to control 3 of 5 citadels on the map. Each power's troops have different statistics for combat and some have special abilities. Also each power has a special ability it make activate at a certain time.
mechanics: Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Gaukelspiel
description:
This is a seven card expansion for Beutelschneider.

It adds cards that can be played in a trick instead of cards dealt to affect the current trick. The cards are used only once and then discarded.

name: Powerplay
description:
Players strive to build an empire in a competitive world market by collecting country cards, either by pick-up or by negotiation. When tabled, a country can be invested in by using money cards and defended using defend card. Power cards can be used to expand one's own empire, or diminish another player's empire. Only undefended countries can be attacked by power cards. Open negotiation to better one's position can lead to dealings with other players in order to expand each other's empires. The wealthiest player at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:
Giant triangular box
104 cards (laminated disks)
6 Power planning mats (segments of a circle)
1 circular mat.

Published in Melbourne, Australia

name: Auf der Kippe
description: This is an abstract game. It is made of plastic. It is about weight balance. The last one who added a chip before the whole thing falls apart wins.

name: Tsushima
description:
Tsushima is a strategic game of the naval war between Russia and Japan, 1904-05. Individual ship counters range the map, searching for the enemy, and when encounters occur, engaging in combat.

Tsushima is a companion game to Port Arthur, which covers the land campaign of the Russo-Japanese War in similar detail. Both games were available in a single package, The Russo-Japanese War, which contained the combined game rules.

Contains:

rulebook
176 counters
1 map


(source: the rulebook introduction and user's description)

name: FlipQuest: "The Test" – A Thief's Quest
description:
FlipQuest is an exciting role-playing, collectible card game, where you build the gameboard as you play.

Play alone or join your friends, and defeat Orcs, Dragons, and other powerful creatures using wits, skills, and awesome magical weapons, in FlipQuest, the exciting, innovative role-playing card game where players build the game board as they play from unique card decks. Each FlipQuest adventure deck contains a separate, stand-alone game for 1-4 players, and can be combined for more characters, treasures, and monsters.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: FlipQuest: Quest for the Princess' Crystal
description:
FlipQuest is an exciting role-playing, collectible card game, where you build the gameboard as you play.

Play alone or join your friends, and defeat Orcs, Dragons, and other powerful creatures using wits, skills, and awesome magical weapons, in FlipQuest, the exciting, innovative role-playing card game where players build the game board as they play from unique card decks. Each FlipQuest adventure deck contains a separate, stand-alone game for 1-4 players, and can be combined for more characters, treasures, and monsters.

http://www3.sympatico.ca/shadowcraft/
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Professor Noggin's Pets
description:
Puppies, kittens, lizards, and turtles are just a few of the popular pets that children long to adopt. Discover interesting facts about common pets, and learn about the proper care these pets need from their human parents.

Card.topics.include:
Boas and Pythons
Cats
Chinchillas
Ferrets
Gerbils
Guinea Pigs
Hamsters
Hedgehogs
Herding Dogs
Hounds
Kittens
Lizards
Non-sporting Dogs
Parakeets
Parrots
Pedigree Cats
Potbelly Pigs
Rabbits
Rabbit Breeds
Rats
Snakes
Sporting Dogs
Tarantulas
Terriers
Toy Dogs
Tropical_Fish_(Freshwater)
Tropical Fish (Saltwater)
Turtles
White Mice
Working Dogs
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., KENSHO Kft., Outset Media

name: Tumblo!
description: Played on a 23x23 board, each player has five pieces, from a 1x1x1 cube to a 1x1x5 block. A move consists of rotating a piece about one of its sides touching the board, so you can make a piece "fall over", "stand up" or "roll". The objective is to get all your pieces off the board by moving them to the center of the board (covering the pink star). Complication is provided by if you cover one of the stars of another player's color you move one of his pieces back to the start. If you cover one of your own stars you get another turn. Half of the stars are occupied by counters, one of which is moved to immediately cover any star a piece moves off.

name: Silly Story Maker
description: From the publisher: Create and Share you Silly Stories! It's storytelling time and YOU weave the tale! Each player takes turns contributing to a story, using the Story Cards they are dealt as inspiration. Then, after creating a unique tale, players test their memories by recalling the story, and the player who remembers the most wins! Your imaginations the limit and possibilities are endless...so get ready to get silly!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Humor, Memory
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling
publishers: Fisher Price, Mattel, Inc., Playchest Games

name: Lingo
description:
Lingo is a boardless word game played with Scrabble tiles, for two or more players. It's like a relaxed version of Scrabble with free-flowing moves and high scores.

Equipment: Lingo requires a set of Scrabble tiles (with the two blanks removed), a flat surface about the size of a game board, and some method for keeping track of players' scores.

Start: Four tiles are chosen at random and placed into a pool shared by all players. Pool tiles are placed face up so that all players can see them. After each turn, new tiles are randomly selected to replenish the pool so that it always contains four tiles.

Moving: The opening player starts by taking any number of tiles from the pool and making a valid word. Thereafter, players take turns forming new words by taking any number of tiles from the pool and placing them adjacent to or on top of existing tiles. Words can be made forwards, backwards, upwards or downwards. No tile can be placed to cover the same letter.

All tiles placed per turn (if more than one) must form part of the same valid word. There are no other restrictions on placement; new tiles do not have to form valid words with tiles they are placed next to, but will score more points if they do.

If no new word can be made, then a single tile can be played for 0 pts. Players may not pass.

Scoring: After placing the tiles, new words formed that turn are counted to score points. Only the highest-valued word passing through each new tile along each axis (vertical and horizontal) is scored.

Word-length multiplier: The score for each new word is given by (total letter value) x (word length - 1).

Word-count multiplier: If more than one new word is formed, then the total word score is multiplied by the number of new words.

Winning: The game ends when there are no more tiles to play. The player with the highest score wins.

Online Play


Gamerz (turn-based, play by email or play by web)

name: DiceWarGame
description:
Iconic dice (showing modern warfare units and tactics) and a straightforward paper-rock-scissors mechanic. Dicewargame is for military enthusiasts who want to give their brains a rest from hardcore strategy.

The object is to either capture cities (best accomplished with infantry)or destroy your opponent's army. Surrender is also an option and a valid one given that you can set-up and start another game in under a minute.

Each turn a player either attacks, re-rolls or withdraws. This provides a variety of tactical options.

Once you get to grips with 'who-does-what-to-who', play tends to be quite fast. It is best played as 'best of five' or in a match of games and sets.

Available as a download from Wargame Vault

name: Kryomek: Hivestone
description:
This vital extension to the original game includes:

Expanded Background Material
Full explanations of the Solaric Rebel period, Colonial period, initial Kryomek encounters, Glindex Fork campaign, the Karanada Incident, the Kryomek Counter-Attack and subsequent Great Rebellion.

Army Lists
Guidelines for creating forces for any of the detailed historical campaigns, including Great Swarm Kryomek.
Army list for Kryomek 2nd Swarm

Points System
New system allows players to construct balanced scenarios.
Points list for human vehicles

Revised Stats
Stats for every unit in the game, revising those listed in the original rules, and adding many new unit types. Stats list for human vehicles

New Units
Including Beta and Gamma strain Kryomek, Drones (Human-Kryomek hybrids), Swarmmasters, jet bikes, twisters (landing capsules), and the Talos T62 MS Cybernetic Battle Unit.

New Rules
Covering human rebels, cyclos (neural-regulated convicts), snipers, quadruped striders, twisters, jet cycles, Cybernetic Battle Units (CBU's), vehicular passengers, beta and gamma strain Kryomek, transomatic artillery and serumic pipes, Kryomek ballistae, Swarmmasters, Drones. New rules for collisions and overruns. New weapon categories and vehicle mountings. Updates to the Morale, Close Combat, Armour rules. Optional rules for evasion and opportunity fire.

Expands

Kryomek
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Colonists of Natick
description:
Two players compete to colonize the newfound Island of Natick. A player earns victory points by expanding their colony: constructing new villages and towns, and employing traders and knights. The first colony to reach 7 victory points (VPs) will dominate the island and the local music scene.

This game is a port of Klaus Teuber's Settlers of Catan Card Game to the piecepack system. It won the Good Portsmanship piecepack design contest in March 2007.

name: Fair Play
description:
Discover the travel of cotton from the fields to the T-shirt you wear. Exchange cards and follow the thread of politically and environmentally correct manufacturing.

Illustrations and graphics by Valeria De Caterini, editing by Claudia Piacenza.

Published in Czech, Greek, Italian, Maltese, and Portuguese. In cooperation with Ctm altromercato (Verona, Italy), Gaia Education Centre (Greece), Finis Terrae (Bari, Italy), Koperattiva Kummerc Gust (Malta), La Tortuga (Padua, Italy), Mondo Solidale (Ancona, Italy), Reviravolta (Portugal), Society for Fair Trade and Development Education (Czech Republic), and Unsolomondo (Bari, Italy).
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Memory, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Open Drafting, Trading
publishers: Koperattiva Kummerċ Ġust Ltd, Pangea-Niente Troppo, Reviravolta, Society for Fair Trade and Development Education, ΕΚΠΑΙΔΕΥΤΙΚΟ ΚΕΝΤΡΟ ΓΑΙΑ (Gaia Education Centre)

name: Coin Collectors
description:
A Solitary Confinement game for the piecepack.

In this solitaire game, the player attempts to collect all of the coins in a 5x5 playing area. By rolling the dice, the player determines which tile in the 5x5 grid he can move to with his pawns. The game is won when the player collects all 24 coins. The game is lost when the player rolls the dice and none of the pawns can collect a coin.

name: El Eco de los Pasos
description:
The title, which is a straightforward, classic wargame with hex maps, attempts to simulate four different campaigns of the Spanish Civil War: Madrid, Barcelona, Valencia and Teruel. Around 200 unmounted counters represent divisions (but actual scale changes between scenarios) and supporting elements (aircraft, artillery, and tanks).

Combat resolution is quite original, resulting in "damage counters" being inflicted on the target, up to the combat factor (whose value is function of troops quality), at which point capabilities decrease radically. Periodically, the right kind of replacements remove some of the damage, resulting in very durable units but fiddly stacks.

All other aspects of the game are quite classic, from movement to victory point based on geographical objectives.

This is a wargame, dedicated to a not well-covered historical event, with an original incremental losses mechanism with four pages of basic rules.

El Eco de los Pasos, recreates four campaigns of the Spanish Civil War:
Madrid (October 1936-March 1937),
Teruel (December 1937-February 1938),
Valencia (April-July 1938)
Barcelona (December 1938-February 1939)

Division-brigade level and 3-7 days per turn.
4 DIN A3 maps, 468 counters.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Castle Wolfenstein
description: A solitaire card game inspired by the Wolfenstein 3-D video game. The object of the game is to defeat the six bosses: Hans Grosse, Dr. Shabbs, Hitler Clone, Otto Giftmacher, Gretel Grosse, and General Fettgesicht. Along the way you will also face other Wolfenstein foes – Stormtroopers, Nazi Officers, Attack Dogs, and Zombies. Your hero starts with 20 hits. If you are reduced to zero or less hits, you lose.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, World War II

name: The Amazing Mammoth Hunt
description:
From the back of the box

Do you like Treasure Hunts?

Grab your magnifying glass and detective's hat - it's time to travel the world tracking down a Mammoth! Transform yourself into a super sleuth, then armed with dice, a track, clues and a map, pit yourself against your fellow explorers as you search for mammoth footprints and discarded blueberries (our Mammoth's favourite snack)!

Each time you land on a square, try to guess where it is on the map. If you're willing to pay for the information, you can buy extra clues with special Mammoth Money. If you get the answer right, your collection of Mammoth treasure grows and your knowledge of the worlds geography increases.

Experienced explorers can play a second, even more challenging game. Using a set of quiz cards, you can launch a fast-paced battle requiring quick thinking and even quicker answers! Even if you don't manage to beat the competition, you keep the knowledge you have learned, so everyone's is a winner!

name: Im Fadenkreuz: Europa
description:
The game is about locating different places on a silent (i.e. no landmarks, towns, rivers, only borders)map of Europe. The questions on picture-cards range from: "Where is this Bridge?" to "Where is the Airport Leifur Eiriksson"?

The Players have to place cardboard rings of different diameter (which are worth the more points the smaller the ring is) on the map.

The solution is shown using the "GPS"-coordinates, not Global Positioning System but "Grüner Positionierungs-Schnürsenkel". Two shoe laces are spanned across the board. If your ring encircles the intersection point, you get the according points.

name: Solo Hex
description:
Solo Hex is a solo game of sorting by suit, played with the Decktet cards. Cards are laid out face down in a hexagon shape, with a few cards turned sideways as special cards. The top card of each stack is turned face-up to begin play. Players pick up and place suit-matching cards on top of each other. The game is won by getting all of the cards in one stack.

This is a game for the Decktet.

Game Rules:

Solo Hex on the Decktet Wiki

name: Quills
description:
In Quills, players use letter cards to form the best word – that is, the one worth the most prestige points – that they can. The words are critiqued, with the fewest critiques going to the most prestigious word. After ten rounds, the player with the fewest critiques wins.

If you can't make a long word, you can instead try to make one that ends in a string of cards of the same suit (a "meld"). Because the game combines word-forming skills with other pattern formation, a player's obscure vocabulary will help but not guarantee a win against players with more conventional vocabularies (but an eye for long melds).

name: Let's Jet
description:
From game rules for "Basic" game:

Draw three "public cards" from the Travel deck and place them directly on the map. Deal each player four Travel cards, and give each player a jet pawn and scoring chip. Each player chooses one of their cards as their starting location and puts their jet pawn on that city. Put the card they chose in front of that player to begin a scoring pile, and put their scoring chip on the 1 on the scoring track.

On a player's turn, their jet can make two "hops" as measured using the distance ruler.

Each time a player stops in a city shown on a "public card" or one of their own Travel cards, they take that card and add it to their scoring pile, then move their scoring chip on the scoring track.


=========="Advanced" game features additional rules for Event cards, Bonus abilities awarded for completing a set of three cards of the same color, and CoPilot cards awarded when another player visits a Travel card you're holding.

Bonus cards:
8x Extra jet power (longer hops)
4x Experienced flight crew (extra hop each turn)
4x Extra capacity x4 (hold more cards - also worth a bonus point)
2x Seaplane (can land in water - also worth a bonus point)
4x Collector cards that each double the value of a different color
1x Prestige card worth 3 points

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Geography, Strategy, World Facts


Sequel: Let's Drive

name: Mitch
description:
From Pagat:

Mitch uses a standard 52 card deck, with cards ranked from King high, to Two low.

The goal of the game is to win suits, by having more cards in that suit when the play ends than the other players have.

Suits are collected in columns. Each column contains cards of a single suit, arranged in descending order from top to bottom. You cannot have more than one column of the same suit. You can only add a card of a suit that you already have if it is lower in rank than the lowest card in your column for that suit.

The game ends shortly after the third Ace is drawn.

name: Gothic Checkers
description:
Gothic Checkers is an old German draughts variant (known as "Altdeutsche Dame" in Germany), which was influenced by Turkish Draughts. It is played on an 8x8 square board. Each player starts with 16 stones, 8 on each of the two back ranks. Soldiers move one cell diagonally forward and capture in any of the five cells directly forward, diagonally forward, or sideways. Soldiers promote on the last row. Kings may move and attack in any of the eight directions. Kings can only attack adjacent pieces. The player who captures all enemy stones wins. If there are several choices, the player must capture the largest number.

Variant:

Kings move and capture in any distance like the so-called flying kings in Dama (Turkish Draughts) or International Draughts.

name: Tribes of Legend
description:
A hardback book featuring three games based on Greek mythology. The three sets are:

Tribes of Legend: This is a miniatures game involving armies of humans, centaurs and satyrs. Combat is dice-driven, movememtn is simple, and the basic grouping for all activities is the unit (as opposed to individual figures). Rules are provided for terrain effects, and each faction has its own special rules. The overall game rules are very simple, shunning the usual complexity of miniatures rules.

Ancient Heroes: a miniatures skirmish game for smaller battles. This is a playing card driven battle game, where individual figures move around the tabletop and draw cards to perform tasks and fight battles. Different fighting abilities and levels of armour are represented by differing card values in the game. Ordinary playing cards are used to play with.

Trials of a Demigod: a solitaire quest driven by action cards.This is mostly an exercise in pulling cards and seeing the total they add up to - nicely presented but not very much of a game.

name: Sammelsurium
description:
The game consists of tiles showing postage stamps. The tiles are shuffled and placed on the table in a grid, leaving some spaces free. Each player gets a secret collector's interest tile, showing which kind of stamps s/he collects.
In a turn, the active player picks up a tile, shows it to everyone and places it facedown in one of the free spaces in the grid. This continues until all tiles have been flipped over. In subsequent turns, a player can either swap two facedown tiles, move a facedown tile to an empty space or flip open a tile, putting it back to where it was.
When a player thinks that there are five stamps of his/her field of interest in a row, s/he flips these open to check. If correct, points are scored. Other players get as many points as "their" tiles are in a row as well.
The player who scored most points after a certain number of rounds is the winner.

name: Gregs Tagebuch: Eier Matsch
description:
Nobody wants to be holding the egg (= an egg-shaped, battery-powered timer) when it cracks. To get rid of it, the active player has to name a word that fits a category from the current card, e.g. "pizza toppings". He/she then passes it on to the next player or returns it to the player he/she got it from. The player who is holding the egg when it makes a cracking sound loses the current round. He/she gets the current topic card and starts a new round by turning over the top card from the stack.
A player who has collected three cards is eliminated from the game. The game continues until there is only one player left. This player wins the game.
If a player uses a word that another player has already used this round (and the other players notice), he has to keep the egg until he/she can think of another suitable word.

name: Super Soaker Twister
description:
Super Soaker Twister is an outdoor game with the unusual requirement of a garden hose. A large, perforated vinyl mat is attached to a garden hose, which results in thin streams of water being emitted from the mat. Players place their hands and feet on colored circles on the mat, as dictated by a waterproof spinner. Example moves include "left foot green" and "right hand red."

The object is to move as directed by the spinner, while only allowing your hands and feet to touch the mat. The player who can do this for the longest duration is the winner. As the vinyl mat becomes increasingly wet, moving without falling becomes more difficult.

Players familiar with outdoor games from the 70s and 80s might recognize this as a combination of Slip 'n Slide and Twister.

name: Kill the Overlord: Village Sot
description:
"Pay 1 to the Prince during the Income Phase. Whenever you give the Execution Order to another player, both of you take a drink (of soda or something)!"

Originally given to every Kickstarter backer as apology for the delay, and a thanks for being so patient. (From Update #38 of the Kickstarter project)

name: Unsun karuta
description:
A traditional Japanese trick-taking card game based on the European game Ombre (originally "l'Hombre"), played with a special 75-card five-suited deck. This deck developed from Tenshō karuta, itself a close copy of the 48-card traditional Portuguese cards called "dragon cards" due to the dragons holding the suit symbols in the aces. Its creation was prompted by a ban on the older form of playing cards after Japan closed off the contact with the Western world in 1633, and became critical towards everything of European origin. Sunkun karuta took this game one step further.

The deck contains all 48 cards from Tenshō karuta; these are supplemented by introducing a fifth suit and increasing the number of cards in each suit from twelve to fifteen. Most additions refer to Japanese and Chinese culture, presumably a conscious choice intended to downplay the European origins of the game.

The suits are はう (hau), "flower" based on Portuguese 'paus' meaning "clubs", いす (isu) a shortened form of 'espadas' or "swords", こっぷ (koppu) from 'copas' or "cups", おうる (ōru) from 'ouros' or "coins" (literally "golds") and finally the added ぐる (guru) with the traditional Japanese 三つ巴 (mitsudomoe) sign as suit symbol. As in the European predecessor games, higher-numbered pip cards beat lower ones only in the former two suits, while the latter ones are "reversed".

The "dragon aces" are split into two distinct ranks by reintroducing a normal "one" in each suit and separate from the ろばい (robai) or "dragon" which normally ranks right above the ones. Above the number cards (1–9 plus robai) there are five court cards. From low to high, these are: そうた (sōta) "queen", うま (uma) "horse", きり (kiri) "soldier" (originally a king), うん (un) various Japanese mythological figures and すん (sun) various Chinese officials. The latter two ranks give the game its name. In the trump suit, the robai is promoted to above the kiri and the sōta above this again, except that the robai of hau is a permanent trump which is the fourth highest regardless of which suit is trump.

name: ESSEN: Live!
description:
ESSEN: Live! is one of the ESSEN bonus tiles

When playing with the bonus tiles, players have one additional action during the Action phase. By placing their player token next to the bonus tiles, a player is allowed to either place a bonus disc on to a tile, or move one disc from one tile to another. If a disc is moved away away from a track, all progress made on that track is lost.

The bonus tiles are all intended for games with at least 3 players.

When the players are using one or two bonus tiles, use 1 bonus disc per player.
When the players are using three or four bonus tiles, use 2 bonus discs per player.

ESSEN: Live!
Every year there are hundreds of board game geeks who can’t make it to ESSEN. These unfortunate souls watch from their computers while the newest games are presented by their designers via a live feed, right from the fair.

When placing a disc here, place it on the first numbered space. In each subsequent activation of this tile, the disc advances on a track, which corresponds to 1,1,2,2,4,4,6, or 10 bonus points at the end of the game. If a disc is moved away from this track, all progress is lost.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Worker Placement

name: ESSEN: CW & WC
description:
ESSEN: CW & WC is one of the ESSEN bonus tiles

When playing with the bonus tiles, players have one additional action during the Action phase. By placing their player token next to the bonus tiles, a player is allowed to either place a bonus disc on to a tile, or move one disc from one tile to another. If a disc is moved away away from a track, all progress made on that track is lost.

The bonus tiles are all intended for games with at least 3 players.

When the players are using one or two bonus tiles, use 1 bonus disc per player.
When the players are using three or four bonus tiles, use 2 bonus discs per player.

ESSEN: CW & WC
While many forget to eat anything at all, booth staff at ESSEN must occasionally have something to eat. When that happens, options are limited, but a Currywurst stand is never far. Motivated by the semblance of nourishment, morale rises, and the whole booth benefits. However, this is not without sometimes sudden and inevitable consequences...

When moving into the CW, and while a player’s disc is there, a player can always move ahead one step in turn order during the Cleanup phase - ie. if 3rd, they become 2nd. Their disc must remain in the CW and continues to give this benefit in each subsequent Cleanup phase.

A disc in CW may only be displaced when another player places a disc there. The displaced disc is placed in “WC”, where it must remain until it can be moved again.

A disc in WC does not give any benefit. It may be moved again in one of two ways:
When yet another player places a disc in CW, causing the disc there to be moved to WC, which frees the disc currently in WC.
OR
If there is still a disc in WC at the Cleanup phase of an afternoon round (2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th), it becomes available for use again in the next turn.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Worker Placement

name: ESSEN: Waffles & Crepes
description:
ESSEN: Waffles & Crepes is one of the ESSEN bonus tiles

When playing with the bonus tiles, players have one additional action during the Action phase. By placing their player token next to the bonus tiles, a player is allowed to either place a bonus disc on to a tile, or move one disc from one tile to another. If a disc is moved away away from a track, all progress made on that track is lost.

The bonus tiles are all intended for games with at least 3 players.

When the players are using one or two bonus tiles, use 1 bonus disc per player.
When the players are using three or four bonus tiles, use 2 bonus discs per player.

ESSEN: Waffles & Crepes
Sometimes, a waffle or a crepe with hazelnut-chocolate spread on it can make up for the paltry salary of booth staff.

When first placing a disc here, place it on the “0” space. In each subsequent activation of this tile, the disc advances on a track which corresponds to a discount of 0, 1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 3, 4 money when paying sellers during the Booth Setup phase. If a disc is moved away from this track, all progress is lost.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Worker Placement

name: Video Game High School: Freddie Wong
description: Promotional item included with the purchase of Video Game High School from Plaid Hat Games web store. The promo introduces the Freddie Wong character, with a cardboard standee and character cards for use in the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Babylon 5: The Board Game – 2259 Starter Kit – Centauri
description:
In the Babylon 5 Component Game System, you take control of a certain faction which is trying to gain power in the galaxy. You play the role of an ambassador on board Babylon 5. You explore the vast stretches of space, lead huge fleets into battle, and control the economy of your faction. There are several ways to achieve victory ranging from economic growth to all out militaristic control of the universe. Diplomacy is not to be neglected either, as the more powerful game changes are brought up in Babylon 5 council vote to be decided.

You construct your playing 'board' using hexagonal shaped pieces that come with the game. The various pieces are different and can represent a multitude of things so that the game is different every time you play. In addition to the board and the ships that move on it, there are cards. Players may buy cards allowing special actions above and beyond the normal game, like an extra move or more EPs.

Using your faction's wealth and resources you play the game and explore the map. You search for planets to colonize and possibly conquer. Use your fleets to engage in battles and use characters to assist you in reaching your faction's goals. The choices are yours and will decide if your faction is successful.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Energy Expansion Deck B
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Red deck has an Energy based theme which also includes power, invisible forces, and extraordinary cards such as Gone In Twelve Seconds which can destroy a city and Death Delay which allows your bunny to live past its time!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Doggy Go! Plus
description:
Old dogs can be taught new tricks! Let’s find out how incredible those doggy acrobats can be!

All rules remain the same as the base game with the following modifications:
1.Deal one Red and one Green Ball card to each player.
2.Put the Acrobat cards from the base game back to the game box. They won’t be used in the game.
3.Some Acrobat cards show fewer dogs on them. When completing these cards, simply put unused Doggy tiles aside.
4.Scoring:
(1)Each Acrobat card is worth 1 VP.
(2)Each set of three Acrobat cards of different colors grants 3 VP.
(3)The player with the most Acrobat cards of the same color gains 5 VP. If tied, no players gain the bonus.

name: Sacramento
description:
In Sacramento, players draft cards from a common pool to create the strongest poker hand.

Played over multiple rounds. Each round a set number of cards are placed face up to a common pool. Each turn, a player chooses one of the cards from the pool and adds it to their hand of cards. This occurs until everyone has seven cards in hand. From those seven cards, each player builds their best five-card poker hand and is awarded points based on the strength of that poker hand. Whoever has the most points after all the rounds are played out, wins.

Sacramento is in the same family as Bonanza and Nugget.

Played with a standard deck of cards, published in Reiner Knizia's book Blazing Aces!: A Fistful of Family Card Games.
publishers: Convivium Publications, FRED Distribution, Inc., Hugendubel Verlag

name: Catan: 999 Games 25 jaar Expansion
description:
A new expansion published in the 999 games 25 years gift box. It adds a new tile, a joker and gift tokens to the game. It seems it is more intended as a fun promo extension than a serious addition to the game.

The tile replaces the tile on which the number "2" is placed. The number "2" is then placed at the same tile as the number "12". Place the joker on the new tile.

The joker gives away "gift tokens" that can be traded for resource cards.
This expansion increases the strategic value of wool, which in the basic game is considered the least attractive commodity. Furthermore, the Joker is useful to chase the robber and/or to protect a land tile.

This item is contained in 999 Games trakteert!.

This is identical except in artwork and theme to the Catan Mini-expansion in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015.

name: 12 Days of Munchkin Christmas Coloring Book
description:
Description from the publisher:

The 12 Days of Munchkin Christmas Coloring Book is a 28-page coloring book that illustrates Christmas the Munchkin way – by showing just how much havoc Spyke wreaks with his chainsaw on each of the twelve days of Christmas! Hint: Many orcs, trolls, and other fantasy creatures did in fact die in the making of this product. So color it yourself, or give it to your real munchkins so they can learn all about monster-killing!

The book also comes with ten unique Munchkin cards, which means when you're done coloring, you can shuffle some new cards right into any Munchkin game and do some slaying of your own.

name: Meu Jardim
description:
Meu Jardim (My Garden, in Portuguese) is a tile placement game, similar to dominoes, that focus on color perception and attention.
The game comes with 45 hexagonal tiles, each one showing an unique combination of 3 from 5 types of flowers. Each player must place its tiles touching at least 2 other pieces whose sides match in their colors. Different from dominoes, the hexagons make a closed grid, that forms the garden. That way, each play creates a new garden.
The game can be competitive -win who puts down all their pieces- or can be cooperative. In this mode, players help each other to build gardens based on one of the 27 templates that comes in the manual. This mode can also be played solo, as a puzzle.

Designed by Rafael Arrivabene with art from Luiza Sequeira

name: Quickpick: Mutant Dinosaur Park
description: Quickpick: Mutant Dinosaur Park, the second title in the Quickpick games line, challenges players to pay close attention to everyone around the table, with the gameplay combining humor, dexterity, and simultaneous action. On a turn, the imitator draws a dinosaur card and tries to recreate the sound he imagines the dinosaur would create, while the other players try to guess which dinosaur they are acting out. If a player guesses correctly, both guesser and imitator collect a card. Whoever collects the most cards by the end of the game wins.

name: Fantasy-Opoly
description:
Escape from Reality with Fantasy-Opoly
Summon a Fellowship and March to Quest!
Who hasn't dreamed of being a legendary hero? Of being sent on a magical quest to save a princess, fight a dragon, or find the long lost treasure? Prepare to brave the battlegrounds of light and dark!

Collect your favorite mythical creatures and amass a fortune by trading Runestones in for Keys to the Keep. It’s all fun and games until you wake the dragon and you’re sent to the Dungeon for three turns!

Who knows? You may soon be knighted by the King… or eaten by trolls! Whatever happens, this is a game where you are the hero,and the fate of the earth rests in your hands.

On a player's turn they move their token around the board and purchase properties. When they land on other player's own property they have to pay rent.

Once a player can not pay another player due to being out of funds or property, they are out of the game. The object of the game is to be the last player standing with properties and currency.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Rival Realms: Far Frontiers Expansion
description:
Fantastiqa Rival Realms: Far Frontiers Expansion adds powerful Relics to Rival Realms.

Components:
2 - Player Aid Cards
2 - Enchantment Cards
2 - Quest Cards
14 - Relic Tokens
1 - Instructions

Relics are chosen at random and placed in the 4 corners of your Realm. You must explore the corner regions of your Realm to claim the Relics!

Fantastiqa Rival Realms is a standalone game for two players, and the Final Frontiers expansion is a separate addition for the game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Black Stories: Daily Disasters Edition
description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with riddle stories about stupid mishaps from real life.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
publishers: Kaissa Chess & Games, moses. Verlag GmbH, Tucker's Fun Factory B.V.

name: Art Deck
description:
Art Deck is a drawing game for 2-6 players. Players are dealt cards from a deck of instructional sentence fragments ("what do to do", "how to do it" and "something that makes it difficult") and deal out a starting sentence with one of each. (eg. "Draw eyes / across half the page / without taking your marker off the page.")

On your turn, you play a card onto the sentence, replacing the previous one in that position, and then contribute to a communal drawing, obeying the sentence's instruction.

The game continues until someone plays a "sign your name" card and signs the artwork, completing it.

name: Rummy Five
description:
Rummy Five is a small-sized rummy game for 2-4 players, played with a 32-card deck. Player's main goal is to make a 5-card combination (a hand of 4 cards plus one drawn from the deck) including a pair and a 3-card run or set, before the others. After the predetermined deals, the player with the highest score wins.

It is also necessary to declare "Go" call or make some special combination to win a deal; however, after calling "Go" you cannot change your hand, or some of high-score combinations are made hard to complete. Some additional calls, "Run", "Set" and "Catch", can be made for capturing other players' discards to make a meld or complete a combination faster.

Rummy Five is a transcription of Xiangqi Mahjong (Chinese Chess Rummy), a Taiwanese traditional game, arranged to be played easily and somewhat well-balanced.

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer Armies (Fifth Edition): High Elves
description:
Warhammer Armies: High Elves is an expansion to the 5th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 112-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect High Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Shady Agents
description:
Truth or lie, who's on your side?
You are all Undercover Agents hired to investigate each other. Some of you are law-abiding agents fighting for justice. Others are crooked operatives corrupting the law. You all meet at the same rendezvous point, but since everyone is undercover, no one is sure who is on their side. To signal to one another, law-abiding agents always speak the truth and corrupted operatives lie. One bullet left to hurt the defector. A medical kit to heal your fellow operative. So, truth or lie, who's on your side?

What's in the game :
10 Character Cards (5 Law Abiding Operatives and 5 Corrupt Defectors)
20 Power Cards (10 Medical Kits and 10 Bullets)
10 Color Id Cards
100 Questions (50 Cards)
1 Rulebook
1 Marker to indicate turn

How to play :
In this game of 4 to 10 players, you will take on a role as either a LAW ABIDING OPERATIVE or a CROOKED DEFECTOR. Each role remains hidden and your objective is to help your allies and harm your foes. But how? Depending on your spy code, you will communicate to your team using either lies or truths.

Once you determine your fellow members, hurt players on the opposing team with the BULLET and heal those on your side with the MEDICAL KIT.

For each BULLET wound received, your team loses a point. For each MEDICAL KIT you receive, your team will gain one point. Side with the highest score wins.

If there is an EVEN number of players, shuffle together a deck of character cards with half the players on the Law Abiding Operative side and half on the Corrupted Defector side. Randomly distribute one to each player. Players must keep their role card secret during the gameplay.

Each player also takes a set of tool cards: One BULLET and One MEDICAL KIT. If there is an ODD number of players, select two even sets of ROLE cards (one more card than the number of players). Deal out the ROLE cards and reveal the last one. The team revealed will receive a scoring bonus at the end, to compensate for a fewer player.

RULES

There are two rounds in this game.

Round 1: Gameplay begins with each player getting a choice to MAKE A MOVE or CALL FOR AN INTERROGATION.

MAKE A MOVE: When a player makes a move, they take one of their Tools, either Bullet or Medical Kit, and gives it to another player. The Tool Card remains facedown. Only the player who received the tool card can look at it. Send Medical Kits to your teammates to score, and fire your BULLET at the other team to reduce their point total.

CALL FOR AN INTERROGATION: If you need more information, you may select one of your Tools, either Bullet or Medical Kit, and discard it without revealing to “Call For An Interrogation.”

Draw the next Interrogation Card and read it aloud. Starting with the next player clockwise, they must make a statement that answers the card. Law Abiding Agents, they must answer honestly. Corrupted Agents, they must tell a lie.

Feel free to discuss! Because the first player has less information to act on, that player does not have to give up one of their tools to Call For An Interrogation.

Second Round: After each player has had a turn to either Make A Move or Call For An Interrogation, in reverse order, each person now plays their remaining tool card. There is no more Interrogating in the second round. Gameplay ends with the first player distributing both of their Tool cards at the same time.

End Game: All the players reveal their Role Cards. All Tools are turned over. Your team gets +1 for each Medical Kit and -1 for each Bullet played on you. Team with the highest score wins. If there is an odd number players, the team with less players gets an additional +1 point. If there is a tie, the team with the most MEDIPACKS wins.

name: The Omaha Beach Landings
description:
Part of Against the Odds Magazine's Pocket Battle Games series, this is the second of their "Five For Fighting" series of linked games covering the D-Day invasion.

Pocket Battle Game #22

name: MechAge: Countdown
description:
The giant monster Varanor has been defeated, but he was only the beginning... The lab techs have analyzed the mutations of this monster and it is unlike aynthing seen before. It appears that Varanor was exposed to a new form of alien radiation were calling "Nova".

We've traced Nova to a small but fortified enemy research base, and our intel reports that they are preparing to launch a missile that will spread Nova across the globe creating millions of super monsters. We don't know their motivations, but you must stop that launch at all costs...

Adventure scenario expansion for MechAge.


The scenario consists in 1 Scenario card and 2 Mech cards:

Rules booklet
Countdown Scenario card
Twin Cannon Mech card
Personnel Carrier Mech card


Players are expected to provide their own tokens for this scenario:

1 Countdown token
1 Gate Guns token
1 Attack Target token
6 Destruction tokens
6 Scan Value tokens



Released in the July 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: UNO: Nonpartisan
description: Uno with red and blue cards replaced with orange and purple, and with a Veto card to show if anyone starts talking politics. Otherwise, Uno.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Take That

name: WWE: Headlock, Paper, Scissors
description:
WWE: Headlock, Paper, Scissors is a game of striking, showboating, and making hand signals! Players select their favorite superstar from the twelve included in the game — e.g., Roman Reigns, Kofi Kingston, Becky Lynch, and Asuka — then work to gain the most popularity and reach the briefcase at the top of a 3D ladder while making sure their opponents don't get there first.

Each round, players select a shared technique or their superstar's signature technique, then simultaneously chant "Money!" "In The!" "Bank!" before revealing their technique and their target. Comeback cards and the Underdog token mean that you're never more than a few well-chosen techniques away from the lead!

—description from the publisher

262 is a wargame showing the fights of fighter and bomber planes over Europe in 1944-45. Players may perform air operations as pilots of Lutwaffe, British RAF or US Air Force. Air combat, fight against bombers expeditions or their protection are the main tasks of the players. The variety of scenarios guarantees fast and excellent play.
—description from the publisher

262 to gra strategiczna ukazująca walki powietrzne samolotów myśliwskich i bombowych nad Europą w latach 1944-45. Gracze mogą prowadzić działania powietrzne wcielając się w pilotów Luftwaffe, brytyjskiego RAF lub US Air Force. Walki powietrzne, zwalczanie wypraw bombowych lub ich osłona to główne zadania graczy. Różnorodność scenariuszy gwarantuje szybką i doskonałą grę.
—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Catan: First Adventure
description:
The kids on Catan are adventurous, learning to sail at a young age and wanting to spend their time sailing around the small offshore islands and playing exciting games. Today, you are playing pirates and want to build camps and a fort faster than anyone else.

In Catan: First Adventure, you start with a pirate camp that sits across two of the islands in the larger ring of islands. Each island depicts a resource, and you start with one of each of the resources showing on the islands under your camp.

On a turn, you first roll the six-sided die. On a result of 1-5, all players take a resource from the reserve if they have a camp on an island with a matching number; on a result of 6, you move the Ghost Captain to an island of your choice, taking two of the resource depicted there. No one else can claim resources from this island as long as the Ghost Captain remains there.

You then move the single ship on its course clockwise around the island. If you have one of each resource — molasses, wood, goat, cutlass — you can build a camp on an empty space adjacent to the ship. If you don't have what you need, you can trade any two resources for one of your choice, or you can spend a wood and a goat for random help from Coco the parrot. You don't know what Coco might give you, but ideally it's better than the wood and goat you just sacrificed to him!

After you build all your camps, you can build a fort on an empty space by spending two of each resource, and whoever does so first wins.

name: Lava
description:
Lava is a territorial stacking game for two players, Red and Black. Play using a Hexhex board of edge size 4, and a sufficient supply of Red/Black stacking checkers. To setup, place one Red and one Black checker in opposite corners of the hex hex board.

On each turn, take N checkers (where N is any number from 1 to stack size) from the top of a stack you control and move them N spaces in a straight line to a destination containing N or less checkers. Then, add a new checker of your color to the destination. Stacks may not jump over enemies, but may land on enemy or friendly stacks, thereby burying them.

When the board is full, the player controlling more stacks wins the game.

Lava was designed by Michael Amundsen and Alek Erickson in August 2021.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Automatic Resource Growth, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Stacking and Balancing

name: Slam Words
description:
Slam Words is the fastest word search game ever. Shake the cup, then slam it shut to lock in the dice and reveal three letters. Quickly find a word that uses these three letters, then pass the cup to the next player, who has to find a new word — or they are out.

Slam Words is part of FoxMind's "Slam Dice" portable game collection.

name: Stranger Things: Escape Game – Salvate Will & Undici
description:
A card game that simulates an escape room, full of references to the Stranger Things series! Following the game stages, you will explore the city of Hawkins immersing yourself totally in a fantastic adventure !!

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Kortspelet Klimatkoll
description:
Does a trip by air across the Atlantic have a greater climate impact than eating a steak a day for a year? Does one year’s heating of a house have greater impact than the trip? Players of Climate Call get to learn how the climate is affected by everyday life. The game is guaranteed to lead to lively discussion and eureka moments! The estimations of climatic impacts are based on calculations by researchers at Chalmers University of Technology.

In Kortspelet Klimatkoll the players compete to get rid of their cards first. To get rid of acard, it needs to be placed in the right place on the emission line, which consists of cards that are arranged according to how much emission their activities cause. The challenge is to guess what causes more or less emissions in relation to other activities.

—user summary

name: Wie die Wombats
description:
Wie die Wombats is a fast-paced cooperative eye and head twister where much is much less than it seems.
Together, the players estimate as quickly and correctly as possible where how many wombats are scurrying across playing cards. To do this, they have to lay out the cards in a pattern that shows the animals in ascending order. With each round, the scurrying gets wilder as more and more marsupials appear. Part of the teamwork is to turn over the sand timer every time a minute consists of fewer seconds than you would have estimated. In 5 short rounds, you learn to appreciate the estimation of your fellow players.

—description from the publisher

name: Suspects: Mörderischer Marathon
description:
Wembley Stadium is now a crime scene! Runners from all over the world wanted to win the marathon race here, but now things have turned out differently with the firing of the starting gun...

In Suspects: Mörderischer Marathon, the player must solve this case together with detective Claire Harper. Throughout the fascinating story, you must collect clues, question suspects, discuss evidence, and investigate the crime scene. Will you rise to the challenge?

name: Damask: Gamefound Expansion Cards
description:
Shuffle the cards in with the rest of the Damask cards into the bag. These three cards play as regular Damask cards but with three exceptions.

1. The pattern does not count as one of the patterns for the bonus points from mounting all 4 patterns and is never considered fashionable.
2. The pattern only matches up with other Gamefound promo patterns.
3. Each card only needs 2 background colour cubes to complete instead of 3.

name: Undersea Explorer
description:
Dive and grab fast.
Research the ocean! Roll the dice and the dive begins: search the deep sea cards and find the suitable swarm. But the glowing sea animals never stand still. Look closely and don‘t go wrong, else there are penalties.

Abgetaucht und schnell geschnappt.
Erforscht den Ozean! Die Würfel fallen und euer rasanter Tauchgang beginnt: Durchwühlt gleichzeitig die Tiefseekarten und findet den passenden Unterwasserschwarm. Doch die leuchtenden Meerestiere stehen nicht still! Schaut genau hin und vergreift euch nicht, sonst gibt‘s Minuspunkte. Wer in fünf Tauchgängen die wenigsten Minuspunkte sammelt gewinnt.

name: Maple Valley: Roaming Raven and Feathered Friends Mini-Expansions
description:
Roaming Raven Mini-Expansion includes:

1 Wooden and screened Raven bit
1 rules card


Feathered Friends Mini-Expansion includes:

10 Feathered Friend cards
12 Wooden and screened feathers
1 rules card

name: La Batalla de las Ardenas
description:
The Ardennes Offensive, officially named the Battle of the Ardennes by the U.S. Army (and known to the general public as the Battle of the Bulge), started on December 16, 1944. The goal of these operations as planned by the Germans was to split the British and American Allied line in half, capturing Antwerp and then proceeding to encircle and destroy four Allied armies, forcing the Western Allies to negotiate a peace treaty in the Axis' favor.

This NAC game represents the important battle of WWII.

name: Guildraft
description:
This game was included with the IoGioco magazine (issue number 10).

Hire the best characters to find the best treasures and make your guild rich.
The player who earns the best total value of treasures at the end of the game is the winner.

The game has two phases: the character selection phase and the treasure conquest phase.
In the first phase every player is dealt an equal amount of cards; then each player will draft his own characters by choosing one from his hand and passing the rest, going on until cards are finished. This will form his hand in the second phase
In the second phase treasure cards are revealed and every player chooses simultaneously a card from his hand. The highest character card chooses the treasure first, after character effects are applied.

At the end the value of each treasure is summed up and trophies are awarded based on number of treasures of a certain kind; highest value wins the game.

—user summary

name: Shop Until You Drop
description:
Play as your favourite Mr Kiasu* characters in this push-your-luck card game about going to a sale and grabbing the best deals.

Each turn, pick an item from the sale display. But beware - the items with the most points may be the hardest to fit into your bags! Each of the player's three bags can only carry items of the same discount and different type, or the same type with a maximum of 100%!

One player for sure will shop until they DROP (a bag), so don't be the one to lose your shopping. Which player can grab the best discounts over the sale weekend?


Mr Kiasu is perhaps the most well-known comic character in Singapore, especially famous in the 90s.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Vice Versa
description:
Whenever we see a game about crossed words formed by letter tiles, we tend to think, "Scrabble". Wörterklauer has almost nothing in common with that ubiquitous game, other than the fact that you cross words orthogonally with letter tiles. The board has no special spaces because there is no score to tally. In fact, all the spaces are designed to facilitate flipping the tiles over....

Wörterklauer works like this: On your turn, you form as many words as you can, then leave the board for your opponent to try to convert letters and words. Any word whose root she can alter by appending to it or changing one letter, any letter she uses in her word, and any crossed words tweaked (you're allowed to change one extra letter in one of the two crossed words), convert to her color by flipping over. If you can't end your turn with more letters in your color than in your opponent's, you lose the game, simple as that.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Spelling, Square Grid, Tile Placement
publishers: Hallmark Games, Otto Maier Verlag, Steffen-Spiele

name: Ancient Conquest II
description:
Multi-player wargame based on ancient warfare in the eastern Mediterranean, featuring the Peloponnese War, Greco-Persian wars, the rise of Alexander the Great of Macedonia, to just before the beginnings of the Roman era.

The innovative victory system requires each player to assume the control of multiple nations listed on their player card (Group One, Two, Three and Four). They win by achieving the most historical objective points listed on their card. Each player has different objectives listed by the peoples/nations of their group.

Each turn begins with 5-minutes of negotiation and open discussion/diplomacy.

Components include:

(1) 8-page rulebook
(1) Full-color, 22x34" map
(2) Counter sheets (400) Counters
(4) Player Objective Cards (order of appearance/setup on the back)
(1) 2-sided Charts/CRT card
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: HolyPoop
description:
Holy Poop is the game where players take turns taking a dump!
Cap a poo pile to make it yours.
The player with the biggest poo pile wins.

Test your brains and your bowels New age strategy game!

name: Robo Battle Pigs
description:
Robo Battle Pigs is a game in which the object is to destroy your opponent's Robo Battle Pig by inflicting five points of damage with your laser or powerful robot fist. It was a finalist in the 2001 8×8 Game Design Competition sponsored by About Board Games, Abstract Games Magazine, and the Strategy Gaming Society.

Robo Battle Pigs is a lighthearted programmed movement battle game played on an 8x8 board using 1 token with a distinct front for each player. Players program a sequence of 5 moves for their Robo Battle Pig(RBP) using pen & paper, then simultaneously execute the program 1 step at a time. RBPs may move in several directions, fire a laser, swing their snout, rest, or regenerate. When an RBP is damaged, it loses one programming step. When 5 points of damage have been received, the RBP is destroyed. Last pig standing wins.
mechanics: Action Queue, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Who Said That?
description: Who Said That? is a party-style self-expression game, in which players write down their own answers to a common question posed to everyone. The playing objective is for each player to accurately predict which opponent provided which answer, although the real point of the game is as a conversation starter.

name: Celtic!
description:
Players take turns placing tiles showing knotwork segments within a 5x5 grid. They may place either a tile of their colour or a neutral (white) tile each turn.

A player wins by having the highest score at the end of the game, given by the number of their tiles visited by a single knot.

name: Parallelo
description: In Parallelo, each player starts with three pawns in each of six colors. Players take turns placing the pawns in indentations in a parallelogram-shaped layout on the wooden game board. Your goal is to create a parallelogram with four pawns of the same color — but since you have only three of each color, you need to make use of pawns placed by your opponent in order to do so. Whoever first creates three parallelograms wins.

name: Kanoodle Head-to-Head
description: Two-player, competitive version of the puzzle Kanoodle. A challenge card is played between the players, showing the set up for the present game. Each player sets up the game on their own personal board. When the game starts, players use the remaining game pieces to fill up the area on their board without leaving any open space. First player do so wins the round. The game ends after a prearranged number of rounds.

name: Dice & Danger: Dragon's Lair
description:
The dragon Firethrax has left his lair to take a bath in a nearby lake, leaving his treasure unguarded. Your band of adventurers teleports to his treasure to claim it, but you must evade traps and battle monsters to escape. Just when you think you have reached the exit, Firethrax returns to stop you! Which adventurer among you will defeat the dragon to claim victory?

Dice & Danger: Dragon's Lair is a board game designed to introduce younger children to the basic concepts of fantasy role-playing games. It is a simple race game in which players try to be the first to defeat the dragon at the last space on the board. Players take on the roles of various fantasy characters and start the game with three treasure cards, which allow them to perform actions or add to their combat die roll. A ten-sided die determines movement and combat. The spaces on the board are either free spaces or encounter spaces. The encounter spaces can be traps, monsters, or the single Holy Fountain treasure space. The monsters become progressively more difficult to defeat along the track, culminating in Firethrax the dragon. Defeating a monster rewards the player with a new treasure card, but losing to a monster means losing the next turn. The first player to defeat Firethrax wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Corsaire
description:
In Corsaire, the players take on the role of merchants and privateers - trading in the first half of the game and looting in the second.

The cards in the game have a number, one of three suits/colors, and a way to convert resources (e.g. change one red into two blue). In the first half of the game, players are building a pyramid on their side, starting with the base. Whenever a player adds a card to the 2nd level or higher, they can activate that card's trading ability, and then trace that back to the base of the pyramid, activating any cards along the way that they desire. Ultimately the path will trace back to some ship boards in the middle which hold both the cards the players will refill their hands with, as well as a cost to buy the ship board.

Once the players' are finished building their pyramid, the looting begins. Players will form 3-card poker type hands on each of the ship boards. They can choose from the cards remaining in their hands or the cards in their pyramid; however, to choose cards from the pyramid, they must "unbuild" the pyramid from the top and can only access uncovered cards. Once the players have both added 3 cards to each board, the boards are evaluated and points are awarded.

The player with the most points from the boards acquired during trading and the boards acquired during looting wins.

name: Monopoly Pizza Game
description:
In Monopoly Pizza Game, players move around the game board trying to buy as many types of pizza as they can, from pepperoni to spinach to mushroom. Instead of buying properties or collecting rent, players aim to collect a color set that corresponds to a type of pizza, such as veggie lovers, barbecue chicken, or even mac and cheese. A full set of flavors combines to make an awesome new pizza, giving those cards a higher value.

At the end of the game, the player who collects the most pizza slices wins!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Alien Labyrinth
description:
Alien Labyrinth Twists and Turns in Outer Space

Cool Factors:
- A randomized board of rotating rooms
- Simple rules with complex strategy
- Space Cats, Displacer Beams, and the Neutron Burrito!

Description:
Stranded aboard an alien space station millions of miles from Earth, your only hope of getting home is to outrace your companions and buy the only seat on the last space taxi leaving. It won't be an easy task. The station itself is constantly changing as you move through it, making every step a challenge.

As you explore the station, you'll find all kinds of strange souvenirs the aliens have collected on their travels. Gadgets, weapons, clothing, food and even a few mysterious specimens that can only be loosely defined as creatures. Collect what you can and trade it away to afford your ride back home. But beware the others and what they might do with the things they find, and never go near anyone who has just eaten a Neutron Burrito...

Objective:
Be the first player to buy your way onto the space taxi to get home.

Gameplay:
The board is modular and made up of 24 square tiles which are randomly placed in a pre-configured shape at the start of the game. One tile will be labeled sleeping pods, which is where all players start the game. On your turn, you have 4 moves. Each move allows you to rotate your room or an orthogonally adjacent room clockwise one turn, or move one space. Exploring a new room spends all remaining movement, but also allows you to draw an item card. Item cards represent clothing, specimen, food, or occasionally an event.

When you end your movement on a tile, you may perform the action depicted on that tile once. Most tiles allow you to trade in an item of a specific type for 1 credit, 2 credits, or 2 more cards. Some tiles allow you an additional movement, some allow you to draw a card if your hand is empty, and others have no effect at all. Once you have 10 credits, you need to race to be the first player to the escape pod to escape and win!
publishers: Foam Brain Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Spuddle
description:
The thirty second word game.
Spuddle involves an unusual blend of quick thinking, cunning, table banging fun. Everyone plays at once, there are no individual turns. Each round begins with the 7 lettered dice being rolled. The timer is turned and players have just thirty seconds to make a unique word form the letters shown. Then it's table banging time, point scoring and the next round.

name: Colomo
description:
Colomo comes in a small box containing 60 wooden cylinders in 6 different colors (the colors of the rainbow) and a die.

The rulebook describes 12 different games that can be played with these components ranging from simple memory games, to dexterity games, to strategy games.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Game System, Memory

name: Do You Gnome Me?
description: Have you seen this gnome? Gnomes are a mischievous lot. They love playing tricks on people by hiding misplaced objects. And the only way to get back your belongings is to catch the culprit. Too bad the gnomes are so sneaky! The clever rotating device only allows you to see the card with the gnome for a split second: this should be enough to compile a portrait of the troublemaker. What did the beard look like? And what about the shoes? And the hat? Identify the most elements in order to win the card — and the points!
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Car Wars Supplement, City Blocks 4: 3-D Arena
description:
A 3-dimensional arena for Car Wars. The packs contains arena sections to lay out your own arena, and 3-D ramps and bunkers to cut out and build.

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars


Combines with:

City Blocks
City Blocks 2
City Blocks 3
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Masters of the Universe: Battle for Eternia
description:
From the back of the box:

"On your way to the Evil lair of Skeletor you'll have to battle with the evil warriors blocking your way. If you're lucky you will even make it past the treacherous "Fright Zone" trap to confront Skeletor himself. The fate of all Eternia hangs in the balance as you battle Skeletor to Free He-Man."

A basic 3D kids' game with a simple combat mechanic and cute dexterity trap, one of the most interesting features of this game is it allows kids to use their actual Masters of the Universe figures as the playing pieces (the game includes stands to put them in).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Crocodile Hop
description:
A game for the piecepack.

"It was a beautiful summer day in the Kingdom of Frogtopia and four young and bored frogs of varying social classes were looking for a little adventure to pass the day. And the addition of danger would only make the adventure all that more exciting. One of the young frogs said he had heard of a dangerous game called Crocodile Hop that was played by the frog knights to prove one’s froghood in the olden days. A game where a frog knight would display his agility and bravery by taunting Young Croc while hopping from lily pad to lily pad. A game that occasionally ended with the loss of limb and sometimes even life. A game that was no longer played.

"Although one of the young frogs was a little hesitant to play such a reckless and dangerous game, comments were made about him being a tadpole and “Do I see still see a tail back there?” that eventually peer pressure won. “Besides Old Croc is now so old he can barely move and he is quite predictable” another one of the young frogs said. With that the young frogs headed out to the other side of the swamp looking for Old Croc.

"Once they arrived at the other side of the swamp they started to splash and make noise trying to rouse Old Croc. “Look there he is, there he is” said one of the young frogs “and he moves about as fast a slug in the mud”. Then Old Croc came up and with his huge mouth swallowed up a whole lily pad with just one bite. The young frogs started hopping from lily pad to lily pad as they yelled at old Old Croc “You’ll never get me you old slug” and the game began. Old Croc was popping up out of the water chomping down lily pads while the young frogs hopped from pad to pad before he could get them.

"Then one of the young frogs noticed something, there seemed to be less and less lily pads to jump to and the ones that were left were getting harder to reach. “He’s running us out of lily pads” he yelled and that was when the young frogs realized what they had gotten themselves into."

A mad hopping game for the piecepack -- hop your foolish young frogs to victory, while avoiding being eaten by Old Croc.

name: Walcheren 1809
description:
In July 1809 the largest British expeditionary force ever assembled weighed anchor off the Kent coast and sailed for the island of Walcheren in the Scheldt estuary.
The map of Walcheren 1809 represents the Southern part of the Walcheren Island and the fortress of Flushing (Flessingue or Vlissiningen), the theatre of the battle.
The players have two different tasks. The British player has to march towards Flushing fortress in order to avoid a strong occupation by enemies. In order to do so he risks attrition and diseases. In effects there was fighting with the French, but the worst casualties were inflicted by diseases. Dysentery and other infectious illnesses arising from the unhealthy swampland killed thousands and incapacitated many more, causing the abandonment of the inglorious expedition.
The British lost over 4,000 men to a disease called "Walcheren Fever", thought to be a combination of malaria and typhus.

The French player has two options:
1- attack the British columns try to delay their advance
2- retreat inside Flushing and flood the area nearby (mining the dams)

Victory is assigned to the British player by controlling the fortress of Flushing. The French player wins if he has the control of Flushing while having eliminated 10 British units. Any other outcome is a draw.

name: Les Aventuriers du Rail: en Belgique (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)
description:
The board for this Edition is based on a map of Belgium.
As with other Ticket to Ride games, players are collecting sets of cards to claim routes necessary to complete destination tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: バハムート ゲート (Bahamut Gate)
description:
Fun, fast-playing cooperative game that that reduces the fantasy RPG experience to fighting a climactic boss battle by rolling dice and playing spell cards. Comes with five characters and five sealed scenarios; stands up to replaying well.

The boss stays in an octagon in the centre, and is surrounded by eight spaces that may be occupied by players, or in higher levels fire or minions. Each turn consists of a player phase and a boss phase.

In the player phase, the player on turn rolls 4d6, and rerolls up to 2d6 once. The dice serve two functions: first, they designate through character-specific tables which actions (move, draw spell cards, heal, etc.) or spells you can take; second, the largest set of identical dice determines how much damage you do to the boss.

In the boss phase, the boss rotates either two 45° steps or to face a player. The current player rolls 3d6, discards the high die, and looks up the two lower dice in a table to determine which octants take how much damage.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers
