In This amazing game, you will be an explorer trapped in a city of hallucinations, your goal is to get rid of the nightmares that overwhelm you and escape from this place of march.
At each turn, the spears of a dice and the result of the nightmare can return to the pages of the necronomicon, and more if you want to make arrangements of Sanity.

The game allows from 2 to 5 players.
Place the game board in the center of the table (the box).
To start the game distribute the nightmare cards in an equal amount to all the players. Also randomly gives each player 5 cards of sanity.
Do not reveal your nightmare or sanity cards to any other player.
In this game of cards and dice, you are at the mercy of the dice roll, which will tell you your destiny.
The turn consists of throwing the dice, and according to its result from 1 to 6, you must put one of your cards in any of the pages of the game board, if this space is empty, you can put any type of card, but If you are busy, you must put a card of the same type.
If you do not have this card, you have the bad luck to take all the cards of that space.
You can also defend yourself using the cards called sanity, which allow you to attack other players or use them for your own benefit.
To win the game you must get rid of all the cards (nightmares) of your hand.

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Nurgle Team Card Pack
description:
This is a pack of 43 handy reference cards for a Nurgle Blood Bowl team, along with blank cards allowing every coach to create their own players! Contained in the pack:

- Reference cards for Rotters, Pestigors, Bloaters and Rotspawn;
- Reference cards for the following Star Players: Guffle Pusmaw, Lord Borak the Despoiler, Grashnak Blackhoof, Max Spleenripper, Bilerot Vomitflesh, Withergrasp Doubledrool, Lewdgrip Whiparm, Buboe Shardhorn, Tolly Glocklinger, and Morg 'N' Thorg;
- The following blank cards that you can use to create your own players: 8 Rotters,5 Pestigors, 5 Bloaters, and 3 Rotspawn;
- A team roster card, with match record on the reverse;
- 4 Dirty Tricks cards: Public Inconvenience, Plentiful Poxes, Sweat Socks, and Suppurating Sores;
- 3 Random Events cards: Bountiful Growth, 'Pus' The Ball, The Excitement is Contagious!;
- The most important card: a card explaining how to use the other cards.

description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Munchkin 1+2
description:
With 112 cards to enhance your Super Munchkin game, The Narrow S Cape is much more than just this season's favorite fashion accessory! It teems with new villains like the contemptible Cheese Wiz, Gothzilla (with earthquake-causing platform boot action!), and the Ratwoman. And lest you feel overwhelmed by villainy, this expansion also features new items, new Powers and a new Class: the Brain!

This game combines Super Munchkin and Super Munchkin 2.

Früher war es ein niedliches Munchkin-Spiel. Aber dann wurde es in mysteriösen Energien gebadet, von einem radioaktiven Chihuahua gebissen und fasste ein uraltes Götzenbild an. Nun fliegt es durch Super-City und kämpft für eherne Werte wie Wahrheit, Gerechtigkeit und noch höhere Boni! Schlüpf in die Rolle eines Superhelden und sei ein Mutant, ein Exot, ein Mystiker, ein Techno oder ein Superhirn. Je höher deine Stufe ist, desto mehr Superkräfte kannst du haben. Bekämpfe niederträchtige Teufelsgenies, verheerende Monster und aus anderen Dimensionen einfallende Außerirdische – vom läppischen Explodoman über Jürgen von der Grippe bis hin zum Großen Alten Planetenfresser – UND NIMM IHR ZEUG! Wenn du deine Unterwäsche drüber trägst, eine Lizenz zum Verwüsten hast und alle mit deinen Monologen langweilst, kann kein Feind vor dir bestehen!

Die Erweiterung Coole Capes ist in Super Munchkin bereits enthalten.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Jeanne d'Arc: la bataille d'Orléans
description:
The Hundred Years War rages on; the English are laying siege to Orléans, a strategic city between the north and the south of the Loire, between those territories annexed by the English and those held by the French Dauphin.

Despite the English forces, Joan of Arc manages to get into the city. The inhabitants and the troops rally around her. You are one of Joan of Arc’s Companions, like Dunois, De Laval and La Hire, and your aim is to distinguish yourself as much as possible during this battle.

Show yourself around enemy fortresses, confer with Joan or the Dauphin, deploy your troops and be ready when Joan launches her attack.

Aim of the game:
You are Joan’s Companions and your common enemy are the English. To liberate the fortresses, you will need to cooperate.
But you need to know that only one will be the winner : The Companion who gathers the more prestige during the battle.
He will have the great honor to accompany Joan and the Dauphin to Reims for the coronation.
So be vigilant, place your troops at the right place and at the right time to shine more and acquire more prestige than the other Companions.

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting

name: 5x7 Dungeon solo card game
description:
A set of 32 cards consisting of a character, an adventure, a map and rules on how to play. One card is a complete game, all you add is a few d6s and an erasable marker (glossy stock). You can play one card or go campaign style and use a continuing character through the various cards. Fast, fun and has variations for multiple different scenarios. Can be played with multiple players, it is not co-operative but competitive.

—description from the designer

name: Marvel Battleworld: Series 1 Thanos Ship Showdown
description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos! Expanding the core game established with the Marvel Battleworld Battle Ball and Mega Packs, the Thanos Ship Showdown brings an exclusive Thanos character and his brutal flagship into the fight! Stop Thanos as he tries to distract and defeat your Heroes!

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Trainsilvania
description:
Trainsilvania is the wacky rail haunt at dawn.
Dracula wants to go home. With the Trainsilvania Night Express, of course. Each player tries to deliver his 4 monsters to their home stations by train. If only you knew who is hiding under your own figures. And then the night express is full to bursting. There is pushing and shoving in this disorder. You need a good memory not to fall by the wayside here.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Memory, Trains, Transportation

name: Punch Line
description:
From the box:

The word game that makes you laugh

The object of the game is to get points for making a word that fills in the blank in a sentence. Similar to the TV game show Match Game, players are all read the same sentence with to fill in the _______.

Each player has a plastic "slide holder" to hold strips of letters, which they manipulate to move the letters to the center column forming a word. Timer is set for 30 seconds.

Points are scored for by points for each letter, similar to Scrabble, but also extra points for letters in specific positions, first word completed, words over 5 letters.

Example in the rules: "It was raining cats and _____." One player might have "dogs" while another has "money". My family gives extra points for specially funny answers.

First player to 250 points wins.

name: Yahtzee: Frenzy – Dice & Card Game
description:
Yahtzee Frenzy Dice & Card Game takes Yahtzee to the next level! Inspired by Yahtzee With Buddies, the popular mobile game, this family party game is a fast-paced, frantic dash to roll combinations shown on the cards. No shaker, no score pads--everyone rolls at once, makes as many combos as possible, and keeps track of their matches on their Dice Tracker card. Once a player has locked in a matching combo, they shout the fun name shown on the card such as "The Spicy Burrito" or "Pair of Threeves" -- and slap it before anyone else can. Power Up cards like "Clumsy Roller" and "Dice Thief" keep players on their toes with game-changing actions such as stealing a die from another player, or having opponents play with one hand behind their back. The Yahtzee game is easy to learn and quick to play, making it a great board game for family nights.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Real-Time
